11.content:
"Sammy!" Mom called.
"Ouch." I mumbled from the loudness.
"You're going to be late for the first day of 2nd grade!" She cried as she entered the room. My mom was a very creative woman. Well if she wasn't then she wouldn't be a very good artist. She paints the most beautiful things. Once she even made her own book full of drawings. You could also tell by her wardrobe that she was artsy. She wore a green silk top with laced with blue ribbon and drawings of lipstick, orange juice, and all of the most random items you could think of. She wore long flare jeans that were covered in paint stains. Her hair was placed in a neat blob up on her head, that was finished off with a butterfly clip.
"Okay mom, just let me finish my cereal." I said. She grinned and looked through the window studying something closely. I watched her as she twirled a strand of loose hair. She looked so peaceful.
"I hope it snows. That would be just wonderful to paint!" It was my mom's voice, but strangely her lips didn't move a bit. Then I heard it again. "Oh my! Look at that, I think I saw a flake!"
"What was that mom?" I asked suspiciously.
"I didn't say anything." She said looking at me. "Now hurry up! You're already late."

That day at school was the weirdest. I seemed to know what everyone was thinking. I knew all the answers to math problems and could hear the other students' thoughts. And I thought it was funny to know who liked who.
Julia liked Dan who liked Catlin who liked Seth who didn't like anyone. But unfortunately I liked Jamie, who didn't like anyone either. I could tell when someone was lying, or daydreaming. It was so cool. But Jake, my best bud, knew that something was up. I knew I would have to tell someone about my "secret powers". But should I really? Would it freak him out?

111.content:
At lunch, I walked up to Jake. Through the last period, I was thinking and decided to tell him that I had superpowers. Still, I had to be cautious. He could tell anyone. He was just like that.
"Um, Jake." I began, sitting next to him at the lunch table. He nodded which indicated he was listening. His mouth was stuffed with a turkey sandwich. "Can I tell you a secret."
That excited Jake and he quickly swallowed the sandwich. He mumbled a 'yeah' in the process. He was grinning widely. I thought of what I should say. It was hard to think though, hearing everyone else's, too.
"You can't tell ANYONE!" I said with emphasis. He agreed, still smiling. I listened to his thoughts and saw he was telling the truth."Alright... I have su-."
The person who interrupted me was my other friend, Kati. That wasn't her real name, which was Kathleen, but she liked this name better. She shoved me deeper into the seat and sat next to me.
"As you were saying." Kati grinned.

113.content:
I figured I might as well tell Jake and I made my way to the cafeteria after the lunch bell rang to try and find him. But I could hardly move from my locker when Josiah Walters appeared in front of me with two of his buddies. Josiah was this big grade four guy who bullied people all the time, including me. He's got black hair and this mean looking face, like he can't smile. His buddies are just silent muscle, I don't know if I've ever heard them have a full conversation with anyone.

"Hey there blondie, ready to pay your hall taxes?" he asked aggressively. I didn't respond and I didn't even try to hear his thoughts, I didn't want to. So I ducked past him to try and get going but his buddies moved to stop me. He came up to me and shoved me against the locker roughly "Where ya goin' Carter?" he asked, spitefully using my last name. "I asked for money, now give it to me."

"No," I finally murmured. He shoved me hard against the locker and I could feel a little pain coming now. "Go away!" I shouted and started trying to get away when I shoved him to try and get him off me. Josiah let go alright, let go and flew across the hall into the lockers on the other side. His bodyguards ran over to help him up and I took that moment to run to the cafeteria, but they followed me and grabbed me before I could get out of the even emptier halls. I gulped as his friends grabbed my arms while he started pummeling me all over.

"Think you can do that to me and get off?" he asked furiously as he stops to take a breath. I can't help it now, I start to cry from both pain and anger. I struggle against my captors and easily wrench my arms free and punch Josiah in the shoulder; which is followed by a cracking sound leading to him dropping to the floor crying and holding his shoulder. The only thing I can do is run off and grab a teacher and I try to explain what happened so I won't get in alot of trouble and I can tell the teacher was surprised to hear that I broke the shoulder of someone older than me and bigger. Josiah went to the nurse and I went into the cafeteria, for now.

Now I really had to tell Jake what's going on. Mind-reading AND superstrength in one day? It's cool, but I had to talk about it.
113.title: Sammy discovers super strength

1131.content:
I figured Jake was going to find out anyways after what happened, or he'd have enough information to work it out. BEsides I think he was worried about me, so I figured it couldn't hurt. So I sat down opposite to him and opened my lunchbag giving him a 'hi'. Almost immediatly he folded his arms on the table and said "What wrong?"

"Now?"

"Yes, we can eat and talk at the same time."

So I told him what had happened when I got up and what had happened in the hall, his mouth was hanging open by the end of my story and I kept eating while he thought of something to say. I knew I'd have to talk to mom about this too when I got home, but for now I was contented to let Jake know.

"That is so cool!" Jake said with barely controlled awe and excitement. "Can you show me super strength?" he asked.

I couldn't really see an issue with that and I agreed to show him after school the rest of which passed without event. So when we got out we walked to Jake's house which was close by, with his mom who came to walk us there. Jake's brother has all this weightlifting stuff and he's really big so he was saying I should see how much I can lift. So when we got there we were instantly down into the basement where the weights were all sitting, currently not in use.

He said the bar was itself about seventy pounds and I laid down under it and found it extremely easy to lift. He put on first ten, then twenty with each being scarcely heavier than the last for me and lifting them proved to be boring. I had to help him put the weights on eventually as they got too heavy for him to move, but I found them easy to lift. Eventually the barbell had all the weights on it and I still lifted it, and the entire bench, with relative ease. Jake was just standing there with his mouth open at the last feat of strength and once again was barely containing his excitement. "That is so cool! You know what else? I think your muscles are a little bigger, look at yourself."

I looked at my arm and flexed and saw a little bit of bicep and lifted up my shirt to see I was flexing faintly visible abs, which was insane cause that morning I bad a bit of a tummy. "I wonder why this is all happening all of a sudden," I mused to Jake.

"Dunno, think your mom would know something?"

"Maybe I should go talk to her. It's cool being really strong though."

11311.content:
I left Jake's house and began walking towards home, but I was barely five steps from his house when a police car went by, lights flshing and sirens wailing. I had absolutely no idea what was going on, but I figured I could try to help, being superpowered and all. I ran after the car and was scarcely surprised when I started running twice as fast as I usually did. I guess after the superpowers I had so far, superspeed hardly seemed odd. So I ran, keeping behind the car enough to not be noticed, but close enough to keep track of it.

It took perhaps five minutes for the police and me to arrive at what could be described as a battleground. It was a downtown four-way with lights, fire hydrant, and so on. However there were great craters in the street, chunks of dirt and asphault lying around, a broken fire hydrant spouting into the air, and several crumpled cars, some burning and apparently already exploded. There, in the middle of the street was a massive man in hi-tech armour. When I say massive, I mean he was like seven feet tall and all muscle covered by the battle armour. As I watched he shot a rocket at a police car, which exploded and sent several police men flying. "I will find town hall," the man shouted. "This city will bow to me, the Steel Lord."

It was so horrible I had to dodge into an alley to make sure he didn't see me. "He's scary," I mumbled to myself. Then I realized that if he saw me, he might be able to come back for revenge, and he might hurt mommy. There went my hopes of being a celebrity with the powers, because if I wanted to help out and not put mommy in danger, I'd have to use a disguise. Then I remembered mom always packed my balaclava so I wouldn't forget it in the winters. So I took it out of my back pack and put it on, and left my backpack in the alley. I took a deep breath then ran out into the streets at high speed, jumping over the police and their barriers and charged right at the Steel Lord. He was facing the other direction and I charged into his leg and threw him down where he landed with a crash into the road.

I stopped in the street and turned to face him as he stood up. "Well aren't you a strong little pipsqueak," he scoffed. "But I have plenty of tricks to deal with you."

11312.content:
“Gosh, Sammy! I think it’s so cool that you got these powers…” Jake began.

“Listen, man…” I whispered to him. “Please…. Don’t tell anybody, okay?”

“Oh… I won’t! But, it’s gonna be hard keeping this a secret!” Jake said, as he led me out to his garage.

As we walked out of the living room and into the garage, we saw his dad’s SUV standing there. Jake pressed the button on the wall, which opened the garage door.

“Sam… Try to lift the car…”

I just sighed and rolled my eyes.

“Oh, come on, Jake…”

“Just try it!” he said excitedly. “I wanna see how strong you are!”

“Well, you saw me lift all those weights just now!” I replied.

Jake just let out a deep sigh of frustration. I stared at him and I was able to read his thoughts.

“Why doesn’t Sammy just do it?” Jake was thinking.

“Alright, alright…. Just to make you happy….” I said, as I walked over to the front of the Suburban and reached down by the front bumper.

Then I slowly raised up my arm, lifting the front of the SUV along with it. To be honest, I couldn’t believe it myself. I was standing in my best friend’s garage, and I was lifting his dad’s SUB with just one hand. The front tires of the large, brown car were hanging suspended in the air, about six inches above the ground, as I held on to the front bumper. To my great surprise, the SUV just didn’t seem that heavy at all! It was like lifting a big balloon. In fact, it felt like I was lifting one of those inflatable giant balloons. The only difference is this thing was REAL! It was a real vehicle, made of metal, rubber and plastic! It must have weighed several thousand pounds, and I was lifting it with just one hand!

“Wowww!” Jake gasped. “I can’t believe how strong you are!”

“No… I can’t believe it, either…” I said, as he bent my knees so I could set the SUV back down on its front tires. “I mean… I can’t feel its weight at all…. I must be getting stronger and stronger…”

“Let’s go to your house!” Jake suggested.

We walked out of the garage and onto the driveway. The sun was out, and it was over ninety degrees outside.

“Man, it’s so hot out here!” I grumbled. “I wish I were home already…”

Suddenly, I found myself standing in my bedroom, in my house.

“Holy crap!” I exclaimed. “How did I get here so fast?”

I thought for a moment and realized that I must have teleported from Jake’s house to mine, in a blink of an eye!

Then I realized that Jake must be freaking out right now.

I pictured Jake in my mind, and I wished to see Jake standing in my room at this moment as well.

Then, out of the blue, a bright flash of light appeared in my room, and when the light faded, I saw Jake standing before me!

“Hey! Holy CRAP! How… What… How did I get here?” Jake wondered out loud. “Sammy!”

“I… I think I teleported us from your house to my bedroom…” was the only explanation I had.

“But… But… How? How did you do that?” Jake wondered.

“I dunno!” I shrugged. “I’ve never done it before! I guess… I just discovered a new power!”

“Wow!!!” Jake gasped. “You teleported us!”

“Yeah….”

1132.content:
I was confused, and quite frankly a little scared. I’ve heard from my mom that puberty changes the body, at least that’s what she says when she’s talking to my sister about it, but this, this is insane, but then again from her talks I don’t think I’m old enough to go through puberty, I am only 7years old, but either way seemingly in one day I’ve developed two super powers. I could read minds, and now I have super strength. I need to talk to someone about this before I lose my mind, for god sakes I broke a guys shoulder. Josiah was a jerk, but not even he deserved that. I was going to tell Jake, after all he is my best friend, but the last thing I wanted to do was scare him, heck I was having trouble not scaring myself. I decided to wait, to tell my mom, but the only problem with that plan was that I had to wait after school to talk to her, AND I NEED SOMEONE NOW! Well I’m just going to have to suck it up and wait.

School was nothing but torture. It was like my whole body was waging war on itself. If I wasn’t concentrating on not reading minds, then I was concentrate on not breaking my fragile pencils and desk, and making sure I’m using the necessary strength when it comes to opening doors and giving my friends high fives, I don’t want either of them to go flying. I’ve already broke a door today, I was able to convince my teachers that it was because of poor workmanship, that the door went flying off its hinges, but I don’t think that lie will last forever. I could hear the thoughts of every person in the school, I swear does this thing have a off button. It was almost getting to the point that I could not hear the actual words coming out of people’s mouths.

Some how I was able to make it through the day, with very little teachers mad at me. I wasted no time getting home as soon as school was out. I had to tell my mom right away of the things that had happened to me. I soon make it to the apartment complex. Me and my family live in a three bed room apartment, as far as apartment complexes go our apartment was pretty big, and was a good place to call home.

I run up to the door and open it.

“Bang!”

The door goes flying off the hinges, with small pieces of wood falling everywhere. Ah man I forgot my mom always kept the door locked, so that situation was like a unstoppable force meeting a movable object, the door didn’t stand a chance.

The door had been right next to the living room, which was the area my mom was, sitting on our brown leather couch watching Tv, so she got a front row seat to my little display of strength, and she looked at me surprised as ever. Well the bright side was that I no longer had to explain as much, also she would probably believe me when I tell her my story.

“I’m home.”

11321.content:
I tell my mom everything that has happened to me, during my first day of school. The story sounded strange coming out of my mouth, but what was even more strange was the look my mom was giving me as I told her my ridiculous story. It wasn’t a look of surprise, nor was it a look of disbelief or shock, no it was a look of acceptance, a look of secrets. The point is that my story didn’t shock her, which only meant two thing she knew what was going on in my body, and she was hiding something, and by the looks of things it was something big.

By the time I was done telling my short and brief story, silents fell over the room. I swear it was so quite that I could hear the crickets outside. I looked at my mom who was to busy staring at the floor to look at me. I wanted to give Her time to process this information, but she really didn’t look like she need that much time.

“So mom is there something, you want to tell me?” I said.

I really wanted answers, why was this happening to me, is it going to stop, or get even worse. The only person who could answer any of my questions was my mommy, I needed her more than ever.

“Sammy, I’ve been keeping something from you.” My mom says in a low voice.

Mom looks at me with trembling eyes.

“You are adopted.” She says with tears welling up in her eyes.

The world started to spin, for a second I became dizzy. Did my mom just say that I’m adopted. No that couldn’t be true, it couldn’t. I remain silent looking at my mom like she had committed a series crime.

“W, what are you talking about?” I ask.

I was in what my mom would call denial. What can I say, I wanted to remain her son.

“It happened 6 years ago, me and your sister who was eight at the time was driving on a road in the middle of the night. We were coming home, from the movies, we were living with my mother at the time, and that women lives far from people. Me and your sister were just having a nice drive, then it happened.”

Mom stops talking for a few minutes.

“What happened?” I asked.

“Something bright, something burning fell from the night sky, crash landing right in front of my car.” Mom says with a little smile.

“At first I thought it was a meteor, or maybe a satellite, but when I got out of the car to take a closer look, I knew it wasn’t any of those things. It was some kind of alien spacecraft.” She said looking at me.

“A spacecraft, like aliens?” I said with doubt in my voice.

Granted I’m 7 years old, but that doesn’t mean that I’m a idiot, nor does that mean I’m going to believe everything that I hear. Heck even when I was young, I could never get myself to believe in Santa clause, let alone aliens. I really didn’t believe what my mom was saying, but deep down I couldn’t help but think, could this story really be true. My eyes had never left my moms face, she was not lying. All of a sudden I felt sick.

“I know how it sounds but the technology looked to advanced to be man made. The alien craft glowed with a purplish hue and their were a few symbols on the surface. Symbols that I couldn’t understand.” Mom says putting on her thinking face.

“I was about to call the police or something, but I was stopped, I stoped when the craft began to open, and inside I saw a beautiful little baby boy. Inside the space craft was you.” Mom says putting her hand on my cheek.

This wasn’t true, it couldn’t be. I was a alien, That was what my mom was basically telling me, that I was some kind of alien freak. Tears flowed from my eyes, as I started to realize the truth.

“Why, why didn’t you tell me!” I yell.

I was a Angry, hurt. Was my whole life a lie.

“I didn’t tell you because I didn’t want you to feel the way you feel now, what was I suppose to say, how was I suppose to tell you that you, you are not human, how was I suppose to tell you that you would have to live your whole life different from everyone else?” My mom asks.

Mom made a good point, but that still didn’t stop the pain, it still didn’t vanquish my anger. Mom reaches for my hand but I pull away. I couldn’t control my strength when I was in the right state of mind, there was no way I could control my strength when my mind was clouded by anger. The last thing I wanted to do was break my moms hand.

“You have a huge burden to carry Sammy.” Mom says

“All I wanted to do was lessen that burden as much as possible.”

“What does this make me?” I ask, not knowing what to call myself, human, alien p, freak.

“You are the answer Sammy, the answer to are we alone in the universe.” Mom says grabbing both of my shoulders.

“I, I don’t want to be, I don’t want this.” I say trying to stop crying.

“I know, I wouldn’t want it either. I know it’s unfair but this is the paint you must walk.” Mom says looking me straight in the eyes.

“C, can I still be your son?” I ask with a little fear in my voice.

I couldn’t help but think, what if she says no.

“You will always be my son, I will always be your mother. I love you.” She says giving me a hug.

While hugging me I saw something moving in the corner of the hallway. My 14 year old sister Bianca was standing by the wall listening in on me and moms conversation. I didn’t mind, after all Bianca knew everything about me being a alien.

Bianca slowly walks over to both me and mom, who still had me in a huge bear hug, and rapes her arms around us. She knew everything, and she still saw me as her little brother.

I truly was blessed.

113211.content:
I was experiencing the strongest family hug ever, that’s saying something, seeing as to how I have super strength, but after a few minutes my mom, and my sister finally release me from their embrace.

“We love you Sammy.” My sister Bianca says before returning to her room, leaving me and mom alone In the living room.

The room was silent for a few minutes, my cheeks were a little wet from my tears, but otherwise I was feeling better.

“Sammy I don’t know what is going on with your body, I don’t have any answers to give you.” Mom says looking ashamed.

“But I might have something that can help you.” My mom says getting up, walking towards her room.

I followed my mom into her room, and together we stood before a large dresser that stood inside her closet. Mom opens up the top Dresser drawer, and brings out something that looked like a crystal the size of a baseball. The crystal was almost clear as glass, but had a crimson aura surrounding it.

“Your space ship evaporated like mist as soon as I had picked you up. Their was nothing left except this small crystal.” Mom says holding the crystal right in front of my eyes.

“I don’t know what it is, but it is yours.” Mom grabbing my hands gives me the crystal.

As soon as the crystal touched my skin, it’s crimson aura turned azure blue like the sky.

“What’s happening?” I ask, realizing that the crystal is starting to vibrate in my hands. It kind of tickled, but the last thing I wanted to do was laugh.

“I don’t know?” Mom said realizing the sudden change.

Out of fear I drop the crystal, and watch it fall to the ground, but before it hit the carpet floor it started to levitate in mid air, and start to ascend up to my face.

“My son.”

I heard a voice emanating from the crystal. I couldn’t help but take a step forward, the voice it sounded familiar to me, and seemed to calm my nerves. Deep down in my soul I really wanted to trust that voice.

Soon the crystal disappears, and is replaced by a man. The man had short brown curly hair, and short trimmed beard. The man wore strange white clothing, that made him look like a holy saint. But the thing that drew me in more than anything was his eyes, which were blue and green like the sea, yet seemed peaceful, gentle.

“To see you there my boy, is the greatest blessing I could have ever received.” The man says with a smile.

“Who are you?” I ask with very little strength left in my body.

Deep down I already knew the answer, but I had to hear him say it.

“My name is Sharal Etregal, and you Sammy are my son.” The man says with a warm smile on his face.

“How did you know my name is Sammy, and how are you here right now?” I ask.

“To answer the first question, when you touched the Essence crystal all of your memories your very essence was absorbed. I know everything about you Sammy, as for the second, I am standing before you as nothing but a hologram, I believe that is what humans call it.” Sharal says having to think about it for a little while.

“All of who I am, all of who I was, was recorded and put into the crystal, along with all of the knowledge and research of our race. I am here as a guide to help you along your journey my son. You have questions, the time has come to provide answers to those questions. So ask.” Sharal says.

Mom leaves the room, giving me and my hologram dad alone time in her room.

“Please tell me where do I come from.”
113211.title: The final truth

1132111.content:
The questions that had been plaguing My mind, the answers to my whole entire life, finally they would be revealed. I stood completely still as I stared at my supposed father like a hawk.

“Please tell me where do I come from?” I asked, my voice shaking as if my very words were about to break.

“You come from the planet Edora.” Sharal says looking at me.

“Edora? That’s the name of our home planet?” I asked making sure that I have a the facts.

“Correct.”

I couldn't believe it, I was actually a alien, even after my mom had told me the whole entire story, deep down I didn’t really believe it, but it was all true.

Breaking out of my thoughts, I soon realize the room begin to change. I once stood inside my mothers bedroom which was filled with a queen sized bed two nightstands and one large closet containing different outfits, now it looked like I was standing in the middle of space, with a myriad of stars surrounding me, in all directions. In front of me was a humongous green planet that completely filled my whole vision. I would be lying if I were to say I wasn’t terrified.

“Fear not Sammy, I am showing you a hologram of the past.” Sharal says as if we were reading my mind.

“So this is?”

“Yes this is the planet Edora back when it was in its prime, my son this is where you were born .”

I couldn’t revert my gaze, right at this moment I was looking at my birth planet in all of its glory.
“What am I?” I asked looking at Sharal.

“You are Zorge.” Sharal says as he looks at me, with eyes that were no longer as kind as they were before.

“Zorge, what is Zorge?” I asked.

“Zorge is the name of our species, it is what we are.” Sharal says coldly.

“Why do you say that like it’s a bad thing?” I asked as I look at my father configured and worried.

My father looks at me with sadness in his eyes, he looks me dead in my eyes and I look dead into his, what was he hiding from me?

“The Zorge Empire covered more than 1000 planets my son, planets from all around the whole universe.” Sharal says with even more gloom than before.

“What’s wrong with that father, it sounds like the Zorge where pretty successful.” I said with a little 😀.

“The problem with that my son is that those planets where conquered.” Sharal says, not being able to look me in the eye anymore.

“Conquered?” I asked hoping I heard wrong.

“My son the whole Zorge Empire was built on war itself, the planets we owned were our trophies as we expanded throughout the universe.” Sharal said as if he were in pain.

“What do you mean.” I said not being able to except the truth, heck I couldn’t even understand the truth let alone expect it.

“Let me start at the beginning.” Sharal says putting his right hand up, which was indication to stop talking.

“The Zorge, ever since their earliest days have always been a race of war and violence.” Sharal says.

The hologram of the planet Edora started to disappear, actually the whole scenery began to change drastically. I soon found my self standing on solid ground, surrounded by super tall building, every building had its own unique shape. Looking up I could even see flying vehicles, flying at different altitudes. Observing my surroundings even more I could see wide tubes coming out of the ground, these wide tubes surrounded the building and seemed to spread out everywhere around the strange city. People wearing strange clothes were inside these tubes, each person being carried to a certain destination. I knew seemingly by instinct were I was. I was on the planet Edora.

“The Zorge race was not known for its wisdom nor was it known for its intelligence, but we still possessed far greater technical advancements than most species, and we used that technology to wage war on those we saw as inferior, and in doing so we formed the Zorge Empire. The one thing we Zorge where known most for was our battle hardened instincts that we develop at birth.” Sharal says with a lot of shame evident in his voice.

I couldn’t believe, I didn’t want to believe it, was this really where I came from. I didn’t want to be a Zorge anymore.

“Wait are you saying that the Zorge, killed people to be successful?” I asked, hoping that my father was joking.

“Yes my son, we killed billions, simply to prove our superiority.” My father says.

“Wait does that mean you also killed people.” I asked feeling disgusted.

Sharal goes quit, he says nothing, he does nothing but stare at me.

“I have never once approved of the way, our race has dozen of skilled warriors, I on the other hand am a scientist 👨‍🔬.” Sharal says with pride.

“I have never once killed another living being.” Sharal says.

“You were a scientist?” I asked feeling a little relived that my father was not a mass murder.

“Yes. I am one of the very few Zorge scientist.” Sharal says.

“Why were their so few?” I asked.

“The Zorge are a race that only think with their fist, therefor scientists were highly looked down upon in our society.” Sharal says, with a little frown.

The more I heard about these Zorge the more I strayed to hate them.

“Where the Zorge really that horrible as a society father?” I asked.

“Yes my son. The Zorge are a race drenched in blood.” Sharal says.

“Is that why you left me on earth?” I asked, barley able to hold my curiosity.

“No.” Sharal says.

“I am no longer in this world my son.” Sharal says with a sad smile.

My heart seemed to stop as soon as those words where uttered.

“What do you mean father.” I asked

“I, along with every single Zorge in the universe is dead son.” Sharal says looking at me with ocean blue eyes.

“Our people, our empire, even our home planet no longer exists my son.” Sharal says looking at me.

It was one surprise after the other, and really I wasn’t sure that my have art would be able to take much more.

“What happened to them, what happened to you.” I asked, wanting to get to the bottom of this.

Sharal stays quit as he looks at me once again.

11321111.content:
Pain, pain filled my chest like a unrelenting disease, my legs grew week from the truth, I no longer wanted to hear. Apparently I come from a war like race called the Zorge, who travel around the cosmos conquering planets, these planets became part of the Zorge Empire. Sounds impressive, doesn’t it? Well spoiler alert, the Zorge are pretty much extinct. I’m the last Zorge, the last of my race. I really didn’t think it was possible for me to feel even more alone than I did before.

“Father please, I have to know what happened to my people.” I say looking at my father Sharal in his sea green eyes.

Silence echoes throughout the whole entire room. Me and my father lock eyes with one another, both of us determined. I was determined to get answers, my father on the other hand was determined to hide the truth from me, this I couldn’t allow. I continued to stare at my father not saying a word, crossing my arms to make it clear, this subject wasn’t going to change.

“All I am permitted to say at the moment, is that our planet was destroyed my son.” Sharal said with sadness.

The whole entire back ground that was disguised to look like The surface world Edora, once again started to change. I was once again standing in the middle of space, the planet Edora floating right in front of me in all of its glory. The planet that had A green like surface that as time past began to change, to transform into a mottled rock filled with fire and magma. Large Cracks appeared around the planet, cracks that glowed from the lava that Rose from the depths of the planets core. I who stood far away from the planet, in outer space could see gigantic volcanoes 🌋 spew out rivers of lava. The planet looked horrible, and it seemed to be getting worse. It soon looked like the planet was collapsing in on it self.

“BOOM!!!!”

The planet after going through so much destruction finally exploded. Large chunks of the planet Edora floated off into the empty void of space. I knew that I was looking at a hologram, but it looked so real. It was so real that I could have sworn that I felt the whole room shake from the explosion. The background once again begins to change, I was once again standing in my mother’s room, everything reverting back to normal.

“Didn’t you say that the Zorge empire had 1000s of planets that they controlled.” I asked turning to look at my father, hoping that he had forgotten these simple facts.

“It is true, the Zorge race had collected countless planets, but Edora was different.” Sharal said.

“Different how?” I asked.

“Edora was the birth planet for all Zorge, it was a holy land so to speak, and even if this wasn’t the case, every planet that the Zorge had conquered in the past was destroyed as well.” Sharal says, shaking his head.

“I don’t understand, planets don’t just disappear, and explode for no reason. So what was responsible for all of that destruction?” I ask, not being to except what I had just witnessed.

“I’m sorry my son I can not tell you anymore about our planets destruction.” Sharal says, defiance in his voice.

“Why not?!” I yell.

“You are not ready for the answers, at least not yet.” Sharal says, acting like a father.

I wanted to argue, I didn’t want to except being in the dark any longer, but the look in my fathers eyes told me that he wasn’t going to change his cyber mind any time soon.

“Fine.” I say feeling a little annoyed.

“Can you at least tell me why My body is going through so many changes so suddenly.” I ask.

“My son your changes are caused by your Zorge DNA 🧬.” Sharal says.

Sharal wasn’t telling me things I already didn’t know, I mean it wasn’t like human DNA could produce people who where able to read minds and have super strength. I didn’t want to call him out on his obvious answer, he was my father after all and I didn’t want to seem rude.

“My son, the Zorge have the ability to evolve.” Sharal says with a smile.

“Evolve?” I ask, wondering what he meant by those words.

“Yes evolve. It has come to my understanding that the human race is no stranger to the process of evolution. They themselves are in a constant state of evolution, but the Zorge have the ability to evolve at a alarming rate.” Sharal says.

“I know about evolution father, but evolution doesn’t give super strength, nor does it give the ability to read minds.” I say.

I in truth didn’t know a lot about evolution, just the bare minimum I had learned in my science class at school. The last time I checked I was correct. I mean evolution could do many things, allow a aquatic species to walk on land, or give a land base animal the ability to breath under water 💧, and even allow a Flightless animal to fly in the sky with their wings, but mind reading, super strength, human evolution cannot do those things, at least that is what I think 🤔.

“That is not true my son.” Sharal says as if he were reading my mind.

“The possibilities that evolution provides are endless, especially when it comes to the Zorge.” Sharal says sounding very smart.

“As I have told you before the Zorge are a war like race, our evolution has helped us wage those wars, and not only win, but come out even stronger.” Sharal says.

“Stronger how.” I ask

“The process of evolution for most species is a process to help them survive and grow as a species, for the Zorge it is different.”

My eyes widen from my fathers words

“Different how?” I ask.

“The Zorge did not evolve in order to survive, they evolved in order to fight.” Sharal says with a dark voice.

“Our evolution was designed to turn us into the ultimate warrior, providing us with strength and power able to rip apart entire worlds.” Sharal says.

I couldn’t believe what I was hearing, could any one being be that powerful.

“The more we grew the more powerful we became. We as a people didn’t even have to be fighting for our bodies to evolve, the only requirement was that we had to be alive.”

“So did you also have the ability to read minds, and where you also super strong like me?” I asked, complete taken back from what I had just heard.

“No, every Zorge experiences their own evolution. Some are almost the same, some are very different.” Sharal ways with a small smile.

“My abilities included, enhanced knowledge, and telekinesis, after I had reached my prime I no longer evolved.” My father told me.

“My enhanced intelligence was the reason I wanted to be a scientist, to better help my people evolve into something better.” Sharal says with his eyes closed, his smile growing even bigger. I could tell that he was thinking of something beautiful.

“So is this it for me father, will I stop evolving.” I asked sounding a little hopeful. My fathers evolution had stoped at two powers, maybe mine will be the same.

“I do not know my son. As I have said before everyone experiences their own type of evolution. Their have been some Zorge with around 10 abilities, some with even more.” My father says feeling sad, as if he knew he would be disappointing me with his answer.

“A Zorges evolution doesn’t just happen out of no were though.” My father says.

“The one thing we scientist were able to find out over the years, is that a Zorges background, their environment matters when it comes to their evolution, and of course the situation.” Father says rubbing his chin.

“What do you mean the situation?” I ask.

“For example the Zorge were a war like race, therefore when ever a Zorge went into battle that would come about of that battle stronger than they were before. I myself didn’t like to fight so I wasn’t as strong as most of my brethren.” Sharal says.

I was beginning to understand a little more about my people, and why exactly they were so powerful. The ability to constantly grow and develop more and more super powers, that was a OP ability, but I still had one more question.

“Why now, why did I start to evolve today of all days?” I asked curious.

“My son all Zorge begin their path of evolution around the ages of 7 and 8. My father says.

It all made sense. I was 7 years old therefore I was old enough for my Zorge DNA to be awakened.

“The only thing that a Zorge child has at a young age before the ages of 7 and 8 are a greater intelligence.” Sharal says.

I could understand that logic. Ever since I was a smaller child than I was now, I had always been smarter than all of the children. My mind seemed think like a computer. Math and even Science came easy to me, therefore I hardly paid attention to my teachers. They always hated me for that.

“So let me get this straight, their is a slight possibility that I will evolve to be even stronger?” I asked.

“Not a slightly possibility but quite a large possibility my son. Zorge are bred to fight, so it is very rare for a Zorge to obtain a ability not suited for combat.” Sharal says.

“Oh great.”

I stood in my mother’s bedroom listening to my father Sharal talk about my very origins. I apparently come from a war like race called the Zorge, who travel around the cosmos conquering planets to add to the Zorge empire. You may be asking yourself what made the Zorge so powerful and special, well apparently the Zorge had the special ability to evolve, and gain greater abilities, so yea even now I am still processing that.

I stared into my fathers sea green eyes as he stared into mine. I didn’t want to evolve, to be something other than human, to bad I didn’t have a choice.

“So your saying I’m going to keep getting more powerful?” I asked hoping my father would say the answer I wanted.

“Yes my son, their is a high probability that you will develop even more powers as time goes by.” My father says with a sorrowful tone.

I began to start pacing around my mothers bedroom, with both hands on top of my head. What was I going to do, how could I ever go to school, I wouldn’t know when a new power would develop putting people in danger.

“ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ”

Upon hearing a strange sound in the corner of my ear, a sound that sounded like a glitching computer I began to stop pacing around the room. I looked towards my father and realized the strange sound was coming from him. The image of my father began to fade away slowly, he soon became transparent enough that I could not only see right through him, but I could see the crystal that aloud me to speak to my father.

“What’s happening?” I ask feeling a little concerned.

“I’m afraid that our time is at a end.” Sharal says with a small smile.

“What do you mean?” I ask with fear in my voice.

“This form that stands before you is nothing but a hologram, my true self had already died a long time ago. The essence crystal that aloud us to meet was never suppose to last forever and now that it’s done it’s job it is time for us to depart.” Sharal says staring at me with peaceful eyes.

“No... no I can’t lose you, what happens if I have more questions, what happens if I need help?” I ask.

“I have faith in you my son, deep down I know you will find a way to handle any problem that you may face. No o be knows what the future holds, but one day I have a feeling we will meet again.” Sharal says nodding his head.

Tears fell from my eyes. I had just found my father and now I had to say good by to him. Truly life is not fair. Looking at my father I soon realize the smile that he wore soon disappeared, as he stared at the ground and not at me. The room falls quite for what seems like a eternity.

“My son, I know that this is not the life you wanted. You are so young and yet already burdened with a huge responsibility. But know this I am proud of you. Sharal said disappearing even more.

“I believe in you......” Sharal had almost disappeared at this moment, I could hardly see him at all.

“And I will love you always.............” with that declaration Sharal had completely disappeared the essence crystal falling to the carpet floor, no longer glowing crimson red or azure blue, or was complete gray, which was evident to me that it was completely dead.

I stood completely still, not knowing what to do, what to say. After a few minutes I soon walked outside of my mothers bed room and walked into the living room. My mom and my sister where sitting on the couch waiting for me to come out of the room.

Seeing me appear from the room, both mom and my sister run over to me and look at me with concerned eyes.

“How did it go?” Mom asks grabbing my right shoulder with her right hand.

“My fathers gone and I have a story to tell you guys.”

That night I told my mother and my sister Bianca everything that my father Sharal had told me. I could tell that my mom and my sister where taken back by the information I shared, and as I finished explaining the room fell quite, my mother and sister where struggling to form words.

“Sammy....” mom says with a small smile.

I look at my mother with a little worry in my eyes.

“It doesn’t matter where you come from. You are my son, it doesn’t matter where you come from that will never change. You are a good person, and are not defined by your people. Understand?” Mom says.

“Yea.” I said with a shaky voice tears once again falling from my face. Me and my mom and sister once again shared a family hug.

That night I didn’t eat dinner. I wasn’t even hungry, my mind was to occupied with overwhelming thoughts. I simply went to bed to prepare tomorrow. The next day of school.

(The next day)

I slowly open my eyes feeling strange, as if something was missing, but what? It took me about a minute to figure out the problem.....

“Why can’t I feel my bed?” I ask no one in particular.

By angling my body I was able to look down to see my bed on the ground.

“I’m floating. Oh my god I’m floating.”

Great, this was just great. I have developed the power to defy gravity itself now.

“What am I going to do?”

After the storm that Sammy had caused, he had to force himself to not tell Cody. He knew it would be a relief to tell someone; it was a secret that was too large for a kid like him to handle, but he knew better. He didn't want to freak his friend out or lose him. He had enough problems at the moment. No need to add another.

School let out, and Sammy had convinced his mother to let Cody and Jake come over. They picked out a movie and sat in front of the television munching popcorn.
Cody threw a piece at Jake's head as the movie began. Jake turned and responded with his own barrage. The three boys laughed, and finally started watching the movie.
It was the Incredibles, and Sammy's mind began to wander. If he had super powers, was he a superhero? And just how many powers did he have?

The movie ended, and the boys ran outside. After several games had passed, they flopped down on the grass. Cody and Jake were arguing over who won the last game of tag, when Sammy interrupted.
"If you had a superpower, what would it be?"
Cody responded immediately. "Flying."
Jake snorted. "Don't be stupid. Super strength, or fire. C'mon, wouldn't it be cool to shoot fire out of your hands?"
"Or lasers out of your eyes?" Cody put in.
"What about names? I would be..." Jake started. "Dark Lord Spartan Tiger King."
Cody pushed himself up on his elbows. "'Dark Lord Spartan Tiger King?'"
Jake looked put out. "Well, you do better."
Cody grinned. "Captain Talon or Captain Sparrow."
"What about Sage or Phoenix?" Sammy suggested.
"Awesome!" Jake and Cody said.
"But... what's a Sage?" Jake asked.

That night, Sammy asked his older sister to make him a superhero suit. In the back of his mind, he wondered if his sister had superpowers too. To his surprise, she had rummaged through her desk and pulled out a piece of material. "So Mom finally told you, did she?"
Sammy's eyes widened. "So are you like me?"
His sister (whose name was Ashlynn) unfolded the material revealing a pretty cool superhero costume, just Sammy's size. "Yeah, but not as powerful. I only have telekinesis and super speed. So kid, what's the name you are gonna have?"
Sammy shuffled his feet. "Um...I was thinking Sage or Phoenix."
Ashlynn pulled her sewing kit from her desk as well. "Hmm... lame. Based on Mom's prediction, I'd call myself ' the Temporal Shadow' or 'the Time Lord' or..." Ashlynn smiled and tapped her lip. "This is my favorite... 'Iridium'."
"Iridium?" Sammy asked, crinkling his eyebrows.
"It's a type of metal that we can only get on Earth through asteroids and tin." Ashlynn explained. "It's the strongest, rarest, densest, expensive, lightest metal we can get. At least, that's my opinion and-"
"Older sisters know best." Sammy droned, repeating the phrase Ashlynn was so fond of. "Iridium sounds cool."
Ashlynn grinned. "Good, because that's what I put on your supersuit." She picked up the suit and tossed it to her little brother. "Oh, and by the way, you should be more careful with your powers. I'm guessing the storm was your fault?"
Sammy blushed, glaring at his sister. "Bye. Thanks for the suit."
Ashlynn waved her hand. "Someone has to do the work in this house. See ya, kid." She turned to her desk, paused, then tossed a mask at Sammy's head.
Sammy left, heading towards his room to put on his new alter ego.

Kody Hart hopped off the school bus along with Edward and Alex. It was Friday, and they boys were happy that the weekend had finally begun. They were looking forward to a weekend of fun and relaxation, with just a little bit of homework as long as they had no classes and teachers to deal with until Monday morning.

“Hey dude, whatcha doing this afternoon?” Edward asked Kody. Kody and Edward were almost like twins. Both were the same height and weight. They were about 5 feet tall, both were twelve years old, and they both had blue eyes. The only difference was that Edward had slightly dark brown hair while Kody’s hair was jet black.

“I can come over later to play some games… If mom lets me!” Kody replied. “You know how mom is… I gotta finish my homework first!”

“Tell me about it! Well, send me a text message or IM me on Messenger when you’re done!” Edward replied, before he walked into the front door of his house. “See ya later, Kody!”

Kody quickly jogged back to his house, which was right next door to his own. Kody and Eddy were neighbors, which was nice, since they loved to get together to play video games. Alex lived right next to Eddy.

Kody was an only child living with his mother. His dad passed away when he was only one year-old, so he never knew him. Their house was located right behind a large lake, which was where he enjoyed to go fishing with his friends occasionally.

As soon as Kody got into his bedroom, he tossed his backpack on the floor next to his bed. Then he ran back to the kitchen and enjoyed the snack that his mother had left in the refrigerator to eat, to hold him over until she came home from work. She worked at a large office building downtown.

When he finished his ham-and-cheese sandwich, he ran back into his room and pulled his math textbook and his notebook out of his backpack.

“Let me get this over with so that I can chat and play my video games…” he mumbled to himself. “And maybe take a nap… I’m getting sleepy!”

Kody worked on his sixth-grade math problems and finished them off. Then he changed into his shorts and t-shirt, before he crawled onto his bed. He closed his eyes for a moment before drifting off into a deep sleep.

He didn’t get to sleep for long. When he woke up, he had a pounding headache.

“Ooooh man…” Kody groaned, as he rubbed his hand over his head. “Why does my head feel like it’s about to burst? I never get headaches like this…”

Still feeling groggy, Kody just stared at the wall before him. His room was facing Edwards’s house, and there was a window just a few feet away from his bed. However, Kody just had a wall before him.

Suddenly, the white wall, which had posters of race cars and fighter jets hanging from it, appeared to become transparent while Kody continued to stare. Then, Edward’s house suddenly became visible. As Kody continued to stare, the walls of Eddy’s house also began to become transparent for his eyes as well!

For a brief moment, he was able to see Edward sitting at his desk in his bedroom! Then Kody closed his eyes and blinked. When he opened his eyes again, everything appeared to be normal again!

“What the heck was that?” he wondered out loud. “Did I just see Eddy, or was I dreaming?”

Kody walked over to the window, which was a few feet to the other side of the wall, and verified that his wall was indeed facing Eddy’s house.

“I must be seeing things…” he thought.

He then put on his socks and shoes and got ready to run out the house to go to Eddy’s to play some video games for the rest of the afternoon…

“I left the game in its plastic bag and I put it in one of these drawers. Darn it! I forgot which drawer I put it in…” Eddy replied, as he frantically searched through the large, wooden drawer.

As Kody stared at the large wooden dresser containing five large drawers which were stacked on top of each other, suddenly the wood became transparent to Kody’s eyes, and he was able to see the contents of each drawer right before him! Then, he spotted the plastic bag containing the game in the third drawer from the top.

“I think the game is in the third drawer, dude…” Kody said calmly.

Eddy has just closed the top drawer and he had now opened the second one.

“No… I think I put it in here!” Eddy said, as he rummaged through the second drawer, which was filled with books, papers, pens, and small toys.

“No, man… Look in the third drawer!” Kody grinned. “I’m serious!”

Eddy closed the second drawer and finally opened the third one. Then, right before him, he spotted the plastic bag, containing the new video game. He pulled the game out of the drawer and held it right before him.

“Hey! How did you know that my new game was in the third drawer?” Eddy asked. “Did you put it there?”

“No way, dude!” Kody shrugged. “I just got here, remember?”

Eddy gave Kody a suspicious look. There was no other way Kody could have known where the game could have been, so he just though that Kody had made a lucky guess.

“Oh well… Lucky guess!” Eddy said, as he took the game out of the bag and inserted it into the video game console.

The two boys then started playing video games, when the phone rang.

“Oh shoot! I bet that’s my mom…” Eddy grumbled. “She always calls when I’m in the middle of a game…”

Eddy stood up and walked out into the hallways and strolled over to the kitchen, where the telephone hung from the wall.

“Hello?” Eddy said, as he answered the call.

Meanwhile, Kody was sitting on the floor, in Eddy’s bedroom, playing a video game. To Kody’s great surprise, he was able to hear the entire conversation between Eddy and his mother, word-for-word!

“That’s weird…” Kody thought to himself. “Why is it that I can hear everything they’re saying?”

Kody heard Eddy’s mother telling him that he had to finish his homework and that Kody wasn’t allowed to spend the night because they were expecting company over for dinner around 7 o’clock that evening. It was already after 6 o’clock, and Eddy still needed to finish his homework.

When Eddy walked back in the room, he had a very downcast look on his face. He didn’t say anything at all, but Kody already knew everything that was said in the conversation.

“Hey…” Kody said. “What’s wrong?”

“Nothing…”

“Hey, dude… I don’t want to get you in trouble… I’d better get back home since you guys are having company over, so you can finish your homework…” Kody said, as he switched off the video game.”I’ll come over again tomorrow, okay?”

“What? How did you know all that?” Eddy gasped.

“Ummm… Lucky guess?” Kody shrugged.

“You’ve had several lucky guesses today! How do you do that?” Eddy asked him.

“I-I don’t know! I just pick up on things…” Kody sighed. “The look on your face kinda gave it away…”

“Alright, dude… See ya tomorrow… I gotta finish my stupid homework before my mom kills me…”

“See ya!” Kody said, as he walked out the door and returned home.

As Kody walked out the door, he began to wonder how he was able to see the contents of Eddy’s dresser. That was the second time he was able to see through a solid object that afternoon! And, to make things even weirder, how was he going to explain the fact that he was able to overhear the entire telephone conversation between Eddy and his mother?

More question filled his mind, as he walked back into his house. What else was he going to discover about himself?

As Kody was walking towards his house, a sudden sound caught his attention. It came from the Anderson’s house, which was right across the street from his house. He knew Karen, a girl from school, and he also realized that her parents were very strict. It seemed like Karen’s parents were shouting at each other. Kody stood there, frozen on the sidewalk while standing right in front of his own house, staring at the house across the street. His x-ray vision and telescopic vision kicked in, while his super-hearing allowed him to hear everything that was being said behind the walls of the house, over one-hundred feet away from where he was standing.

“How come you didn’t pay for her school supplies?” Jack shouted and MaryAnn, who was Karen’s mother. “Do I have to come home from work just to get handed a bill from my daughter’s school for over forty Dollars?”

“I used the money to buy her cheerleading uniform!” MaryAnn shouted back. “For God’s sake, Jack! Let the child enjoy her time in middle school, will you?”

“She’s going to school to get an education, and not to wear a skimpy uniform just to dance around a bunch of football players! I forbid it! I want you to get that money back, and to pay for her school supplies, do you hear me?” Jack shouted, as he tore the bill in half.

“Mom! Dad! Stop it! STOP!” Karen begged them to the point of tears. “Just stop! I can’t take this anymore! I hate it when you two fight over me!”

Karen turned around and ran into her bedroom, slamming the door shut behind her. Then she jumped on her bed, face-down and clung to her pillow while she covered her pillow case with her tears.

Meanwhile, Kody stood outside, and he witnessed the entire spectacle from a distance, thanks to his strange, emerging powers, which he couldn’t yet explain or control. Just at that moment, Kody’s mother, Pam, pulled into the driveway with her car. Right away, she spotted Kody standing on the sidewalk, while he was staring at the house across the street. She parked the car and walked up to her son.

“Kody? Kody?” she asked him. For a moment, it seemed as if the boy was in some sort of trance, for he didn’t respond. He stood there, with his mouth open wide, and his eyes fixed on the house across the street, in a cold stare.

“KODY!” Pam shouted, as she got closer. “What’s the matter, son? What are you looking at?”

Kody was startled by his mother’s voice, and he turned to face her right away.

“I-I’m sorry mom… I was looking at something… Poor Karen…” Kody said calmly.

“Why are you staring at Karen’s house?” Pam asked him.

“Karen’s mom and dad were having another fight. I feel so sorry for her…” Kody said sadly, as he bowed his head.

“Kody?” Pam asked the boy calmly. “H-How do you know that Jack and MaryAnn were having a fight?”

“I saw it, mom…” he whispered. “And I heard it… I heard every word of it… It was ugly! I-I don’t want to talk about it… Can we go inside now?”

Pam embraced Kody and hugged him. She didn’t understand what he was talking about, or how he was able to see and hear things from such a distance, but she realized she needed to comfort him. Kody was obviously feeling upset, and she tried to make him feel better.

“Come on, let’s go inside, okay?” she said calmly.

Then, Pam and Kody walked inside through the garage door. Pam made sure she closed the garage door behind her, so that Kody wouldn’t see or hear anything from the Anderson’s house across the street. Little did she know that Kody would start picking up sights and sounds from much farther away now, than the Anderson’s house…?

“Okay Kody!” Edward ordered. “This is how it works. You got all the powers, but you must do everything I tell you!”

“Okay…” Kody replied humbly.

“In return, we will cover for you and we will protect you and help you learn all your cool powers!” Alex added. “Is that a deal?”

“Sounds like a deal!” Kody replied with a smile.

The boys stood in the middle of the open field, which was surrounded by tall trees and bushes.

“Kody! Take off and fly a few circles in the air so you get used to flying above us!” Edward commanded.

“Okay!” Kody responded.

Kody then extended his arms above his head and straight into the air. His body slowly rose off the ground, before leveling off into the horizontal position. Kody quickly ascended higher and higher, while flying in a wide, lazy circle around the area where Edward and Alex where standing, while he was waving down at them with his right hand.

“Whoohoo! You guys!!” he cheered, as he slowly flew in a wide circle.

“This is so cool!” Alex said, while looking up at the flying boy.

“Amazing!” Edward grinned. “Our best friend can fly!”

Kody extended his arms sideways as he banked to his right, making several turns and forming the number eight in the air, about twenty feet above the boys, who were looking from the ground.

“This is so much fun!” Kody cheered, as he descended and flew right over them, almost brushing their hair.

Kody circled around and came back, this time coming straight for Alex from behind. This time, he dove further down, and aimed for Alex’s waist. Just before he was right behind Alex, he grabbed Alex from behind, and lifted him off his feet and pulled him into the air with him!

“Whaaa!” Alex shouted. “KODY! What are you doing?”

“I’m taking you flying with me!” Kody said, as he carried Alex in his arms.

Kody flew a wide circle around the forest before slowing down and gently setting Alex down on the ground. Then, he took off again, and flew straight up into the air before coming straight down for Edward. He grabbed Edward from behind, and pulled him off the ground by his waist as well.

“WHOA!” Edward gasped, as he was lifted into the air.

“Having fun on Kody Airlines?” Kody chuckled, as he carried Edward with him.

“Wow! You’re going so fast!” Edward said, as he looked down at Alex, who was standing on the ground, looking up at the two flying boys.

Kody and Edward flew high over the woods and then circled around their house. Alex saw that, and started running towards Edward’s house. Since Edward had his bedroom window open, Kody flew into the room through the window. Luckily, Alex wasn’t far away, so it took him only a few minutes to catch up to the flying boys.

Once inside, Kody slowed down and hovered over the center of Edward’s room, before landing on his feet. He set Edward down, right in front of him.

“There! That was easy!” Kody laughed. “Now I know how to fly!”

Alex had just walked in the house and he entered the bedroom, closing the door behind him.

“What an amazing sight, seeing you guys flying like that!” he said to Kody and Edward.

“Well, let’s take a break and watch TV or play some video games?” Edward suggested, as he turned on his PC and his video game console.

Alex and Edward started playing a video game as Kody got on his bed, and started watching a movie on Edward’s PC screen. Since Edward had two large dual monitors, it was easy to watch a movie on his computer. Kody was feeling a little tired from all the excitement after all the flying so he grabbed one of Edward’s pillows and quietly dozed off while laying on Edward’s bed.

Edward and Alex didn’t pay any attention to Kody, since they were busy with the game and they heard the sound from the movie playing in the background. However, after ten minutes had passed, both boys had begun to notice something strange. When they looked up, they saw Kody floating almost six feet above them, in the center of the bedroom, hovering like a balloon!

“Holy smoke!” Alex whispered to Edward. “Look!”

Both boys got up and saw Kody floating in the air, but sound asleep, while clenching a pillow with both arms wrapped around it, and his head resting on the edge of the pillow.

“Looks like our superhero now flies in his sleep!” Edward whispered.

“That is so weird!” Alex whispered back, as they stood there, at Kody’s head. “He’s almost like a balloon!”

Edward then walked to the other end of Kody’s body, which floated in the complete horizontal position, and gently grabbed hold of his right tennis shoe. Then he slowly pulled Kody towards one end of the room, where his bed was.

“Wow! When he flies, he weighs the same as a sheet of paper!” Edward noted. “This is awesome!”

“We need to watch him… Always!” Alex stated. “Especially in school!”

“We’ll use cell phones and earpieces… I have them! That way, we can always talk to him!” Edward noted. “Because we don’t know where he will go, now that he knows how to fly!”

“Yeah! He’s ours! And nobody else’s!” Alex stated.

The two boys couldn’t help but feel proud of their alien superhero-to-be, and wonder what strange power he would discover next…
12421111111.title: Kody's first solo flight

124211111111.content:
A couple of days later, Alex, Kody and Ed were heading off to school. The school-bus broke down so they found themselves walking the last few blocks to the campus. They talked in whispers about Kody's powers. Flying, heat-rays out of his eyes, X-ray vision, supersonic hearing...

"...Oh, that would be so cool!..." said Kody. Eddy grinned. The three boys started crossing the street. Kody tugged out a ten-dollar note his mother had given him as lunch-money. He fingered it in his hands when a slight breeze tugged it out from between his fingers. It fluttered to the ground a couple of feet from him. Kody walked over and picked it up.

"So anyway, I thought that perhaps you could...Kody?"

Eddy turned around. Kody was gone. Alex looked behind him to see Kody bending down to pick up his ten-dollar note.

"Hey Kody!"
"Yeah just a minute!"

Kody was having trouble picking up the smooth, flat note which was lying on the ground. His fingers just wouldn't grip it. COME ON! Kody tried again, but the note refused to crinkle up into his hands. He tried pinching one of the edges. Got it!

"KODY!" Alex was screaming! Kody looked up and yelped! A truck the size of a blue whale was charging towards him!
"Oh God, I wish I wasn't here!" Kody whispered.

Suddenly, everything went blurry. Then white. Then...

Kody felt something soft underneath his feet. He opened his eyes. He wasn't standing on the road at all! He could feel grass under his feet. He looked around. He was standing behind a tree, next to the road. Alex and Eddy were staring after the truck. Kody felt dizzy. What the HELL just happened!?

"Hey guys!" he shouted. Ed and Alex jumped about two feet in the air and turned around. They yelped in relief and ran over.

"WHAT DID YOU DO!?" Eddy screamed.
"I don't know!" Kody panted, "I...I..."
"You didn't..." Alex whispered.
"Didn't...what?" Kody asked, nervously.
"You can teleport!" said Alex. "You can move from place to place! Oh man that is awesome!"
"I...I can?...I CAN!" Kody said. "Woah..."
"How did you do it?" Ed asked.
"I...I'm not sure yet..." said Kody.
"Well think about it. It'll come to you," said Ed. "Come on, we're gonna be late for school."
124211111111.title: Teleportation Powers!

1242111111111.content:
During lunchtime, Kody, Ed and Alex had more fun with Kody's new powers. They smuggled a magnifying glass out of the science-labs after their chemistry experiment and they were sitting in a quiet spot behind one of the larger buildings on campus, with Kody pretending to burn pieces of paper with the glass. He wasn't, really. It was too shady, and to burn stuff with a magnifying glass you need really strong sunlight. Kody was holding the glass up to his eyes and looking through it. He narrowed his eyes as if he was trying to concentrate on something really small. He was actually concentrating on fire. He was thinking...FIRE!

Fhwoomp!!

Alex and Ed watched as Kody's eyes turned blood red, glowing like traffic-lights. A laser-beam-like light shot out of them, passing quite harmlessly through the glass, and hitting the paper which Ed had scrunched up and put under the glass. It smouldered, then burst into flames!

"Aww man!" said Alex, "This is awesome, okay, my turn next."

He ripped a piece of paper out of an exercise book, scrunched it up and put it under the glass.

"OUCH!!" Alex yelped. Kody blinked and the red in his eyes vanished. "Oh Jeeze, sorry man, did I get you?"
"A bit..." said Alex. He was rubbing the back of his hand and Kody saw a small burn-mark there. Kody grinned, "Sorry," he said. He turned back to the paper.

"Naughty naughty naughty, you little boys are gonna get caughty!"

Kody nearly smashed the glass into his face. He turned around to see three figures standing in front of him and his friends.

Kody, Alex and Eddie were sitting on a low, brick wall, about three feet high. In front of them were the back walls of the art-classroom. The space of the passage between the classroom walls and the lower, brick wall which they were sitting on was perhaps three or four feet wide. It was a shady, lonely spot in the school, perfect for such activities as burning paper with your eyes. Unfortunately, Kody and his friends had decided to do this activity at the corner of the building and wall, where the paved passage turned at right-angles. One figure stood at one end of the passage, another at the other end, and one, right in front of them, leaning against the angle in the classroom's outer wall. Eddy gulped.

Adam, Greg and Kaydan were huge. They were in their senior years in highschool, they would be leaving next year. But before leaving, they were damned sure they were gonna make life living hell for just about everyone else. Including, it seemed, the three amigoes sitting innocently on the wall.

"What do you want, Kaydan?" Alex said, trying to sound more confident than he was. The three bullies were huge. They were your stereotypical highschool jocks. About six feet tall, muscular, tough, popular and stupid.

"We noticed that you guys haven't had LUNCH yet," said Greg. "All that money in your pockets must be burning a hole there, huh? Why not give it to us?"

"No way!" said Alex, standing up.
"I don't think you have a choice," said Kaydan, moving closer.

Kody grabbed his two friends and pulled them back. "Let me handle this..." he whispered, "give me your money..."
"WHAT?" Alex hissed back.
"Just do it! You want another bleeding nose to explain to your mother? How many times can you walk into a door?"
"I guess you're right..."

The two friends dug their money out of their pockets. Kody handed over the crumpled five and ten-dollar banknotes. Kaydan pocketed it. "Good boys," he said. And turned to leave. Kody watched him carefully. He watched which pocket he put the money into. Then he watched Kaydan take out a box of matches and light a cigarette. He watched him put the matches into the same pocket as the money...perfect...

"Kody...what are you doing...?" Alex whispered. He saw Kody's eyes turn red.
"Stop talking, I need to concentrate..." Kody hissed.

It didn't take much. There was a pause, and then...

Frrrumph!!

The matches in Kaydan's jeans did a hotbox and all the little splinters of wood caught fire at once! It was like a miniature firework! He screamed as smoke and flames rushed out of his pocket!

"RUN!" Kody screamed. Alex and Eddy took off, with Kody just behind them. Kaydan screamed and threw himself on the ground, rolling from side to side, trying to put the fire out. Adam threw his coat him and finally beat the flames out. Kody and his friends watched from behind a bench nearby.

"Oh man that was AWESOME!" said Alex. "How did you do that?"
"The matchbox made a pretty obvious shape inside his pocket," said Kody, "I just concentrated on it...sorry about your lunch-money..."
"Dude, it was WORTH IT!" said Alex, laughing. Eddie grinned.
1242111111111.title: Money burning a hole in your pocket...?

12421111111112.content:
"Mr. Hart!"

Kody and his friends turned around to see one of their teachers walking towards them.
"Yes sir?" said Kody. It was Mr. Arden, the maths teacher.
"I saw you and your friends running just now," he said. "You knocked over the rubbish bin over there. I want you to clean it all up."
"Yes sir," said Kody. "Come on, guys."

The bin wasn't too heavy, and Alex and Ed tipped it right way up again. Kody started flinging rubbish back into the bin. He was furious.

"Who do those jerks think they are!?" he shouted as he tossed empty yogurt cups and clingwrap into the bin. "ONE DAY I'm gonna get them!"
"Dude, you nearly roasted his balls right off!" said Alex, still laughing, "I think that's revenge enough."
"Yeah, but they make me so ANGRY!" Kody said. He picked up a glass bottle and held it in his hands. "All of them do! They think they can just bully people and get away with it and..."

CRACK! CRUNCH!!

Kody let out a yelp of surprise. Alex and Ed looked up. The bottle in Kody's hand was gone!

"Um...what just happened?" Ed asked.
"I...I don't know!" said Kody.
"It's another power!" said Alex, excitedly, "What did you do?"

Kody thought for a minute. He was ranting about Kaydan and the other bullies, he had a bottle in his hand. It was a glass lemonade bottle. He was squeezing it because he was so angry and...and then...and then...

Kody looked at his right hand, which was still clenched in a fist of rage. No way, he thought. He did not just..he didn't just...

walking over to the bin, Kody held his right fist over it and slowly opened his hand.

Powdered glass, as fine as the sand it was once made of, sprinkled out into the bin like dust.

"Woah!" said Alex, he grabbed Kody's hand. "You didn't even cut yourself! There's no bleeding or anything!"

Kody looked at his hand. Sure enough, there wasn't anything there!...Well, apart from a bit of crushed glass. Carefully, he dusted his hand off. "What the hell is going on?" he mouthed.

Ed finished binning all the rubbish, and then he picked up something else. "What about this?" he said. He handed Kody a brick.

"No way!" said Alex, "He can't!..."
"He just turned that bottle into dust!" said Ed, defensively.
"Yeah but that was hollow!" said Kody, "Anyone could do it..."
"Go on, give it a shot!" said Ed. Kody sighed and took the brick. He clasped it in both his hands and thought for a minute. Then, he tensed his body and twisted his wrists outwards.

CRACK!

The brick shattered as Kody snapped it clean in half!

"Okay THIS is weird..." said Kody, "It didn't even feel like a brick!"
"Huh?" Alex asked. He was examining the brick which Kody had just destroyed. It was a clean break right through!
"It was like...Like I was...Hold out your hand."
"Wh..." Alex goggled. But, he held out his hand. Kody slapped one half of the brick into his friend's hand. "What's it feel like?" he asked.
"A brick? What else?" Alex asked.
"Feels like a cookie to me," said Kody. "Feels like a potato chip!" And as if to make his point, Kody crushed the remaining half of the brick with his other hand, as easily as if he was crunching up a single potato chip. Reddy-brown dust trickled out of the bottom of his clenched fist.

"Duuude..." said Ed. "What's this mean?"
"It's super-strength!" said Alex, quickly, "that's what it is!"
"I think he's right," said Kody, "How many people can crush bricks to dust?"
"That is cool..." Ed said. "I wonder what else you can do?"

124211111111121.content:
Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrring!!

"Damn!" Kody swore. It was the end of lunchtime. Quickly, the boys headed back to their classroom and sat down. It was time for English. Kody sat down at the back, with Eddy and Alex. Their English teacher Mr. Matthews entered.

"Okay boys, now today's class is a double-period before we all pack up and go home, so let's just have a bit fun, hmm? I want you take out some paper and a pen and do a bit of writing. Whatever you like. Make it creative, fantastic, scary, mystical. Work on it during the week when you can, and hand it in next Monday."

Sitting down at his desk, Mr. Matthews took out a book and started reading. Kody and his friends took out their notepads and pens and started writing. Kody struggled...then he got an idea. Why not write about his super-powers? Pfft. Nobody would believe him. And if they asked him to prove it, he could just fake it and say that it was an 'off day' for him. But then...perhaps he should change the kid's name? Yeah...

Kody started writing. He'd covered two or three pieces of paper on both sides before someone tapped him on the shoulder. Kody was angry. He was working on a totally ass-kicking story about a kid named Lance who was the Blue Flash, super-kid who could do anything, when he was forced to acknowledge the interruption. It was Alex.

"WHAT?" Kody growled, although not very loud.
"Are you paying attention to what you're doing?" Alex whispered.
"Huh?"

Alex picked up the pen which Kody was writing with and pressed the tip to the desk and then picked it up again. A small, black burn-mark was left there.

"Hey!" Kody hissed, "What gives, man?"
"You're writing so fast you're melting your pen! Look!"

Kody looked. Sure enough, the hard, ballpoint tip of his pen and the plastic sleeve were smoking! What the...

Kody thought for a minute. Was this a new power?...Not that writing super-fast could be considered a 'power' but...Then Kody thought a bit more. He ripped a blank sheet of paper from his notepad and scrunched it up and aimed for the bin on the other side of the room and threw.

CRACK! PANG!

Alex watched as Kody's arm flashed through the air, catapaulting the ball of paper across the room. The ball hit the window, cracking it, and then fell into the bin, hitting the side and denting it. But that was normal, sorta. Kody had just acquired super-strength. But then Alex saw Kody moving. He was FAST! REAL FAST! Alex decided to do a test. He snatched up Kody's book and threw it across the room, aiming right for Mr. Matthews' head.

Kody jumped up from his seat, whizzed throgh the room, grabbed the book and zipped back, quicker than the time it took the second-hand on the clock to move! The two friends looked at each other. SUPER SPEED!

Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrring!!

"Alright, dismissed!" said Mr. Matthews. "Have those stories in by this time next week."

Back at home, Kody tried experimenting more and more. He waved his hands, snapped his fingers, jumped, blew, blinked his eyelids, waved his arms, kicked...Nothing. He wondered if this was the limit of his powers? No. His mother said he had the powers of FIFTY superpeople. He had to have more powers!...he just didn't know how to get them going yet.

It was a boring night at home. He sat or lay around, reading, writing, doing homework, watching TV. Playing on his computer. In the end, he just lazed around in front of the TV, trying to kill time until he had to go to bed.

"Scratchers! Come here!"

A little ginger furball ran across the living-room and Kody tried to catch it, but the cat raced under the coffee-table and behind the TV. Kody swore! He bent down and yanked the cat out from behind the set.

12421111111112111.content:
“Darn cat… Running around the house!” Kody grumbled, as he got on his knees and crawled behind the TV set, where several appliances were plugged in to one electrical outlet in the wall. “Scratchers!”

Kody reached over for the outlet, and grabbed the plug where the lamp was plugged in, when he realized that the plug was about to fall out. His hand just brushed the plug, and it did fall out, and it landed on the carpet.

“Oh… I’m so clumsy!” Kody groaned.

Kody’s hand accidentally got closer to the electrical out, when electrical sparks came shooting out of the unused outlet, and struck Kody in all five of his fingertips!

“Ohmygosh!” Kody gasped.

The weird thing was, however, that Kody didn’t feel a thing!

“Holy smoke! The electricity is going from the outlet to my fingers, but I don’t feel anything!” Kody wondered out loud. However, when Kody turned towards the window, he noticed that all his hair was standing straight up!

“Ahhhhh! My hair!” he gasped. “I’m loaded with an electrical charge!”

Kody quickly pulled back his hand, so that the electricity would stop going from the outlet through his fingers. He then reached down, and picked up the end of the power cord, which belonged to the lamp, which stood on top of the TV set. As soon as his thumb touched the metal tips of the electrical power plug, the lamp lit up!

“Oh cool! I’m like a power source!” he laughed.

Then he removed the thumb, and the lamp turned off again. He repeated the process, and saw the lamp switch off and on and off and on several times. Finally, he plugged the cord back into the wall outlet.

“Haha! I discovered a new power!” he chuckled. “I can allow my body to get an electrical charge, so I can give electricity to other things just by touching them!”

He couldn’t wait to show –and tell- Alex and Edward about his cool, new power…
