124211111111121111.content:
Alex and Edward had walked over to the park, with Alex’s little sister Katie. Katie was walking around with a small bottle of soap, and a plastic ring. She was dipping the ring into the bottle and then taking it out, and holding it out and before her lips, so she could blow bubbles in the air with it.

“Look, Alex, look at my bubbles!” Katie grinned. “Can you make any bigger bubbles?”

“Sure, Katie… I can try—“he replied.

Just then, Kody appeared standing right next to Alex. He had teleported there from his house. He decided to use his teleportation powers more often now.

“Hello!” Kody said with a smile.

“Whoa! Dude! Don’t just pop up like that! You scared me!” Alex gasped.

“Oh… Sorry…” Kody said sadly. “Didn’t want to scare you, bro…”

“It’s alright, dude…” Alex sighed. “So, discovered any new powers these days?”

“Yeah! I got an electrical charge! I can turn on any electrical device with my fingers!” Kody cheered.

“Good! You can charge my cell phone… It’s kinda low…” Alex mumbled, as he took his cell phone out of his pocket and handed it to Kody.

Kody took the cell phone and placed his thumb on the charger’s plug.

“Now charging” the cell phone beeped.

“Whoa!” Alex gasped. “You’re serious!”

“Yup! Your phone will be all charged up in a few seconds!” Kody grinned.

“Beep! Charge complete!” the little device in Kody’s hand beeped.

“There ya go!” Kody said, as he handed the cell phone back to his friend. “All charged up!”

“Dang… I bet you can charge up all my batteries, too…”

“Yup!” Kody shrugged.

“Kody!” Katie said excitedly, as she tapped on Kody’s shoulder. “Can you blow some big bubbles for me?”

“Sure, Katie!” he said, taking the bottle of liquid soap from the little girl, as he was facing Alex.

Kody dipped the ring in the liquid and pulled it out.

“You have to blow hard!” Katie suggested.

Kody did just as she said. He took a deep breath, and then exhaled.

SSSSSWWWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOSSSSSHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!

A mighty, powerful gust of wind came from Kody’s lips! In fact, hurricane-force wind came from his mouth, blowing Alex off his feet and causing the boy to fly through the air, over 10 feet off the ground!

“Whaaaaaaaaahhh!!!!” Alex screamed, as he went airborne!

“Oh no!” Kody shouted. “I’d better catch him before he gets hurt!”

Kody ran at super speed after Alex, and raced right past him. Then, he estimated where Alex would fall, and extended his arms so he could catch his friend like a football. When Alex came down, Kody caught him, preventing the boy from getting injured.

“Uhhh!” Alex groaned, as he landed in Kody’s arms.

Alex was still in a daze.

Kody ran back to where Katie was standing at super speed. Then he tried it again, and tried to control his super breath this time.

1242111111111211111.content:
Kody, Edward, and his little sister Katie walked around the park a little longer, when Eddy and his sister went back home for dinner. Kody decided to leap in the air and fly home for a change, after making sure that nobody was around to see him from the ground.

After a few minutes of flying, Kody landed on the balcony, and walked in the second floor of the house. Then he strolled into his bedroom, where he began to change into other clothes. He was about to change into his sweats, when he was overcome by a sudden, intense stiffness in his joints and his muscles.

“Uh oh… I feel strange… I feel like I’m changing!” Kody wondered out loud.

Then, Kody began to notice something really strange. His feet no longer felt natural. His feet began to feel like they were made out of… metal! After a few seconds, his toes, his ankle, and his heal had turned to solid steel!

“Hey! I’m turning into steel!” Kody gasped, as he looked down. He quickly stumbled to the full-body mirror in the bathroom, making a thump-thump sound as his steel feet hit the floor. His legs began to feel heavier and heavier.

His skin began to change as well. His skin began to change gradually, from his ankles going up to his calves, changing from his smooth skin to thick, smooth metal. His calves slowly converted to metal, then his knees, and finally his quads began to convert to solid steel as well.

“Oh man! Am I becoming some sort of a robot or cyborg?” Kody began to wonder, as he saw his legs completely transform to steel.

Kody tried to move, and he was pleasantly surprised that he was able to walk on his metallic legs. In fact, his legs felt heavy, but powerful. They were thick, and strong. He could tell that his legs were now built to last! Not only that, his legs were slightly longer than they were originally, making Kody stand a few inches taller. He was all light metallic-gray, almost like silver-colored.

Then, the strange transformation began to creep further upwards across the rest of Kody’s body. The change felt good, though. First, his waist, and then his abdominals changed into a steel plate of muscle. His chest then morphed into two spheres of metallic pectorals, sticking out like armor protecting a mighty warrior in battle. Then, his broad shoulders and his upper arms and his biceps converted to light gray metal as well, as the skin disappeared and changed to metal. Finally, his hands, his wrists, and his fingers turned to thick, solid steel. This gave him a grip of steel as well!

“Oh wow! I feel so… strong!” Kody chuckled, as he raised his metal arm and flexed. He then made a fist and closed his fingers. He marveled at the way all five fingers moved so smoothly. Still, his arms felt thick and heavy, but he also felt as if his skin had become like armor!

The metallic transformation continued to creep upward as Kody’s shoulder blades turned to steel. Then, his neck and lower jaw started to change as well. Finally, his cheeks, his chin, his lips, his nose, and his eyes began to transform into metal, although Kody still retained his ability to breath, speak, look, and smell. Within moments, his entire head had changed to metal! Even though he had turned to steel, it was still easy to recognize him as Kody Hart. His face still retained all his features, just; he was now completely made of steel!

Kody walked into the living room, where Pam was just watching TV after coming home from work.

“Hey, mom! Look what happened to me!” Kody chuckled, as he strolled in the living room. With every step he took, he made a loud, deep “thump” sound on the carpet.

“Oh my goodness!” Pam gasped. “I was wondering what that noise was! You’ve turned into a boy of steel!”

Kody walked up to the couch, where Pam was sitting, so she could examine her metallic son.

“How are you feeling?”

“I-I feel great, mom… I just feel really heavy… I’m all metal!” Kody laughed.

“Yes, I bet you must weigh a ton!” Pam observed.

“I feel really strong, too…” Kody grinned. “I want to show my new look to Eddy and Alex…”

“Go for it, iron-boy!” Pam laughed. “Don’t scare them!”

Kody closed his eyes and began to concentrate on contacting Eddy and Alex telepathically.

“Guys! You guys want to see what I look like now? I’m all metal!” Kody thought.

Both boys replied excitedly “Yes!”

Kody then concentrated on teleporting both boys to his living room. Then, suddenly, both Eddy and Alex appeared standing right before him!

“Hey guys!” Kody smiled.

Both Alex and Edward stood there, gawking at their metallic friend, who now looked like a teenage robot.

“What happened to you?” Alex shouted.

“I guess I changed into Iron-Boy!” Kody replied.

Edward walked up to Kody and tapped his finger against Kody’s metallic chest.

TONK! TONK!

“So… What do you think, huh?” Kody laughed.

“Do you still have all your other powers?” Eddy asked the metallic boy.

12421111111112112.content:
"Yo Kody!"

Kody jumped the fence into Alex's backyard. Alex was in the pool, swimming. It was a large pool, about nine feet deep. It was a warm day and Kody was dressed in a T-shirt and boxer-shorts.

"Hey Kody! Come in!" Alex shouted.

"I can't!" Kody shouted, "I don't know how to swim."
"Oh come on! You can stay up the shallow end!"
"Yeah but.."

Before Kody knew what happened, he felt two hands at his back, pushing! He tripped forward and fell, head-first right into the deep end of the pool!

"Gotcha!" Eddie shouted, and cannonballed in.

Kody hit the water and gasped. He kicked towards the surface, but for some reason he couldn't get there! He thrashed wildly with his arms and legs but the moment his head reached the surface, it went under again!

"YOU IDIOT!" Alex screamed at Eddie, "Get a pole to get him out!"

Eddie jumped out of the pool and Alex swam over to Kody, who was going down fast. Alex dived and tried to grab Kody, but he couldn't pull him up.

Kody was panting and gargling under water, water filled his mouth, his throat, nose, lungs...He gurgled water out and gurgled more in...and out...and in...and out...and in again!

Kody could breathe under water.

Kody plunged deeper and deeper until he was just a few inches from the bottom.

"KODY!" Eddie screamed.
"Hey chill!" Alex shouted, "Look!"

Eddie stuck his head underwater. Kody was sitting, quite calmly, on the bottom of the pool, as calmly as if he was lying in bed! His black hair swirled around him, but he seemed to be perfectly fine. There were no oxygen bubbles anywhere, but he didn't seem to be having any trouble breathing. Suddenly, Kody stood up at the bottom of the pool, and started kicking...faster, faster, faster, fastser, faster...

Kody broke the surface and flew three feet into the air before hitting the water again, drenching everyone!

"I..." he coughed and spat out water, "I can breathe under water! Oh this is cool!"

124211111111121122.content:
Swimming to the edge of the pool, Kody climbed out and shook the water out of his hair.

"That was cool!" said Alex. Kody grinned and he went to get a rubber floaty-mat. he threw it into the pool and climbed on. The mat wobbled and rippled and Eddy and Alex watched. Eddie tugged the mat to try and make Kody fall into the water, but he had surprisingly good balance.

"Get get me!" Kody shouted. And it was true. No matter how hard or which way Alex or Eddy tugged the floating rubber mat, Kody stayed on it perfectly. Then Alex got an idea. Grabbing the broom which Eddie had tried to save Kody's life with, he pushed it between Kody's legs. Eddie grabbed one end of the broom and Alex grabbed the other. Together, they dived, taking the mat DOWN with them!

They'd gone down perhaps three feet when they realised they hadn't heard the loud 'splash!' which they thought they should. They kicked around in the water and looked up. They could see the soles of Kody's feet through the water...and he looked perfectly still.

Quickly, they kicked back up to the surface!

Kody was standing on the surface of the pool, as easily as if he was standing on land!

"What the hell?" Alex gasped. He grabbed Kody's ankle and pulled. Kody stumbled...but remained on the surface of the water.

"No way..." Eddie said.

Kody jumped. He hit the surface again...and stayed there. He took a few steps foward...back, side to side...he stayed on the water! He ran! He stepped out of the pool and jumped in again!

RIGHT DOWN! Kody gasped and swam to the edge again. This time, he put one foot out over the water and stepped down.

Then the other foot. He was standing on the water.

Kody tried this several more times until he discovered that if he wanted to walk on water or pretended to walk on water or made to walk on water - He would. If he wanted to go INTO the water, then he would! This was awesome! He had to try this at the beach!

"Woah!" Kody gasped, as he climbed out of the pool again. "This is cool! Hey, you guys have some clothes I can change into?"
"I've got some boxer shorts in the laundry," Alex said, "try them on and then you can come out here again."

Kody headed into Alex's laundry and dug out a pair of clean boxer-shorts. He unddressed and looked at himself in the mirror. A young, slim boy with black hair stared back. Terrified, he looked at his hands...Gone. His arms. Gone. His entire body had disappeared! What was goig on? Kody punched the mirror. Ouch...well perhaps he was still here, but his reflection...his visible self...was gone. Kody stared at the reflective side of the washing-machine. Nothing. He ran usptairs and looked at himself on the kettle on the stove. Nothing. The toaster. Nothing. The fridge. Nothing.

Alex and Edward had enough of swimming in the pool, and they decided to get out of the water for a few minutes and lay on the two lounge chairs for a few minutes, and work on their sun tans. They each put on their sun glasses, and got on the chairs.

They left their towels next to them, on the floor. Since Kody had just discovered that he could become invisible, he decided to have some fun with his new power. Kody then stood right between the two lounge chairs, where Edward and Alex were laying down, and decided to tease them, while completely unseen by either boy.

He picked up the towel, and tossed it on top of Alex’s chest. At first, Alex just brushed it off, and pushed the towel back on the ground. He did it the second time as well. Then, the towel raised up from the ground, and magically floated back on to his chest for the third time.

“Hey!” Alex said to Edward. “Quit it!”

“Quit what?” Edward wondered. “I didn’t do anything!”

Then Kody walked up to the edge of the pool, and used his hand, to splash a little water over Alex.

“What did you do that for?” Alex said, while getting annoyed.

“You just splashed water over me!”

“What?” Edward gasped. “I haven’t moved from my chair! What are you talking about?”

Alex just folded his arms and stared at Edward for awhile. Then he closed his eyes. A few seconds had passed, and water was splashed all over him again!

This time, Alex got up from the chair; he walked over to the edge of the pool, and started splashing water over Edward, using his hands.

“Hey! What… What are you DOING???” Edward shouted.

Edward got up and ran over to the other edge of the pool, and started splashing Alex. While they were now splashing water at each other, they noticed that the water started covering an invisible figure, that was standing right between the two boys!

“Ha ha ha ha!!!”

They heard this laughing… It sounded just like Kody!

“KODY?” Edward shouted. “Where are you?”

Suddenly, Kody appeared, standing right between the two boys, and he was completely drenched!

“Ha ha ha ha!! That was great!” he was laughing out loud.

“Holy smoke! He was invisible!” Edward noted. “He has a new power!”

“Oooh boy…” Alex sighed. “We’re in deep trouble now! If Kody can become invisible, then we may never know where he’s at or what he’s doing…”

124211111111121122222.content:
"Thanks Mrs. Hart," said Alex as he rolled out the mattress on the floor of Kody's bedroom.

"No problem!" said Pam, "I know how uncomfortable it can be, sleeping in a house with no air-conditioning in the middle of summer! Poor boys. Does your father know when it'll be repaired?"
"Naw," Alex said. "This heat's playing havoc with all the electricity around town. People running their fans and air-con so much it's overwhelming the powerboard."

"Well you boys can sleep here tonight," said Pam, ushering Eddie into the same room, "Our house is always nice and cool in summer."

Kody helped Alex and Eddie roll out their mattresses on the floor of his bedroom.

"Nice of your mom to let us stay overnight," said Eddie. "You think the power's gonna fail totally?"
"Why?" Alex asked.
"A blackout! We can use candles!"

Alex giggled. Eddie loved playing around with fire. Closing the door and turning off the light and drawing the curtains to keep the heat out, the three boys lay down on their beds and mattresses, chatting about nothing in particular. Outside, it began to rain. A real summer downpour. The boys kept talking, louder and louder, trying to make themselves heard over the rain. A thunderclap echoed around and the house shook!

"I'm going to bed, boys!" Mrs. Hart called through the closed bedroom door, "Try not to make too much noise!"

"Okay mah!" Kody shouted, "Come on, let's get to bed."

Rolling over, the boys tried their best to fall asleep. It wasn't easy. The falling rain echoed through the house, drumming on the roof and gurgling over the gutters. Alex groaned and rolled over. And over. And over. He fell off his mattress onto the floor and grunted in pain. He got up and laid down on his mattress again.

Something creaked. Alex sat up.

Another creak.

Alex stared around the room. "HOLY!..." he yelped and stuffed as much blanket into his mouth as he could to stop himself from screaming. Two bright, white ovals of light were hovering in mid-air above Kody's bed.

"K-k-Kody?" he whispered.

"Hmm?"
"Wh...what's that?"
"What?"

Alex got up and felt his way to Kody's bed and sat down. Now he realised that Kody was awake and sitting up.

"Tha..." Alex reached out for the two white lights...

"OUCH! Jesus man, what gives!?" Kody snapped, shoving Alex's fingers away, "That HURTS!"

"Wh..." Alex was speechless. Kody blinked, trying to get rid of the pain. He blinked and blinked until the sudden pain was gone. He sighed, "Ouch," he said. He looked up again. Alex's mouth dropped. Kody's eyes were shining in the dark! Kody blinked and Alex yelped, turning away! Two, twin beams of light shot out of Kody's eys, lighting up the entire room!

"Eddie!" Alex hissed, shaking Eddie on his mattress, "Eddie, man! Wake up!"
"Turn the light off!" Eddie groaned, "I want to...woah!"

Eddie sat up, shielding his eyes from the light coming from Kody's, "What the hell!?"
"It's kinda cool, huh?" Kody said, he stared around the room, his eyes lighting up everything. Kody drew back the curtains of his bedroom window and stared outside. His friends joined him. Kody's "eyelight" shone right down the road! They could see to the end of the street, as clearly through the pouring rain, as if it was daytime!

"This is...weird!" Alex said. Kody blinked, and his lights went off, "Yeah...cool, though." He opened his eyes again. He started slightly. Everything was green and yellow...wha...Kody stared around his pitch-black room. He could see everything! Everything, as easily as if he'd just turned on his bedroom light. Experimentally, he turned on the light. Nothing happened. He guessed the power really was out, due to the storm, but he could totally see everything! He had night-vision too!

Kody sat on his bed, blinking, his eyelights went from weak all the way to headlamp, searchlight, ligththouse-intensity brightness! And then, he could see in the dark, too! This was awesome! Kody couldn't wait to try out his new powers...

"HEY SNOTBALL!"

Kody and Alex stopped. Ed turned around.

"Koooody..." he said. Kody turned around too, and swore.

Kaydan, Adam and Greg were walking towards them, the massive seniors towered over the youngsters. Kody noted with supreme satisfaction that the place where Kaydan's right blue-jeans pockets were, had disappeared, replaced with a singed, frayed area which showed off his boxer-shorts underneath. Did he go around the rest of the school day looking like THAT? What a jerk!

"You got lucky, asswipe!" Kaydan said. He seemed to be singling Kody out for some reason. He was advancing steadily towards him and the three boys started backing away until they hit a fence.

They had been walking home from school, when they were accosted, and Kody had led them all down a side-street. Right now they found themselves in an alleyway, with no-where to go. Alex looked around for something to defend himself with, and picked up an old, rusty pipe.

"I didn't do anything!" said Kody, calmly. "It's stupid to keep matches in your pocket. My mommy always said that..."

A sickening 'Crack!' told Alex that something - possibly Greg's jawbone, had been broken. He grunted and fell over, hitting his head and falling to the ground in an unconcious heap. Eddie tried to defend himself but he was pinned against the wall with Adam beating the living daylights out of him.

Kaydan was swinging left and right, trying to nail one, but Kody kept ducking and weaving. He remembered all those old martial-arts films that they showed on TV, and he copied all the movements. Finally, he decided he had to do something.

"You want something?" he panted, "Sure!"

Kody jumped up and swinging back his fist he hurled it forward!

The sound would've made anyone throw up. Blood and teeth spurted out as Kody's right fist hit Kaydan in the cheek, smashing his jawbone. He let out a scream and fell back. He could feel blood inside his mouth and he spat out a couple of broken teeth. "You..."

Kody kicked him between the legs and Kaydan toppled back onto the ground, one hand grabbing his face, the other one nursing his tortured goody-bag.

Alex had managed to knock Adam out with the pipe and, finding themselves without any opponents, the boys grabbed hold of Kody, who teleported them out of there as fast as he could.

12421111111112121.content:
Kody got home and sat down at his desk in his room. He only had the English work to do and with his newfound powers, he got it done in no-time. His mother had gone out for dinner with friends so he found himself alone that evening after dinner. He was lazing in front of the TV when the doorbell rang. Kody opened the door and saw Eddy and Alex standing there.

"Hey," said Kody, "what's up?"
"Well we finished our work and we wanted to...I dunno...hang out?" Eddie asked. Kody smiled, "Sure, come in."

The three boys sat down in front of the TV and Kody licked his lips, "You guys want anything? It's so hot..."
"Yeah okay," said Alex, lazily. Kody yawned and got up. Warm weather always made him sleepy. He shuffled to the kitchen, his mind on the tubs of ice-cream in the fridge...

Fwunk!

The freezer door swung open completely of its own accord. Kody stopped. Huh?

He licked his lips again...then he nearly screamed when he saw three tubs of ice-cream float out of the freezer in front of him! No way! Kody wondered what kind of new power this was. He grabbed the ice-cream and put it on the counter in the kitchen. He took out bowls and then wondered what kind of spoons he would need. The cutlery drawer sprang open and three dessert-spoons and one large serving-spoon floated out. Kody paused and thought about what was going on...Everything he'd thought about had floated out towards him. What did this mean?

Kody thought about three drinking glasses, and sure enough, they floated out of the cupboard and onto the counter.

"I think I'm onto something here," he said softly to himself. He imagined a bottle of lemonade pouring fizzy cold soda into the glasses. The fridge door opened and the bottle came floating out. The door slammed shut and the bottle landed with a 'clunk!' on the counter. Kody unscrewed the bottle with his mind and thought about filling up glasses. The bottle swayed and nearly fell over. Perhaps he needed more practice.

Clearing his mind, he thought about filling up the glasses.

"Fill...tip...come on...come on..." Kody whispered. The bottle rose into the air! It tipped over and lemonade sloshed out. Alex turned around on the sofa and looked into the kitchen. He saw the bottle floating, upside down in mid-air as it filled the glasses.

"WOAH COOL!" he shouted and jumped off the sofa to have a look. Eddy followed him quickly.

Filling the glasses, Kody put everything on a tray and carried it into the living room. No, he levitated it into the living-room, and put it on the coffee-table in front of the TV. Using his new telekinetic powers, he scooped out the ice-cream, filling up the bowls. Alex and Eddy watched as their friend served them food and drink as if it was normal to have a bowl of ice-cream soaring towards you. They watched it as if it was some kind of cool magic show.

124211111111121212.content:
Alex and Edward really enjoyed hanging out at Kody’s house, especially after that terrible fight with the bullies after school.

“Thanks for having us over, dude…” Alex said quietly. “I really hate coming home after a day like this… “

“Why is that?” Kody wondered, as he made that empty bowls levitate towards the kitchen sink.

“I got a bruise on my arm, my lip is still bleeding a little, and I got a cut on my right hand…” Alex said, as he held out his hand before him. “My mom is gonna be so pissed if she found out I got into a fight after school, she’ll ground me for sure!”

“Yeah, me too!” Edward said, feeling a bit worried. “I have a cut on my arm…”

“Those rotten bullies! It doesn’t bother me if they bully me… They can’t hurt me…” Kody said out loud. “But, it really bugs me when they mess with my friends! I need to teach those guys a lesson they’ll never forget!”

“Ooh man…” Alex groaned. “My arm hurts…”

Kody got up and walked over to where Alex was sitting.

“Let me see, dude… Let me see your arm. Are you alright?” Kody asked him, obviously feeling very concerned about his friend.

Alex extended his right arm, which contained the ugly bruise.

When Kody saw it, something inside of him told him, that all he had to do was to just run his fingers over any wounds or bruises or cuts, and they would be healed, instantly!

“Here, just hold still, dude…” Kody said calmly, as he slowly and gently ran his hand over the bruise on Alex’s arm. As soon as his hand passed over it, the bruise had disappeared! It was completely gone! There wasn’t even a scar!

“Ooh… That felt good…” Alex grinned. “What did you do to my arm?”

“I just healed it! Your bruise is gone! Now show me your right hand!” Kody ordered.

Alex extended his right arm, revealing his hand which had a nasty cut on it, which was still bleeding.

“I’m gonna patch you up, dude…” Kody said, as he gently rubbed his hand over the cut. Instantly, the ugly cut on Alex’s hand had disappeared as well.

Next, Kody placed his finger over the cut on Alex’s lip. Instantly, the cut healed and disappeared. The bleeding stopped, the cut was gone, and it didn’t hurt anymore!

“Holy smoke!” Alex gasped. “It’s gone! All my cuts and bruises are gone!”

“Hey! What about me?” Edward asked him.

Kody walked over to Edward and placed his hand over the cut on Edward’s arm, healing that instantly as well.

“Whoa! That was awesome!”

Just then, Pam came home from work, carrying a bag of groceries.

“I’ll help you with those, mom!” Kody offered.

“Ooh, this is gonna be fun!” Alex said, knowing that Kody was going to use his powers.

Suddenly, the grocery bag hovered in mid-air and floated to the refrigerator. The fridge door opened on its own, and the carton of milk and some other items floated out of the bag and into the fridge. Then the bag set down on the kitchen counter, and everything else that was still in it, came out and floated on the counter. Then, the door to the kitchen pantry opened, and all the canned items flew to the shelf for the canned goods, the items for the cereals and grains flew to that shelf, and all the cleaning supplies and soaps flew to the bottom shelf. Finally, the empty grocery bag flattened out and folded up by itself, before floating inside of one of the closets. And, all this happened while Kody just remained sitting on his chair at the dining table.

“You can take out the two cans of chili, son…” Pam said. “We’re making chili tonight!”

“Great! Can Alex and Eddy stay for dinner, mom? Please?” Kody asked his mother.

“Sure, why not?” she replied. “As long as it’s okay with their parents!”

Kody then used his powers to levitate the cordless phone to Edward’s hand and he dialed the number to his house. Eddy then asked his parents for permission to stay for dinner. Of course, Kody heard the entire conversation, thanks to his super hearing. Then, he did the same for Alex. In the meantime, Pam prepared a big pan of chili for the boys.

Kody then commanded four ceramic bowls to float out of the cupboards and to land right before them on the kitchen table. He allowed four sets of silverware to land on the table, along with four glasses and four napkins. Finally, a large pitcher of lemonade flew out of the refrigerator and landed on the center of the dining table. Kody then used it to pour some for everyone in their glass.

When they finally enjoyed their chili, they were able to taste the hot and spicy ingredients.

“Whoa, mom… This is good!” Kody said.

“Wow, Miss Hart! This is delicious!” Edward added.

“Especially on a cold night like tonight, a hot bowl of chili will warm you up, huh?” Pam chuckled.

“You got that right, mom!” Kody responded. “I’m beginning to feel really warm on the inside…”

“Oh, come on, dude…” Alex laughed.

Kody took a couple of deep breathes through his nose. Then, he opened his mouth wide, while aiming his head a little towards the ceiling, and a large, thick, red flame of fire burst out of Kody’s mouth!

SSSSWWWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOSSSHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!

“Whaaaa!!!” Alex shouted. “Kody has dragon-breath!”

“Oohmygosh!” Edward exclaimed.

Kody then closed his mouth and gulped down a big glass of water.

BUURRRPPPPP!

“Whew!” he cheered. “That felt great!”

“Kody! That was rude!” Pam said angrily.

“Sorry, mom…”

But, both boys just couldn’t hold in their laughing… What would their super-powered friend do next?

12421111111112121211.content:
Alex lay in bed, sound asleep, when he suddenly had a dream. He was playing baseball, and it was his turn at bat. The pitcher pitched the ball, and he swung the bat with every ounce of strength he could muster. The bat connected with the ball, and sent the ball flying over the baseball field! In fact, the ball soared high over the outer fence! It was a home run! The crowd went nuts! Alex dropped the bat and started his leisurely run over the three bases until he passed over home plate. Then, he woke up, with a smile on his face. Alex always dreamed up hitting a home run in baseball…

“Had a nice dream, buddy?” Kody’s voice rang in his ears.

Alex opened his eyes and laughed.

“Oh, yeah…” he said with a yawn. “I had a dream about baseball, and…”

“I know, dude…” the voice responded. “I gave you that dream! I made you dream that dream just now… Did you like it?”

“Oh wow!” Alex laughed. “What a great way to wake up! Thanks for that dream! Now I gotta take a shower…”

Suddenly, Alex was standing in his bathroom.

“There ya go! Go and take your shower!” Kody’s voice spoke.

Alex took his shower and dried off when he was done. Then, he went to his bedroom to get dressed, before he finally came into the kitchen to enjoy a bowl of cereal.

choices: Kody shows up in history class, dressed in a suit with his pocket watch.
Kody stays in 1909 New York to do some exploring.
1242111111121211.content:
Kody stared at his clothes. Woah this was pretty cool. He was wearing a brown flat-cap, a brown pair of trousers, black socks, brown shoes, a white shirt, suspenders, a brown waistcoat and brown suit-coat over the top of that...he tugged at his clothes. They were surprisingly comfortable. What was he going to bring back? He thought...what was really common a hundred years ago?

"Hey kid, you have the time?" a man asked. Kody tugged back his wrist. His watch was gone!
"What are you? A dame?" the man asked. He looked at Kody's waiscoat, "Huh, no watch. Never mind, I'll ask someone else."

Kody watched the man disappear into the crowds of 1909 Broadway in the middle of Manhattan. What was he going to bring back? Wait, what did the man do? He looked at his waistcoat...why?

Kody looked at it too. It was an ordinary brown waistcoat, made of wool and cotton. It had half a dozen buttons and two straight pockets.

Pockets.

Kody felt the pockets. They were empty. Pockets...time...no watch...Kody grinned. Of course! He'd bring back a pocket watch!

In 1909, and for the roughly 400 yeras preceeding it, men wore pocket watches. Wristwatches didn't come into fashion until the 1920s or even the 1930s. Kody wondered how he could get one. Even if he could find one, he wouldn't be able to pay for it! They must've been real expensive.

"HEY!" someone shouted. Kody turned around. A smashing of glass, people shouting. Someone running.

"STOP THIEF! POLICE, POLICE!!"

Kody searched for the noise, then he saw a man running towards him with a bag under his arms, about six people were running after him. A policeman on his beat saw the man running and he dashed across the street, pulling out his service-revolver.

"STOP! STOP!" he shouted. He drew his gun level and fired! The gunshot was deafening and Kody covered his ears! The bullet missed him by an inch!

"No stop!" one man, obviously the victim, said, "You'll hit someone!"

The thief was getting closer and closer, Kody stared around and looked for something to defend himself with. He snatched up a broom lying on the ground and stuck it out! The man tripped on it and hit the footpath hard, the bag flew out of his hands and hit the footpath, it burst open and rings, necklaces and watch-cases spilled out. Before the man could get up, Kody jumped on him and forced his head onto the pavement. The policeman skidded to a halt.

"Good work, kid!" he said. He tugged out a pair of D-shaped Darby handcuffs. Solid steel, shiny and unbreakable. He shackled them roughly around the man's wrists and hauled him up. "Alright buddy, let's move it!"

The jeweller rushed up to Kody, panting. He looked about middle-aged. He was balding and wore glasses. He had brown trousers and a white shirt and a yellow waistcoat on him.

"Oh thankyou!" he gasped. He bent down and picked up the bag. "He didn't take anything, did he?"
"I, I don't think so!" Kody said.
"Good, good...come with me!"

Kody followed the man back to his jewellery shop and helped the jeweller put all the stuff back.

"Thank you so much!" he said, "Anything at all that I can give you! I...I..." he collapsed into a chair, still panting. "So terrible!"

Kody stared around the shop. "Can I have a watch?" he asked.
"A...a watch?...Well since you did save about a thousand dollars worth of merchandise...Pick what you want!"

Kody stared at a display cabinet filled with watch-movements, intricate little machines. He picked out a large, 21-jewel Hamilton and then stared at the watch-cases. A large, solid gold one stared up at him. He made his selection and the jeweller put the two things carefully together. He tightened the screws and wound the watch.

"There!" he said. He held the watch up to Kody's ear. It ticked loud and fast. The jeweller clipped a long, gold chain to the watch and put the watch into Kody's waistcoat pocket and affixed the chain to a buttonhole on Kody's waistcoat.

"Aah, doesn't that look nice?" the man said, "Thank you so much! Have a nice day, young man."
"Thanks!" said Kody, and he left.

Kody paused outside the shop and tugged the watch from his pocket. It was a huge thing and it was dazzingly golden. He put it back in his pocket...
1242111111121211.title: The Gold Watch.

12421111111212111.content:
"I hope you all brought your things for show-and-tell today," Kody's history teacher said, "Who wants to go first?"

Kody stood up, "I'll do it," he said. Kody was wearing his brown three-piece suit and had neatly put his watch in his pocket and the chain through the buttonhole.

"Well, history is time..." Kody said, "And, when I thought of time I thought of watches...And, well with watches, I thought of...these..."

Kody reached into his pocket and pulled out the gold pocket watch. It was large and heavy. "A hundred years ago every man wore a pocket watch. These days hardly anyone does. This one's a hundred years old. Perhaps even older. And it works."

"How'd you get it?" one of the kids asked.
"I went back in time," Kody said. The class laughed.
"No really," one of the boys said.
"Okay, I borrowed it from my mom. It was my grandpa's," Kody lied.

Unhooking the watch and chain from his waistcoat, Kody passed the little ticker around the room. People held it, dangled it, swayed it in their hands, held it to their ears and heard it ticking. Then they handed it back.

"Thank you, Kody," said his teacher, "And a very nice suit."

Kody smiled and sat back down, holding the watch in his hands.

12421111111212112.content:
Kody stared around the busy streets of 1909 Manhattan. Trolley-cars, horses, carts, carriages, bicycles, and the occasional motor-car, drove past him in the bustle and hurry of the morning. It really was a fascinating place. Kody was hungry. He realised he hadn't eaten anything yet, and wondered where he could get a bite to eat. But first he needed money.

People in a hurry forget things. Especially when they don't expect to forget them, like leaving banknotes fluttering in the wind. Kody had no idea where the banknote came from, but it was being whipped through the air towards him. He grabbed it. Five dollars. Kody wondered whether or not this was enough to get something to eat. He headed into a likely cafe, filled with suited men and dressed women. He headed up to the counter and sat down, looking at the cakes, sandwiches and pies on offer.

"Can I help you, young man?" asked a middle-aged bartender.
"I just want something to eat," Kody said.
"Yes I'm sure," the man said, "Well, we have sandwiches here - cheese, ham, bacon...then there's some freshly baked pies, and over here is our selection of cakes and muffins," he said, pointing to various glass-fronted cases underneath the counter, or to pretty display-stands on the dark, marble countertop.

"What can I get for five dollars?" Kody asked.
"You want to spend THAT MUCH?" the man asked, raising his eyebrows, "You taking something home to mommy, huh kid?"
"Uh, no," Kody said. Inwardly, he cursed. He should've known that things used to be a lot cheaper.

"Umm..." Kody said, scratching his temple with a hand, "I'll have...two...no...four...ham and cheese sandwiches and...two tuna sandwiches and...can I have some milk?"
"Sure kid," said the bartender, he counted up everything. "Thaaaat's...seven cents".

Kody handed the five dollars over and the bartender ran it through the old, clanking cash-register and gave Kody the change. Then, the drink, and the sandwiches. Kody found a quiet table near the back of the cafe to eat. He took his time, counting the change and fiddling with the coins. Four dollars, ninety-three cents. Kody munched on one of his sandwiches while he rubbed a one-dollar banknote between his fingers. He laid it on the table. A sudden breeze caught the note and blew it up against the cruet-stand. Kody picked it up. Then he gasped.

It wasn't one dollar. It was two dollars. Two, one-dollar notes. Kody looked at them. They were identical. Except for the serial-numbers. Kody rubbed one of the notes in his hands again and looked at it. A minute tear in one corner appeared. Kody tugged at it. Another banknote appeared in his hands. He kept rubbing. And another, and another! What was going on?

Kody pulled out his new watch and rubbed it. His hand grew heavier. He opened his cupped hands to see two watches. His eyes narrowed as he tried to make sense of what was going on. He seemed to have been given the power of duplicating things with his hands. Kody tried it on other stuff. He rubbed the sandwiches, they too, fell apart into duplicates of each other, each one just as tasty as the other. Kody grinned, this was getting fun...

1251.content:
Putting the seeing through walls incident out of his mind, Kody got dressed and left the house. When he got to his friend's, not far away considering it was next door, he was hardly thinking of the incident. Eddy invited him in with much joking and laughing between the two. Video games occupied little of their time that day for it was sunny and warm as a late spring day should be. So within an hour's time they grabbed their skateboards and were off to the park.

As they skated there and talked about various things, Kody's head began to hurt. He tried to ignore it and focus on what Eddy was saying and their skating, but the pain soon became almost unbearable. So much in fact that he actually lost his footing and tumbled to the ground. As suddenly as it had began, it left and Kody looked around to see himself laying on the ground with his skateboard on the grass of someone's lawn just beside the sidewalk. "Are you okay?" Eddy asked.

"I'm fine, what happened? I just had this mega headache, but it went away like, just after it came."

"It looked bad. you just sort of toppled over."

"I said I'm fine. Come on, I wanna see if you can grind those rails yet."

Enthusiasm restored and the headache being put aside, the two boys were soon at the skatepark and performing their various tricks for the judgement and ridicule of each other. Being the slightly less skilled, Eddy always made extra sure he could rub in any mistakes his friend made, jokingly of course. Eddy's attempts at grinding were better, but he wasn't very good at ending them and that was when he would fall. On the actual park he wasstill trying to do something that involved being in the air, anything at all would be good if he could master it.

That was when wierdness event number three happened for Kody. His friend seemed to be getting the hang of it. He was up in the air and then on the ground again. Then he was doing a number of random things in the air, not really tricks, but at least he was doing something. Then Eddy actually tried to do a trick and to Kody it was as if in slow-motion. There was his friend, in the air, trying to flip the skateboard while moving, but he ended up kicking it away by accident and it crashed to the ground across the park. He hung there in mid-air for a second and then he was falling, his arms flailing and it was a height enough that something would probably be broken. Kody kept thinking of trying to stop the fall if he could to prevent injury to his friend. Then, to his surprise, his friend stopped. Just for a couple seconds and inches from the ground his friend stopped and hovered before landing on the ground much more lightly then he would've done.

Kody's head felt weird now. It was like something new had started working in his brain and he couldn't explain what. He saw his friend stop in mid-air before landing and Eddy came over and noted the event as well. "That was so weird. I just stopped, did you see?"

"Y-yeah. I think... I think I might've done that?" Kody said carefully.

"How?"

"I dunno, but I just wanted to stop you from falling and then you did."

"What so... moving things with your mind?"

"Maybe," Kody said. He looked over at his friend's skateboard and thought about moving it in the air. It suddenly floated into the air and with another thought it moved towards them. His friend watched with awe and nervously looked around and saw that there wasn't anybody else nearby who would see. Kody set the skateboard down in front of Eddy and looked up nervously. The two exchanged looks and finally burst into laughter.

"That's cool!" Eddy said.

"Tell me about it! Maybe I'm just like a superhero or something."

"Like Superman, only cool."

"Yeah, he sucks so much it's sad."

Kody grinned. "And I am sooo showing this off. Think about it, why is there any reason to hide it? I could be famous I bet."

"Might get put under tests or something."

"Meh, not a big deal. They're not allowed to be cruel. Let's go, I so have to talk to mom about this."

1252.content:
As Kody followed his best friend to his bedroom, he started to feel weird again.

"Are you okay, bro?" Eddy said when he noticed that Kody wasn't feeling well.

"Oh yes, don't worry. Well... Which game we should play?" Kody said trying to hide his dizziness.

Eddy and Kody talked a bit, then they chose one of their best videogames. Eddy turned on his videoconsole and sat on his bed next to Kody, who already picked up his gamepad. Both kids started playing, Kody tried to bear the cold that now was starting to feel on his feet and legs.

Kody finally sneezed and, when he opened his eyes, he saw something strange. His legs were different!

"Ed... Eddy... take a l... look... at..." he said scared pointing to his legs. His best friend looked at Kody's legs. He could not believe what he was seeing.

Kody's legs were not human anymore. His human skin was gone. Now his legs seemed to be made of ice. He tried to move them, and fortunately he was still able to move like any human. He quickly took off his shoes and socks and discovered that his feet were already made of ice.

"Dude... You are getting frozen!" Eddy said worried. "What are we going to do!?"

"I don't feel cold anymore, at least. In fact, I'm feeling very good now." Kody said. It was true, now Kody was feeling better than ever, and his freezing body wasn't worrying him.

"What are you talking about!? We should call your mom!" Eddy said and ran to the door.

Without knowing how, Kody pointed to the door and a strange ray came out from his finger. When the ray touched the door, it instantly froze! Eddy became amazed, he tried to open the door but it was stuck there.

"How... How did you do that!?" Eddy asked.

"I don't know!"

As Kody finished talking, he felt a strange tingling all throughtout his body. He looked down and noticed that the rest of his body was freezing too. The new ice-skin was taking over all his body slowly. Eddy stayed quiet while he looked how his best friend was becoming an ice-boy!
When the transformation was almost finished, Kody's hair disappeared going inside his body turning him into a bald boy.

"I... I think it stopped..." Kody said and started to look at his new body. He touched and rubbed his new frozen arms and legs. Every part of his body was now made by a crystal blue and white ice. He was even a bit transparent. Eddy could see his reflection on his best friend's bald head! Kody's eyes were totally plain, he had no pupils nor corneas, but he was still able to see.

"Kody. Can... Can you hear me?" Eddy said nervously.

"Yes..."

"You totally rock, dude!" he said smiling.

"Why?" Kody wondered. His best friend didn't look scared anymore, now he was happy.

"I don't know what happened to you. But it's obvious that if you froze the door with your hand, you're a superhero or something like that! You have superpowers! You have the power of ice!" he said. But Kody didn't seem to like that.

"Why are you so serious?" Eddy asked his best friend.

"I'm a monster." Kody feel ashamed.

"Of course not! You always will be my best friend, no matter if you are an iceboy, a flameboy, a stoneboy or whatever!"

Both talked for some minutes and finally Kody accepted his fate. After that, he started to practice his new superpowers. He was able to freeze anything he wanted shooting his ice ray from his fingers. He was even able to freeze the air, he could make ice roads on the air and skate at superspeed over them. Eddy loved to see his best friend so changed.
Finally, Kody decided to take off all his clothes except his briefs. Then he touched them and froze them. He seemed to be naked because he was not wearing any human clothes, but the ice-briefs now were part of his ice-body and they protected his dignity.
He continued and discovered that now he was able to return back to his human form again! After some practising, he could switch between the human body and the ice body easily.

"There is a thing that I still don't like..." Kody said.

"What is it?" Eddy asked.

"Dude... I'm bald!" Kody said ashamed, but his best friend laughed.

After playing for some hours, both kids decided to continue playing their videogame. Kody stayed on his ice form, because Eddy enjoyed seeing him like that. He knew that now his best friend was a superhero, and he felt protected being next to he ice-boy!

"Huh... I should go back home. Mom must be there already." Kody said when he noticed that it was too late.

"What are you going to do?"

"Don't ask me why, but I feel that I must tell the truth to mom."

"Good luck, bro. Please tell me as soon as possible how went the conversation with your mother." Eddy said and hugged his best friend. Kody controlled his temperature so he could hug Eddy without freezing him.

"See you later!" Kody said. He took his clothes, made an ice bridge between Eddy's bedroom and his own bedroom, and walked over there. When he arrived to his window, he made disappear all the ice in the air. Eddy watched amazed everything from his window.

"Ok. Let's go..." Kody said.
1252.title: Frozen Kody

12521.content:
Kody heard his mother doing the supper dishes. It was the perfect moment to tell her what happened to him that evening. But... What if she became scared? He knew that it could be shocking to see your son as an ice superboy. But he had no choice, his mother had to know the truth.

Before he went downstairs, he decided to admire himself a bit more. He opened his wardrobe, that had a mirror at the back of the door and smiled. It was the first time that he saw his own ice-face, because at Eddy's bedroom there was not any mirror. He looked at his bald head. It was not so bad after all! looked at his new eyes. He had no pupils nor corneas. He even didn't know that he didn't have eyelids!

Then he started to some superhero poses! He smiled. "I'm Frozen Boy, the superhero kid!" he said laughing. He loved to see his new ice-body.

But while he was staring at himself, he started to feel the strange tingling all throughtout his body again.

"Oh no! I'm going to lose my powers now!? No, please!" he thought as he felt dizzier.

He tried to open his eyes, and when he saw himself reflected on the mirror he stared astonished.

He wasn't the ice-boy anymore... Now he was made of fire!

"What?" he exclaimed even knowing that he was alone in his room.

All his skin was red-hot. All his body was giving off flames and smoke. There was no doubt: now he had the power of fire. He knew that he could shoot fireballs with his hands, burn anything he wanted, absorb any fire around him... He felt great! He smiled again. His eyes and mouth were now bright yellow. His briefs were not made of ice anymore. But fortunately they were red originally, so they disguised very well in his red-hot body.

But then he became serious again. He closed the wardrobe and went downstairs. He was a bit scared at first because he thought he could start a fire by simply walking on the floor, but then he noticed that his flames were not burning the parquet. Finally, he arrived to the kitchen.

"Mom..." he said scared, "I must tell you something..."

"Oh, Kody! You were upstairs? I thought you were at Eddy's home." she said before turning.

"Mom..." Kody said when his mother already saw him.

Kody's mother stayed amazed for some seconds then smiled.

"So... You finally got your superpowers!" she said looking at the flame boy.

"What!? Did you already know this, mom!?" Kody asked.

"Of course...! We must talk, son." she said.

Then she explained why Kody was suffering those changes. His father was an alien, and he even more superpowers than his own father. She didn't know when Kody was going to be able to use them, so she never told him anything about it. Kody felt sad at first, but then he understood that he was now the heir of his father and he had to use his superpowers to save the world.

After some chatting, Kody's mother asked him about what happened that evening and if Eddy knew something about it.

"Sorry mom. But I suffered the transformation when I was on Eddy's home. I couldn't stop it." Kody said sadly. His mother then approached and gave him a hug. Kody became scared, he thought that his mother could burn herself. But she knew that there wasn't any danger.

"Don't worry about it, Kody! You must share your secret with your best friends, they must know the truth. But please, try to hide your superpowers to the rest of people, okay?"

"Okay mom!" Kody grinned. "Well... Can I show myself as Frozenboy and Flameboy, right?"

"Yes. But never reveal your real identity!" she said. "So... You got the power of ice and the power of fire... You must know that you will get more powers from now on, so be prepared."

"More powers? Cool! I can't wait to show them to Eddy and Alex!" the burning boy said.

"Go and show them your burning body now if you want. I must still finish your favourite dessert. But can you show me your ice form before that?"

"Of course!" Kody said.

He switched to his ice form easily now that he knew that he could do that. Kody's mother stared at him.

"You are bald like your father was when he was on his ice form." she said.

"I don't mind. In fact, I like being like this."

"You are so cute, my ice boy!" she said rubbing his head.

"Awww... Mom! I'm not a little boy anymore!" he said laughing and switched again to his fire form.

"Okay mom. I'll come back on some minutes." he said and started walking to the door.

"By the way... Why are you walking? Do you know that you can FLY at superspeed while you are in your fire form?" she said when he saw his kid walking.

"Really?" he said amazed. "Cool!"

Kody left a red blur in the kitchen and disappeared almost instantly.

Kody ran out of the house, deciding he would go to Eddy's house for a while. It was a pleasant day, although it was the middle of March, and many families were taking advantage of the sun to cut their lawns or tan themselves. 125311.content:
Kody felt around him. He was trapped inside a T-shirt! A big one, too. Shaking and jumping, he climbed out of it and scampered up a tree-branch to a higher level.

Wait...scampered?"

Kody looked at hs hands, his feet...they were small and furry. He ran up a little higher and stared down at his reflection on the roof of a parked car.

He was a squirrel! A beautiful, fuzzy red squirrel! How did this happen? Kody thought...he was near squirrels when it happened...he was near a tree...He'd discovered his ability to shape-shift! Oh this was cool.

"Hey mommy, look!"

Kody stared down to see a little girl with her mother, looking at him.

"He looks cute!" she said. Kody grinned and jumped down. He scampered over to her. The girl bent down and petted him. Ooooh that felt good. Right behind the ears...Awww don't stop...scratchity-scratchity-scratchity...Kody scrambled up around her chest and shoulders.

"Hehe...Mommy, he's cuddly!" she said.
"Now be careful, sweetheart, he might be dirty. He could have rabies."

Kody looked shocked. He was the most handsome, adorable squirrel ever! How could he have...RABIES!? He snuggled up against the girl, who hugged him. "Awww, he's fuzzy...Can we keep him, mommy?"

"He's a squirrel, dear, not a kitten. Let him go, now."
"Bye Mr. Squirrel!"

Kody jumped down and onto the grass. He waved a left forepaw.

"Mommy, mommy, he waved!"

Kody watched them go. Scarpering back to his clothes, Kody climbed into them.

"Hey kid, coolin' off in the shade, huh?" said a policeman, walking by.
"Yeah, hot day, officer," Kody said back.
"You better run on, we gotta look after this smashed car. Go on!'

Kody got up and jogged home. He turned around at the end of the street and watched the policeman examining the crashed car which had caused his body to discover its new shape-shifting abilities. Oh this was going to be fun!

1253112.content:
When Kody got home, he ran into his room and closed the door shut, locking it behind him. "I wonder what all I can do," he thought to himself. "Let's see, what would be a good thing to try..."

His mind thought back to watching TV the other day where he saw a show that had a talking toilet. He thought that was hilarious at the time, and he would love to try to duplicate that. "I wish I was a toilet!" he said aloud.

He closed his eyes, preparing for change. After a few seconds of nothing, he opened them again, looking down. His body was still the same old Kody. "Oh, well," he thought, "I guess I'm limited to just animals and people. What else should I try..."

As he thought, his eyes looked around the walls of his room, landing on a poster of a tiger leaping in midair. He had always liked big cats; he found them majestic and powerful. "It would be cool to be one," he thought.

Suddenly, he felt his lower back begin to forcibly bend over, as he instinctively got down standing on his hands and feet. His hips shifted, until his legs were perpendicular to his spine, which lengthened a few feet. He felt a weird feeling at the base of his spine. He turned his head and saw that a new appendage was growing out; he quickly realized it was his tail

Kody's thigh and upper arm muscles began to thicken, and his hands clamped together. His skin suddenly started itching badly, and he tried to scratch it, but noticed that he was sprouting hair all over his body. Within a few seconds, he had grown a nice full coat of orange, black, and white fur all over his body. His hands--check that, paws--now had a smooth black pad where his palms were, and his fingernails and toenails had grown out and formed into sharp claws.

Finally, his nose and mouth began to jut out and form into a muzzle. Whiskers sprouted out, and his teeth elongated and were now much larger. His ears shifted from the side to the top of his head, and stuck up and out.

In thirty seconds, it was all over. Kody looked down and saw that his shirt and pants were in tatters on the floor. He quickly trotted to the other side of the room and looked at his full length mirror, and he liked what he saw. He now was a beautiful tiger, the king of beasts.

After admiring his new body for a short while, he noticed that his boxers were still on, if barely. It was a ridiculous sight; a majestic, noble creature like himself wearing a pair of underwear. He put his large paws up against the top of the mirror and tried to balance on his two hind legs, but he didn't have a great handle of his new weight distribution. He lost his balance and fell to the floor with a loud THUD.

Shaken up a little, Kody quickly jumped back up to four feet. He was about to try again when he heard footsteps in the hall. "Oh, no!" he thought, "Mom must be home!" He held his breath, hoping she would leave him alone.

No such luck. The footsteps stopped in front of his door, and then Kody heard three loud knocks from it. "Kody?" his mother's voice called out. "Are you alright? I heard the sound of something falling."

Kody opened his mouth to answer, but instead of words, a growl escaped his lips. He quickly stopped; he had forgotten that as an animal, he couldn't speak. He hoped against hope that his mom's stellar hearing somehow missed that noise.

"What on earth?" his mom said. "Kody, are you playing video games?" After a few seconds, she knocked again, louder this time. "Kody, I'm coming in!" Kody heard the doorknob jiggling; he knew that his mom could open his bedroom door from being locked in about twenty seconds, using her hair pin. He had to do something fast!

He quietly wished aloud, "I wish I was human again!" He felt his body beginning to change, but it wasn't going fast enough! He didn't want his mom to see him like this; as supportive as she was, this probably would freak her out. He had to buy some more time.

He quickly turned towards his closet; luckily he had a walk-in and the door was already open. As he hid behind some clothes, he felt the burning in his skin again as the fur was magically sucked back into his body and his legs begin to straighten. His claws and his teeth recessed, and his face straightened out.

The bedroom door suddenly opened. His mom walked in, looking around. "Kody, where are you?" she asked. She looked at every corner, finally spotting Kody's feet in the closet. "There you are!" she said. She walked over and slid the clothes that Kody was hiding behind.

Kody looked at her, with a sheepish smile on his face. "Hi, Mom," he said.

"Kody," she asked, "what are you doing in your closet half-naked?"

"Um, I had just taken a shower," Kody mumbled as he tried to make up an excuse, "and I couldn't find anything to wear, so I was going through the clothes in the back here."

Kody's mother looked at him with a questioning gaze. "I heard a loud banging sound. Did you fall?"

"Yeah, well, I was looking for something on the top shelf, so I was standing on this box here," he said, pointing to a cardboard box in his closet, "and I lost my balance and fell to the floor. I'm alright, though."

"Hmm," his mother said. Kody looked at her eyes, knowing that she knew he was lying, but didn't have any way to prove it. "Well, just be more careful next time, okay?"

"Yes, Mom," Kody replied.

His mom walked out of the room, and Kody breathed a sigh of relief. “That was a close one,” he thought to himself. “But it was cool! I wonder what else I could do."

12533.content:
As Kody sat down, he realized that something was off. His stomach warned him of upcoming nausea and he swayed before tilting his head forward and started vomiting. Did the colors of that boring painting on the wall that his mother had bought dirty cheap seem brighter? No, it was just an after effect of the puddle of vile green vomit that contained chunks of the brownie he had eaten earlier bobbing in it.
When was mom coming home again? Oh right, she was working late at the police station tonight. Kody (still slightly trembling) went over to the home phone and dialed 890-768-3651, praying that his mother would answer.
"Hello, this is Julia White at the Fishers Police Station. Who would you like to contact?"
"My mom..." Kody's voice was scratchy and rough.
"Name please."
"Kody..."
"Well Kody, what is your mom's name?"
"Julie."
"Last name please."
"Uhh..." Kody tried to remember, but something was blocking it all out. He slammed the phone onto its place on the charger and began to realize that the world was a big cloud of bright colors and only after did he realize that he couldn't concentrate did he flop onto the couch and close his eyes.

"Julie, will you please take the time to consider this?"
"No, I am tired of considering!" Kody sat up from the coach realizing that both his mom and his dad were home and arguing. This did not surprise Kody in the very least and he trudged over to the place were his parents stood bickering like animals.
"Peace!" demanded Kody. All of a sudden there was a change, mom looked happy and dad seemed to relax. What had he done?
"Uh, you guys can go back to arguing now!" In the blink of an eye, Julie was raising her voice over her husband's and the argument started up again like it had never started. Neither parents looked at Kody how he glanced absentmindedly out the window thinking about what he had done with a glint of mischief in his eye.

131.content:
I took a few steps back and focused on the task at hand. Their was walls and a ceiling around me. My best hope would be to figure out some way to get out using the walls. I decided to try to push again. I took in a deep breath and with all the force I could imagine I would possible have. I expected less. A lot less. I felt a surge of energy fly through me and the bricks that were once stacked in front of me, were pushed away and hit the ground in the distance with a loud crash. The bricks fell to pieces and I found myself in a hallway that had many doors. It was not entirely like the room I was just trapped in. I looked up to see the ceiling but just saw darkness. It must be extremely high. But than I realized something. I was in a box of bricks earlier with no light source and I could still see. I than pushed against the wall to see that I pushed and broke a brick wall. I looked around but still found no light source or any clue of to why I was here. Suddenly I saw a giant burst of green light in front of my eyes. Where was it coming from?
I hurried down the rusted metal ladder and hit the ground with a thud. I ran and through myself against the rock wall in front of me and broke through it. I was now in the grass at night. A full moon was in the sky and I heard loud voices behind me. I tripped and hit the ground with a thud. The cold air wrapped around me. It sent chills through my bones. I felt something hit my back hard.

Finally, I decided to flip it so I reached my hand over. It seemed like the only thought in my head was to flip the switch, and that's probably what made this happen next.

The switch flipped itself, and I fell through the ground.

Not seeing any way out of this mess, I stood in despair watching the spikes move closer and closer.
Soon, they got so close that I had to dodge in between them and almost get stabbed. Then, thankfully, the wall stopped, and there was a loud grating sound coming from above me.

"Thank goodness I came in time!" a voice hollered from the light, now pouring into the room, "Here, I opened a hatch to get out of here! You can climb up the spikes, only the tips will hurt you."

I climbed up the spikes, and found a hole in the ceiling where it looked like a chunk got ripped out of it. "How did you do this?" I asked amazed, "I didn't see this before!"

"Just broke through it, I thought you would know." The voice said right above me. I looked up, but couldn't make out the persons face, due to the glare of the light in my eyes. "The names Patrick, whats yours?" He then asked.

I got out of the hole, and looked around. We were on the roof of a tall building in the middle of a city. "What should I do next? Follow him, or run away?" I thought.

14.content:
The name-tags on the schoolbooks read "S.K. Jones". A hand grabbed them and shoved them into a leather satchel-bag which was slung over a shoulder.

Skander Kenneth Jones.

Skander Jones was sixteen years old and six feet tall. He might also well have been six hours late.

"Honey! Break..." Mrs. Jones called out, but a tall, blond blur raced out the front door, slamming it behind it.

Skander Jones ran, his feet thumping into the pavement. Late for school AGAIN! Mrs. Ashbury was going to murder him! He grabbed a lamp-post and skidded uneasily around the corner and kept running. His heart was pounding, his legs aching. He checked his watch - 8:45. Damn it!

WHAM!

The front doors to the campus's main building burst open! Lone, running footsteps, slamming doors, squealing of shoe-rubber on linoleum.

"Late again, Mr. Jones?"

Susan Ashbury was in her forties, a married woman with three children, and no patience for tardy students. She stared up from her desk at the tall, handsome blond boy in front of her with messy hair and a flushed face.

"Sorry Mrs. A," Skander panted, "I...My...alarm..."
"YOU need to get a new alarm-clock," said Mrs. Ashbury. She filled in something in a book and then filled in something in another book. She ripped out a slip of paper and passed it to Skander. "That's the third one this week! TRY and set a RECORD for NEXT week and get NONE!"
"Yes ma'am!" Skander wheezed. He stuffed the ticket into his jeans and ran off to his locker.

Skander slammed the locker door shut and shackled the battered padlock into place. He grabbed his books and charged into English class, a full twenty minutes late.

"Very nice of you to join us, Mr. Jones, take a seat up the back," said his English teacher, lazily. "Take out your copy of 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee, and try and answer the questions on the sheet given to you."

Skander collapsed into a chair at the back of the class...which promptly collapsed onto the floor, throwing him back against a bookcase.

"...And Mr. Lawson, please would you take this to Mrs. Ashbury? It's a note telling her to send some maintenance men to this room to fix that broken chair..."

"Yessir," said a black boy about five and a half feet tall. He grabbed the note and left the room.

"NOW, MR. JONES," his English teacher said, "Perhaps if you can find a CHAIR that won't COLLAPSE under you, we can get on with the lesson!"

"Yes sir," said Skander, "Sorry sir."

Skander grabbed another chair and sat down.

"Dude, what gives!?"

Skander stared at his friend. Jason 'Jase' Lancet, was Skander's best friend, a boy with a thin face, brown hair, green eyes and pallid skin.

"Hey, my damn clock packed up on me again..."
"Well get it UNpacked! You can't afford to get another detention! I need you to help with my tutoring, and I'm gonna friggin' crash and BURN if you don't help me! And you can't help me if you'r stuck in some classroom every Friday doing lines about punctual..."
"WILL YOU SHUT UP!?" Skander hissed at Jase, "I'm trying, alright!?"

Skander tugged out a biro, a notebook and a copy of the American modern classic. He started reading...
