1432.content:
"What was your life like?" Skander asked. He was sitting in his chair at his desk. Adrian was lying in bed, fiddling with a pen.

"Life..." The ghost-boy said, "Ninety years since I took a breath...Hah!"
"Do you remember what it was like?"
"I remember death," Adrian said. "I remember it. Slow. Painful. The influenza. Nasty stuff. I think you can read about it on the...the internet?" he asked. "..I think you can. There are probably pages and pages about it on there...But it's nothing like actually seeing it...having it."

"What was it like?" Skander asked, he was getting excited now.
"Imagine drowning," said Adrian, "Imagine drowning...backwards. Everytime you breathe, your lungs flood from the inside. You breathe in air but your lungs, they fill up with muck. You cough and retch and spit, but they keep filling. You bleed inside. You wheeze and you struggle. You feel cold, hot, shivering, boiling, sweating, trembling. You can't stand, you can barely sit up..."

Skander thought about it. He looked at Adrian, lying there with his neat, clean suit and his semi-transparent, brown hair, neatly parted.

"Sounds pretty bad," said Skander.
"Sounds bad, looks worse," said Adrian. "My mother was going berserk! You can't breathe. You drown. Your lungs fill with this white pus and blood. If you're lucky, you throw it up. Tastes like...I can't even THINK of what it tastes like. Then, you live a little longer...eventually, you can't take it anymore. Christ, I wish I could show you..."

Skander closed his eyes, trying to imagine it. "I wish I was back...90 years," he said. "Wish I could see it..."
1432.title: Skander asks Adrian about his life and past.

choices: Skander decides to stay and explore 1919.
Skander and Adrian return to modern times.
14321.content:
"I wish I could see it..." Skander said.
"No you don't," Adrian replied.
"No, I mean, really...Must've been cool..."
"COOL!?"

Adrian jumped up, glaring at Skander, his eyes blazed red with fury. "If you think it's COOL then go ahead and wish and see it!"

Suddenly, Skander's head felt dizzy, his eyes went blurry. He staggered to his feet. "Adrian!" he shouted, "Adrian what's happening!? I...I can't see!" Skander struggled two steps, and collapsed backwards onto the floor.

Whunk!

"In here, doctor! In here!" a man shouted.
"Honestly Mr. Stone, I don't think this is wise, he is badly infected!"
"I don't care, I want him here, at home. Here. Here where I can see him, where we can...we can keep an eye on him".
"Oh alright, alright...In here, men!"

Skander opened his eyes. He was lying on the floor in a room. He stood up and looked around. It was his room! Only...it wasn't. He stared around. Everything he knew was gone, his clothes, his bed, his computer, his desk-lamp. He looked around. The desk was older, plainer. It had a rocker-blotter, dip-pens, inkwells and notepaper on it. An old bed and cabinet were in the corner where Skander's bed usually was. A shiny, brass alarm-clock ticked loudly on the bedside table. Two men were standing near the desk. The older one looked like a doctor. He had a doctor's medical bag behind him, sitting on a chair. The other man was taller, younger. He had brown hair and was wearing a brown suit. Four men came in, wheeling a gurney. The doctor stepped forward.

"Easy now," he said, "Onto the bed...careful, careful!"

The gurney rattled as the men struggled to move the patient. They laid him down on the bed and moved aside. The doctor placed a metal bucket next to the head of the bed.

"Keep him in isolation," said the doctor, "If he wants anything, he can ring the bell. Otherwise, keep OUT of this room. It is not safe! I must leave."

Taking his bag and hat, the medical man left the room. Skander stepped closer to the bed. He gasped.

Lying in bed was Adrian. He was wearing a suit. A black suit. He looked a mess. The white dress-shirt was covered in speckles of blood and the waistcoat and sleeves of the shirt were badly stained. Mr. Stone stepped towards the bed.

"Are you alright, son?" he asked.

Adrian struggled to get up, he wheezed and his arm collapsed. He fell heavily on his right side, his head hanging over the side of the bed. He gagged and coughed. The sound was sickening. A loud, rasping, retching hack. Skander clapped a hand to his mouth as white phlegm gurgled and spewed out of Adrian's mouth and slopped into the bucket with a dull "fwop!" Mr. Stone backed away and left the room, "Ring the bell if you want anything!" he said, pointing to the bell on the table, and he closed the door.

"Enjoying it?" Adrian asked. Skander jumped and turned around to see Adrian, the ghost, staring at him. "My last moments alive. Let's watch, shall we? It's not pretty, huh? I was so dizzy, I didn't even know which end was up! My father and mother are coming soon..."

The Adrian on the bed reached out a trembling, shaking hand. It was vibrating so much it hit the alarm-clock. The metal contraption fell to the floor and exploded into a hundred pieces, cogs, glass, metal and screws flying everywhere. The hand grasped the bell weakly and rang it. The door opened a couple of minutes later.

"What's the matter, son?" Mr. Stone asked. Mrs. Stone screamed and collapsed into the chair by the desk.

"I...I want..." Adrian wheezed. He reached out a trembling hand and tugged on something. Mr. Stone stood up and looked at his watch. It was the most expensive thing he owned. He knew how much his son wanted a nice watch of his own. Carefully, he undid the chain and tugged the watch out of his waistcoat pocket. He put the watch into his son's pocket and did the chain up around the buttonhole.

"There now, Adrian. You take it. I know you've always wanted it, you may as well have it now...Oh god!"

Adrian was shaking in bed, thrashing! Throwing his body around. The bed shook and rattled.

"ADRIAN!" he screamed. Adrian struggled over the side of the bed and threw up. Blood and white mucus squelched out his mouth and splattered into the bucket. He struggled up and stared outwards with bloodshot eyes.

"Father..." he wheezed. Suddenly, the body went limp. It fell off the bed, hitting the half-full bucket and tipping it over. The body hit the floor and the bucket rolled across the room. Mrs. Stone screamed and screamed while Mr. Stone ran out of the room.

"Jesus Christ!" Skander whispered...
14321.title: Dying Moments.

choices: Tour the house a bit more.
Let's go outside!
143211.content:
"Like it?" Adrian asked, glaring at Skander malevolently.

"I...No! NO!" said Skander, quickly. "I'm sorry".
"Good!" said Adrian. The ghost turned back to the scene. The dying historical Adrian was twitching on the floor. Slumped on the other side of the room, Mrs. Stone lay senseless.

"She'll die soon," said Adrian. "About a month later. Mother was always fair, fainty and fragile as soap-bubble. The influenza was too much for her. Come on, want to look around your house? My house? What it used to look like 90 years ago, before YOU showed up?"
"Um..okay," said Skander.

The ghost grabbed Skander's arm and led him out of the bedroom. The house was dark. Most of the curtains and blinds were drawn. Electric lights shone from lamps hung from the celing, or from sconces screwed into the wall. They passed the bathroom with its old-fashioned toilet and sink and the clawfoot bathtub. Adrian opened a door and beckoned Skander inside.

"This is my father's study," said Adrian. He cast a hand aorund the chamber and Skander took it in. A nameplate on the desk read: "Lawrence Stone".

Mr. Lawrence Stone was a man of precise habits and an almost sterile neatness and cleanliness. A gigantic desk the size of a bathtub was situated in front of several bookcases. Between the bookcases was a fireplace. A fire crackled in the grate, throwing a hot, yellow glow around everywhere. Between the fireplace and the desk was a high-backed, leather office chair. On a side-table was a gigantic black desktop typewriter the size of a microwave oven. A tall, stately grandfather clock ticked slowly from where it stood next to the door. A couple of couches and a couple of armchairs filled in the empty spaces. A chandelier hung from the ceiling, but it had been turned off. A green banker's lamp on the desk was turned on, and the light reflected on the green, leather writing surface of the desk. The yellow from the fire and the green from the desk sure made the room look weird. Skander walked slowly around the room, looking at everything. The pens, notepads, papers, inkwells, blotters and stamps on the desk, the books in the bookcase...and a boy sleeping on the couch near the fireplace. The boy looked a little younger than Skander. He had light brown hair, and was wearing a white dress shirt, black trousers and a black waistcoat. His shoes were off, and soft, dark red socks covered his feet. He was truly sound asleep.

"Nathaniel," said Adrian. "My younger brother...Poor kid".

Adrian bent down over the slumbering child and held him in his ghostly arms. He gave the boy a kiss on the cheek, and ruffled his silky, light-brown hair.

"He means the world to me...although I never got a chance to tell him that," said Adrian. "He's a great kid".
143211.title: Changing Rooms.

choices: Skander goes to sleep and wonders what will happen next morning.
Next day, Skander, Adrian and Jason go to the beach.
143212.content:
"Seen enough?" Adrian asked, his voice had lost the usual light, jokey nature.
"Um..." Skander said, his mouth was dry.
"Come on," Adrian said, "Let's go. You don't want to see what happens next..."
"But..."
"YOU DO NOT WANT TO SEE WHAT HAPPENS NEXT. LET'S GO!" Adrian said.

Skander sighed. He closed his eyes and visualised himself back in "his" room, 90 years into the future. He opened his eyes.

The smashed clock, the bucket, the bed and desk were all gone, replaced by modern furniture, a computer, a flourescent lamp and a mess of papers on the desk.

"I...I'm sorry," said Skander. "I shouldn't have said it was 'cool'".

Adrian sighed. "Forget it. But on the bright side, you learnt how to time-travel."
"Huh...? Wait WHAT?"
"You think I took you back in time?" Adrian asked, he was grinning now.
"WHAT!? No way! I DID THAT?" Skander shouted.
"Yeah!"
"Oh God..."
143212.title: Honey, We're Home.

choices: The boys continue to play at the beach.
Skander, Adrian and Jason go to Skander's house to form a crime-fighting team.
1432122.content:
"Oh God, I'm sorry, sorry, sorry..." Skander said.

"Forget it!" Adrian snapped. The two boys walked across the sand of the beach. Skander was wearing shorts and a T-shirt that were probably too small for him. They showed off his form perhaps a little too well. Everyone stared at the two boys, the one that looked like a hot surfer dude, and the one who looked like he just stepped off the R.M.S. Titanic. They ignored them. As usual, if anyone had really bothered to look, they would've noticed that Adrian was not leaving any shoe-prints on the ground, despite the fact that he was wearing the black leather shoes that he had on when he died.

They reached the jetty to see Jason sitting there with fishing-equipment.

"Hey!" he shouted, "You made it!"
"We made it," said Skander. "Come on, Adrian."

The two boys jogged along the jetty and reached the end. Adrian shrugged off his ghostly coat and waistcoat and lay them on the jetty. He stood there in his white shirt, black tie and black suspenders. He bent down and picked up a fishing-rod.

"Haven't changed much since I was alive," he said. "I was rather fond of fishing..."

He baited the hook. "You might want to stand back," he said. The boys took a few steps back. Adrian swung the fishing-pole through the air. A long, thin line of fishing-wire shot out and hit the water with a 'splash!', the little red and white sinker bobbing in the water.

"Nice cast," said Skander. He threw out his line, and then Jason threw out his own.

"You know," said Adrian, "Skander, you could be a great super-hero, like Batman or Superman..."
"Me? Naaah..." said Skander. "I dunno..."
"You have powers," Adrian said. "You could do lots of stuff."
"Perhaps, but...well so what?"
"You could be famous," said Adrian. "A celebrity."
"Well yeeeaaah...but it'd be a pretty lonely life."
"I could help," said Jason.
"You don't have any of my powers," said Skander.
"Perhaps you can give me some."
"I don't know how! Adrian's probably the best sidekick to have if I ever DID become a super-hero."
"Perhaps your mother might know," said Adrian. "She...I GOT SOMETHING!"

The two boys grabbed Adrian's rod and tried to reel it in. A fat, flapping fish came up with the line.

"Awesome!" Jason said, "You are good at fishing!"
"Told you," said Adrian, crossing his arms, smugly. "Hey...what's that?"

Skander stared out. He could see two figures in the water, thrashing.

"I think they're in trouble!" Adrian said, "Come on, Super Skander, let's go!"

"But..." Skander said. "I..."

Adrian pushed Skander off the jetty into the water. Skander coughed and spluttered. Then his head popped up. He started kicking and paddling. Faster, faster, faster...soon, he was a machine! His legs thrummed through the water and his arms swung up and down in a windmill fashion. Adrian gurgled happily underwater. The two friends swam out. Skander didn't even feel tired! What was going on!? Must be super-strength or super-speed...he looked behind him. Definitely super-speed. His legs were slamming through the water like paddlesteamer wheels. He reached the two figures in the water. A boy about twelve, and his brother, about Skander's age.

"Hold on!" Skander shouted. He reached them. "Okay kid, grab on!"

The boy climbed on Skander's back. His extra weight made it harder to swim, but Skander managed. Adrian popped up in the water. "Come on!" he shouted to the other boy, "Your life's more valuable than mine, let's get it back before you lose it, huh?"

Adrian grabbed the other boy's hand and started back to the shore. The older boy was too panicky to realise that Adrian, though he was completely immersed in sea-water - was not even wet. His hair was still neatly parted, his clothes bone-dry. They swam back to shore.

"Oh baby!" a woman screamed. She ran to the water's edge as Skander and Adrian emerged from the surf.

"He's alright," Skander said. Adrian dragged the other boy ashore. "He's a heavy one!" he said. The woman grabbed her sons and kissed them and then grabbed Skander and hugged him. "Oh I had no idea where they went! You boys are VERY lucky!" she said, turning to her sons.
"Yes mom," they said.
"Oh thank you, thank you," said the lady, "What's your name?"
"Skander," said Skander. "No problem."
"You and your friend saved my boys!...Where is he?"

Skander turned around. Adrian was gone. He turned to the jetty. Adrian was packing up the fishing-gear and putting on his coat again. Skander guessed the ghost-boy wasn't used to the attention...
1432122.title: Go Fish.

choices: Jason is happy as an ordinary human.
Jason wants powers! Skander performs the transferral bond.
14321222.content:
The front door slammed. Mrs. Jones got up from a chair where she was reading the newspaper.

"Oh honey, you're back!" she said to Skander and his friends, "What's this?"

"Adrian caught it," said Skander. He held out the fat, silver fish. Mrs. Jones smiled, "I'll cook it for dinner. So, did you boys have a nice time at the beach?"

"Yeah," said Jason, sitting down on the couch, "Adrian and Skander saved two boys from drowning."
"REALLY?" said Mrs. Jones, "Oh Skandy, I'm so proud of you..."

Adrian sniggered. "Skandy..." he said, and grinned.
"Shut up, Adrian," said Skander. "Mom...I've had all these changes lately...I can do all kinds of things. Is something wrong with me?"

Mrs. Jones sighed. "I knew this would happen," she said, as she started gutting the fish, "Skander, you're an alien."
"WHAT?" Jason screamed.
"He is...so am I," said Mrs. Jones. "We left our home-planet shortly after Skander was born and came to Earth. The climate here is similar to our own planet, but it also enhances Skander's physical abilities. He can run faster, hear clearer, see further and is more powerful here on Earth because of the atmosphere. But apart from that, Skander comes from a long line of super-beings. I have various powers, of course...But Skander has inherited all kinds of abilities from his ancestors, passed down through generations. They'll all show themselves with time..."

"What kind of powers does he have?" Jason asked.
"No idea," said Mrs. Jones, "They'll come at random. I have no idea what powers he has or might have. He might have five, a dozen, hundreds, he might have countless powers..."

"Mom, Adrian and Jason and I were thinking of making our own superhero team," said Skander. "Only...Jason doesn't have any powers."

"I know what Adrian can do," said Mrs. Jones, smiling. "But, Jason doesn't have to be left out. There is a way for Skander to transfer his powers to another person."

Adrian cleared his throat.

"Another...LIVING...person. It can only be done once, and the affects are permanent."

"How's it done?" Skander asked. His mother started cleaning the fish.

"You grab the person by the shoulders. You close your eyes and envision that person posessing your powers. A bond is created. And while it's in existence, your powers..." she pointed at Skander, "Could transfer to Jason..." she started prepping the fish.

"...You can only make this bond once, with only one person. The bond transfers your powers and any potential powers, to him. Once it's broken and the powers have been transferred, you can't do it again. So choose wisely."
14321222.title: How's It Done?

choices: The boys go and experiment with their various powers.
Skander's mother makes Jason and Skander their super-hero costumes.
143212222.content:
"So..." Skander stared at Jason, "Wanna try this?"
"Okay..." said Jason.

Skander grabbed Jason by the shoulders and Jason did the same. Both boys closed their eyes.

"Alright," said Mrs. Jones, "Skander, you focus on giving Jason your powers, Jason, you focus on recieving them..."

The boys concentrated, closing their eyes and relaxing, clearing their minds...suddenly, Skander felt something tingly, like static electricity, running along his arms. Jason felt it, too.

"Woah...that's tickly..." he said.
"No talking, concentrate," said Mrs. Jones.

The tingling grew stronger, and stronger. Jason started breathing faster, Skander continued to concentrate. Suddenly, Jason let out a yelp of pain! He staggered back and hit the kitchen table.

"Ouch!" he said.

"I think we did it!" said Skander. Jason stared at himself. "I don't look any different," he said.
"You won't," said Mrs. Jones, "But you'll be able to do stuff now that ordinary humans cannot. Use your powers wisely, Jason."
"I will..." said Jason. He flexed his arms. Suddenly, his clothes tightened painfully as his muscles surged into full development!

"Woah!" he said, feeling his tight, firm chest and bulging arms, "This is freakin' awesome!"

Adrian smiled. "Two hunks, one ghost...God I'm glad I'm dead, or you guys would kill me ten times over."

Everyone laughed.
143212222.title: "I Have The Power!"

choices: Fire-trucks race past their house. An apartment-block is on fire!
Ambulances fly past. A multi-car pile-up one block away!
1432122222.content:
"Good afternoon, Mrs. Jones!" said the manager of the local fabrics shop, "And what can I do for you today?"

Skander's mother headed into the shop, looking distracted. "I need...red and black lycra or cotton cloth...something that can put up with lots of wear and tear...and some black and red thread...and...and some elastic banding..."

"Hmm...wear and tear is lycra territory," said the manager, "Cotton fabric won't last...our lycra's down here at the end..."

After getting the products Skander's mother needed, she headed home and started measuring, cutting, pinning and sewing. She was a good seamstress, and she could judge whether or not her clothes would fit Skander just by looking at her son's current clothes. Jason was a bit harder, but when she was done, Melinda Jones had four red and black costumes, two for Skander, two for Jason. The form-hugging lycra would be comfortable to wear for long periods of time and it was tough enough to put up with anything the boys could do with it. She also created four pairs of close-fitting red gloves and had bought heavy-duty red boots.

"Hey boys! Come in and try these on!" she shouted to the kids who were out in the back yard, practicing with their powers and playing catch. Adrian was too fast for Skander. The moment Skander threw the ball, the ghost vanished and reappeared at the other end of the yard, ready to catch the ball. Eagerly, they all jogged inside.

"Nice...nice fit..." said Skander, after he tugged the uniform on, "A bit tight."
"It's meant to be tight," said Melinda, kissing her son, "Can't have your clothes coming off in a fight, can we?"
"Only with girls," said Jason.

Melinda and Adrian laughed. Skander tugged on the glauntlets and the boots and red socks.

"This is cool!" he said. He looked like a smaller Mr. Incredible, with a reverse-coloured costume. "Hey mom, what about capes?"

"I'm a little worried about those," said Melinda, "But I made them anyway. They're red on the outside, and black inside, with quick-release clasps around the throat. Pressing the clasp here..." she pointed to it after she clipped the cape around Skander's throat, "will instantly release it. It's a safety precaution," she said. She suited up Jason as well, and smiled at the two super-teens. "Oh you look so cute! Oh, and I made these for you, too..." she said. And picked up a pair of black silk masks to cover the top half of their faes. "Just in case you might want them."

Skander stretched his mask over his head and stared in the mirror, then struck a heroic pose.

"Oh yeah..." he said, "That's all kinds of sexy right there..."

Melinda burst into giggles and collapsed into a chair, heaving with laughter. "Oh boys!" she said, wiping tears of laughter from her eyes with a handkerchief. "Now Adrian..." she said.

"Don't worry about me," said Adrian. "I've been wearing the same suit for 90 years. It's my favourite one and I like it. Not gonna change nothin'. Besides, I'd lose my scare-factor. Nothin' freaks people out like a fellow wearing clothes from the last century."

Melinda giggled, "I suppose you're right," she said. "Well! Hope you're all ready for action!" she said. And she hugged, kissed and waved at the boys.

Excited, the three boys rushed to Skander's room and closed the door.

"What are we gonna call ourselves?" Jason asked excitedly.
"Trident Force!" Skander said, "There's three of us, and we got powers. And...it sounds cool!"
"What about our names?" Jason asked.
"Names?" Skander replied, "What do you mean?"
"Well we can't use our REAL names!"
"Good point...I'm gonna be Stryker!"

"STRYKER? What kinda name is that?" Adrian asked.
"A friggin' awesome name!" Skander snapped. "What about you, huh, Ghostboy?"
"The Shadow," said Adrian, and he let out an evil laugh. "He sees all, hears all, but can't be heard or seen...it would be perfect!"
"What about you, Jason?" Skander asked.
"Ummm..." Jason thought. "My surname's Lancet...Jason Lancet..."
"THE BLADE!" said Adrian quickly, "That would be just amazing!"

Jason grinned, "Hey yeah...that would be cool...Stryker, Blade and Shadow - Together...TRIDENT FORCE!" he screamed, punching a fist into the air.

Skander grinned, "Then it's settled! That's what we are!"

After telling Melinda, she agreed to sew emblems on their clothing. A dagger and yellow lightning-bolt for Jason and two yellow lightning bolts shaped like S's for Skander. "Skander Stryker!" was what they stood for, Skander insisted.

Jason and Skander tugged ordinary clothes over their uniforms after their little 'superhero confrence' and alterations to their costumes, and headed outside with Adrian to keep their eyes out for crime.
1432122222.title: All Dressed up And Nowhere to Go.

choices: Adrian flies Skander and Jason to the fire...on the way, something happens.
They use super-speed to catch up to the truck...
14321222221.content:
A firetruck parked down the road from the Jones house looked like a good-enough place to hang out. The boys loitered in front of it, dressed in ordinary clothes, waiting for something to happen. They watched the crew in the cab of the truck, chatting away...

Krrrch! 10-33, 10-33, all emergency units, standby, reports of fire...10-72, 10-70!! Fire confirmed! Residential area. Apartment block fire. All fire-personnel respond immediately! Repeat, 10-70, 10-70, fire confirmed in apartment block, 14 Oak Street...All units respond...

"I think this is it, boys..." said Skander. The stood up and watched. One of the firefighters picked up the radio-microphone. "10-4, this is truck 32 answering, we're on our way..."

The sirens and lights were turned on. Pulling away from the curb, the truck took off, a lot faster than the boys had expected. Skander swore. Now what!? He thought they could jump onto the back of the truck, but it was already a block away!
14321222221.title: 10-70 - Apartment fire!

choices: "...Bank robbery in progress, all units proceed with caution. Code 2".
"...Hostage situation in Sundowner Hotel. Suspects armed, dangerous. Code 3".
143212222211.content:
"How the hell are we gonna catch it!?" Jason shouted. "I don't think we can run quite that fast!"
"Actually we can..." said Skander. Adrian shook his head. "Relax, I got a better way."

"Huh?" Jason asked. Suddenly, Adrian grabbed both his friends and jumped into the sky. The two boy screamed in shock, but Adrian had them both firmly by the necks. "Come on, boys," he said, "Let's take a flight on Stone Family Airlines, the ghostly way to fly..."

Once they got over the shock of being hoisted into the skies by a ghost, the two friends calmed down. They stared down and around, then they spotted the smoke from the apartment fire.

"Over there!" Skander shouted, pointing to the smoke. Adrian dived towards the fire. It was still a fair way off, but Adrian was fast. A bit too fast, perhaps. Skander yelped as he felt the ghost-boy's grip loosen on his collar. He fell.

"Woah!" he screamed as he fell through the air. Skander spread out his hands to try and stop himself...

Wind buffeted Skander's blond hair all over the place...but Skander himself remained quite still. He was hovering in mid-air! No way! Adrian was so shocked he accidently let go of Jason as well, who, after a brief fall, also found himself hovering in mid-air.

"This is COOL!" Skander said, tugging off his clothes and throwing them to the ground. It was like swimming, only in air. He jumped and spun and twirled around, his red and black cape flapping behind him in the breeze.

"Come on, fellahs, we have a HOUSE FIRE! HELLO!?" Adrian shouted.

"Right!" Skander said, "let's go!"

Diving through the air, the boys shot towards the burning building. The smoke was thick and black and impossible to avoid, and yet, despite the fact that they were breathing it in and out, neither Jason or Skander felt wheezy. It was as if the smoke didn't affect them! They smashed through holes in the roof and ran from room to room, shouting. Firemen were shooting water into the rooms as fast as they could and scrambling in from the streets below.

"I found one!" Jason shouted, and Skander ran into a room where a boy about 10 was caught underneath a collapsed closet.

"I can't breathe!" the boy screamed.
"Hold on, buddy," said Skander, "We're gonna get you out...just relax...Jason lift!"

Jason grabbed the closet and hoisted it up in his muscular arms, the lycra on his sleeves stretching impressively. Skander grabbed the boy and hoisted him upright. "Come on, kid, let's get outta here! Blade, take his other arm."

Jason grabbed the boy's other arm.

"You like flying, kid?" Jason shouted, "'cause you're gonna go for one! Hold on!"

The two super-teens shot through the window of the apartment block, their capes fluttering in the updraft from the fire. People in the streets below screamed and pointed upwards. The two figures in black and red hovered slowly to the ground.

"Easy does it now..." said Jason. He let the boy go and he dropped the last two feet and landed lightly on the pavement.

"Nice work Blade," said Skander.
"Thanks Stryker."

"Who are you boys?" a policeman shouted.
"No time for that now, sergeant," said Skander, "there's still people in there..."

Heading inside, the boys stared around, going from room to room. Suddenly, Adrian popped out of the floor, looking as neat and perfect as he always did, although a little spookier with all the flames around him. "I found a guy downstairs!" he said, "Come on!"

Running downstairs, the boys found a man pinned under by a fallen beam. Skander lifted it up while Adrian and Jason helped the man up.

"You'll be okay," said Skander. He helped him outside. The man coughed and gagged. He collapsed onto the pavement, panting for air. Paramedics rushed him onto a stretcher. Just then, a man in an official and hig-ranking police-uniform showed up. Skander recognised him at once from the newspapers and television.

"Good afternoon Commissioner Weston," Skander said.
"Who are you boys?" the commissioner demanded.

"I dunno," said Skander, looking at Jason, "Who are we?"
"Trident Force," said Jason, grinning, "here to watch over the city and people."
"Weeell," said the commissioner, smiling, "Super-heroes, huh? Nice work, boys...very nice work. I see two of you, where's the third in your trident group?"

Skander and Jason looked up. Standing on the roof of the burning building, the crowd could see a boy in his late teenage years wearing an old-fashioned suit. He smiled down at them and waved...then disappeared into thin air...

"I'll be damned..." said the commissioner. "Well, thank you, boys."
"No problem, officer," said Jason. "Stryker, I think we better get going."

Jumping into the air, the boys flew off into the skies.

"What have we learnt today?" Skander asked Jason on the flight home.

"We can fly..." said Jason, doing a barrel-roll through the air, "Smoke and flames don't hurt us..."
"And we're soon gonna be famous..." said Skander, grinning.

Back at home that evening, the boys headed upstairs to Skander's room where they found a package waiting for them.

"What's this?" Skander asked his mother.
"A policeman delivered it while you were out," said Melinda, "Compliments of Commissioner Weston."

Skander ripped the paper off the box and opened it. It was a police radio!

"Oh this is too cool..." said Jason, acting as if he'd just gotten the latest computer-game. "This is WICKED! Plug it in!"

Skander unravelled the cables and plugged the radio into the wall-sockets. He flipped a few switches and turned a couple of dials...and they were on the airwaves...
143212222211.title: Come Fly With Me, Come Fry With Me...

choices: Skander and Jason go to the shooting-range to test their abilities with guns.
What about Adrian and the escaping van?
1432122222111.content:
"...Bank robbery, in progress, all units proceeed with caution. Code 2...All units, all units, suspects are on the move, suspects on the move. They have exited the bank by the side entrance, repeat, side entrance, into the yard. Shots fired! Code 3..."

"Come on," said Skander. Vanishing, the three boys reappeared on the street, opposite the bank where officers were taking cover behind a brick wall, firing over the top.

"What's going on, officer?" Skander shouted.
"Yo Stryker!" the man yelled back, "Eight guys, in the bank. Robbed the joint. Two took off with the cash. Blue van. Other six are blowing this place all to hell!"

"Shadow!" Skander shouted, "Find the van and do something with it, Jason, come with me..."

The ghost vanished. Skander and Jason stood up and ran across the street, bullets bouncing harmlessly off them. The men saw the boys and opened fire. Skander coughed as a mouthful of lead-shot from a shotgun flew into his mouth. He spat it out.

"What the hell!?' one of the men shouted. He threw his gun at Skander. The muscular teen grabbed the gun and twisted it into a spiral shape, the long, shiny shotgun barrel now resembling a piece of metallic macaroni. With ridiculous ease, Skander snapped the gun in half and threw it on the ground.

"Jesus!" the man shouted, "Run!"

The six men jumped up and ran, still firing behind them. Policemen jumped over the wall they were hiding behind and ran after them. The men ran into an alleyway and Jason and Skander ran in after them. The desperate bank-robbers fired their guns in vain.

"Oh don't waste my time..." said Skander, "Your bullets are useless..." he walked up to one man who was holding a Colt .45 in his hands. The man grabbed Skander by the neck and forced the gun into the boy's mouth. He fired!

The bullet hit Skander in the back of the throat. It rebounded and fell down his gullet. Skander felt it being dissolved, like a peppermint drop. Skander bit down on the gun. He meant to hold it in his mouth, but instead...

Crunch!

The entire front half of the gun disappeared into Skander's mouth. He was so surprised, he accidently swalllowed the barrel in shock, but tried to act as if this happened every day and that he regularly ate .45-calibre Colt automatic pistols for breakfast.

"Now lie down," said Skander. "The cops are here now."
1432122222111.title: Bank Robbery.

choices: That night over dinner, the boys discover new powers.
Something happens on the way home.
14321222221112.content:
Adrian flew overhead. He could hear helicopters and sirens. He swooped down to see the van, weaving and speeding in and out of traffic on the highway. He dived. Sure enough, the van was dark blue. Adrian dived through the roof into the back of the van. Duffel bags and backpacks inside bulged with banknotes. Undoing the latches on the rear doors of the van, Adrian threw the sacks out into the street. He slammed the doors shut and locked them. He slid through the dividing wall between the cargo-area of the van and into the driver's cab. There were two men here, and three seats. Adrian sat himself in the middle of the van and calmy materialised and acted as if he was a hitch-hiker, come along for the ride.

"Taking a bit long, isn't it?" he asked.

The two men screamed! One of them tried to grab Adrian, which, of course, was useless. His hand went right through Adrian. The ghost grabbed the man. Another hand reached for the door and opened it. Undoing the seatbelt, Adrian threw the man into the road! The van lurched and the door slammed shut, catching the man's coat and dragging him along. Adrian vanished.

"Who the hell are you!?" the final bank-robber screamed, "WHO THE HELL ARE YOU!?"

"Your worst nightmare..." said Adrian. "Peek-a-boo!"

Adrian's face materialised in the mirror and the robber screamed. He lost control of the van. Adrian dived into the man's body and used his hands to grab the wheel. He turned the wheel hard over to the left. The van skidded across the road and hit a police roadblock and spike-strip. The spike-strip tripped the van over and it crashed onto its side and then up onto its roof, finally crashing down onto its left side.

"Bye!" Adrian said. He smiled at the crooks, one pinned to the door by his coat, the other dazed inside the cab, and floated upwards.

"This is better than any movie!" said Skander, flying next to Adrian.

"That was totally cool!" said Jason, "The way he crashed the van!"
"Aaactually...that was me," said Adrian, "I posessed him and forced him to crash it. They'll be alright though...unfortunately."

The three boys laughed and flew home...
14321222221112.title: Shaken, Rattled and Rolled Over.

choices: Skander sees what else he can make fly around.
That evening, listening to the police-radio...
143212222211121.content:
"Oh Adrian, you really shouldn't have!" said Melinda, Skander's mother, "You could've killed that man..."
"Makes no difference," said the ghost as he helped to set the table, "I'm already dead!"
"Adrian!"
"Sorry."

Mr. and Mrs. Lancet came over for a chat. Melinda had insisted on divulging Jason's new abilities to his parents, they were shocked, of course, but they got over it.

"Perhaps he'll be able to do things faster now," said his father.
"Daaad," said Jason.
"No seriously, you're a lucky kid, Jase," said his father. "And you look great!...we're proud of you. So Linda, what happens if Jason has kids?"
"If he does," said Melinda, "They inherit his powers."
"Ooooh, interesting..." said Mrs. Lancet, "I'm not sure if we can handle super-powered babies, though."

Melinda laughed, "They won't get their powers until they're teenagers, don't worry...Are you sure you won't stay for dinner?"
"I'm sorry Linda, but we're expected at a friend's house. Him and his wife are celebrating their 25th anniversary. We'll see you tomorrow, Jase. Look after yourself."
"Bye dad!" Jason said. His parents left the Jones house and Melinda brought out dinner - Homemade pizza and lasagna.

"I'm sure you boys are hungry as heck," she said, "after flying around so much, so I made you an extra-special dinner."
"Mom, you have powers, don't you?" said Skander.
"Not as many as you do, darling. I married into your father's family, he was the one with all the powers - God rest his soul..."
"What happened to dad?"
"He died on the way to Earth, darling. It was a long time ago, you were only a baby. There was an airlock failure and he...well he suffocated..." Melinda sighed. She didn't want to talk about it. She cut up the pizza and put it on the table.

"Mom, where's the chilli?" Skander asked. He stared around the table.
"Oh I left it in the kitchen..." said Melinda.

Twisting around in his chair, Skander stared at the chilli, sitting on the counter in the kitchen. He reached out a hand for it, even though it was still 15 feet away.

"Oh just get up and grab it," she said.
"Hmmm..." Skander mumbled. Suddenly, he felt something bump against his hand. He turned back to the kitchen and yelped to see the jar of chilli hovering just out of reach.

"Oh very funny, Adrian!" Skander shouted.
"What?" the ghost asked, appearing next to him. Skander nearly dropped the jar.
"You didn't just...levitate the jar over from the kitchen?"
"No."
"Wh..." Skander stared in disbelief. The jar was on the COUNTER! In the KITCHEN! He was in the dining-room! How the hell...?

"I can...I can levitate things and make them move around!?" Skander asked.

Jason looked up, "Really? Let me try..." He raised his hands. The pepper-grinder whizzed towards him. "Hey cool!"
"Man I never knew I had...had..." Skander struggled to find the word.
"Telekinesis?" Adrian offered.
"Uh...yeah," said Skander. "Wow! This is awesome!"
143212222211121.title: Dinnertime.

choices: Next day, the boys go back to school...
The next day, the boys go back to the beach...
1432122222111211.content:
"Hmmmm..." Jason yawned. Dinner was over and everyone was leaning back in their chairs.
"You know, when I was your age, we covered our mouths when we yawned," Adrian said.
"Yes, father", Jason said. "Give it a rest, Adrian."

"I wonder what else I can move around..." Skander said.
"Basically, if you can lift it, you can move it," said Adrian, who had been explaining telekinesis to the boys all evening. Skander stared at the fireplace. At first, nothing, but then, a clanking sound, as the poker rose into the air.

"Cool..." Skander said. He lowered the poker back down. He stared at the piano and, with a jangle, it too lifted a couple of feet into the air.

"Awesome..." he said.
"Ahem..." Adrian cleared his throat, "You mind, hunky-boy? That piano's been in my house for a hundred years, I'd appreciate your not throwing it around."
"Sorry," said Skander, and he set the piano back down with a muffled 'clunk'! He'd forgotten that when his mother bought the house, which hadn't been touched in ages, a lot of the furniture inside it had belonged to the original Stone family. Next, Skander levitated a glass jug, half-full of lemonade and filled up the glasses around the table.

"Oh thanks, honey," said Melinda.

"Hey Adrian," Jason shouted, "You're a ghost right...what kinda powers do you have?"

The ghost swirled around the chandelier in the middle of the dining-room, the glass decorations clinking slightly.

"I can make myself invisible..." he said, vanishing. "I can make myself appear solid," he said, reappearing in complete solidity. "I can be transparent..." he said, turning into a black and white version of himself, whispy and smoky. "Or translucent..." He added, turning into a colour version of himself, but through which light could shine, "...I can teleport..." he said, vanishing from the top of the chandelier and appearing next to the kitchen door, "...I can fly..." he said. "I can go through walls..." and he disappeared in one wall and popped out another, "and floors and celings...anything..."

"I thought ghosts can possess people?" Skander asked.

Adrian let out his usual, creepy laugh. "Sure I can," he said. He flew over to Skander. Then, he vanished.

"...although I don't know why I'd want to posess you," said Skander, in Adrian's voice. The ghost popped out again, "I like you guys the way you are."
"Thanks," said Jason.
1432122222111211.title: Skander sees what else he can make fly around.

choices: The boys have to deal with bullies attacking younger students.
There's an emergency at school!
14321222221112111.content:
"Wakey-wakey-wakey-wakey!"

Skander yawned and got up. Adrian hovered in front of his sleepy eyes.

"Boo!"
"Goddamn it!"
"Yeah, I finally succeeded in scaring you!" the ghost-boy shouted, shooting into the ceiling and coming back down again into Skander's room. "Wake up, bud, time for school! Come on, come on, come on, get that super-ass of yours out of bed! Don't worry, I packed your schoolbag last night while you were asleep."
"So that's what I heard..."
"Hey, I was bored."

Skander rolled out of bed and stripped off his pyjamas, revealing his impressively-sculpted body. He tugged on his black and red "Stryker" uniform and then pulled on some tan trousers, a white tank-top T-shirt (which left nothing to the imagination) and a denim jacket. He headed to the bathroom to brush his teeth and do his hair up with gel in the mad, spikey way he liked it. He headed into the kitchen to find leftover lasagna and pizza on the kitchen table, all hot and ready to eat.

"I warmed up some of the leftovers for you," Adrian said.
"You know how to work a microwave?" Skander asked.
"Of course, why?"
"I dunno, I guess I didn't expect ghosts to know stuff like that since they don't eat..."
"Hey I can work your PC perfectly fine," Adrian said. "Now eat up. I'm gonna go give our knifeblock friend a wake-up call..."

Skander wondered what kind of 'wake-up call' Adrian had in mind, but he didn't have to wait long when next door, he heard a muffled yell. He guessed Jason was awake. A couple of minutes later, Jason was in Skander's kitchen.

"What gives!?" Jason said, as he sat down to eat some of the leftovers from dinner.
"What's wrong?" Skander asked.
"That idiot hit me on the head with a baseball bat!"

Skander grinned. He finished off the last of the pizza and the two boys and their ghostly friend teleported to school...
14321222221112111.title: Back-to-school Time.

choices: Something happens after school...
An accident in the chemistry-block, an explosion and fire!
143212222211121111.content:
Skander and Jason strolled around the vast schoolyard during their lunch-break. They'd already done history, geography and maths and now they walked around the campus, stretching their legs.

"Oh yeah..." said Jason. He was feeling his arms and abs, totally ripped and rock-hard. He acted as if he was having a love-affair with himself, "I am such a BEAST!"

Skander sniggered, "Stop it, Jase, you're gonna embarrass yourself."
"Yeah whatever," said Jason. He glugged down his can of lemonade, crushed the can into a disc no larger than a dime coin, and flicked it into the bin nearby. The two friends kept walking.

"Hey Shandy, whutcha got for lunch, Shandy?"
"Leave us alone!"
"Yeah! What's the matter!?"
"Shut up Rank..."
"Hey that's mine!"
"Hey Davy, look...pistrami sandwiches...rich pricks...How much lunch-money you got, Rank? Fifty-million bucks? Gimme!"
"Hey get off us!"

Skander and Jason turned the corner to see two eighteen-year-olds picking on two boys of twelve. Sean and Ryan.

"Hey leave them alone, alright!?" Skander shouted. Ryan's backpack was ripped open and his lunchbox lay open on the ground. One of the jocks named Davy sneered at Skander. "Piss off, Twinkie-boy..."
"Easy guys," said Jason, "You don't wanna get Skander angry now, do you?"
"Shut up, Jam-trap," said the other bully. "Get outta here!"

Skander was walking closer and closer. He was perhaps four feet away now. Davy swung a meaty fist towards Skander. Skander whipped aside so fast, Davy might as well have been punching in the opposite direction. Skander slammed his fist into David's stomach. The bully collapsed like a house of cards in a tornado.

"You want some of this!?" Skander asked, turning to Brad, the other guy. He was already moving his feet, preparing to take Skander on. Skander punched and Brad ducked! Skander's fist hit the brick wall behind him, cracking it. Skander kicked, but missed again. Brad turned to run, not wanting to chance fate another time, but found his way blocked by Jason who did a nasty, curved, underarm jab. It nailed Brad right between the legs and he let out an anamalistic howl of pain, clutching his potato-mashed goolies and collapsing to the ground, twitchin in pain.

"You guys better get outta here," said Jason to the kids, "Go on, scat!"

When the boys left, Skander stood, examining the cracks he'd left in the brick wall. He kissed his knuckles.

"Ouch," he said. Jason grinned.
143212222211121111.title: Children, Never Fear, For Trident Force is Here.

choices: The first fan club meeting
More action and heroics for the heroes
1432122222111211111.content:
Two gunmen stormed the administration office of the high school and held up the administrators and the two students, who were working there. They demanded all the money that was in the cash drawer be stuffed in a plastic bag. Luckily, the secretary pressed the button, which triggered the silent alarm.

Two police cars were dispatched to the building, and Jason and Skander were just on their way home, when they spotted them.

“Dude, time for action!” Skander said to his partner.

The two boys, along with Adrian, raced to a back alley where they changed into Stryker and Blade. Then, Adrian teleported the heroes into the building.

The masked men were about to get away, holding Jeremy, one of the students, hostage. As they left the building, the heroes surrounded them.

“Hold it right there! You’re not getting away with this!” Stryker shouted.

One gunman fired at him, but the bullets bounced off the superhero.

Blade quickly disarmed the other gunmen at super speed, and he melted the gun using his heat vision.

“Ohmygosh… Who… Who are you??” the man shouted.

Then Adrian possessed the gunman who was holding Jeremy hostage, and made him toss the gun on the floor.

“Run, Jeremy!” Stryker told the boy.

Jeremy ran away, so he was freed from the robbers, just as the police arrived.

“Are you alright?” Blade asked the shaken student, who witnessed the three superheroes in action.

“Y-y-yeah… You guys were awesome!”

Then Stryker, Blade and Shadow leaped into the air and flew away, as the cops lead the two gunmen into the patrol cars, with handcuffs on.

Meanwhile, Jeremy was making plans to launch the Trident Force Fan Club at school…
1432122222111211111.title: Something happens after school...

choices: Saturday afternoon at the beach: Surfing and Swimming
Super heroes at the beach, and afterwards
14321222221112112.content:
It was Saturday morning, when Adrian was flying over Skander’s body.

“Wakey wakey wakey…”

“Hmmm…” Skander groaned softly, as he turned around.

“Come on… I let you sleep all night long…” Adrian grumbled.

“It’s Saturday, Adrian… “Skander groaned. “Let me sleep a little while longer…”

“Alright…” Adrian sighed. “I’ll go see what Jason is up to…”

Adrian teleported to Jason’s bedroom, only to find a similar scenario. The superhero was sound asleep.
Adrian was about to wake him up, when he heard Jason’s mother talking to her husband in the kitchen.

He quickly flew over and materialized.

“Hello Mrs. Lancet!” he said politely.

“Well, hello Adrian! I’m baking a chocolate cake for you guys to take to the beach today! I guess Melinda is taking you all to the beach, so why don’t you go ahead and wake up Jason?” she said to the ghost.

“Sure!” he cheered.

He flew back and grabbed a feather from Jason’s desk, and started to run it over the soles of his feet, which were sticking out from the covers.

“Hmmm…” Jason groaned.

“Wake up! We’re going to the beach! We’re taking chocolate cake with us!” Adrian said to Jason.

“Chocolate? Hmmm Yummm!” Jason yawned, as he rubbed his eyes.

He jumped out of bed and stumbled over to the kitchen.

“Good morning, honey! Would you like to try a slice of cake?” his mom said.

“Sure!”

“I want to see what that tastes like!” Adrian chuckled.

Jason sat down on his chair at the dinner table, where he poured a glass of milk and grabbed his fork and knife, just as his mom placed a slice of delicious chocolate cake on a plate before him.

“Well, you can’t have any! You’re a ghost, remember?” he replied.

“Ohhh wanna bet?” Adrian said with an evil grin on his face.

Just as Jason was about to take his first bite, Adrian walked over to him, and allowed his body to take possession of him. Adrian became transparent and “merged” with Jason’s body.

Jason took a bite and swallowed. He then drank some milk.

“Wow! That was pretty tasty!” Jason spoke, in Adrian’s voice.

“Hey! What the---?” Jason said.

“Congratulations! You’re possessed!” Adrian’s voice continued, from Jason’s mouth.

“Hey! Quit that!” Jason protested.

“Just take another bite, will you?” Adrian grumbled.

Jason just complied and ate the rest of his small piece of cake. It was absolutely delicious. Then he washed it away with a glass of milk, before he grabbed his swimming trunks, his towel and some sandals.

“Now, I’ll teleport you to Skander’s room…” Adrian’s voice said, speaking from Jason’s mouth. “Here we go!”

Instantly, Jason disappeared, and re-appeared in Skander’s bedroom, just as Skander was getting up.

“Whoa! You teleported!” Skander gasped, as he saw Jason pop up in his bedroom.

“Yeah… I’m possessed by a ghost!” Jason grinned.

“Good morning, sleepyhead!” Adrian’s voice then said, while coming out of Jason’s mouth.

“Wow… That is so weird… Two people in one body…” Skander chuckled.

“Mom gave us some chocolate cake to take to the beach with us…” Jason explained.

“And I even got to taste some of it!” Adrian spoke up.

“Yeah, well he just jumped into my body without—“ Jason said.

“I took it over… Muahahahaha!” Adrian laughed. “We like the same food… So I’m gonna do it more often! Who’s gonna stop me? Plus I get to experience your cool little powers!”

Just then, Melinda walked in the room.

“Alright, are you guys ready to head on out to the beach?”

“Yeah!”

“So, where’s Adrian?”

Both Adrian and Jason spoke up at the same time.

“Over here!”

Melinda looked up at Jason in confusion.

“Why does Jason sound like Adrian?”

Just then, Adrian came flying out of Jason’s body, and landed right next to him.

“Finally! I thought you were NEVER gonna come out!” Jason complained.

“Hey, I could use some ocean water over my body, so I might possess you again when you go swimming at the beach!” Adrian snapped back. “I haven’t gotten wet in decades!”

“So, how does it feel to be possessed?” Skander wondered.

“Weird… I could feel him inside of me the whole time… Making me say and do things…” Jason noted.

The boys grabbed towels and packed the SUV for the ride to the back, where they would spend the rest of their Saturday afternoon…
14321222221112112.title: The next day, the boys go back to the beach...

choices: A friend from school recognises the boys and runs over to meet them.
Adrian decides to make his first public appearance in 90 years.
143212222211121122.content:
"Oh honey, help me with this..."

Skander grabbed the deckchair from his mother and forced it apart. The stiff joints snapped into place and the whole chair broke open.

"Aaaah! Thanks sweetie," she said, and gave him a kiss. She set the chair up and tugged out her book. "You boys go and play. Try not to get too wet..."
"No chance of that, mah," said Skander, "Come on, Jason."

The two boys reached the surf, but didn't go in.

"I think I wanna stay dry today," said Jason.
"What are you? A wuss? Who always listens to their best friend's mother?" Skander asked.
"Well I..." Jason waved his hands dismissively. Skander shrugged. "Whatever...I wanna build a sand-castle."

Wearing nothing but their tight, black lycra costumes with T-shirts over the top (to hide their logos), the boys started digging. Adrian sauntered over, having left his coat, hat and waistcoat with Melinda.

"What on earth are you doing?" he asked.
"Building a sand-castle," said Skander.
"Huh..." Adrian said. "You can't build a sandcastle without a spade and bucket..."

The ghost disappeared.

"Now where'd he go?" Jason asked. Then Skander saw Adrian striding out of the waves with something in his arms.

"While you were acting all heroic last time we were here, I went exploring," said the ghost, "I found these buried in silt underneath the jetty. Some kid must've left them there a long time ago. We can use these."

And so the castle-building had begun. People passing by watched the two teenagers in what looked like surfing-gear, and another wearing black trousers and a white dress-shirt, digging, stacking, moulding, patting and sculpting. Skander's powerful hands gouged into the damp sand near the water's edge, scooping up huge clumps of the stuff and dumping it next to Jason, who filled the bucket to make the towers.

"SHARK!" someone screamed. Skander's head snapped around. He could see people both running away, and towards, the surf. He stared out to sea. He could see people caught out in the riptide.

"Jason!" Skander shouted, "You deal with the sharks and I'll get the people!" Skander tugged off his T-shirt and Jason did the same.

"And let him get eaten alive!?" said Adrian, standing up, "I don't bloody think so! BOTH of you get the people, I'll handle the sharks. They can eat me all they like - nothing'll happen."

Both teens had dived into the water. Adrian teleported, disappearing from the beach, and showing up a few miles out to sea. He grabbed a shark and started punching it, pulling at it, smashing it and wrestling with it. Unfortunately, Adrian couldn't posess animals, but he sure fought like one.

"GOOD AFTERNOON!" Skander shouted to the struggling group of teenagers in the riptide. "My name is Stryker and this is my friend The Blade, we're gonna be your surf-lifesavers for today!"

There were four teenagers, two girls and two boys, all in their mid teens.

"Get us outta here!" one of the girls screamed, and gurgled as she swallowed more water.

"Come on Blade, you take two each, I'll handle the others!" Skander shouted.

Jason grabbed one of the boys and reached his hands out for one of the girls. "Come on, sweetheart," he said. "Let's get the hell outta here! Hold on now...Deep breath! Dive!"

A wave hit them and they went under. Jason started kicking. He powered through the water like a speedboat. The boy tugged on Jason's arm and he went up again. They were almost at the shore! They took another breath.

"Dude! How the hell do you swim so fast!?" the boy gasped.
"The Blade is as keen as a knife, through water, air and land..." said Jason, grinning, "Come on, not much further! Jeeze, you guys know how to get yourselves drowned!"

Back out at sea, Skander was having a bit more trouble. With the extra weight and with no firm footing below him, he wasn't sure if he could take off and fly, and the waves kept disorientating him about where to swim. He let out a scream of frustration.

"Come on surfboy," said Adrian, pretending to swim through the water towards him, "Move it!"

"Shut up, Shadow! You're not helping!" Skander yelled.
"Duck!" said Adrian, grinning. Skander turned around. Jesus Christ!

A wave, a HUGE wave, was surging towards them! Skander swore. If he could just WALK on water this would be no problem!

The wave hit them. They were forced under, but their natural boyancy made them shoot up again! Skander felt himself shoot into the air. Then he fell...

Whunk!

Skander lay there, dazed, then he got up.

Wait...got up?

Skander stared around him...he was walking on water! He jumped and pounded and slammed his feet down - He didn't go under! It was like he was walking on a gigantic sheet of glass! One that he could reach through. He grabbed the girl and heaved her into his arms. Then the boy. Holding them as easily as pillows, he cuddled them close and started a leisurely stroll back to land.

"Oh!...Wow!" the girl panted. Then she grabbed Skander around the chest and neck. "You're cute..." she said. Skander blushed. She kissed him.

"Knock it off Stacy, you think everyone's cute," said the other boy, who was obviously her brother.

Stacy ignored him and her hands wrapped themselves around Skander's bulging arms. "So strrrrrroooong..." she said, and giggled.

"Easy now," said Skander, he lowered the two of them onto the sand. People crowded around them.

"Hey look!" someone shouted, "It's those super-kids!"
"Where!?"
"There, near the water!"
"Hey let me through!"
"Daddy, I wanna see! I wanna seeeeee!!"

Skander strolled over to Jason. "Hey," he said.
"I saw you out there," said Jason, "What did you DO?"
"I'll explain later..." said Skander. "Right now...just wave for kids, smile at the olds, shake with the boys and pose for the girls."

Jason collapsed into fits of laughter. "You idiot!" he said, snickering.

Skander and Jason teleport into Blake's living-room to surprise everyone.
1432122222111211221.content:
"It IS them! Wow!"

Skander and Jason shook hands, signed autographs and posed for photos and answered questions. As the crowd thinned, a boy ran towards them. He had light-coloured, sorta clay-coloured hair.

"Hey!" he shouted. "Hey Stryker!"

Skander and Jason looked to see Blake Sanders jogging towards them. Blake was in a few of Skander's classes and they knew each other fairly well. He stopped right next to the two boys.

"Woooow...YOU guys are Stryker and Blade?"

14321222221112112211.content:
"No way did you get them to come!" said one boy.
"I did!" said Blake, lying back on his couch. "They'll come, don't worry."

It was just past six o'clock and the little fanclub had gathered in Blake's living-room. They chattered excitedly and couldn't wait to meet their heroes.

"I wonder what they can do!" said another boy.
"The guy with blond hair can walk on water!" It was the girl, Stacy, that Skander had saved from the surf. The girls giggled. "What's he like, Stacy?"
"He's sooooo strong!"

A sudden gust of wind blew through the living-room. The pictures hanging on the walls swung slightly.

"What was that!?" one of the boys said, standing up.
"I dunno," Blake replied, "I didn't see anything."

One of the girls screamed. Her handbag was hovering in mid-air! She reached up for it and the bag dropped into her hands.

The piano in the corner of the living-room started playing by itself. Everyone watched in amazement. It turned out some sort of old-fashioned jazz tune.
"Hey Blake, I didn't know you had a player-piano," said his friend Eric.
"It's not a player piano!" said Blake. "Who are you!? What are you doing here!?"

A horrible, chilling, rattling laugh echoed around the living room.

"Who knows what evil...lurks in the hearts of men?...The Shadow knows! Muahaahahahahahahaahah!"

The kids stared at each other in terror! A window banged open and they all turned towards it. Two figures in red and black flew through it, landing neatly in the midddle of the room.

"I see The Shadow has decided to join us," said Skander. "Shadow! Show yourself!"

Slowly, Adrian materialised in front of the piano. He leaned against it and smiled. "Good evening," He said, grinning. The ghost vanished and reappeared in the middle of the crowd. "Wow...modern girls. The deader I are, the hotter they get..." he said.
"Shadow stop fooling around and get over here!" said Jason. The ghost floated casually over. He tugged his watch from his pocket. "Yeah...time to start the show," he said.

Blake stepped forward, "So this is all of you?"

"So, what do you want to do, Blake?" Skander asked.
14321222221112112211.title: I Declare This Meeting - Open.

choices: They ask Adrian to show off his ghostly powers.
Time to head home, boys...
143212222211121122111.content:
"So," said Skander, "What do you want us to do?"

"Show us your powers!" said one of the boys.
"Yeah!" another one said, "Do something cool!"
"Blow something up!" one of the boys shouted. Skander laughed. "You...you don't want me to do that."
"Aww come on!"
"No I mean really...you...don't want to see me do that."
"Awwww..."
"Just one thing, Stryker..." said Jason, "Let them have some fun."
"Okay okay..." said Skander. "It better be something you don't value, 'cause it won't BE very valuable once I'm done with it."

The small crowd laughed. They rushed out onto the balcony and Blake stared around his back yard. He pointed to a rusting metal hulk in the yard. "Dad's been wanting to throw that out for years," he said, "But he keeps complaining it's too big."

Skander looked at the rusting barbeque-set. It was so old and...gone...that it was barely standing. This was easy. Skander could sneeze at it and it'd fall over. But, to oblige, he thrust out his right hand, palm open...

WHAM!!

The very ground beneath them shook! A blue-white beam and ball of energy pulsed out of Skander's hand, smashing the barbeque-set to pieces! Shards of metal, none of them bigger than a cookie, littered the yard.

"Woah cool!"
"Duuuuuuuuuuuuude!"
"Awww man!"
"Siiiiick!"
"Blow up something else!"
"Oh no," said Skander, "Can't be blowing up everything...What else you want me to do?"
"Fight someone!" one of the boys said.
"Oh you don't want him to do that," said Jason.
"Aww come on, I can take him!" said one of the boys, shrugging off his jacket.
"Uh...no...you can't," said Jason, "Nobody can."

But the boy was already hopping around on his feet, doing practice jabs. Stryker grabbed the boy's shirtfront and hurled him into the air! He screamed as he shot up like a rocket, his hair whirling around him! Stryker jumped into the air, catching the boy on the way down.

"Easy now," he said, and he dropped him the last few feet. The boy hit the balcony with a 'whunk!'

"Wooooaaaah..." he said, getting up. "Oh maaaan..."

"What can you do?" one of the girls asked, looking at Jason.
"Anything Stryker does, the Blade does better..." Jason said, grinning.
"No you can't," said Skander, crossing his arms, confidently.
"Try me," said Jason.
"Okay superkid, let's do target-practice," said Skander, "Blake, you got any newspapers around here? Old ones?"
"Um...yeah," said Blake, "In the study."
"Get them, wrap them up with some rubber-bands or something and bring them out here."
"Okay."

Blake ran into the house and came back a few minutes later with some rolled up newspapers.

"Okay," said Skander, "Ready?...Aim..."

Skander threw the first newspaper into the air. "FIRE!"

Jason's eyes blazed red and a laser shot out of them, hitting the first newspaper. It burst into flames! Suddenly, the whole bundle of papers was scooped out of Skander's hands. Adrian soared upwards and started throwing them everywhere! The club-members watched as red flashes of light went everywhere, and flaming newspapers fell to the ground.

"Hey, it's getting dark," said Blake, "We better get inside."

Skander blinked. "Why?" His eyes flashed a blinding white light all over the yard. "Not bright enough?"
"Woah! How'd you do that!?' one of the kids asked.
"I can also see in the dark," said Skander. He blinked and his eyelights went off. "Jase, show them night-vision!"
"I can't SHOW them...I can DO something with it, though."
"Okay," said Skander. He left and came back a few minutes later with a handful of kitchen-knives.

"Hit me," Skander said. He stood at one end of the balcony and handed Jason the knives. "Blake, turn off the lights."

Blake did as he was told. "You guys stand back," Skander said. "Okay, go!"

Jason blinked. His eyes turned green. Night-vision. He threw a knife through the air. Skander caught it and threw it back. Jason ducked it. The blade thudded into the balcony-rail behind him. They continued throwing knives for a few minutes, with everyone gasping and applauding...
143212222211121122111.title: "Show us your powers!"

choices: Trident Force has to leave.
They stay and show off more powers.
1432122222111211221111.content:
"Hey," said Eric to Blake, "Where's that ghost-dude?"

"Ahem!"

Everyone screamed as Adrian floated up onto the balcony through the floor!

"Good evening, ladies and gentlemen," he said, "Tonight you will witness the powers of one who has passed to the world of the dead. Will you be spooked? Maybe. Terrified? Hopefully...Possessed? Definitely".

The crowd thrilled and clapped.

"This guy is creepy," said a boy with black hair to his friend.
"I'd be a sad excuse for ghost if I wasn't, now wouldn't I be?" said Adrian, swirling around him like a human-shaped cloud of smoke. Then, he vanished!

"Come on, boy," the black-haired kid said, in Adrian's, old-fashioned American accent, "Let's dance!"

The crowd laughed as the boy broke into a quick 'Charleston' dance, swinging around and kicking his legs.

"Hey what the..." the boy said in his own voice. Adrian's took over, "Shut up, kid, I'm not done yet!"

Suddenly, the boy found himself climbing over the railing of the balcony. He ran along the ballustrade, from one end to the other, doing cartwheels and handstands and jumps all the way. Finally, his body flipped and tumbled back onto the balcony and Adrian flew out.

"Wow that was fun!" Adrian said. The crowd gasped and clapped.

"Can you make things fly around like a pollygust?" one of the girls asked.
"That's a poltergeist," Adrian corrected and he made a truly creepy face, "...an angry and vengeful spirit...RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAR!" he roared. The sound was deafening and the girl's hair flew back, as if blasted by a hurricane!

"And yeah, I can," said Adrian. He vanished again, then reappeared next to one of the boys. "I can also teleport, make myself invisible, semi-visisble, transparent, translucent, solid..." he grabbed the boy's hat and disappeared again and reappeared, floating twelve feet up in the air, waving the blue baseball cap, "And, I can fly, just like those two skin-tubes there," he added, pointing to Skander and Jason. He dived thrugh the roof and then emerged in the living-room. He stepped through the window. "And I can go through walls, floors, celings, rooves...anything!" he threw the hat back to the boy, "Even yoooooooou!!"

He shot across the balcony, his ghostly form spearing everyone in the chests and abdomens, popping out of one and into another, until he appeared next to Skander and Jason at the other end of the balcony.

Everyone was speechless. Adrian bowed...and once more, disappeared into thin air.
1432122222111211221111.title: The Ghost with the Most.

choices: Skander and Jason head back home with Adrian.
The three friends spend the night on the town instead.
14321222221112112211111.content:
"Well that was fun," said Blake, "Can you do more stuff?"
"Adrian, what's the time?" Skander asked.

The ghost tugged on the gold chain around his waist and pulled out the pocket watch his father gave him before he died. "Eight-thirty," he said, stuffing the watch back into his waistcoat.

"Sorry Blake," said Jason, "But we better get going. Another time."
"Sure," said Blake. He followed them to the door. When they were outside, Blake whispered in their ears.

"Jason...Skander...can I see you guys at school?"
"Sure," said Skander, "So long as you don't blab. Tell everyone who we are, I swear I will rip your head off!"
"I won't, I won't! I just think it's really cool."
Jason and Skander nodded, "Just keep it under your hat, okay?"
"Right."
"You don't have to rip his head off," said Adrian, hovering through the living-room wall. "If he blabs, I'll haunt him until the day he dies. Come on!"

The three friends headed out of Blake's house and started walking home. It wasn't a very long walk, but they took their time. Adrian turned a corner.

"Hey, where you going?" Jason asked.
"A different route," said Adrian.
"Well wait up!" said Skander. The two boys jogged up to Adrian and followed him.

"Adrian, where are we going?" Jason asked. He didn't recognise this part of town at all.

"A special place," said the ghost. "Come on."

They kept walking. "I had a real fun time tonight," he said. "First time since I died I spent time around real people...and actually did something worthwhile. You fellows are great."
"Thanks," said Skander. Adrian turned a corner. "Here we are."

It was a cemetary.

"Um...what are we doing here?" Skander asked.
"It's a shortcut," said Adrian. "Come on."

"Adrian..." said Jason. "I...I know my neighborhood, cutting through Elmtree Cemetary adds another twenty minutes to our walk! Why are we here...HEY!"

Adrian snatched Jason's iPod out of his pocket and ran off with it.

"Hey come back here!" Jason shouted. The two boys ran after the ghost. He vanished and reappeared a few feet ahead. They kept chasing him and he kept vanishing. Finally, Adrian stopped. The two boys teleported from their last spot right to where Adrian was, so that they didn't have to waste time running anymore.

"That's NOT FUNNY!" Jason shouted, "My mom'll kill me if she finds out I lost my iPod! Give it back!"

Adrian tossed him the iPod. "There," he said. "I wanted to show you guys something and I thought I'd have some fun doing it..."

"Doing...show...what?" Skander asked, "What is there around HERE that you'd want to show US?"

Adrian pulled his silver match-case from his pocket and opened it. He tugged out a match and closed the case. Kneeling down in front of a gravestone, he struck it across the top. The splinter of wood burst into light. The ghost knelt down, holding it at the base of the gravestone so that the light could illuminate all the text above it. Kneeling down, Jason and Skander read...

Here lie the remains of Master Adrian Jeremiah Stone.
Born into this world, 15th of June, 1898,
And who departed this life, 4th of January, 1919.
Aged Twenty Years and Five Months. A victim of
Spanish Influenza.

Here lies a Stone, inscribed in stone,
One stone tells of the other.
The upper stone doth last forever,
How unlike the Other.

Skander and Jason gulped.

"I've never shown ANYONE this," said Adrian. "You're the first people. Ever. You're the first people I ever really liked since I died. I think you deserve to see where it is that I am buried."
"Wow..." said Jason. "Cool..."

Instantly, Skander grabbed Jason and covered his mouth. He turned quickly to Adrian, "He doesn't mean it!" he said quickly, when he saw the ghost's eyes turn blood red. He knew Adrian was very sensitive about his death.

"There's something else I want to show you..." Adrian said. He vanished. A couple of minutes later, he reappeared, half in, half out of his grave. He held something in his hands. "Skander, this is for you."

Skander looked at the thing in Adrian's hand. It was a long golden chain. A large, gold pocket watch hung on the end of it.

"What the..." Skander whispered.
"It's the watch I always wear," said Adrian. "It was buried with me. Take it."
"No..." said Skander, "I...I can't, this was..."
"Take it. I want you to have it," said Adrian. "You're the first real friend I've had in years. You should have it. Look after it. It's antique now."

Skander held the watch and chain. They were in absolute MINT condition. "Father took very good care of his things," Adrian said. "It works just as fine today as it did when it was made. It's probably worth a fortune now. Look after it."
"I will," said Skander. He put the watch into his pocket.

"Jason, this is for you," said Adrian. He held up another item. A dazzling gold ring with rubies, diamonds and sapphires set into it. "It is my signet-ring. Another item I was buried with. Wear it on your right hand, on your pinkie-finger. Keep it there."

The two boys were speechless. Again, they tried to refuse, but Adrian ignored them.

"How come you can still wear these things, if we have them?" Skander asked, noting the gold chain still threaded through Adrian's waistcoat.

"Because I died wearing them," Adrian explained. "So their remains are always with me. But the material posessions are now yours, forever. They were the most priceless things I owned. As expensive now as they were back then. Look after them".
14321222221112112211111.title: From the Cradle to the Grave.

choices: Melinda and Jason's parents have a surprise for the kids the next morning...
Something happens during the night! Adrian wakes the boys up.
143212222211121122111111.content:
Skander stripped down until he was wearing nothing but a pair of boxer-shorts. He climbed tiredly into bed and turned off the light. Adrian floated through his bedroom wall.

"Going to sleep already?" he asked.
"I'm tired..." Skander yawned. "Leave me alone...go haunt a church or something..."

Adrian floated out and went to check on Jason. Finding both boys asleep, Adrian hovered around the bed. He saw the watch which he gave Skander, lying on the table next to Skander's bedside lamp. The ghost picked it up and held it in his hands, sadly. Then, he wound it up. The fast, metallic ticking filled the room. He set the time and then hovered over Skander's bed, dangling and swaying the watch on its chain. He held it up to Skander's unhearing ear, and then put it back down on the table. He grabbed the covers and tugged them up over Skander's body until only the top half of his head showed.

"G'night, buddy," he said. He floated over to Skander's computer and turned it on. He may as well surf the internet until they woke up. He clicked and tapped and typed, searching around for stuff that would interest him. Something bumped against him. He looked up. Skander was floating in mid-air. Fast asleep. Adrian blew the boy back to over his bed, but he continued to float. Adrian shrugged. He just hoped the boy would wake up over his bed instead of over the floor, otherwise he was going to be in for a very painful wake-up call...
143212222211121122111111.title: Sleep Tight, superboys.

choices: One Week Later...
1432122222111211221111111.content:
"...Oh you don't have to, really!"
"No, I think it's worth it! It'll be something new, something for everyone to enjoy, come on Melinda, say 'Yes'!"
"But the boys, they don't even know yet!"
"They will!"

Skander peeped into the living-room from the corridor to see Mr. and Mrs. Lancet talking to his mother.

"Know what?" he asked.
"Oh honey, you're up," said Melinda, standing. "Come here...Mr. and Mrs. Lancet have booked us a holiday!"
"Us?" Skander asked.
"Well it is your school holidays right now," said Mr. Lancet, "And even superheroes need a break! My wife and I were going to spend this money on a sort of...second honeymoon, but then we decided, what the hell? We'll take you all with us!"
"All?" Skander asked.
"You, your mom, Jason, even Adrian...if he wants to come."
"Don't know if I'm gonna find much to do on a stinking ocean-liner," said Adrian, popping out of the wall, "But it might be fun."
"Good!" said Mr. Lancet, "We leave in a week's time."
"But where are we going?" Skander asked.
"Right down the coast and right up the other side," said Mr. Lancet, "We take the train to San Francisco, from there we hop and sail down around South America, then all the way up to New York City. We make stops on the way, of course, and spend three nights in each port we stop at. New York's the end of the line. We can spend as many days there as we like. After that, we take a train back home!"
"Why not fly?" Skander asked.
"We thought a train would be more romantic and fun," said Mrs. Lancet, "Nobody travels by train anymore, and we thought it would be nice to give you boys a treat."
"Woah...thanks," said Skander. "Does Jason know?"
"Jason isn't awake yet," said Mr. Lancet, "Sleeping away...No idea what he did last night, but..."
"I'll wake him up," said Adrian. The ghost vanished. A couple of minutes later, they heard another loud yelp of shock.

"How that boy gets Jason up every morning I'll never know..." said Mr. Lancet and they all laughed.
1432122222111211221111111.title: Holiday Time.

choices: "Exploring the QM2 with Jason, of course! I haven't been on a ship in years!"
"...It's time for lunch! I wanna taste stuff with Jason."
14321222221112112211111111.content:
"This way, ma'am!" said a steward, "Take the stairs up, and then left! Your cabin's on the starboard side."
"Thank you," said Melinda. She headed up the flight of stairs with Skander carrying all their bags.
"You sure you can manage, young man?" the steward asked. Skander gave the man a look as if he'd just asked him if he knew how to breathe by himself, and the steward went to help Mr. and Mrs. Lancet find their cabin.

"Oh yes...right opposite Mrs. Jones and her son. Travelling together, are you?"
"That's right," said Mr. Lancet. "Come on, Jason."
"Coming, coming," said Jason. He too, was carrying all the bags.

"I hope you enjoy your time sailing with Cunard, welcome to the Queen Mary Two," said the steward, "We'll be casting off soon. Lunch will be served..." the man checked his wristwatch, "two hours after we leave port...at one o'clock, in the main dining-room."

"Thanks," said Melinda, and closed the cabin door.

"Woooow..." said Skander when he had put down the bags and stared around at the wide and comfortable cabin. They even had their own private balcony!

"Very nice of the Lancets to book us a passage on the Queen Mary 2," said Melinda. "Honey, where's that suit I bought you?"
"Suit?" Skander asked. "Mom, you don't seriously expect me to wear it?"
"Sure I do!"
"But...It won't look good on me! I'm too...bulky."
"Nonsense! Put it on! Come on! You'll look great!"

Skander sighed. He tugged off his clothes and went to put on the suit his mother had bought for him. It was a sort of medium grey. He sat down on the bed and put on his white dress-shirt and a pearl-grey necktie. Then, the trousers. He tucked in the shirt and buttoned up the fly. He looked hopelessly at the suspenders. He had no idea how to put them on.

"Let me do it," said Adrian. He floated over and showed Skander how to clip the suspenders on and adjust the strap-lengths.

"There!" he said, "Now, the waistcoat."

Skander picked up the waistcoat and shrugged it on. He buttoned it up and then put on the coat.

"Ooooh!" said Melinda, giving her son a hug and a kiss. She ruffled his longish blond hair. "Doesn't he look ah-doooooorable!?"
"Cute as a button!" said Adrian, who was examining his own, jet-black, ghostly suit in the reflection of his cigarette-case.
"I always said you were born classically handsome," said Melinda, "You look great in a suit, honey."
"Moooom!" Skander grumbled as his mother ruffled up his hair again.

She kissed him. "All done!"
