"Not yet," said Adrian. He picked something out of his coat pocket. "You didn't bring this with you. I found it on your desk just before we left home."

He was holding the watch he'd given to Skander. The antique gold timepiece twinkled in the sunlight streaming in through the cabin's windows.

"Oh I can't wear that!" said Skander. "It's...too valuable!"

Adrian blew a raspberry, "This watch and its spiritual counterpart," he said, looking at the duplicate chain on his ghostly body, "Is the most expensive and valuable thing I own! And you will wear it!"
"But!..."

But before Skander could do anything, Adrian was already fastening the chain to the buttonhole on Skander's waistcoat. He put one half of the Double Albert chain into Skander's left pocket, along with the watch, and into Skander's right waistcoat pocket, he put the other length of chain, and the knife which Skander had clipped onto it.

"I see you bought a pocket-knife to go with the other end of my chain," said Adrian. "Nice. Useful in today's society, I suppose. I always..." he tugged out his own chain, "Kept my match-safe on it. Well, come on!"
"Come on where?" Skander asked.
14321222221112112211111111.title: All Ashore that're Going Ashore!

choices: The boys go up onto the bridge deck and explore the top of the ship.
They explore the cargo-holds down below instead.
143212222211121122111111111.content:
"Come in!"

Skander opened the cabin door and saw Mr. Lancet dressing. The man did up his tie and glanced in the mirror, "Oh very smart, Skander. Did you pick that out yourself?"
"Mom did," said Skander. He still felt uneasy in the suit.
"Hahaha...We got one for Jason, too."
"You did?"

Jason stepped out of his own cabin, wearing a dark grey, pinstriped three-piecer with a matching dark grey tie.

"Well look at you," said Skander.
"I like it..." said Jason. "Fits good."
"I dunno," said Skander. He looked at his own suit. It bulged a bit in various places.
"Hey relax man, just think what happens when the chicks see us!"

"What ARE you doing!?"

The two boys jumped as Adrian popped up through the floor between them.

"Don't DO THAT!" they both shouted. Adrian swirled around Jason. "Hold out your hand!" the ghost said. Jason did so, and Adrian tugged off the ring.

"Hey what..."
"A signet ring goes on the little finger of the right hand," said Adrian. "And that is where it's gonna stay, brother!" and the ghost jammed it on. "Now come on! I wanna go exploring!"

"Uh...we'll see you and mom later, dad," said Jason. "Come on, Skander."

"You know, I went on the original Queen Mary once," said Adrian.
"You're dead!" Skander said.
"I'm dead and I'm on the second Queen Mary, aren't I?"
"Touche, Adrian, Touche..." said Skander.
"It was wonderful...smoke, noise, parties, all the people, the music, dancing...I haven't had a good dance in ages..."

The boys headed down a grand staircase into a lobby.

"You know, I don't know many people in THIS age who can dance!" said Skander. "Hey, you sure you wanna make yourself visible today?"
"Everybody's gonna see me on this voyage, buddy-boy," said Adrian. "Nobody will recognise me. Not even as a member of...ahme...our little club."
"But what about press-photos?" Jason asked.

The ghost blew a raspberry, "I'm a friggin' GHOST! I don't show up in photos! Not in photos no videos no mirrors no nothin'! That's cause I'm spirit with nothin' with it!"

Adrian opened his cigarette case and tugged out a smoke. He lit it and they kept on walking.

"Let's go up on deck," said Jason, "I bet it's great up there!"

The three boys started looking for a way up.

"Oh to hell with it!" said Skander, "Let's just teleport there!"
"Good idea," said Jason, "Ready?"

"Excuse me, young man!"

They all turned to see a ship's officer walking towards them across the lobby. "You shouldn't be smoke..." the man stopped. Skander and Jason looked between them. Adrian had vanished.

"Something wrong, sir?" Skander asked.
"Ah...no," said the officer.
"How can we get up onto the bridge deck?" Skander asked.
"Take the elevator all the way up," said the man. He had turned around and was heading back upstairs. He stopped.

"Oh by the way!..." he added. He stopped and turned around.

Now Skander and Jason had disappeareed too.

"I have not had my coffee today...this always happens when I don't have my coffee..." the officer said, and went off about his rounds.
143212222211121122111111111.title: Exploring the Queen.

choices: They head to lunch in the ship's main dining-hall.
They decide to have room-service instead, and stay in Skander's cabin.
1432122222111211221111111111.content:
The summer sun was warm, but a fresh breeze levelled out the temperature a bit. Skander and Jason leaned on the railing of the bridge deck and stared out over the harbour. Somewhere, a foghorn blasted and a bell rung. Passengers on the boat deck waved to people down below, or to passengers on another ship. The wind blew Skander's hair around

"This is terribly exciting," said Adrian, looking around at all the crowds of people and the fine weather. "You know, this is only my second-ever voyage, living or dead? I've never really been on a boat before."
"And I've never been on one with a ghost before," said Jason.
"I guess you don't think much of ghosts on boats, do you?" Adrian asked.
"Nah. They're a nuisance. Just havin' 'em around's a nuisance!"
"Well I'll try not to be!" said Adrian, and he headed off to mingle with the passengeres.

"Theyr'e gonna be freaked as hell when they find out what he really is," Skander said, watching their ghostly friend head off into the crowds.
"They're not gonna find out," said Jason.
"Yeah I suppose no--hello lips, legs, tits and ass..."
"Oh you tease!"

Stacy and her brother walked up towards the two of them. "I didn't know you and Jason were on this voyage, Skander," she said.
"Just a...holiday...sorta," said Skander.
"Oh I bet..." she said. She slunk a little closer. Her brother made a face. "I'll see you later, Stace," he said.
"Sure..." she said. Stacy gazed lustily upwards, leaning against Skander's taut, impressive body. "Well, you are tall, aren't you?" she cooed, her hand running through his hair.
"I didn't mean to be," said Skander. He hugged her. Damn, she was hot. She had a beautiful, dark blonde head of hair.

"Ahem!"

The two teenagers leapt apart as Adrian popped up between them. "Lunch in..." he tugged out his watch, "...fifteen minutes, folks. Better get moving!"
"Will you eat with us?" Skander asked.
"Oh I'd love to!" said Stacy, "We're here with our parents and a friend of mine named Tina. I pointed you out at school," she said, looking at Jason. She winked. "She thinks you're cute!"

Jason punched a fist into his palm. "Hey, the J-man's always cute," he said. "When was I not?"

Adrian laughed and, if nobody had been watching, would've flipped over the railing into the water. "Shut uuuup Jason! Come on, lunch!"
1432122222111211221111111111.title: Up On Deck.

choices: That evening at the dance.
They go back to Skander's cabin.
14321222221112112211111111111.content:
Stacy strolled into the dining-room with her friend striding next to her. Skander was so hot; she didn't want him out of her sight for a moment.

"You gonna sit with me?" she asked. Skander smiled, "Sure," he said. "Oh there's Tina!"

Tina was a short girl with black, flowing hair and brown eyes. She was slim and smiling.

"Wow, where'd you buy that hunk of man-candy?" she said, striding up. "Aren't you just gorgeous?" she said, feeling Skander's chest through his suit, "And so well-dressed..."

Skander laughed, "Thanks," he said, "I was kinda worried about wearing this whole...thing...but..."
"No, you look good," she said. "So, where's this friend of yours?"

Jason strolled into the dining-room.

"ABSOLUTELY NOT!"
"It's not like you have a choice, chocolate-top."
"Shut up, Adrian! It's NOT gonna happen!"
"Oh yes it is...but don't worry, I won't be doing aaaanything else."
"You better not be!"

"Eeexcuse me..." said Skander. He left the girls and walked over to his friends, "Guys, what's up?"
"This freak wants to possess me so that he can eat food or taste it or whatever!" said Jason, pointing at Adrian.
"Give the guy a break! We're on holiday," said Skander.
"I won't be doing anything else," said Adrian. But when he saw Jason's expression, he sighed. "Oh fine! I'll just provide the bloody conversation then! Though by the looks of it all, you've got that all covered anyway!"

"Will you two stop fighting!? For heaven's sake..." Skander said.

Jason sighed. "I'm sorry Adrian, it's just...weird!"
"Never mind, never mind," the ghost said. "I'm gonna see what else I can do."

Everyone sat down at the table. It was a large one and when they were all seated, there was nearly a dozen people there. It was noisy but nobody cared. Adrian picked up a jug of lemonade and started filling everyone's glasses for them.

"Aren't you drinking?" Stacy's brother Marsden asked.
"I don't drink," said Adrian.
"This is lemonade, not whiskey."
"I don't...drink."
"Adrian's..." Stacy began, but Skander shot her a look.
"...um, Adrian's already had a fair bit to drink, you know, it's been warm lately and...I guess he's just had enough."

Skander nodded to Stacy, just out of her brother's line of sight.

In all, it was a pleasant meal and by the end of it, everyone was full and feeling lazy. They strolled over to the windows of the dining-room to stare out onto the ocean when someone shouted...

"Stryker?"

Skander turned around. It was Michael, the newspaper reporter!

"Mikey," said Skander. "What are you doing here?"
"Covering the voyage, writing up a series of articles on sea-travel," said the reporter. "What a view, huh? Where's your friends?"
"They're here somewhere," said Skander.
"Don't know why you're taking a ship, you can fly and do all kinds of stuff. If everyone ad your abilities Stryke, the transport industry would go bust!"

"Stryke?" someone shouted, "Did he say 'Stryker'?"

"Uh-oh..." Skander said.

Suddenly, a whole crowd of people surrounded him. Jason stepped up and suddenly, he too was mobbed by people asking for photographs and autographs.

"I can't believe it! They're on the ship!"
"Why? They can fly!"
"Probably just wanna do it the old-fashioned way."
"Aww man he's got a cute ass!"
"Lucy!"
"What? He does! An' that front ain't bad either!"
"That's enough young lady!"
"Yes mom...Bye there bubble-butt..."
"LUCY!"
"Alright alright..."

Skander waved the girl away and the crowd laughed. They continued to ask questions, chatting and chatting until Skander and Jason had to make excuses to leave.

"Wow..." said Jason, straightening out his suit and trying his best to wipe lipstick from his cheeks. "What a mess!"
"Hey, get used to it brother, we're celebrities now..." said Skander. "Hey baby!"

Stacy sidled up to him, "Hey...Me and Tina are going out for the dance in the main lobby tonight. You guys wanna come?"
"Sure," said Skander. "Who else is coming?"
"Mom and dad are dancing together," said Stacy. "Marsden hates dancing, he's going to the disco with some goofballs he met somewhere else on the ship. What about your folks, Jason?"
"I think they're trying to salvage some of their 'second honeymoon' idea thingo and have dinner alone," said Jason. "Hey Skander, who's your mom gonna dance with? She doesn't have a partner!"

"I'm sure she'll find someone," said Skander. "Come on, I wanna see some other stuff..."
14321222221112112211111111111.title: Celebrity Luncheon.

choices: In The Mood, time for a Lindyhop.
Hot Jazz, time for the Charleston!
143212222211121122111111111111.content:
"Oh wow..." said Stacy as she walked out onto the dance-floor. She stared around her in amazement. The room was huge and so grand. Five large mirror-balls hung from the celing and slowly turned, spraying yellow, blue, red, green and white light all over the place. At one end of the hall, a large jazz-orchestra was preparing for the first dance.

"Good evening, everyone, and welcome to the first dance of the first night of our voyage!"

Everyone turned to the center of the room where a man in a white suit was holding a microphone. "I am the head steward, and it's my duty and honour to welcome you all aboard the Queen Mary Two and to wish you all a wonderful time tonight. Bathrooms, if you need them, are behind the central staircase, snacks, drinks, finger-food and nibblies are all over along the sides there. Alright. Mr. Everland!"

The bandleader bowed. "Ladies and gentlemen, if you'll take to the floor."

"Come on," said Stacy, tugging on Skander's hand. "I hope you can dance."
"A bit," said Skander. "I learnt in school."

Tina pulled Jason onto the floor. "Come on Jase," she said.
"I dunno, I..."
"Relax, I'll lead. My cousin's a dance-instructor. If he can teach me, I sure as hell can teach...you!" she said, and gave him a kiss. Jason grinned. "Okay!"

Mr. and Mrs. Lancet stepped onto the floor along with Stacy's parents and the music started to play. The band opened with "Moonlight Serenade", a slow, waltzy, dreamy jazz-piece. The lights flashed and the couples swung, bobbed and turned.

"You're not bad," said Stacy, holding Skander a bit tighter. "You really can dance!"
"Not really," said Skander, grinning.
"Oh don't be so modest...Woah!" she gasped as Skander tugged her closer. "You're the boss," he said, grinning down at her.
"Oh you teaser..." she said.

"Something wrong, Mrs. Jones?"

Melinda was sitting in a chair on the sidelines, watching everyone dance. She looked up. Adrian was bending over her.
"Oh it's nothing, Adrian..."
"Can't dance?"
"I can dance, I don't have a partner..."

Folding one arm behind his back, the ghost bowed and held out a hand. "Ma'am," he said.

"You?" she said.
"Why not? I was a very good dancer in my day. The music may have changed a bit, but I reckon I still have all the...moves!" he said, and he cut a sharp twirl and threw out his hand again and grabbed her, tugging her to her feet.

"Oh no, Adrian, I can't...I...everyone will see you..."
"Everyone CAN see me. I don't care. I haven't gone to a proper ball since 1916! Besides, I loooove to dance."
"Well you're certainly dressed right!"
"Thank you, ma'am, a gentleman is always dressed right for every occasion. Now if you'll let me take the lead, the music waits!"
"Oh alright," she said, and got to her feet. "Lead on Ghostmeo."
"That sounds like a really bad joke," said Adrian as he led her out onto the dance-floor.

Melinda laughed, "I've made worse."

They started to waltz. They'd only done a few steps when the music changed...
143212222211121122111111111111.title: Dancing on Water.

choices: "Let's go outside and watch the stars and chat."
"Let's show off our own...'special moves'..."
1432122222111211221111111111112.content:
"That was Ray Everland and the Ocean Blue Orchestra," said the steward, stepping upto the stage in front of the orchestra with his microphone, "Now ladies and gentlemen, limber up and hunker down, it's time to go to Charleston town! Hit it Raymond!"

The bandleader tapped his baton and raised. "Two..three...four..."

The music blasted out, loud, strong and fast.

"Come on, Skander! Loosen up baby!" said Stacy, "Move it! Kick! Come on now!"

Skander laughed and held on. "Woah this is tricky!" he said.
"You'll get it!" she said, "Move fast, keep your legs wide enough to balance when you put them down, otherwise you'll fall over..."

"God, I never learnt the Charleston..." said Mrs. Jones, laughing.
"Never learnt?" Adrian shouted over the music, "Hot damn, woman!" the ghost shrugged off his coat and threw it at her. "Hold that!"

Dressed in his black leathers, silk and cotton waistcoat and black trousers, Adrian hit it! The crowd watched as he started dancing, his feet flying and arms cutting and slicing through the air.

"What a GOD!" said Tina, staring at Adrian. "Look at him!"
"Sure makes us look crap, huh?" said Skander, sidling up to Jason. Jason was speechless. He was cursing under his breath. "Wish I could dance like that!" he said. Stacy stepped into the ring around Adrian.

"Hey hotshot, budge it!" she shouted. She yelped as Adrian grabbed her with surprising strength by the wrist.

"You know how to do partnered Charleston?" Adrian shouted, "Come on, hotshot...!...MOVE IT!"

Adrian flung himself into the air and did a backflip, landing neatly on his feet again, breaking into a sharp tap-routine before moving smoothly as butter back to the main dance.

"Did you...?" Jason asked, looking at Skander in disbelief.
"No I did not!" Skander shouted back, "Damn if I knew he could bust moves like this I would've left him at home!...He's gonna steal our girls!"

Jason laughed. With a final crescendo, the band finished. The crowd went wild.

The dancemaster only bowed. "Thank you," said Adrian. "Lessons to dance with me are totally free. Just let me know your style and speed and I'll move so fast your heels will bleed".

He took his coat from Melinda and walked over to his friends.

"Well...I haven't done that in nearly a full century...felt good!" said the ghost, tugging his coat back on. Skander and Jason were speechless.

"You...are...a...GOD!" said Jason. "You can take over my body anytime now!"
"I'll take over Skander's body, then he might be as good in bed as he is good-looking," said Adrian, grinning.

Both super-teens made faces of disgust and amazement. The ghost grinned. "What now?" he asked.

Skander scratched his head. "Well you damn well showed us up, didn't you?" he asked.
"Suuure did, flesh-pump," said Adrian. "So, what do you want to do now?"
1432122222111211221111111111112.title: Dancing like a Man Possessed.

choices: Several days later, and the ship is near New York City...
14321222221112112211111111111121.content:
"You were incredible!"
"You weren't bad yourself!"
"You know, if we weren't on a ship together, that could sound almost naughty."

"Oh knock it off, you two!" said Jason.

Adrian smiled. "What can I say, Jason? I'm a natural dancer". The ghost blew smoke out of his cigarette. "Nothin' like a smoke after a bit of exercise."
"I know a fair few modern doctors who would have something to say about that," said Skander.
"I was born in my time and I died in my time and my manners and habits will therefore reflect my time, thank you, young man," said Adrian.
"Oh stop it Adrian," said Skander. The ghost smiled and turned back to Stacy. "I ddin't know you could dance like that."
"I learnt," she said.

The whole group of youths turned around and stared up at the stars while they lazed around on deck.

"It's getting late," said Adrian, "Time for you boys to be off to bed."
"I'm not tired!" said Jason.
"I am," said Skander. "All that dancing pumped all the energy out of me."
"Then go to bed," said Adrian.
"Alright, alright," said Skander, "Come on, Jase. 'Night Adrian. I'll see you tomorrow."
"Night," said the ghost. He turned to Stacy, "Staying up?"
"I think I'll turn in, too," she said, "Thanks for the dance!"
"No problem," said the ghost. Stacy turned to leave but Adrian grabbed her hand. He tugged on it and gave it a kiss.
"Good night," he said.
"I saw that," Skander called from the doorway.

"It's called manners, Skander, learn some and you might understand," said Adrian.
"My manners are just fine," said Skander. "You gonna keep staying up?"
"Yeah..." the ghost replied. He flicked his cigarette out into the ocean. "I think I'll go spook that cute redhead on the deck below us".
"Well don't cause too much disaster," said Skander.
"I'll be fine!" said the ghost, slipping through the floor. "Whooo!"

"Show-off," said Skander. He headed back to his cabin. This had been a real interesting voyage so far. So far, he'd met a lady friend, found a partner for Jason and had discovered that Adrian could dance like a god. Skander was in awe of the ghostly boy. There was certainly a lot there to admire and Skander was glad that he'd discovered his secret ability to communicate with the dead.
14321222221112112211111111111121.title: After the Party.

choices: The two boys teleport to the promenade deck.
They go to the bridge and watch the ship's officers at work.
143212222211121122111111111111211.content:
WHUNK!

"What the hell!?"

Skander picked himself up, and almost at once found himself flat on his ass again.

"Damn it!" he shouted.
"Language, honey," said Melinda. "Trouble with your sea legs?"
"What the hell's going on!?" Skander asked. He struggled to his feet again and grabbed hold of his bedside table.
"We're in a bit of a swell, dear," she said, "Rough water. I was checking the weather-forecast in the internet cafe downstairs, they're not expecting it to let up anytime soon."
"D..."
"Skaaaander!"
"...f..."
"Don't you dare!"
"...Gaaah!..."

Skander kicked the air, furiously. Adrian floated up through the floor.

"Hey watch it!" the ghost said.
"Where the hell did you come from!?" Skander asked, when the ghost was floating in front of him.
"The bridge," said the ghost. "According to what I heard from the officers, they're gonna plough right through this whole mess and hope for the best. Damn the torpedoes, full speed ahead and all that lot."
"Isn't that dangerous?" Melinda asked.
"Perhaps it is," said Adrian, "But I'm not fussed. I'm dead already."
"Adrian!"
"Sorry ma'am, I meant no offence."

"So," said Adrian, swirling around Skander, "What do you want to do today?"
"I dunno if I CAN do anything!" Skander said, frustratedly, "I can't even keep my balance!"

Adrian laughed. "What are you? A simpleton? Fly!"
"What?"
"Fly! Just hover off the ground! Rocking and waving at sea don't affect the air, so you won't have any problems moving around if you just hover."
"Hey...yeah," said Skander. "Hold on..."

Skander bent his knees slightly and pushed.

Whunk!

"Ouch!"
"Look out for the ceiling, flyboy!"
"Oh shut up! That really hurt!"

Adrian laughed, "Sorry buddy," he said. "Come on, I wanna go look at the storm."
"You boys be careful now!" said Mrs. Jones, "Adrian, make sure you keep an eye on those boys, now, won't you?"
"Yes ma'am!"

"What are you? My chaperone?" Skander asked.
"Can't I be? Might as well be, help beat off all those horny highschool girls."

Skander laughed. "I suppose, I suppose," he said. "Come on. I think if we go up to the promenade deck we can watch the storm through the windows...hey wait, where's Jason?"
"Seasick," sid Adrian. "He wants to stay in bed. Come on! Let's go check out that storm!"
143212222211121122111111111111211.title: Rough Seas.

choices: They return to their cabin.
1432122222111211221111111111112112.content:
"Where do you want to go?" Skander asked, floating through the air and still rubbing his head from where it hit the ceiling.

"The Bridge," said Adrian, "It'll be a front-row seat of the storm up there! Come on!"
"Now boys, you make sure nobody sees you now, okay?"

Adrian floated over to Skander, "Can you become invisible yet?"
"Huh?...I dunno, I never...I don't even..."

Adrian dived into Skander's body.

"Hey! Give me some warning before you...woah!"

Skander stared at the mirror and goggled at what wasn't there. He was totally invisible!

"Two in one, twice the features, four times the fun! Let's go buddy!" said Adrian. "I keep you invisible, you move us around. No come on!"

Skander teleported. He landed on the bridge-deck and headed into the wheelhouse. They could see officers and lookouts keeping an eye on the ship's speed and heading. Water splashed around and dribbled down the windscreens and the wind blew around outside.

"This is so unlike the Titanic," said Adrian, "Can you imagine what would happen if this ship went down?"
"Shuttup, you'll jinx it," Skander said.
"I'm a ghost, that's what I do."

A door behind them opened and closed. A man in his fifties came into the wheelhouse.

"What's our speed?"
"Ordinary cruising speed, sir," said the helmsman.
""We need to ride out this bloody storm! Full speed ahead!"
"Aye sir! It's not that bad, though."
"Perhaps, but I want to get out of here and on to New York before it does!"
"Yes sir! Full speed ahead!"

This last direction was shouted at another man, who started pressing buttons.

"All ahead full, sir," he shouted.

The captain nodded, "Good, good...Looks like the rain's slackening. Anything on the radar?"
"No sir. No ships, just..."

WHAM!

The ship gave a sudden jerk and threw everyone forward! Some people fell to the floor.

"WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT?" the captain shouted.
"A wave, sir?" one of the officers asked.
"That was no bloody wave! Felt like a rock or a reef or something! Where are the charts?"
"Over here, sir!" one of the men said. He opened a cabinet and ran his finger through a series of papers. He pulled out a map and handed it to the captain.

"What's our position?"

The position was given and the captain checked it on the chart.

"I don't get it..." he said, looking at the chart. "Nothing here! Another chart!"

Another, larger-scaled chart was brought. Still nothing marked.

"Must be an uncharted reef or something," said one of the officers.

"Must be," said the captain, "Go down below, and see how badly she's damaged, will you?"
"Yes sir!"

"Come on Skandyboy," said Adrian. "Let's go look."

Teleporting, both the boy and the ghost went right down below.

"I wonder what's down this far?" Skander asked.
"Just engines, I think," Adrian shouted. They had arrived. Searching around the engine-rooms, they heard the sound of water. They ran towards it. By the light of the flourescent lamps overhead, they saw the damage. A hole, perhaps twelve feet wide and eighteen long had been ripped savagely through the hull of the ship. Water was rushing in from below.

"Oh Jesus," said Skander.
"You're super-strong, can't you bend the metal back into place?" Adrian asked over the sound of the water rushing in.
"I...I don't think I can," said Skander, "All the metal's been ripped away from the outside as well as the inside, I'll only be able to close up a tiny bit! Come on, we better get up on deck!"
1432122222111211221111111111112112.title: The Rock.

choices: The boys go to the boat deck.
They go to the bridge.
14321222221112112211111111111121121.content:
"Hey mom!" Skander shouted. He opened the cabin door with Adrian walking in behind him.

"Something wrong, honey?" Melinda asked.
"You bet there's somethin' wrong," said Skander, "Dress up all warm, and where's my costume?"
"In the drawer next to your bed...wait, what...what do you need that for?"
"Our little rubber dinghy has sprung a leak," said Skander. "We hit a rock or a reef or somethin' and now we're sinking!"
"WHAT?"
"Adrian and I were in the wheelhouse, we heard everything..."

An alarm went off overhead, and the P/A system crackled into life...

"Ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen, your attention please. This is your captain speaking. We are in an emergency. The ship has struck a sunken reef. We ask that you dress warmly and make your ways to the boat-deck in an orderly fashion. Please leave your luggage in your rooms and take only your most valued possessions. Officers will commence loading and lowering of boats as soon as it is safe to do so. Thank You"

"Skander, where's my watch?" Adrian asked.
"Wh...the watch you gave me? In the drawer next to my bed."
"I'm taking it. I'm not gonna have it lost to the sea," said the ghost. And he opened the drawer and took out the watch. He stuffed it into his ghostly coat and then threw Skander his "Stryker" costume. The boy tugged it on.

"Come on," said Skander, "We better get Jason up..."
"I told you he's seasick..."
"Hang the seasickness! I'm going to wake him up! Mom, you better get to the boat-deck," said Skander, "Come on Adrian".

The two boys entered the cabin across the corridor to find Jason's parents putting on clothes and filling their pockets with valuables.

"Mr. and Mrs. Lancet, you go up on deck with my mom," said Skander, "Where's Jason?"
"In the next cabin," said Mrs. Lancet, "You be careful, Skander."
"I'm fine," said Skander.

Someone knocked at the door. Mr. Lancet opened it.

"Skander!?"

It was Stacy.

"Hey Stace," said Skander. "What's up?"
"Skander I'm scared. Mom and dad have gone up onto the boat-deck, my brother's gone with them. Me and Tina..." she looked to her friend, who had just showed up"...we don't know what to do..."

"All ladies into the lifeboats," asid Mr. Lancet, "Come along!"

He herded the two girls out of the room. "Come on, I'll look after you! You two," he said, turning to Skander and Adrian, "Get that son of mine out of bed!"
"Yes sir," said Adrian. He floated through the wall to the other room.
"Wake up, Chuck-Up," he said.
"Leave me alone..."
"To drown? I don't think so, Jason, get up!"
"I'm sick!"
"The ship is bloody sinking!"
"But..."

CRASH! WHUNK!

Jason yelped in surprise as Skander grabbed his bed and tipped it over, spilling him onto the floor.

"Get into your costume and fly!" Skander said, "It'll combat the seasickness. We got work to do, boy!"
14321222221112112211111111111121121.title: Action Stations.

choices: Evacuations continue...
143212222211121122111111111111211211.content:
"Come on," said Skander, "Let's get up to the boat-deck!"

He tugged on his mask and threw Jason his own. Together, they teleported upwards through the ship, landing on the boat-deck. The captain was there, directing passengers to the boats.

"One more over here!" an officer shouted. He helped a lady and her husband into a boat. "Right! Lower away!"

Turning on the motorised winches, the lifeboat was lowered into the water.

"Good!" the captain shouted, "The next one! Come on! Families, women, children, into the boats!...Easy now!"

"Good morning, captain!" Skander shouted.

The captain jumped and turned around. "Weeeell!" he said, "I know you! You're that Stryker kid, aren't you?"
"Yes sir!"
"We could use you...yeah..."
"Happy to do whatever I can, sir. Me and my friends, of course."
"Of course, of course...The seas are still fairly rough. None of the boats are in danger of being swamped, but I am worried about them being swept apart from each other and getting lost! They need to be tied together!"
"I'll do it!" said Adrian. "Water doesn't bother me!"

Melinda rushed up to them, "You be careful now," she said.
"Women and children first," said Adrian. "Hop in," he said, and pointed to a lifeboat. "And take this with you; put it in your handbag".

He handed her his watch which he'd gifted to Skander. "Don't want it to get wet! Well!...Allay-youp!"

The ghost jumped off the side of the ship into the water. People gasped.

"Where'd he go!?" someone shouted.
"Don't worry about him, guys," said Skander, "The Shadow knows what he's doing! Cap'n, we better get more of these boats loaded!"
143212222211121122111111111111211211.title: The boys go to the boat deck.

choices: Sliding off towards New York City.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111.content:
"But I'm scared!" said a lady when an officer asked her to step into the lifeboat in front of her.
"Ma'am, this is the last lifeboat!" the officer shouted, "If you don't get this one, there won't be another!"
"But I'm..." the woman spluttered.

Skander stepped up. "Hey don't worry lady..." he grabbed her and lifted her easily. "Close your eyes now."

Slowly, Skander stepped into the boat and sat her down, "There you go! Keep your hands inside the boat, now!"
"Thank you, Stryker," said the officer. "Where's your friend Blade?"
"Other side of the ship, throwing flotation-devices over the side," said Skander.

The ship lurched suddenly, and everyone was thrown to the side.

"What was that!?" someone shouted.

"It's the weight of the ship and water!" the officer shouted, "It's forcing itself down on that rock below us! Come on people, into the boats! Women, children, this way, please. Careful now, watch out for the list."

With everything under control at the boat-deck, Skander and Jason ran and teleported around the ship to try and see what else they could do. Pumps had opened up and they were busy churning out as much water as they could, but it still wasn't fast enough.

"What the hell are we going to do!?" Jason shouted. Skander turned to his friend, "This ship's getting more and more unstable, it's gonna tip over before help gets here! I'm going underneath it to keep it stable!"
"WHAT!?"
"YOU HEARD ME!"
"But you never LIFTED something like this before!"
"Well I'm feeling a little stronger since I tried to land a jumbo-jet," said Skander, "Hopefully it's enough!"

Skander vanished. He had teleported himself underwater. He found he could breathe perfectly fine here, despite being surrounded by wet. He grabbed the slippery hull of the ocean-liner and pushed.

To his surprise, the ship moved almost at once! It was like carrying a pillow! Grabbing the ship as firmly as he could, Skander pushed! The ship rose off the rock. Skander stood on the rock. It was just out of the water at its highest point. Skander continued to push and lift. People in the lifeboats screamed and pointed.

Adrian, splashing around in the water, tying together lifelines on the boats, turned around to see a blonde muscle-teen in what looked like a black and red wetsuit, lifting the ocean-liner on his shoulder like an empty laundry-basket! Carefully, Skander took a step forward. The water splashed, but his footing remained firm. Slowly, he started walking. Water rushed and gurgled out of the hole at the bottom of the ship. Adrian watched as it hit the water and solidified into a road of ice! Skander kept walking, slipping, sliding...then he had an idea. Bending forwards a bit, he started skating and sliding across the ice, like what a child might do with slippery woollen socks on a freshly-polished floor! This was cool! This was easy, this was fun!

Jason appeared beside Skander. "What do you want me to do!?" he shouted.
"Get the lifeboats, you and Adrian. Tie them all together and follow me!" Skander shouted. "Next stop, Lower Manhattan!"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111.title: Need A Lift?

choices: The boys tour New York City.
One week later - an awards ceremony!
14321222221112112211111111111121121111.content:
The trip to New York was fast. Sliding and skating and slipping over the ice, Skander was actually enjoying it. Adrian and Jason swam alongside him at top speed, pulling the flotilla of lifeboats along behind them. As if nothing had gone wrong, life onboard ship resumed. Occasionally, people came down below to examine the hole in the ship's hull, and to stick their heads out and wave at Skander underneath the ship.

A forghorn sounded, a bell rang.

Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking, welcome to New York City! Please proceed to your cabins and ensure that your valuables and luggage are secured for exiting the vessel. Thank you"

"Ahoy there young Skander!" the captain shouted a few minutes later, sticking his head out the hole at the bottom of the ship, "Good work! Listen, when we reach the harbour, I want you to put the ship in the drydock! It should be somewhere to your right, a big, open place with sluice-gates!"

Skander nodded. He kept on sliding along the ice. Then he saw it ahead of them. Manhattan island! He slid into the harbour. All around the shoreline and on boats and ships, people waved and screamed and fired smoke-rockets. The crowd gasped as the muscle-teen soared into the air, holding the ship easily on his shoulders. Carefully, he lowered himself down into the drydock and let the ship down as carefully as he could on the cradles behind the closed sluice-gates. He climbed out and jumped onto the jetty. Officers started opening doors and policemen, paramedics and dock-workers ran forwards with gangplanks and stretchers to help people off the ship. Out in the harbour, Jason and Adrian pulled their lifeboats up to empty jetties and tied the ropes off. More people showed up with ladders to throw over the sides of the jetties. People started climbing up, glad to be on dry land again. Jason shook the water off his body and went to find Skander.

"Who ever thought that the dead would come to the aid of the living, huh?" one lady said to another as they watched Adrian helping people out of the boats onto the jetty. They stared at Adrian, impeccably neat and handsome in his suit and neatly combed, brown hair.

"Hey boys!"

Skander, Jason and Adrian, who had gathered around the saved ocean-liner, turned around to see Mike the journalist, with a camera. "Come on! Group-photo! Group photo! Where's the captain!?"

Adrian stood in the middle, with Skander on one side and Jason on the other. Behind them was the captain, and all around them, were the ship's officers. Behind the group was the massive structure of the ocean-liner Skander had so easily saved from the ocean's depths.

Cameras flashed as they took their photos.

"This is great," said Adrian, smiling at his friends.
"Do ghosts show up in photographs?" Skander asked.
"We can when we want to," said Adrian, he smiled.
14321222221112112211111111111121121111.title: Sliding into Harbour.

choices: At the Awards Ceremony.
Dinner in the hotel afterwards.
143212222211121122111111111111211211112.content:
"Oh congratulations, honey!" said Melinda, giving her son a hug. Mr. Lancet gave Jason a shake of the hand. "I'm proud of you, kid," he said.
"Thanks dad," said Jason. He turned to Skander, and grinned.

Melinda had just put down the phone in their hotel-rooms in New York's 'Plaza' hotel, the mayor wanted to present all three boys medals for bravery and acts of heroism.

"I don't know how much more of this I can take," said Jason. He pointed to the newspapers on the coffee-table beside them. From every single front page, they could see the photograph that Michael had taken of them down at the docks a week before when they brought the famous Queen Mary Two and her passengers safely into harbour.

"Hey, you're famous now, son!" said Mr. Lancet, "This evening, you'll be at the awards ceremony!...Dress up good, now".

"We better start dressing now, then" said Melinda, "Skander, you can put on your suit," she turned to Mr. and Mrs. Lancet, "If you don't mind...?" she asked, pointing towards the door.
"Not at all, Melinda," said Mrs. Lancet, "We'll leave you in peace with the boys!"

Melinda fussed over Jason and Skander while Mr. and Mrs. Lancet went to their own room to change into something more appropriate for an awards-giving. Skander tugged on his coat and Adrian put his watch back onto Skander's waistcoat and the ring back onto Jason's right pinkie-finger. Melinda tugged and tousled their hair, trying to get it to stay just right.

"And honey, do something about that hair of yours," said Melinda, rubbing Skander's face and feeling his stubble.
"What? I like my stubble," said Skander, running a hand around his chin, "It feels good. Makes me look sexy".
"Honey, we're going to an awards ceremony, not a frat-party," she said, "I want you to look PRESENTABLE! Now unfortunately, we don't have a razor..."
"I'll sort it out," said Adrian. "You leave it to me, come on, boys, into the bathroom!"

Melinda laughed as Adrian herded the two teens into the bathroom. He slammed the door and locked it after him.

"Wait here, I'll be right back!" he said.

"Now where's he gone?" Jason asked.
"No idea," said Skander. He sat down on a chair inside the bathroom while Jason sat on the edge of the bath. A few seconds later, and Adrian reappeared in the bathroom, holding a towel.

"Okay, who's first?" he asked.
"Um...I'll do it," said Jason.

"Good!" said Adrian. "Skander, move!"

Skander got off the chair and pushed it up against the sink. Jason sat in the chair and leaned his head back against the edge of the sink. Adrian whistled while he opened the towel he had with him. He pulled out a brush and a jar and a small bowl.

"What's all that stuff?" Skander asked.
"I borrowed it from the hotel barbershop," said Adrian. He was lathering up the shaving-soap now. "Hold still, Jason, and try not to move..." he said, and started lathering up Jason's face with the shaving-brush.

"Now..." said the ghost, putting the brush, bowl and cream aside. "Time for a nice...neat...close...shaaaave!"

The ghost picked something up wth his left hand. For a moment, Skander thought it was a comb, but the ghost flipped the contraption open to reveal a long, sharp blade.

"Woah...what the hell is that? A machete?" he asked.
"This, young man, is called a straight-razor," said Adrian, holding it in his hands and melting into the sink behind Jason. "It's what I used to use to shave with".
"What did you...?" Jason asked. Then he saw the blade.
"WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING!?" he screamed, jerking upwards in shock. "Get that thing awaaaaay from me!"
"Jason, don't make this harder than it has to be," said Adrian, "I know how to use one of these things, don't freak out."
"Freak out!? I'll show you freaked out if you bring that hatchet near me!"
"I don't have TIME for this!" the ghost snapped. He dived into Jason's body. Jason's left hand held the razor. Standing in front of the mirror, Adrian started moving Jason's hands, stretching the skin and scraping delicately and methodically with the razor.

"Damn that looks scary..." said Skander, watching Adrian work.
"It's not, really," said Adrian, "It's actually kinda fun, shaving like this".

Jason was whimpering, his face trembling.

"Stop moving you big wuss!" said Adrian, "What are you scared about? I ain't gonna cut yah!...Skander, lather yourself up, I'm nearly done here".

Skander picked up the bowl and started spreading lather over his face, as he'd seen Adrian do. It felt sorta weird. Soft and cool and smooth. When he was done, the entire bottom half of his face was smothered in cream.

Adrian popped out of Jason's body. "All done!" he said. Jason didn't move.

"I said, all done!" said the ghost.

Jason still refused to move.

"What are you, deaf? I said MOVE IT!"

Slowly, Jason looked up, he looked terrified!

"K...k...k-keep that...that thing away from me, you psycho!"

Adrian looked at the razor, which he'd just finished cleaning on a towel. "Oh relax," he said, "Now move!"

Jason got off the chair and Skander replaced him. Jason felt his chin and face. So smooth...

"Softie," said Adrian, "Now Skander," he said, waving the lethally-sharp razor in front of his friend's eyes, "You gonna squirm around like Jason there, or you gonna be a good little boy?"
"I'll be good," said Skander.
"Excellent...chin up, mouth closed, don't move".

Skander felt Adrian get to work. The blade was cold, metallic and VERY sharp. Skander was nervous. He knew he couldn't be cut or sliced or stabbed, but he still felt nervous. He'd never had anyone try to shave him with what amounted to a miniature hunting-knife before. Despite the fear, it actually felt kinda good. Adrian shaved away, pulling, stretching, scraping and wiping, whistling as he worked. When he was done, he patted Skander on the cheek, "Get up big man, all finished!"

Skander didn't move.

"I said get up!"

Still no movement.

"Something wrong?" Jason asked, walking over, carefully.

"I..." Adrian examined Skander carefully. "He's asleep!...I SAID WAKE UP YOU BIG LUMP!"

Skander jerked suddenly awake, the chair slipped and he crashed to the ground in a heap.

"There!" said Adrian, cleaning the razor and folding it up. "I'm gonna take this stuff back to the barbershop, I'll see you guys later".
143212222211121122111111111111211211112.title: Razor Sharp.

choices: More fiery fun!
They go for a nighttime walk around Manhattan after dinner.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"My hero!" said Stacy, giving Skander a kiss. She tugged at the medal around his neck. "Let me see it!"

Skander lifted it up and handed it to her, Jason took off his medal and gave it to Tina. The two girls goggled at it.

"They're so pretty!" said Stacy. "You're both so brave," she said.

The families were sitting in one of the restaurants inside the Plaza Hotel, having dinner after the ceremony. Mr. Lancet was talking to Adrian about the Second World War while Mrs. Lancet and Stacy's parents chatted to Melinda.

"I can't believe it," said Marsden, Stacy's brother, sitting down next to Skander, "I know a SUPERHERO! This is so cool!"
"Thanks," said Skander, as he put the medal into his pocket.

"...Europe would never have won without American intervention," said Adrian to Mr. Lancet, "It was impossible. The war was too big for England alone..."

A waiter appeared next to their table with the first course; soup. He lifted the bowls carefully off the trolley and put them on the table and put down two large baskets of bread. Skander sipped his soup and made a face.

"Something wrong, honey?" Melinda asked.
"I...just a bit...hot," said Skander. He started blowing on it carefully. Puff, puff, puff...

FWHOOOOOMP!

The table shook and a wine-glass fell over. Melinda ducked to catch it and put it back on the table.

"Woah!" Skander gasped. The front of his hairdo was singed and smokey!

"What did you DO?" Stacy's mother cried out.

"I...I don't know!" said Skander, "I was just blowing on my soup."

He tried again. A miniature fireball shot out of his mouth into his soup, warming it up.

"Woah cool!" said Jason, "Let me try."

Rasping his throat a bit, Jason let out a sort of gravelly blowing noise. Flames shot out into his bowl!

"Awww duuuude!" he said, "That is too awesome!"

"Hey, try the candles!" said Stacy, pointing to the tall, white shafts of wax on the table. Skander blew, thinking of fire. the flames shot out his mouth, racing through the air and lighting up the wicks on the top of the candles. Everyone on the table clapped.

"Now you two really ARE the hottest guys in the world," said Tina, giggling and giving Jason a kiss. "And still cute!"

"Listen dragon-breath, how about you stop showing off and do something constructive?" said Adrian, he threw the two baskets of bread in Skander and Jason's directions, "Toast the bread for us!"

Skander grinned and speared a roll on the end of a fork, "Sure thing, buddy", he said.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: I Don't Want To Set the World On Fire

choices: On the train home, a week later...
The next morning in Manhattan...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Skander split the rolls of bread into slices and passed them to Jason, who blew on them, turning each one a toasty brown, which was then passed around the table. The waiters and other diners watched this performance with shock and amazement. Two, incredibly handsome teenagers and their equally hot girls and their parents, watching the boys spit fire out of their mouths just as easily as sticking out their tongues. When they'd finished, Skander stood up and took a deep breath. He blew, hard!

A fireball shot out of his mouth and people ducked! It filled the entire room and turned everything a dazzling, yellow-golden colour. The fireball was hot and very bright. Eventually, it went out. The crowd clapped and cheered and Skander bowed.

"Stryker?"

A boy about ten came scuttling over. He was holding a pen and a laminated photograph. It was the one taken of him and Jason and the crew of the ship after they saved it. "Mommy and I were on the boat when you picked it up," the boy said, "Can you sign it for me?"

The boy turned it over, to show a smooth, paper area where Skander could sign.

"Sure," said Skander, "What's your name?"
"Julian".

Skander tapped the biro on the back of the photo...

"To Julian & Family, From..."

And under this, he signed "Stryker". He passed the photo to Jason, who signed "Blade", and finally, to Adrian. The ghost passed on the biro.

"I hate those pens," the ghost said. He opened his coat and pulled out a dazzling antique hard rubber fountain pen with beautiful, sparkling gold overlay. he uncapped the pen, tapped it and wrote in wide, flourishing letters, "The Shadow". He blotted the signature and handed it back to the kid.

"There you go, kid," he said. He capped his pen and put it back inside his coat.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Fireballs and Photographs.

choices: At school a few days later...
Something happens on the way home...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Adrian helped Melinda pack. The train they had been travelling on from New York all the way back to the West Coast would be at their station in a few hours' time.

"I don't understand why you're coming with us," said Melinda, as she closed a suitcase and put it with the rest of their luggage. "You could just as easily disappear back home".
"I could," said the ghost, "But it's nice to be around PEOPLE again, you know? There's only so many conversations you can have with an empty chair where some dead family-member used to always sit."
"I suppose so," said Melinda. "Come on, it's time for lunch".

Adrian wafted over to the door of the compartment and slid it open.

"Ma'am", he said.
"What a gentleman," she said, smiling sweetly at him.
"Father always insisted on proper manners," said Adrian. "Come along!"

The train rocked and swayed and Melinda strolled along, quite balanced. She reached the dining-car where most of the others were sitting.

"Oh you finished packing?" asked Mr. Lancet, "I was about to send my wife to help you".
"I'm fine, thank you," said Melinda. She sat down next to Skander, who was sitting next to Jason.

"...The spaghetti carbonara..." said the waiter, putting a plate in front of Skander, "The bolognaise..." he added, putting another plate in front of Jason. "And for the lady, the spaghetti marinara".
"You didn't have to order for me," said Melinda.

Skander smiled, "I knew you were busy", he said.
"Awww, sweetheart".

She kissed him.

"Mom! Not in public!"

Stacy and Tina sat opposite the three of them, with Stacy's brother, Marsden.

"Hey Skandy, gimme the salt," said Marsden.
"PLEASE!" Adrian hissed in Marsden's ear. "Kids these days, honestly..."
"Uh...please," said Marsden.

Skander levitated the salt-shaker across the table. Melinda shot a disapproving look at her son.

"What?" he asked.
"Not in public, darling," she said. "And definitely not at the table".
"Sorry mah".

"How are you enjoying your meals, everyone?" asked the Maitre D'.

"Very nice," said Mrs. Lancet. Other passengers shouted compliments and words of approval.

"Excellent...the train will be arriving at our next destination in about three hours' time. I hope that you will enjoy your dinner. And please check your compartments for any items of yours before you leave. Thank you".

They kept on eating.

"Man, I can't wait to get home," said Skander. Jason nodded. "It'll be nice".
"Give us your addresses," said Stacy. She handed Skander a notepad and pen. Skander wrote down his contact-details and passed the notepad to Jason, who wrote down his.

"Don't worry, we can meet in school anyway," said Jason. "Kinda weird how small the world is...I had no idea we went to the same school".

Stacy shrugged at the coincidence. They kept eating. Adrian tugged out his watch and looked at the dial. He made a face of disgust.

"What is it?" Skander asked.
"We're late," said the ghost, "We won't make it to San Diego in three hours...Huh!...In my day, trains ran on-time!" he said, tapping his watch irritably. He wound it up and put it back into his pocket.

The train arrived fifteen minutes late, but everyone was just glad to be home. Skander loaded up the trolleys with luggage and pushed them easily towards the roadside, where he helped the cabdrivers load the stuff into the trunks of their cars. They all hopped in and drove home...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: There and Back Again.

choices: The boys head off to class.
The crowd notices the three teens for real, and crowds around them!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Some people are born celebrities. Some aspire to celebrities. Some are sudden celebrities. Skander and Jason found themselves in this last category. They had no idea that, in the time it took them to get back to California by train, just how far afield their legend had spread. Skander had typed "Trident Force" into Google one afternoon and found at least half a dozen fansites or forums that had been created in a matter of hours after their heroic rescue of the ocean-liner. There were photographs and videos pasted, posted, uploaded and shared all over the electronic cyberspace. Skander flipped through discussion-threads, blogs, vlogs and opinion-polls, everything from "What powers will they have next?" to "Who's Hotter?" Some of the posts really made him smile.

Skander decided it was pretty hard for him and Jason to hide who they really were from the world now, but they dressed as normally and casually as they could, to blend in as best as possible with the population, sporting white T-shirts, jeans, sneakers and zip-up jackets so that they looked like most other teenagers their age. Skander did up his hair in the usual way and, with Jason and Adrian, they teleported off to school.

Even though they were early, they were not prepared for what they saw once they got there. The school corridors were crowded with boys and girls ranging from thirteen up to eighteen. They were huddled in groups all over the place, staring at...something.

"What is it?" Skander asked, looking at Adrian. The ghost, in his invisible form, floated up towards the ceiling. His face broke into a grin. "It's your poster!" he said.
"Poster?" Jason asked, "We didn't do any posters...did we?" he asked, looking at Skander.

The crowd thinned a bit and Skander stepped forward. He gasped.

The poster was about three or four feet long and about two feet wide and it was pasted up above a drinking-fountain between two blocks of book-lockers. It was bright blue near the top, descending to navy blue and then black at the bottom. Standing in the middle of the poster was an illustration of a young man with dark brown hair, wearing an old-fashioned suit and black shoes. One leg was straight, the other was bent at the knee, because his left foot was on tip-toe, with the heel of the shoe resting on the inner ankle of the right foot. Either side of the man was a teenaged boy, wearing a black lycra costume with red gloves and red boots. Two yellow, vaguely "S"-shaped lightning-bolts were slashed across the chest of one of the boys, and two crossed daggers were emblazoned across the chest of the other boy. Skander stared up and recognised each of their faces at once. He looked up a bit further to see, in big red letters:

"TRIDENT FORCE"


And underneath it:

"Everyone's Favourite Super-Teens"


Skander grinned. He looked down a bit more. Above each of their heads were their names and short descriptions:

"STRYKER"

"Strong, blonde and dashingly handsome, Stryker is the muscles of the group, willing take on the humanly impossible for the protection and salvation of Mankind. His strength knows no bounds and his heart no limit of incredible courage and fearlessness in the face of adversity. Known for his godlike and incredible features and handsome appearance, he's as dangerous as he is fun to look at. Stryker holds the lion's share of Trident Force's powers, which are all at once numerous, fantastic, deadly and awe-inspiring. His constant experimentation and discovery of new powers means that Trident Force will continue to grow more and more powerful, to allow them overall to provide greater service and aid to the people of earth, be it from criminals and crimes, or to major world-disasters."

"THE BLADE"

"Firm but kind, The Blade is as keen and sharp as his name implies, able to detect and combat evil, danger and threats to society with ease. Known for his dark, handsome features and firm, bulky frame, the Blade works to preserve peace and harmony and to save people in distress. More vocal than Stryker, Blade has provided the press and the public with plenty of details regarding their incredible missions and services to mankind.

"THE SHADOW".

"The one who sees all but who himself is almost never seen, The Shadow is the mystical and mysterious member of this trio of heroes. Preferring to keep to himself and to work in the background of the group's operations, he is nonetheless a valuable and fascinating addition to the team. Many believe him to be truly supernatural or spiritual in being. While this has been rebuffed by paranormal skeptics, it is hard to deny the facts. Those lucky enough to meet the elusive third member have described him as handsome, tall, well-dressed and with a classic, old-world charm. A gentleman with manners, ethics, morals and above all, a desire to aid those whom he finds.


Together, they are Trident Force, a group of teenage wonders who have dedicated their lives, young as they are, to the assistance, protection and wellbeing of mankind. Always everywhere and always on alert.


Skander grinned. This was awesome. This was COOL! He kept staring at the poster. The artist really drew them up great, he thought. A girl screamed and pointed. Everyone stared.

A white-out pen was hovering in mid-air in front of the poster. It pressed its tip against the bottom of the poster, just underneath Adrian's portrait. The group of excited teens watched as the pen flashed across the paper, leaving a trail of white paint behind. 'The Shadow'.

"Always wanted to sign something with my face on it," said Adrian, whispering in Skander's ear. Skander grinned.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Celebrity Status.

choices: During class, the boys are bombarded with questions.
During lunchtime, the boys are mobbed and asked dozens of questions.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
The boys and girls stared at the floating white-out marker and at the shiny, glimmering words 'The Shadow', written underneath The Shadow's picture, in loopy, old-fashioned writing. The marker hovered a bit more and dropped onto the floor. One of the girls bent down to pick it up.

"What WAS that?" one of the boys said, loudly.
"I bet it was a ghost," said one of the girls, grinning.
"Maybe it was THE ghost?" said a redhead, pointing up at Adrian's portrait, "Perhaps it was HIM?"

They all looked at each other and laughed...and yet...why not?

"Hey guys," said Skander, sticking his head through the crowd to the front where he could see the poster clearly for the first time. Everyone smiled and grinned at him.
"Skander, my man," said Lance, one of Skander's friends; his voice faltered. "What...happened to you?"
"What about me?" Skander asked.
"Dude...you're buffed!...Like...majorly! Have you been working out or something?"
"Sorta..." said Skander, "A...a bit of um...weight-lifiting".

The girls oogled at his arms and chest and drooled from lust. Boys oogled and drooled from jealousy.

"Yeah?" said Lance, "Duuuuude...You are a freakin' TANK!"

Jason pushed his way through the crowd, "Hey guys, what's going on here?" he asked.
"Just checkin' out Skander's new build, J-man," said Lance, "And...holy crap what have you been eating!?"
"What?" said Jason, feeling his face for pimples or zits.
"WHAT!? Look at you guys! You're totally ripped!"
Skander laughed, "I dunno, are we? What do you think Jase?"
Jason shrugged a broad, firm shoulder. "I dunno...I don't feel any different".

"You know," said one of the girls, "You look a LOT like those guys in the poster", she indicated the "TRIDENT FORCE" poster above their heads. Skander looked up and grinned, "Yeah I suppose...that's what everyone's been saying," he replied.

"Are you?" one of the boys asked. Jason and Skander's heads snapped around to face him, "WHAT?" they both said.

Another boy stared up at the poster, then turned to look at Skander and Jason...then back up at the poster...then at the two huge teens in front of him. His mouth opened in slack-jawed amazement.
"No...No freakin' way..." the boy mouthed.
"What?" everyone shouted, turning to him.
"IT IS THEM! LOOK!" he shouted. He pushed Skander and Jason aganst the wall, underneath their respective, artistic selves. "Look!"
The crowd gasped. Jason laughed and Skander grinned.

"God..." said Skander. "...I...Hah!...I...I guess the...the game's up then, huh Blade?"

"Oh...mygod!" said one of the girls, "It IS them! Woah this is like...woah..."
"No way..." said Lance, staring at his two friends, and then up at the poster, "No...waaaaaaaay!..."; but he could see that it was true. He stood there in shocked silence for a minute. And then...
"Wait a minute!" he said, "Where's the other dude? I thought there was three of you?"

Skander stared at Lance. Lance wasn't quite as tall as Skander, but he was well-built and tough. He didn't look like the kinda teenager who was easily scared. He had a rich, dark tan from working-out outside in the sun and his once brown hair had been leeched of its colour so much that it was a sort of brown-blonde mix now.

"This is a joke!" said one of the other guys, "They can't be Stryker and Blade! It's too much of a coincidence! What, they just HAPPEN to go to the SAME SCHOOL as we do? Hah! Yeah right. And if they really ARE here, where's the other dude!?"

"Muahahahahahahahaha!!!..."

The laugh was loud, deafening! CHILLING! Everyone flinched and trembled and stared around, trying to locate the source of the laugh. It sounded totally badass and wicked. The classic evil mastermind cackle.

"What was that!?" the boy stammered.

"...Who knows what evil, lurks in the hearts of men?...Muahahahaha...THE SHADOW KNOWS! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!"

"Jesus they are real!" one of the boys said, he was panicking now. Someone shouted and pointed, the crowd, whose collective heads had been swivelling all over the place like lighthouse lamps, snapped back to the poster that they had originally come to see.

"Look!" one of the girls shouted, "Up there! The poster's moving!"
"It can't be moving, it's glued to the freakin' wall!" said the boy beside her.
"But look!"

The crowd of teenagers stared up. The figure in the middle of the poster looked a bit more solid and lifelike. Suddenly, everyone screamed!

Adrian stepped calmly out of the poster just as calmly as if he was entering another room in his own house. He hopped down onto the floor and stood himself squarely between his two incredible friends.

"Oh...My...GOD!" one of the girls whispered. "IT IS THEM!"

A loud jangling echoed around the room. It was time for class...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Truth is Stranger than Fiction.

choices: The boys agree.
Perhaps another time...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
After the huge exposure around the poster, Skander, Jason and, to a lesser extent, Adrian, became fullblown schoolyard celebrities. Everywhere Skander and Jason went, they were mugged by dozens of students, begging for photographs, auotographs, inscriptions and...in the case of the girls, a chance for a fondle. Skander finished his in-class English-paper and signed his name down the bottom.

Skander Kenneth Jones.

He read it over and folded it up.

"You misspelt 'Nevada'", Adrian whispered in his ear, "One 'E', two 'A's".

Skander opened his paper, rewrote the word, folded up his work again and handed it in to the teacher.

"Good work, Skander," said his English teacher, "You can leave for lunch early".

"Thank you, sir," said Skander. He picked up his books and headed out of the classroom. Jason, who had finished before him, was sitting in the cafeteria, waiting for lunch to start officially. Both boys were hungry and excited, filled with the thrill of being celebrities. And their schoolfriends, in fact, everyone in school, was thrilled at the thought of two teenage gods walking among them.

The bell rang. At once, the school burst into life and boys and girls ran this way and that, throwing open lockers, shoving in books and then stampeding towards the cafeteria. Skander and Jason were sitting in the middle of the room at a table for eight people. Lance saw them first, and raced over.

"Maaaan!" he said, sitting down next to Skander, "This is so cool! I can't believe I know a CELEBRITY!"

Skander grinned, "No I'm not..."
"DUDE YOU COULD WHUP MY ASS AND SAVE IT AT THE SAME FRIGGIN' TIME!"

Skander laughed, "Yeah probably...go get your lunch man, I'll watch your seat".

Lance raced over to the serving-line and came sprinting back a few minutes later. The table was jammed with twice the usual number of students, who all wanted to meet their local superheroes. The food they had taken from the serving-area lay largely forgotten on their trays while they fired questions at the two boys like verbal machine-guns.

"How much can you lift?"
"Can you really set things on fire by looking at them?"
"That ghost dude can fly, what about you?"
"Can you turn invisible?"
"How fast can you run?"
"Can you throw me into the AIR?"
"How strong are you!?"

"Guys!" said Jason, holding up his hands, "Please! One at a time, one at a time!...Okay..."

There was, perhaps, five seconds' pause, and then...

"...Can you really shoot pulse-beams from your hands?"
"Can you breathe fire?"
"Do you have X-ray vision?"
"Can you really make things float!?"

Skander leaned back, took a deep breath and blew.

A massive fireball shot up into the air and everyone yelped in fright.

"PLEASE!" he shouted, "ONE...AT...A...TIME!...Yes, we can breathe fire, yes we can make things levitate, and yes, we can fly like that 'ghost-dude'. And make sure he never hears you say that, he hates it when people call him that".

"Show us what you can do!" one of the girls said. "Everything!"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Out of the Frying Pan, into the Fire.

choices: Lunchtime's over, time for more classes.
Lunchtime's over...sport-class!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Skander cleared his throat. He knew he wasn't going to get them all cleared away, so he decided to cooperate.

"Everything?" he asked.

"EVERYTHING!" the crowd shouted back.

"Okay," said Skander, "But we better do this outside".

Heading out to one of the open basketball courts, the crowd gathered for the "performance". Skander grabbed Jason and held him up easily in one hand. He threw him into the air. Jason screamed and whooped as he shot upwards. The crowd watched him fly up into the sky, then come down again. An inch from the ground, he did a barrel-roll and shot up again. Firing plasma beams from his hands, he destroyed a rubbish-bin landed again. The boys uprooted trees and replanted them, they snapped steel bars like toothpicks, stayed underwater in the school swimming-pool, to demonstrate breathing under water, and then walking ON water.

"Hey, where's that ghost-dude?" Lance asked as the girls crowded around Skander's body, eager to dry him off with towels.

"I have a name," said Adrian, strolling down the stairs into the pool-area. The crowd trembled. This dude was freaky. They watched him. Adrian winked...blinked...nodded...and vanished!

"Where'd I go?" a voice echoed around the room, "where'd I go and where'd I hide? Look up here for a neat surprise!"

The crowd stared up to see him sitting on a cross-bracing beam holding up the ceiling. The ghost jumped down again, flying through the air.

"How do you do that echo-voice thing?" one of the boys asked.

"Voice projection?" Adrian asked, "It's a vocal skill. Something singers used to do back in the old days before microphones...I just made it a bit..." he cleared his throat, "stronger!" and the last word echoed around the room.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Roll up and Be Amazed.

choices: At the Police Station with Commissioner Weston.
Something else turns up...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Weeell..." said Skander. He looked at his meal. "I really DID come here to eat LUNCH...perhaps another time".
"Awww, come on Skander! Jason, say something!"
"Guys," said Jason, "We're both really worn out from all the other stuff we've had to do, we'll show you our powers another..."

Jason's cellphone rang. He pulled it out of his pocket and flipped it open.

"Hello?" he said, putting it to the side of his face.
"Hello, Blade".
"Who is this?" Jason asked.
"Who is this? You don't recognise me? Tch-tch-tch...It's Commissioner Weston here. I require your services and that of your friends...eh...as soon as possible".
"Eh...how soon?" said Jason. "I'm...kinda...in school now?"
"This is pretty urgent, Blade," said Weston, "We've got a kidnapping, and well...we...need help. We've recieved a ransom-note from the kidnappers, but no location where they are, where to drop off the money or anything".
"Alright alright," said Jason. He threw the phone to Skander.

"Hello?" Skander said.
"Good afternoon Stryker," said Weston. "Remember me?"
"Oh sure," said Skander, "What's up?"
"I need your help. If you can spare it, as soon as possible. TODAY".
"Yes sir. We'll be...we'll be eh..."
"...At the police-station?"
"Eh...yeah...in um..." Skander checked the time on Jason's phone, "...fifteen minutes".

"Good. I hope I can count on you guys," said Weston. "I didn't give you a police radio as a gift for nothing, you know".
"Sure Commissioner," said Skander. He hung up.

"Well?" Jason asked.
"Let's just say we have an excuse to get out of showing off our powers to a group of horny schoolgirls for the day," said Skander, handing Jason his phone back. "Come on".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Saved by the Bell.

choices: More information comes in!
The boys go hunting...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Vanishing from the boy's bathroom, Skander, Jason and Adrian showed up in the police-station fifteen minutes later, having first gone home to put on their costumes underneath their regular clothes. They strolled into the commissioner's office and sat down...or, in Adrian's case, hovered in the air.

"Ah you made it, gentlemen," said Weston. "I'll make this as brief as I can, the son of a hotel tycoon has been kidnapped".
"Oh?" said Adrian. He lit a cigarette and started smoking. "What's his name?"
"Jasper Horowitz," said Weston, "He's the son of..."
"Mr. Arthur Horowitz, owner of Horowitz Hotels," said Adrian. "I know who he is. Wealthy type. Old money. Been in business since my time. What about young Jasper?"
"Weeell..." said the commissioner, getting up from his desk, "He's been kidnapped, like I said. We have recieved a ransom-note and frankly, it's...not good".
"How old is Jasper?" Skander asked.
"Eighteen," said Weston. "Popular, well-liked, attractive. He's an athlete and a good student in university. Hopes to carry on the family business when he grows up. Steady boy. Likes to splash his cash around a bit too freely. So these goons nabbed him, figured if they squeezed him enough, the old man would start splashing some cash to bail the kid out".
"And?" Jason asked.
"Well there's the problem," said Weston, "We don't know where to send it to. They've asked for..." the commissioner picked up a piece of paper on his desk, "...Ten million dollars".

Skander swore. Weston looked at him.

"Sorry," said Skander. "HOW MUCH?"

Weston repeated the number. "They say if the money isn't paid by the end of the week, they'll kill the boy. Torture him. I don't know if they really mean it, but that note was sent two days ago, and we don't know what condition Jasper is in...OR, where to deliver the money. And I don't wanna wait for another letter because God knows what condition that kid'll be in when we DO find him! We need to find him now..."

Skander, listening patiently to the commissioner's 'debriefing', started finding it increasingly boring. He sat back in his chair and started staring around the room. First at the desk, tables, chair, filing-cabinet, then at the water-cooler. He kept staring at the cooler, looking at the water gurgling and sloshing and bubbling inside it. He blinked and rubbed his eyes...He turned back around to look elsewhere in the room. He blinked again. He saw something. What?

He turned back to the desk and looked at it. There was something wierd about it. It was like Skander was looking through a dirty window. He could see vaguely through the wood! He strained his eyes, rubbed them, wiped them...he opened them again.

Now he could stare right through the desk! Skander looked upwards. He could see through walls! Doors! Even people! What was going on?

"...So that's what you have to do," said Weston.

"Right," said Jason. "Come on, Stryker".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Clear as Water.

choices: Back at the police-station...
At the hospital, with Jasper under observation...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Skander and Jason stood up and turned towards the door. It opened and a woman strode in with a piece of paper in her hands, "Sir!" she said, looking right at the commissioner, "We've got a lead".
"Oh?" said the commissioner. "Where?"
"One of those guys was stupid enough to make a cellphone call. We tracked it to the nearest telephone pole. It was a building somewhere in this area..." she said, handing the commissioner a birdseye view of a street. "Officers just finished surveying the area and we've reason to believe it's this..." she pointed to a crossroad on the photograph, "...apartment building, at the end of the street".
"Excellent!" said Weston. "Perhaps now we can do something. You three best get over there and see what you can do".

"Sure commissioner," said Skander, "Come on, guys".

Teleporting from the room, the boys arrived in the apartment block. It was an old, run-down joint, deserted and empty.

"Shadow, perhpas you should scope the place out," said Skander, "Me and Jason will wait out here in the back".
"Right," said Adrian. The ghost vanished. The boys waited.

Unseen and seeing all, The Shadow wafted around the building, sliding in and out of rooms and checking every cavity he could find. He was on the top floor when he found them in a back room. Two men and a teenage boy. The boy was tied by his arms and legs to an old bed. Adrian looked at the two men, who were playing cards. The boy was awake, but gagged. Adrian headed back to the yard behind the apartment building.

"Top floor, back room," he said. "Let's go!"

Teleporting into the building and landing just outside the door, Skander raised his fist. Then he paused. "Let's creep them out a bit, first".

"Hehehahahahahahahaha!!...Who knows what evil...LURKS...in the hearts of men!? Hehehehahahahahaha! The Shadow knows!

Seeing through the wall, Skander grinned. "Oh that was wicked," he said. "They're totally spooked!"

Jason looked through the wall. The two men were standing up now and the boy was straining against his bonds, trying to look up.

"The Shadow fights for truth and justice and to prove the old addage that...crime does not pay!"

"What the hell was that!?" one of the men said. "This place is haunted!"
"Chill it, you douche!" his partner said, "It's some idiot with a megaphone playing jokes! Okay Shadow! How about you show us what you can do!? Big show-off..."

Adrian grinned at Skander and vanished. Watching through the wall, both boys clapped hands to their mouths to try and stop themselves from laughing as the two kidnappers were hauled into the air and thrown back down onto the ground! A wind whipped up inside the room, blowing dust and cards and loose clothes everywhere. The table and chairs rose into the air and were flung down, smashing to pieces on the floor!

WHAM!

Skander and Jason kicked the door down and rushed in. Grabbing both men and knocking them out, easily.

"Blade, get these guys outta here," said Skander, "Shadow, show yourself!"

Holding them as easily as tissuepaper, Jason left the room, dragging the two, dazed and beaten men behind him in one hand. Adrian showed himself, sitting on the bed.

Jasper Horowitz went insane.

He screamed and thrashed in his bed, jerking, twitching and throwing his body around, trying to break the bonds. Skander ripped the bed apart and burned through the ropes with his eyes. He helped the older boy up and threw his clothes on him, which were stuffed into a chest of drawers. The older teen stared at Adrian in terror.

"What, him?" said Skander, "Relax, he's not here to hurt you. Now get dressed!"

Jasper tugged on his clothes and stood up. He was tall for his age, his appearance reflected his wealth. Perfectly smooth skin, no blemishes, hands manicured to within an inch of their lives, hs hair would once have been a perfectly arranged classic style, each and every brown strand held firmly in-place by hair-gel. His teeth were straighter than ramrods and more even than a spirit-level and just as white as pure cotton.

"Woah...wow!" he panted, "Thanks!" he gasped.
"Come on," said Skander, he led Jasper out of the room. Jasper kept looking back at Adrian, who waved, and then vanished slowly into midair.
"Who...?" the rich-kid asked, but Skander just grinned. "A friend of mine".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Trident Force to the Rescue!

choices: The boys go to check out their free suite at the hotel.
Something strange happens on the way back home...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Ahem...He'll be alright, Mr. Horowitz. Dehydration, mostly, and a couple of bruises, but nothing else. A good few drinks and some square meals and a bit of rest and he should be fine".

Mr. Horowitz smiled and shook the doctor's hand, "Thank you, doctor," he said. He turned to Skander and Jason and Adrian, "I can't thank you boys enough for what you've done. You saved my son's life".

Skander grinned and scraped his shoes across the hospital floor. "Well..." he said, and shrugged.

"Now don't be so modest," said Mr. Horowitz, "I have something special for you". He picked up the two briefcases he had with him. "This was to be the ransom money".
"How much again?" Jason asked.
"Ten million in cash," said Horowitz. "...I don't need the money and you boys worked hard. It's going back into my account and I'm writing all of you a cheque for three and a half million dollars each".
"No you're not," said Adrian, "You're writing those two cheques for five million each. I don't need the money, what would I spend it on?"

The older man laughed, "I suppose you're right," he said. "Well...then that'll be it!"
"Five...No," said Skander, "We can't!"
"Yes you can," said Mr. Horowitz, "I insist! Take it...please! I can make more easily!"
"Well..." said Jason, he looked at Skander. "It's certainly...very generous...but..."
"I think we're being stupid," said Skander, "We'll take it, Mr. Horowitz, and thanks for your reward".

The businessman smiled, "Excellent," he said. He tugged a chequebook out of his pocket and filled out two slips, ripped them off and handed them to the two boys.

"Please, if there's ANYTHING I can do to help you boys in the future, you let me know," he said. "As a matter of fact, I have another idea".

"Now what?" said Jason.

The man felt through his pocket and pulled out a key-card. He handed it to Skander. "Take this and keep it".
"What is it?" Skander asked, examining the card.
"It's the keycard to one of the luxury suites at my hotel, top floor. It's got a view of the city you'll never have imagined! You guys and go there and use it whenever you like. No charge".
"Oh no," said Adrian, standing up, "That's too much!"
"Not at all," said Mr. Horowitz, "All the suites at the top are for special guests, and I think it'd be grand to have you boys staying in one of my hotels! And the original hotel, started by my grandfather!"
"I know," said Adrian, "I saw it being built".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: At the Hospital.

choices: Jason tells Skander and Adrian about his discovery.
Melinda invites the new neighbours over for dinner!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
