Skander and Jason appeared at the end of the street, dressed in regular clothes with their costumes underneath. Adrian floated along behind them, perfectly invisible to everyone but them.

"That was cool!" said Jason. "Five million each!"
"Yeah," said Skander, "Hey, at least he's alright, Jasper, I mean"
"Yeah, totally...Hey Skander...who's those guys?"

Skander stared ahead to see two large trucks parked in the street, and a large car in the driveway across the road from his house.

"They look like new neighbours," said Skander, "But...what are they doing on MY lawn?"

The two boys picked up their pace and reached Skander's front yard.

"Good afternoon," said Skander. "Like it?"
"Afternoon," said a man. "You live here?"
"Yes," Skander replied. He looked across the street, "New in town, huh?"
"Yes," the man said, "My name's Geoffrey, that's my wife Susan and my two sons, Reggie and Michael".

Skander looked at the two boys, they were probably a year or two younger than he was. "Nice to meet you," Skander said. He shook hands. Jason introduced himself and the handshaking was repeated all over again. Skander looked at Reginald and Michael. They were tallish for their ages and had light brown hair and thin faces. Their father was taller and beefier, with darker brown hair. Susan was slimmer, younger and had blond hair.

"So," said Skander, looking at the house, "What's your interest in this joint? You're moving in across the street from me, right?"
"Yeah," said Geoff. "Just admiring the house. It's so old and beautiful".
"It's got most of the original furniture in it," said Skander. "Are you from around here?"
"Used to be...a long time ago," said Geoff. "I actually live in New Jersey, but well...we decided to move here instead. Go back to the family roots, you understand".
"Yeah," said Skander. He stared at the two lorrys parked outside the house. "Where are the guys who are meant to unload the stuff?"
"Not here yet, just the drivers," said Geoff.

"We'll help," said Jason. Skander nodded. And slowly, they lifted, carried and pushed everything inside. Between the two of them, both boys made a great pretence at lifting up a piano and putting it in the front room, when each boy could really carry a hundred pianos as eaily as a loaf of bread. Jason helped them unpack everything. He picked up a large, heavy book. It looked very old. He put it on the coffee-table in the living-room and then picked up another book, of the same size and style, but which looked to be of modern manufacture.

"Aaah, my family bible," said Geoff, walking over. "That's the original," he said, pointing to the older book, "This is one I had made especially, so that we could continue recording family events".

Jason opened the cover of the older book. Drawn neatly with pen and ink on the front page was what looked like a tombstone, with black grass growing around the base. 'Carved' into the stone in loopy, neat cursive writing were the words:

"Good Lord bless and preserve this book of records, tales of deeds and misdeeds carried out by the Family Stone"


Jason blinked and looked at the page again. He turned more pages and kept reading. He found a family-tree. He scanned through it, until he found a familiar name...

STONE, Master Adrian Jeremiah.
Born: 15th June, 1898.
Died: 4th January, 1919.

"No way..." he whispered. "No...freakin'...way!"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Repotting the Family Tree.

choices: Skander and the boys discuss Geoff and his family upstairs in Skander's room.
The boys hear on the radio about three escaped killers in the neighbourhood.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"You sit here, Jason, Geoff, you and Susan can sit over there...Skander, next to Jason, Reggie and Michael, here".

Everyone took their seats around the dinner-table and started helping themselves to the food. Melinda had invited the new neighbours over for dinner.

"A pity your parents couldn't make it, Jason," said Melinda as she poured out water for everyone.
"Oh they had to work late," said Jason. "So uh...Geoffrey, you said you used to be from around here?"
"Oh not me personally," said Geoffrey, "My family was. Waaaay waaaay back. Stone is my name. Geoffrey Adrian Stone".
"Adrian?" Skander asked, looking up.
"Yes," said Geoffrey, "That was what my grandfather insisted I have as my second name, so he told me once. In memory of another family member, his older brother. My grandfather was born in 1905, my father was born in 1940, I was born in 1973. Grandpa was still alive and he told me one day when I was born he insisted I took Adrian as a second name. To remember my great-uncle. In fact, that's one reason why we all decided to move back here. To find out more about him. He died young".

A sudden breeze forced its way into the house, whipping up the curtains and making the chandelier shake and sway. The lights flickered.

"Perhaps you shouldn't talk about death," said Skander.
"Interesting thing is," said Geoffrey, "According to what I've managed to dig up, this used to be my old family house".
"I'm not about to move," said Melinda. "But one day, when Skander grows up I might move and I can give it to you".
"That's not gonna be for at least ten years," said Skander.

"He's talking about my little brother Nathaniel," Adrian whispered in Skander's ear during the meal. "I was seven when he was born. God I miss him. Cute kid!"
"Nathaniel Stone?" Skander asked.
"Huh?" Geoffrey asked.
"Oh nothing," said Skander.
"Nathaniel Stone was my grandfather," said Geoffrey. He looked at the two teens, "Now look at you two," he said, pointing to Skander and Jason with his knife, "You boys must work out lots, huh?"
"Well..." Skander said.
"Just...weights," said Jason. "You know...heavy stuff..."
"Like pianos?" Susan asked, grinning.
"Oh, pianos, cars, buses...ocean liners...." said Jason, chuckling. "Skander's been bench-pressing the QM2 for past couple of months".

Skander laughed, "Stop exaggerating!"

Once dessert was finished, everyone sat around the living-room, chatting, shaking hands, asking questions and joking.

"So you boys are going to the local highschool, right?" Skander asked Reggie and Michael.
"Yeah," said Michael. "We're kinda...well...excited. We heard...stuff".
"Stuff?" Jason asked.
"You know those 'Trident Force' guys who saved that ship?" Reggie asked.
"I...might have heard of them..." said Skander.
"They say that they go there for school! We just think it's kinda...weird," said Michael. "Hey Reg?"

Reginald nodded. "You think we'll get to meet them?"
"Oh I'm pretty sure they know you already," said Jason. "Isn't 'Stone' supposed to be a fairly prominent family in these parts?"
"It was!" Geoffrey said, "But I'm gonna shoot it up there all over again!"
"What do you do, Geoffrey?" Skander asked.
"I'm a lot of things," said Geoffrey, "I'm a doctor, I'm a writer, a historian, a geneologist..."
"A genewhat?" Jason asked.
"A geneologist. It's someone who looks up family histories. I'd been doing others for so long I decided to finally climb up my own tree and look around!"
"Cool," said Skander.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Dinner Conversation.

choices: Adrian makes his appearance in school, meeting Reginald and Michael first.
Skander gives the watch and ring to Geoffrey, and Adrian makes his appearance...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Jason slammed the door to Skander's bedroom and the three boys sat down on the bed.

"Well I'll be goddamned!" Skander said, looking at Adrian, "The Stone Family is back home! What do you think about that!?"
"I'm amazed my brother ever managed to get married, let alone pop out kids!" said Adrian. "Besides, are you SURE?"
"Oh I'm sure," said Jason. "I found your old family bible when I was helping them unpack. It had your name on the family tree. Born 15th June, 1898, died 4th January, 1919, that's you, isn't it?"
"Yeeeaaah..." said Adrian. "Wow...living Stones...I never thought I'd live to see the day..."

Skander and Jason looked at Adrian.

"It's a figure of speech," said Adrian. The boy paused in his talking and then said, "Jason, hold out your right hand".
"What?"
"Hold it out".

Jason did so, and Adrian slid the signet ring off Jason's right pinkie finger. Skander followed suit and gave Adrian the watch and chain.

"These should be returned to my family," said Adrian, putting them inside his coat. "I know I promised them to you but..."
"We understand," said Skander. "Give them back".
"I can't believe it...Stones...in this house again after nearly a whole century..." said Adrian. And for the first time ever, Skander saw the ghost looking sad.
"What's wrong?" Skander asked.
"N...Nothing! I..." the ghost let out a huge sigh, "I..." he sniffed, "Feeling...a bit emotional. How will I meet them!?"
"MEET THEM?" Skander almost shouted, standing up. "You're not seriously considering making an appearance, are you!?"
"They're my family, damn it! My blood is inside their bodies and you're sure as hell right I'm gonna make an appearance!" said Adrian. "The only thing is...How?"

Skander gulped. "I...I'm sorry Adrian".
"It's alright," said the ghost. "Let me think..."
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Blood is Thicker than Water.

choices: Adrian meets his nephews during lunchbreak.
Adrian does something else with Skander and Jason.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Bye, Mrs. Jones! Thanks for the lift!"

Reggie and Mikey slammed the door of the car. Melinda honked the horn in farewell and drove off. Skander and Jason were standing at the school gates. The boys ran over to them.

"Hey Skander!" Mike shouted. "Your mom's cool!"
"Thanks," said Skander, "Come on".

There was still plenty of time before school started, and Skander and Jason showed the boys around everywhere. They chatted and joked and asked questions. The two newcomers couldn't help but notice the huge blue and black posters with "TRIDENT FORCE" on them, that seemed to be pasted on every available square inch of wall. The three figures stared down at them. Skander and Jason with red and black masks over their faces, and Adrian in his suit and tie, with a black fedora hat and black silk mask drawn on and around his head and face.

"Man, I wish we could meet them!" said Michael, staring up at one of the posters, "They must be so cool!"
"Well thank you," said Skander.
"Huh?"
"Nothing".

The bell rang.

"Jeeze guys, we gotta go!" said Skander. "Come on Jase...can you find your classroom alright?"
"Number twelve," said Reggie.
"Oh that's...down the corridor. Turn left and go past the front doors, then to the end of the corridor, turn left again and it's on your right," said Skander.
"Thanks dude!"

The two brothers ran off in one direction, and Skander and Jason teleported from where they were, to their own classroom. Another, shadowy figure followed the two young brothers down the corridor. Adrian was going to make darn sure that nothing happened to his blood on their first day in school. He floated, invisible, along the corridors, hovering just above them. He floated into their classroom with them, and sat down at the back of the classroom, in an empty seat.

"Class!" said the teacher, wafting in, "I want you all to meet our new students. Reginald and Michael Stone. Reggie, Mike, why don't you introduce yourselves?"

The two boys got up and introduced themselves, telling a bit about who they and their family were and why and when they moved to California.

"Thank you," said Mrs. Cotter, "You can sit down now..."

"Hey Reggie..." said one of the boys, "What kind of name is Reggie, Reggie? Sucky gay name is what!"

The boy's name was Grego and he was mean to everyone.
"Stop it, Grego!" another boy hissed, "Let them be! It's their first day!"
"Reggie-Reggie what a dredge, slipped on dog-crap fell in a hedge...Aaaaagh!....Guuuh..."

Grego let out a strangled yelp of pain, his face contorted in excruciation. He was hyperventilating, gritting his teeth and seemingly twitching in his seat.

Something or someone had grabbed his right ear and was twisting, tugging and pulling at it with all his might! The pain was almost dizzying! He tried to bat it away, but he couldn't feel anything there! No hands, no clothes-pegs or anything, just a LOT of twist-and-pinch-indunced pain!

"Try that stunt again wise-guy, and I'll rip your freakin' tongue out!" a voice from an unseen mouth whispered in his ear.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Keep An Eye on the Kids.

choices: The Stone Twins have more questions for the boys.
Later on, the Stone twins are bullied. Trident Force comes to their rescue.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
The bell rang for lunch and Reggie and Michael packed up their books and headed out of their classroom, they bumped right into Skander and Jason.

"Hey guys," said Skander, "How's everything going?"
"Cool!" said Reggie. "Cool if we hang out together?"
"Sure," said Jason, "come on".

The boys headed down one of the corridors to their lockers and opened them. Reggie and Michael took out their lunchboxes and then followed Skander and Jason to their lockers.

"Yo! Skanman," said Lance, throwing up his hand and slapping Skander a high-five, "What's up, dude?...Hey, who are these guys?"
Skander looked at Reggie and Michael, "New students, new neighbours," said Skander.
"Oh cool. Hey dudes," said Lance. "Hey Skandy, I gotta baseball on the roof outside, Mr. Peters is being a pain in the ass and won't get a ladder out to get it down."
"Well you know Peters, he does stuff in his own time," said Skander.
"Yeah so anyway, can you fly up there and get it down for me?"
"After my lunch".
"Okay, whatever dude. I'll be outside!"

Lance waved and walked off. Skander and Jason reached their lockers. The wheels on their conbination-locks spun this way and that without them even touching the dials. The locks clicked and fell open. The doors opened without anyone touching them and their books floated in and their lunches floated out. The doors slammed and the locks clicked shut again.

"What...did...just...happened?" Reggie asked.
"Huh?" Skander asked. "Oh the locks thing? Nothing...it's...it's nothing".
"How did you DO that?" Reggie asksed.
"Hey it's not the only thing I can do," said Skander. He unwrapped a sandwich and scrunched the paper wrapper up in his hands. He threw it into the bin and ate as he walked.
"What did that guy mean by 'flying' up to get his ball?" Mike asked.
"Just what he meant," said Jason, "He's gonna fly up there..." he pointed to the ceiling, "And get the ball down!"
"Yeah right," said Reggie, "To do that, you'd need to be some kinda superhero!"
"Why not?" Skander asked. He flexed his arms, "This ain't super enough for yah?"

The two boys laughed. They passed another poster.

"Those things are everywhere!" said Reggie, "It's like they follow us around or something!"
"More true than you might think," said Skander. "That's Stryker," he said, pointing to the red and black-clothed, masked figure with blond hair, "That's Blade," he added, pointing to the other figure, with brown hair.

"Who's the guy in the middle?" they asked.
"The Shadow," said Jason. "Third member of the team. Sort of like...the leader. Very mysterious. Almost never seen".

"Lookin' at yourselves in the mirror huh?" said Lance, walking back with his lunch in his hands.

"It's a poster," said Reggie. "But it could be. A mirror, I mean. They sure look real similar. Bet they'd look exactly the same if they did the masks thing...wait a minute!"

Reggie's mind snapped back to Skander and Jason levitating their stuff out of their lockers. The two brothers had been so amazed at the time that they totally disbelieved what they'd seen!

"You guys made your books fly!" he said, pointing at Skander and Jason. He stared up at the poster. "YOU'RE STRYKER AND BLADE!"

"Christ these two are slow on the draw," said Jason. "Yes, we are".

"Woah cool!" said Reggie. "And you're our NEIGHBOURS! Oh this is sugary! You guys really DO have powers, don't you!?"
"Sure," said Skander. "Haven't you guessed?"
"Well...yeah but...hey, what can you do? Can you really fly?" Mike asked.

Jason and Skander sprang into the air and hovered in front of the poster, in front of their illustrative selves.
"Oh awesome!" said Reggie. "But..hey who's the guy in the middle?"
"That's the third member of our little crimefighting group," said Skander, hovering back down to earth. "His name is Adrian Stone".
"Stone? He's got the same name as us!" said Reggie. "How come he's dressed all old-fashioned?"
"Well, it's just...what he likes to wear. But then he's always been pretty formal," said Jason.
"Can we meet him?" Mike asked. "It'd be awesome to tell dad we met a guy in town with the same surname! He'd go crazy!"
"I bet he would," said Skander, "Sorry guys, but the Shadow is very reclusive. He only shows himself when he wants to. You can't force him".
"You act like you know all about him," said Mike.
"Perhaps I do," said Skander, laughing.
"Yeah, well then what's he look like?" the two boys asked.
"He's on the poster, ain't he?" Jason said.
"Yeah but that's just a drawing!"

"Oh he's about six feet tall, brown hair, dark eyes, smooth complexion, light skin," said a voice behind them.

"Who said that?" said Reggie.

The two boys turned around, but saw nothing. Then, a young man appeared before them, wearing a black, three-piece suit with a Double Albert chain, neat, black leather shoes and a black fedora hat.

"HOLY CRAP!" they screamed and backed away.
"Reginald and Michael Stone! I would appreciate it if you kept civil tongues in your mouths!"
"Who are you!?" they gasped.
"Boys," said Skander, resting hands on their shoulders, "Meet the Shadow. AKA, your uncle Adrian".
"WHAT?" they shouted.

Adrian walked forward. "Good afternoon," he said.

"No way!" said Reggie, "No way this is real!"
"About as real as your face, young man," said Adrian. "Now stand up straight or I'll give you a hundred reasons not to sit down again!"
"Yessir!" the boy said quickly. "So...you...you really are real?"
"Sure," said Adrian.
"But...You're not us...I mean...part of our family...right?" Mike asked.
"I beg your pardon? Of course I am," said Adrian, "What do you boys think this is, a joke? You, Michael, hold out your hand".

Michael did so. Adrian took the ring from his pocket. "You know what your family monogram is, don't you?"
"Mono...what?"
"Monogram! It's like a logo".
"Um...ah, yeah, dad showed us, um, two 'S's in front of a diamond".
"Right," said Adrian. "Then this is for you".

He handed Michael the ring. MIchael looked at it. "You really are related to us!" he said.
"Yes I am," said Adrian, "And you two, my nephews, will behave yourselves".
"Yes sir," they said. "But how are you related to us?" Michael asked.
"Your father's name is Geoffrey Adrian Stone. He said that his grandfather Nathaniel gave him the second name of Adrian. Right?"
"Yes".
"Nathaniel was my younger brother. He was thirteen when I died. That makes me your great-grand-uncle."
"Coooooool..." the boys said. "Wait til dad hears about this!"
"This is wicked!"

Adrian grabbed both boys and gave them a hug each. "It's nice to see Stones back in town," he said.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Uncle Adrian.

choices: That evening at dinner...
Trident Force answer a call. The Stone Twins come with them.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Uncle Adrian, how did you die?"

The boys were walking home from school and the ghost was strolling along, normal as any other person.
"It's a painful story," said Adrian. "My gravestone's in the cemetary a few blocks away. Visit whenever you like".
"Cool," said Reggie. Skander grabbed Reggie by the arm so tight he nearly snapped it in half. "I wouldn't say that, if I were you...Not unless you want a really big family argument".
"Oh...sorry..." said Reggie.

They reached the front steps.

"Come in," said Reggie. Michael unlocked the front door and they all stepped inside.

"Hey dad!" Mike shouted. "Daaad!"

A door opened and Geoffrey Adrian Stone stuck his head around the frame. "Yes, what is it Michael?"
"Can we talk?"
"I'm kinda busy doing some research, kid, later".
"Now".
"Later".
"Dad, now".
"I said, later!"
"Dad!" said Reggie, "We said 'now' we mean 'now'!"

Geoff groaned. "Alright what is it?"
"We uh...we found something at...we um, found something today," said Reggie. He held out the ring. "It's got that logo thing on it that you showed us once".

Geoff took the ring. It was bright gold with two "S"s on it and a diamond between them. He whistled. "This is beautiful!" he said. He took out a loupe and held it up to his eye, closely examining it.

"It's a...signet ring...turn of the century...with the family monogram on it...where did you find this?"
"Just...lying around," said Reggie. "We knew you didn't have it in your collection, so..."
"It's nice..." said Geoff. He checked out the ring more closely. He read the engraving on the ring inside the band...

Mast. A. J. Stone

Geoff turned to his desk and opened the family bible. "A...J...A. J..."
"Adrian Jeremiah," said Reginald. "It stands for Adrian Jeremiah".
"How do you know?" Geoff asked, not turning around, "You guys never look in this bible".
"It was a hunch?" Mike suggested.

Silently, Adrian wafted into solidity behind everyone. He stepped forward, holding a finger to his lips, indicating to the twins, Skander and Jason, to remain silent.

"Michael don't lie!" he said clearly, "I told them what it stands for, that's how they know".

Geoffrey turned around. His jaw dropped, he was totally speechless.

"Good afternoon, Geoffrey. I apologise for my tardiness, I'm only about 90 years late for the family reunion, but I'll be there next time you throw one".

"Who..." Geoffrey stammered, "Who are you?"
"Christ...for a history professor you're a bit slow on the ball aren't you?" said Adrian. A gust of wind blasted through the study. The pages on the old bible fluttered and turned rapidly until they stopped. Geoffrey looked at the pages that were opened...

STONE, Master Adrian Jeremiah.
Born: 15th of June, 1898.
Died: 4th of January, 1919.
Cause of death: Spanish Influenza.
Age at Death: 20 years.
Parents: Lawrence and Cynthia Stone.

"You're real!" said Geoffrey.
"Why not? Aren't you real?" Adrian asked. "The boys have been telling me that you have been researching my life for the past year and a half. Well I'm here now, ask me whatever you like".
"This is incredible!"
"Not really. I just wanted to hang around on Earth and watch time go by," said Adrian. "Speaking of watching time ticking away," he said. "I have something else to show you guys".

He pulled out the gold watch and chain. "This was my father's. And it would make a fine addition to your family museum".

Adrian opened up the caseback of the watch and handed the whole thing to Geoffrey. He looked at the engraving on the caseback...

Property of Lawrence Stone


"It's beautiful!" the boys said.
"It's incredible!" said Geoffrey.
"It works," said Adrian. "So don't drop it".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Family Reunion.

choices: "Alright they can come, but be careful!"
"Watch it on the TV news. We'll tell you everything when we get back".
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Aaaall aboard!"

Adrian flipped a switch and the model locomotive took off around the dozens of yards of track which had been laid out neatly in one of the house's basements. Michael and Reginald watched as their ghostly ancestor tugged out his ghostly pocket watch to check the time.

"You are so cool..." said Michael. "We have a GHOST in our house!"
"I'm not cool," said Adrian. He wafted over, and then shot through Michael's body. The boy shivered!
"I'm ice-cold, kid," he grinned.
"I can't believe we live in a house that's haunted! By a family-member!" said Reggie, grinning.
"What haunted house?" Adrian asked, "This house ain't haunted. I haunt Skander's house. The house I grew up in, the house I died in. The house that will, hopefully, one day, be returned to the family of Stone".
"Relax Adrian, I'll take good care of it, and when I move out, your family can take it back," said Skander, popping downstairs. "What's up?"
"Just playing," said Reggie. He flipped another switch and the train on the model tracks skidded to a halt.

"Adrian, can I speak to you?" Skander asked.
"Sure," said Adrian.
"Um...privately?" Skander asked.

Adrian looked offended, "My nephews have as much right to hear what you have to say as I do. What is it?" he asked, his voice suddenly harsh.
"I'm sorry," said Skander, "But um...it's eh...business? Weston".
"Oh?" Adrian asked, his arms crossed, "And what does he say?"
"Our friends the Horowitzes are in more hot water".
"Now what, did that stupid kid get himself kidnapped again?"
"Eh...it's rather more serious than that," said Skander. And he whispered the words "bomb-threat"

"WHAT?"
"See why I wanted to keep it between you and me?"
"Yes I see...I'm sorry. Come on".

The two boys vanished and reappeared in a locked room upstairs.

"What's wrong?" Adrian asked.
"Commissioner Weston says that a group of nutjobs set themselves up in one of his hotels, one of the modern ones, on the beachfront. The terrorists or whatever they are, have the whole place on lockdown.They say they got a bomb or bombs or something inside the building, ready to blow the entire place up if Horowitz doesn't cough up".
"How much?"
"Eeh...Two billion dollars".
"WHAT!?"
"I know!..."
"WHERE THE HELL DO THEY THINK HE'S GONNA GET THE MONEY!? I've known the Horowitz family a hundred and ten years!" Adrian shouted. "They got big in the 20s. In the 30s they got busted in the Depression just like everyone else. They shot up again the 60s after the War and they'd been living the highlife ever since, but I don't think they have THAT kind of money! Oh Lord!"
"Well Weston KNOWS THAT," Skander said, "Our job is to go into the hotel and take out the baddies and if we can, locate whatever bombs there are. Once we have, the bomb-squad can handle the rest".

Adrian made a face of disgust and let out a whistle of amazement. "Damn!" he screamed.
"Now come on, keep a level head," said Skander, "Let's go get Jason..."
"Where is he?"
"Downstairs with Geoff and his parents".

The two boys headed downstairs and found Jason in the kitchen. They explained everything to him and the third member of the crimefighting trio whistled. "Well we better get going! Come on!"

"Uncle Adrian, where are you going!?" Reginald asked.

As fast as they could, Adrian explained to everyone present, what had happened.

"We wanna come!" said Michael, quickly. "We wanna see you do what you do!"
"Oh no!" said Adrian. "You stay here where it's safe!"
"But we won't get IN the way! We just wanna watch!"
"I SAID NO!" Adrian roared, so loudly that the windows rattled!
"Yes sir".

"Oh for heaven's sake uncle," said Geoff, standing up, "I'll come WITH them and keep an eye on them. It's not every day they see superheroes in action!"

"I..." Adrian spluttered. He was beside himself with fury!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Trident & Stone - Professional Crimefighters.

choices: A wooshing sound - Adrian is back from his sweep of the hotel.
The bedroom door opens - It's one of the terrorists!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"I!..." Adrian began. He looked at Skander and Jason. The teens stared at Reggie and Michael, Adrian detected the thinnest smiles on their faces.

"Alright, alright!" he groaned, "Fine! You can come! But you stay in the background, listen to the cops and make sure none of you do anything stupid! Geoff, you're my nephew and I love you, but God help you if anything happens to these kids, I will make the rest of your life on Earth a living HELL! Skander, Jason, come!"

The ghost vanished and Skander and Jason vanished with them.

"Well, in the car, boys," said Geoff, reaching for his wallet and keys.

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---


"So, what's up?" Skander asked, following Commissioner Weston into his office and sitting down in a chair.

"We are in a crisis, Stryker," said the policeman. "We have about two dozen guys inside the hotel. They are armed, heavily armed. Shotguns, rifles, submachine guns, assault-rifles, hell, the only things they don't have are field guns. They've locked and barricaded all the entrances to the hotel, they got all entrances guarded, and they claim to have at least two bombs. Now the problem is, we can't go in because at the slightest sign of any police-presence, they claim they're gonna blow the place sky-high, money or no money!"

"So what's the plan?" Jason asked.
"You boys fly up to the top floor," said Weston. "You start there, and you go down, floor by floor, checking all the rooms. You neutralise any suspect IMMEDIATELY. I don't care how you do it and I won't ask. I know you fellows can't be hurt, but that won't stop these guys from trying awful hard, believe me!"

The commissioner pulled out three walkie-talkies and handed one to Skander, one to Jason, one to Adrian and kept a fourth one for himself. "Now go!"

The three boys vanished. Reappearing on the top floor of the hotel, they devised a plan. Adrian would do a quick sweep of the hotel to locate everything, then they'd go through, floor by floor, clearing everything out.

"Are you sure you can really do a sweep that fast?" Jason asked, "These people may not have much time".
"I reckon I can," said Adrian. "Leave it to The Shadow. You boys wait here and be good, now, okay?"
"Yes papa," said Skander. Adrian zipped up to his face.
"No wisecracks or I'll let you do the sweep".

The ghost vanished. Jason and Skander walked to the windows of the hotel-room they were in, and peered down into the street below to see police-cars and barriers everywhere, and huge crowds. What would happen if a bomb really did go off? Skander was nervous. He looked at the crowds below him. Somewhere, down there, looking up at him, were two boys and their father with the surname 'Stone'.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Coming Along for the Ride.

choices: Deal with this man first.
Lock him in the room and find the others.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"What is taking him so long?" Skander asked Jason.

Jason lay on the bed, thinking. "I dunno...Listen, let's start searching this floor for people anyway, just in case".

The boys opened the door and stepped out into the corridor. They looked one way, then the other. Then they stepped out. They reached the end of the corridor when they saw a figure in black walking towards them. It was not Adrian. For one thing, he didn't have the gold chain across his abdomen that Adrian always wore, and this man, whoever he was, was wearing a black ski-mask.

"Holy crap!" Skander shouted.
"Oooh no! Hey! You kids! Get back here you punks!" the man shouted, and ran towards them. He pulled out a gun, but Skander and Jason were back in their room and had the door closed faster than the terrorist could aim. Desperately, Skander looked around for something to defend himself with. He opened the bathroom door and yanked the towel-rails off the walls. These would do. He tossed one to Jason.

"When he comes in, beam him!" Skander said. Jason nodded.

The door opened, the man charged into the room. He stared left and right, searching for the boys. But he didn't think to look up.

Floating near the ceiling, Skander and Jason watched the man. When he decided he'd picked the wrong room, he turned to the doorway and was about to barge out again when Skander jumped down from the ceiling.

"Boo!" he said.

The man punched Skander, who ducked. Skander tripped the man over with a kick and the revolver in the crook's hand spun out of his reach, under the bed. The man pulled out another gun from his coat and fired, aiming for Skander's chest. The bullet hit the superteen in the chest and bounced off. The man kept firing, at Skander's chest, arms, legs, his face, neck, forehead...the bullets kept bouncing off.

"Enough of this!" said Skander. He bent down and easily twisted the gun out of the man's hand. Breaking it apart as easily as if it was made of paper, Skander rolled up the metal like it was playdough, blowing on it with his firebreath to melt the metal until he had what looked like a long, steel cable in his hand. Jason forced the man onto his back and twisted his arms around. Skander wrapped the melted and reshaped remnants of the man's gun around his wrists from behind, and then hauled him upright. Skander made a face, and then spat something hard in the man's face. It struck the man's cheekbone and fell to the ground.

A bullet rolled across the floor.

"Hey guys, what did I mi---woah!"

Skander and Jason turned around.

Adrian had returned.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Takedown.

choices: A few days later...
Trident Force reports to the police station.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"So, what do you want to do?" Skander asked Jason.
"Lock this guy up and then search around for the others".
"Right," said Skander. He walked over to the bed and started ripping up the blankets like tissue-paper. He threw the strips cloth to Jason, who hogtied the man and gagged him. When they were done, he looked like a trussed up goose. His hands were tied behind his back, his legs were tied together at the ankles and knees and he was on his stomach, with his legs bent backwards to meet his hands. His four limbs were then tied to each other. For extra measure, Skander tied the hogtied terrorist to the bed with one least strip of cloth. Searching his body and the room, Skander picked up the man's two guns. He tossed one to Adrian and kept the other one for himself.

"That ought to hold him for a while," he said.
"What are the cops gonna say?" said Adrian.
"Thank you", said Jason. "Now let's go!"

The boys headed out of the room and started doing a door-to-door search. Jason's walkie-talkie crackled to life.

"Trident Force, come in Trident Force. This is Weston, do you copy, over?"

Jason flipped a switch on his walkie-talkie.

"Reading you loud and clear, over", he said.
"What is the situation? Over".
"One terrorist captured and tied on top floor. Have just finished searching top floor. Nobody here, nothing else to report, over".
"Good work boys, keep going. Over and out".

The hotel was a large one, and the boys had to use superspeed and teleportation to get anything done. Most of the top floors were empty. It was when they reached the middle and lower floors that things started heating up. From the middle floors down, there were men with guns walking around everywhere. They were all wearing black clothing with black ski-masks on their faces.

"What do we do?" Skander whispered to Adrian. "We need some way to surprise them".

The ghost hovered as he thought, and thought as he hovered. "I'll handle this," he said, finally.
"Don't do anything stupid, don't give us away or anything," Skander said, "No theatrics".
"Yes, mother," said Adrian.

Hiding behind a closed door, Adrian raised his hands. With X-ray vision, the boys stared through the door to see a heavy floor-lamp raise itself into the air. They watched it spin around like a baseball bat.

WHUNK!

The man didn't know what hit him. He fell senseless to the floor. Slowly, the boys opened the door and stepped onto the staircase landing where the man was standing. Binding him up with bedsheets again and stripping his body of weapons, they headed further down.

At each floor down from then on, there was always at least two men to try and get rid of. They were a few floors from the bottom when Adrian's luck ran out.

A heavy wooden statue of a bald eagle mysteriously floated up from the side-table it was sitting on and was slowly floating through the air, ready to stun another man on the head, when they heard a voice.

"...Yeah whatever, I know, I know, don't worry! I'll handle it!"

"Adrian!" Skander whispered, "I think we got company!"
"Wh...?" Adrian said. His attention broken, he dropped the levitating eagle statue too early. It hit the ground and gave away their position hiding behind the closed door. The man in the lobby on the other side of it, twisted around and opened the door. Skander, Jason and Adrian turned to run, when they bumped into the other man, coming down the corridor. For a moment, the sudden meeting took everyone by surprise. Then Jason swore.

"Oh what the hell!" he said. He struck out with his right foot. His heel hit the man who was talking on his cellphone, in the stomach. He flew back and crashed through the wall, into the room behind him. Skander ran for the other man. But he'd already pulled out his shotgun.

"DON'T MOVE!" he shouted. "DON'T MOVE!" He pulled out a cellphone and pressed a speed-dial number and held the phone to his ear. "Yo dude, we got some freaky kids up there!" he shouted.
"Deal with them!" an answering voice on the phone shouted back.

The man fired his shotgun but Skander dived. He did a forward somersault. He popped up on his feet right in front of the man and grabbed the shotgun by the barrel.

"No no no, that's not a toy," said Skander, softly, "Now give it to papa".

The man struggled to shake Skander's grip off the gun, but it didn't work. Skander grabbed the shotgun slide and ripped it off. Holding the barrel in his hands, he twisted it around until the whole gun looked like nothing more threatening than a bubble-blowing stick. The man's face contorted in fear. He dropped the gun and shrugged a machine gun off his shoulders. He fired desperately but the bullets bounced off Skander's taut, hard body. Then, the man pulled something out of his pocket. It was his cellphone. He pressed a combination of buttons on it.

An explosion like an erupting volcano shook the building! Skander grabbed the man and forced him onto the ground. He twisted the phone out of his hands and ripped it to pieces in front of his eyes. Skander picked the man up and threw him down the stairs. The man screamed and hit the bottom step with the back of his head. Knocking him out.

Outside, policemen and firefighters were going crazy. Weston was screaming into a radio mouthpiece.

"Shots fired, shots fired! The first bomb appears to have gone off! Requesting SWAT teams to land on the roof!"

Helicopters whizzed into view over the hotel. They landed on the roof of the hotel and black, heavily-armed policemen charged into the building. They grabbed hostages from their locked hotel rooms and started herding them up to the helicopters while more police charged into the hotel from the bottom.

"Where's uncle Adrian and Skander!?" Reggie shouted. "I wanna see them!"
"REGINALD COME BACK!" Geoffrey shouted. But the boy had already run off towards the hotel.
"REGGIE!" Michael yelled. Then he too, vaulted the barriers that the police had set up and ran after him. They ran into the hotel, screaming. Policemen were firing canisters of tear-gas all over the place while firefighters with extinguishers ran up the shiny, marble staircase, to put out the fires in the rooms above. Skander, Jason and Adrian flew down to the lobby.

"ADRIAN!" the boys screamed. The ghost stared down. His eyes blazed a horrible blood red. He swooped down on them, his face contorted in fury! His arms grabbed the boys around their throats and hoisted them into the air before flying out of the building.

"I TOLD YOU TO STAY OUTSIDE!" the ghost roared at them.
"But we were scared for you!" Reggie shouted.
"I'M A FREAKIN' GHOST! SCARED IS MY DAMNED BUSINESS!" Adrian yelled back. "YOU DO THAT AGAIN, I WILL BEAT YOU KIDS SO HARD YOU WON'T SIT DOWN FOR TWO WEEKS! NOW GET OUT OF HERE!"

He threw the boys out of the building and swooped back in.

"Kids, honestly!" he growled as he landed on the floor next to Skander. The police had taken over the fight now, and they could hear gunshots upstairs. In another half an hour, it would be all over.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: The Attack.

choices: They meet some friends while driving around.
Adrian talks about his past...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
BEEP BEEP BEEP! A delivery van honked its horn as it backed into the driveway of the Stone's house.

Adrian wafted through the house, watching Reggie and Michael sleeping in their rooms.

DING DONG!

Adrian flew downstairs and, invisibly, opened the front door.

"Um...hello?" a man shouted. He rapped on the open door and then stepped inside. "HELLO!?"

A door at the end of the landing opened and Geoff came lumbering down wearing jeans and a blue, button-down shirt.

"Yeah?" Geoff said, and yawned.
"Sorry to wake you up so early," said the man, "But I have a delivery for this address?"
"Do you...?" Geoff asked. He took the clipboard and read it. "Oh yeah..." he said, rubbing the sleep out of his eyes. "Okay..."

The driver of the truck handed Geoff a pen and he signed the paper on the clipboard. Putting on his shoes, he followed the man outside. Parked in the driveway was a large moving-van. Slowly, the two men opened the doors at the back of the van. The noise woke everyone up. Reggie, Michael, Skander, Jason and all their parents crowded out into the street. It was only eight thirty in the morning.

"Okay," said the delivery man, "I'll hold the front, you push".
"Right," said Geoff. He climbed into the back of the van. "Ready!?"
"Hold on...okay ready! PUSH!"

Together, the two men pushed and pulled and heaved and tugged. Slowly, something covered in a heavy blue tarpaulin, came sliding down the ramp into the driveway.

"There we go!" said the delivery man, "All in one piece!"
"Thanks," said Geoff, and shook the man's hand.
"Bye now," said the delivery driver; he closed the back of his van and then drove off.

"What IS that?" Susan asked her husband.

"A little surprise," said Geoff, "Gather around everyone. Mr. Lancet, if you take the other side, we'll pull this tarp off".
"Okay," said Jason's father, "Down the bottom here?"
"That's right...ready? Pull!"

The two men pulled back the tarp and folded it and put it aside.

"What do you think, boys!?" Geoff asked. "How's this for family history?"

Standing in the driveway was a glistening antique motorcar. It was bright red and its chrome and brass trim, headlamps, bumper-bars and windshield frames sparkled and twinkled in the morning sunlight. The logo of the car was screwed onto the front grille. The canvass roof of the touring car was folded back, and the beautiful leather seats inside looked soooo comfortable. The sparkling nameplate on the grille read:

Pierce Arrow

"Woah!" said Reggie and Michael, walking up to it and looking it over. "Does it run?"
"Sure it does, I had it professionally restored and shipped over!" said Geoff, proudly. "What do you all think?"
"It's beautiful, honey!" said Susan, admriing the gleaming paintwork. "How old is it?"
"Um...1918," said Geoff. "Purchased by Mr. Lawrence Stone in December of that year".
"Nice family heirloom," said Skander and Jason walking over. The car was so shiny that Skander ended up checking his reflection in the headlamps.

"It's a Pierce Arrow 1918 family touring car," said Geoff, proudly, patting the red paintwork with his left hand. "Ain't she a beauty?"

"Well I'll be goddamned! Father's automobile!"

Everyone turned around to see Adrian walking towards them. The ghost had an expression of disbelieving shock on his face. He walked up to the car and examined it minutely. "Good God..." he whispered.

"Recognise it, Adrian?" Skander asked.
"RECOGNISE IT? I was WITH father when he BOUGHT it! Oh wow!...Had no idea it had lasted THIS long in the family!"
"Was it expensive?" Reggie asked.
"It cost about a thousand bucks back in 1918," said Adrian. "Pierce Arrow was one of the best cars you could buy!"
"Well," said Geoff, "Who wants to go for a drive?"

At once, everyone started shouting.

"Oh cool!"
"Daddy I wanna go, I wanna go!"
"Geoff it's so beautiful!"
"A real antique and it works!?"

Geoff laughed. "Well first, we gotta get this car started".

He picked up a long metal rod which was sitting on the running-board of the car. "This rod goes through the hole in the front grille," he said. "Let's see how it works, huh?"

Geoff slotted the crank-handle into the hole and grabbed the hooked end and started turning. Nothing happened. He kept turning it. Still nothing happened.

"What on EARTH are you doing?" Adrian asked, standing over Geoff, "Try turning it the OTHER way".
"I...I did, it's too stiff," said Geoff.
"You SURE this car works?"
"Yeah!"
"Then you're not starting it the right way. Move, let a PRO handle this".

Geoff stood up and stepped aside. Everyone turned to watch. Adrian grabbed the handle and turned it three or four times in the opposite direction.

"Are you sure that won't break it?" Geoff asked.
"It's MEANT to be turned this direction," said Adrian, "You're just not using enough..."

REEEEEEEERRRRRRRR!!!

The engine caught and turned on. Everyone gasped and cheered.

"...FORCE!" Adrian said, giving the handle one last turn and then getting up. He snapped his fingers and grinned, "Aaaay! Still got the magic touch!" he said, and grinned. "NOW it's working! Who wants a ride? Geoff, I hope you're better driving than you are starting up a motor-car. If you can't do it, I'll drive. Reggie, Michael, hop in. Skander and Jason, if you're brave enough, you can stand on the running-boards and HOLD ON TIGHT!"
"Um...you drive, Adrian!" said Geoff, laughing. Adrian smiled. He floated into the driver's seat. "I haven't touched this baby in nearly a hundred years, I hope I can still remember how it works!"

Pulling on a couple of levers, the ghost pressed on the accelerator. The car crept forward a bit. "Right!" he said, "All aboard!"

Everyone climbed in. Adrian tugged on a lever and the car took off down the road...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Driving Along in my Automobile...

choices: Everyone dresses up for the celebration costume party.
Adrian takes everyone to the museum to show them more stuff from the past.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Woah, this is COOL!" said Reggie as Adrian pressed down on the gas-pedal. The car lurched forward and Adrian turned the wheel. The automobile rumbled out into the road and Adrian opened it up.

"How fast does this thing go?" Skander asked.
"About a hundred miles an hour is its top speed," said Adrian. He honked the horn with his left hand and waved an arm out the side of the car. He turned left and kept driving.

"Why'd you wave your hand?" Jason asked.
"Signalling!" Adrian shouted over the noise of the motor, "This car doesn't have indicator lights. That's how we used to signal in the old days!"

He squeezed the bulb-horn and the horn hooted loudly. People shouted and waved and gawked at the car as it drove by.

"HEY LOOK!" Skander shouted. He pointed ahead to see Lance, Stacy, Tina and Stacy's brother Marsden waving from a car that pulled up alongside.

"Dudes!" Lance shouted, "What is that THING you're driving!?"
"Family heirloom!" Geoffrey shouted back.
"Huh!" said Marsden, who was driving the other car, "What can it do?"
"A hundred or so," said Geoff.
"Woah! Hey Skander, man, we saw you guys on TV last week! That was crazy awesome, man! We're throwin' a party, and like...well...for YOU GUYS! And...yeah".
"For US?" Adrian shouted, jerking his head around and nearly crashing the car. "WHAT?"
"Yeah!" Tina screamed. "You guys totally gotta come! Everyone is going crazy wanting to meet you!"
"It's a costume-party," Lance shouted, "Find somethin' cool and come!"

Adrian nodded, "Sounds great!...Now, come on!"

Suddenly, Skander felt himself being jerked back as Adrian stepped on the gas! The old Pierce Arrow lived up to its name and took off! Everyone cheered as Adrian revved the engine and sent the car flying along the highway at top speed!

"You sure it can take this!?" Geoff shouted.
"It'll be fine!" Adrian shouted back. He took an onramp off the highway, did a U-turn and then drove back towards home, again at near top speed. It was a thrilling joyride. They reached the main road near their houses and Adrian slowed down. The Arrow skidded around the corner and drove back to their neighbourhood. Adrian stopped the car while everyone got out. Geoff opened the garage-door, and Adrian gently backed the car into the garage, to park it beside Geoff's Mercedes.

"That was wicked!" said Reggie and Mike. "We love this car!"
"You're not gonna sell it, are you?" Adrian asked.
"Hell no! This is staying in the family forever now!" said Reggie. He hugged the hood of the car. Then he let out a yelp of pain.

"Careful kid, the engine's still hot from the drive!" Adrian said, and laughed.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: The Flying Arrow.

choices: An emergency on the way to the party.
The car pulls up at the party-location to huge cheers...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Hey mom, what do you think!?" said Skander as he tugged on his "Stryker" costume.

"Oh very nice, sweetheart," said Melinda. "Where's Jason?"
"Here I am," said Jason, coming into the living-room of the Jones household. "Where's my cape?"
"Oh I threw out your capes," said Melinda.
"YOU WHAT?" they both shouted.
"I got you something special..." said Melinda, smiling. "I was searching around upstairs for something to wear to the party and I found some old fabric your grandmother gave me, Skander. It's glass silk".
"What?" Skander asked, puzzled. Melinda smiled. "It's a special silk grown by special silkworms," she said. "Your grandmother has a whole farm of the little things," she said, smiling, "and she gave me some of this fabric, and I forgot about it. Glass silk is see-through silk when it's woven into cloth. I took some and did a bit of measuring and cutting...well...here".

She gave the boys two cloaks. They were black on the outside and red inside.

"They look exactly the same as our old ones," said Skander, exmaining his carefully.

"Are they?" asked Melinda, smiling, "This is a very special silk. Put on the cloak and you'll see what I mean".

Skander clasped the catch around his throat. Nothing happened.

"I don't get it," he said.

Melinda grabbed the cloak and threw it over Skander's head. Jason yelped in horror and nearly fell over stepping backwards.

"What is it!?" Skander shouted.

"Glass silk makes its wearers invisible," said Melinda, smiling. "Look!"

Skander walked to the mirror above the fireplace. Sure enough, he was invisible!

"Oh cool!" said Skander. He tugged the cloak off him. The invisibility disappeared and he was back to his old self, and the cloak morphed back to its old black and red colours.

"Does mine do that too?" Jason asked.
"Yes it does," said Melinda. "Under your cloaks, you're completely invisible!"
"Cool!" said Jason. "Hey, what are YOU going as?" he asked, looking at Melinda.
"Joan of Arc!" said Melinda, looking at her old-style clothes. "I just need to find something to tie on my bonnet with".

With their costumes on, the boys ran across the road to where everyone else was getting ready.

"Hold still!" said Susan as she tugged on Michael's belt. "Okay...there!" she said, and slapped him on the back, "All done!"

Michael looked at his belt and holster. "Cool!" he said. He pulled out his toy cap-gun and loaded it with caps. He fired it in the air, and it let out a very realistic 'BANG!' that made everyone jump. Reggie was dressed up as a gunslinger with his own belt, holster and toy revolvers. Michael clipped the sheriff badge onto his costume and looked at himself in the mirror in the hall.

"Reach for the sky, boy," said Adrian, wafting up behind him. Michael nearly died. He twisted around and fell over, bumping against the wall.

"What the!...?" he spluttered.
"Ghosts don't reflect in mirrors," grinned Adrian, "Gotcha!"
"You are SUCH an asshole sometimes, Uncle Adrian".
"Hey come on, no language like...what the hell is THAT supposed to be!?"

Reggie and Michael looked up to see Geoff tugging on a black coat. "What do you think?" he asked. He pulled out a cigar and put it between his lips.

"What ARE you supposed to be?" Adrian asked.
"Winston Churchill?" Geoff said.

The boys burst into laughter while Adrian struggled to keep a straight face.

Eventually, everyone was dressed.

"How are we gonna get to Stacy's house for the party?" Skander asked. "Jason and I can just fly there..."
"I wanna take the car!" said Michael. "The old one!"

Geoff grinned, "Me too. Let me think...It's not too far...The kids can all go in the car. Us grown-ups and drive in our own cars. Uncle Adrian, can you handle them all?"
"We'll be just fine," said Adrian. "Come on Reginald".

Adrian opened up the garage. The five adults piled into the Mercedes and drove off. Skander and Jason climbed into the back of the Arrow with Reggie while Michael was up the front with Adrian.

"Can I start it up?" Michael asked.
"You think you have the strength?" Adrian asked.
"I dunno..."

Adrian vanished. Suddenly, Michael yelped. "What's going on!?" he said.

"Now you do," said a voice coming out of Michael's mouth. "Go on my little nephew...grab the crank with your right hand, thumb away, and turn!"

Michael grabbed the crank and turned. Once, twice, three times...the engine caught! Adrian swooped out of Michael's body and landed in the driver's seat. "Come on!" he shouted. Michael jumped in and Adrian pulled on the gears and pressed on the gas-pedal. He flipped on the electric headlamps and the car drove off...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Off to the party.

choices: A carload of gatecrashers try to storm the party.
The next day...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
The Arrow rattled to a halt in the driveway of Stacy's house and her brother Marsden ran down the front steps of their house to meet them. Stacy's family was rich, and they owned a huge, old mansion called Rosewood Hall. It was a towering, ancient structure on the edge of town, four floors high and as old, creepy and cavernous as they come. The perfect place to host a big, freaky costume party.

"Duuuuudes! You made it!" said Marsden. He grabbed the doorhandle of one of the Arrow's doors and opened it. Jason and Skander stepped out with Reggie behind them.

"This is a cool car," he said, looking over it. "How old is it?"
"About ninety years," said Adrian, killing the engine, turning off the lamps and getting out. "Is it alright if we leave it here in the driveway, off the street?"
"Sure man," said Marsden. "Yo, Michael my man, what's up with the gun?"
"I'm the sheriff!" said Michael, pointing his gun to the older boy who was dressed up as a 1920s gangster.
"Oooh, dah shewwif!" he grinned, "Damn kid I'm scared!" he laughed, "Come on in guys!"

The group of friends headed inside to see everyone chatting and laughing. The moment the heavy front doors closed, everyone stopped.

"Uh-oh," said Skander.

At once, all the party-guests had swarmed around them, hugging, kissing, grabbing, touching, feeling...stroking. And then the voices started.

"Oh my god! OH MY GOD HE IS SO HOT!"
"HOW DO YOU KNOW THESE GUYS?"
"That Blade is such a hunk! Oh God!"
"Hey dude, can I have your autograph!?"
"What about a photo?"
"Do you really go to the same school as the Stone twins?"
"Hey it's that ghost dude!"
"Where!?"
"Over..."
"BOO!"
"HOLY CRAP!"
"...there!"

"Oh Skaaaaander!"

Skander turned around to see Stacy. She gave him a kiss, "Gimme a hand, flyboy. Take these lights and throw them up around the chandelier, will you?"
"Sure," said Skander. He grabbed the fairy-lights and soared into the air. He strung them around the chandelier and looped them around staircase railings and then plugged the lights in. He let out a yelp of surprise.

"Oooh what's wrong!?' Stacy asked. She ran up the stairs to where Skander was hovering above the power-socket. "This house is pretty old and we haven't had a chance to sort out all the wiring yet. You didn't get shocked, did you?"
"A...a bit, I think...It's nothing!" said Skander.
"Are you sure?"
"I'll be fine, thanks".
"Okay hunky-boy. Come on, I want you and your friends to meet some of MY friends!"
"Uh-huh, okay," said Skander. He wondered who Stacy's 'friends' were, and how they were gonna react when they found out she had a superteen for a boyfriend...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: The Life of the Party.

choices: The gatecrashers run away.
They put up a fight.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"You're not drinking, are you?" asked Melinda, walking up to her son.
"Uh, no mah!" said Skander, slamming down his third glass of vodka, "I'm a good little boy!"
"Sure you are honey...sure you are..."

"So what was it like?" Stacy asked.
"Alright, until the last few floors," said Skander. "Adrian dropped a statue or something and that gave our position away".
"If you didn't distract me, I would never have DROPPED it," Adrian said, swirling over. "Skander, can I speak to you for a minute?"
"What's wrong?"
"Trouble".

Skander got up and followed Adrian to the window. The ghost pointed to a group of rowdy teens and college-students who were charging up the street in a white pick-up truck.

"Uh-oh," said Skander. "What's up?"
"Gatecrashers".
"I'm sure it's nothing".
"I wouldn't be," said Adrian, "They're coming here!"
"Oh crap!"

"Yo! It's Stryker and Spirit, what's up guys?" said Marsden, walking over.
"There's some freaks coming into the yard," said Skander. "And...woah! What the..."

The old Pierce Arrow parked out in the driveway was levitating off the ground. It eventually landed on the garage roof.

"They are NOT gonna touch that car," said Adrian, "I will rip them a new asshole if they so much as SNEEZE at it!"

CRASH!

People screamed as a heavy pot-plant fell over, shattering on the verandah. Everyone went to the window.

"YO DUDES!" one of the guys called out, "WICKED PARTY!"

"Hey!" Marsden shouted "Get outta here! This is our joint!"
"Ooooh! Make us, dweebus! Come on guys, let's get some food!"
"Guys, I'm asking you nicely, to leave," said Marsden.
"Eeeeeeh...aaaah...uuuh...NO!" said the largest and most obnoxious of the gatecrashers.

"Boys!" said Geoff and Mr. Lancet, "This is not your party and it's not your house, get out!"
"But we wanna party!" said one of the other college jocks. He smelt drunk. Skander watched him as he walked over to Stacy. "Hey baby, want some action?"
"Get AWAY from me, you creep!"
"Hmmmm..."
"GET OFF ME!"

A stinging 'slap!' could be heard and howl of pain. Skander walked over. "Something wrong?" he asked.
"HE TOUCHED ME!" said Stacy. Skander looked at the guy in front of him. He was a little taller than Skander and had unkempt facial hair.

"Listen dude, just back out, okay," said Skander.
"But we're having fun, dude! We ain't...HURK!"

Skander's fingers had wrapped around the guy's nutsack and was squeezing it with (to him) very gentle force.

"I'll give you one chance," said Skander. He squeezed a bit harder. The gatecrasher let out a weird, whining noise.

"...to get out," said Skander, releasing his nuts, "...Before I make a girl out of you. Yes?"

"No!"

Skander grabbed the taller guy with his hands, "You don't have a choice, grogbreath!"

Lifting the guy as easily as if he was a toothpick, Skander hurled him out the front door. The guy flew out, over the fence and down the road like a javelin, eventually ploughing through a hedge at the end of the street. The other guys started backing away.

"Get...out," said Skander.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Partycrashers!

choices: Friday - History excursion day!
Alarms start ringing - the school's on fire!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"..and lastly, do not forget the big trip to the museum that we have at the end of the week!" said Reggie and Michael's history teacher. "I expect all your permission-slips to be returned by Thursday..."

"Oh no!" Reggie groaned.
"What is it?" Michael asked, looking at his brother.
"I lost my slip! It was supposed to be on my..."

"Ahem!"

Reggie looked down to see a rectangular piece of paper sliding across the desk towards him, pushed by an unseen hand.

"Thanks Uncle Adrian," Reggie whispered.
"Where would you be without me?" the ghost whispered in Reginald's ear, "You left that on the hall-table before you ran off to school!"

The bell rang and the kids raced out of the classroom. The school trip to the local history museum wasn't down to classes, but down to students. Whoever wanted to go, signed up their names and were issued permission-slips to be signed. It meant a day away from school, so most kids put their names down, including Skander and Jason, who both wanted time away from the classroom.

"Mr. Jones!" said Skander's teacher, waving him back into the room at the end of history, "I hear you're going on the trip on Friday. I'll be going too! I wondered if you could give this to your mother," he said, handing Skander a piece of paper.

"What is it?" Skander asked.
"Well, the school wasn't able to book quite enough coaches to get everyone to the museum, so we're hoping that some parents will ehm...will...offer to um...carpool".
"Sure," said Skander. He took the piece of paper and turned to leave again.
"Oh and one more thing!" said his teacher, calling him back in.
"Yes?" Skander asked. And now, his history teacher pulled something out of his briefcase, "Could you sign this? My son Timmy's one of your fans," he said, "And I promised him I'd get your autograph!"

The teacher rolled out a poster onto his desk. Skander grinned, "Sure," he said. He took a pen from the whiteboard and uncapped it.

"To Timothy, from Stryker", he wrote.

"Thanks!" said the teacher, and lifted his hand away from the poster, which snapped back into its rolled-up position. And Skander ran out to lunch.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: The next day...

choices: At the Museum.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Oh I'm sorry, honey!" said Melinda, giving Skander a kiss, "I KNOW I promised, but I simply HAVE to get into the office today. Meetings, decisions, problems..."
"But..." Skander began.
"You can fly, and Jason can fly, you don't need me!" she said.
"But..." Skander said again.
"And you could carry your friends with you!"
"But..."
"...So I'll see you tonight darling!"
"BUT!..."

SLAM!

With a wave of her scarf, Melinda was out the front door, and gone.

"DAMN IT!" Skander screamed.
"Language!" said Adrian, wafting through the living-room wall into the hallway. "I'll drive your friends".
"I suppose Jason and I can fly there," said Skander, "Could you drive Reggie and Michael there?"
"No problem," said Adrian, "We can swing by the school and pick up their friends, then we can head onto the museum...It'll be fun to drive that old Arrow again".
"Are you sure that's wise?" Skander asked.
"Hey, what better way to go to a history excursion, in a piece of history, driven BY history?" said Adrian, and giggled at his own joke. "Go on! Get out of here and I'll handle it!"

Skander shrugged. Jason popped up behind him, "Ready to go?" he asked.
"Yeah," said Skander. The two boys vanished. Adrian disappeared again, and reappeared inside the garage of the Stone household. He opened up a plastic jerry-can of gasoline and poured it into the gas-tank of the Arrow, then filled up the radiator with water. He opened the garage door and, turning himself into full-visibility mode, cranked up the engine, hopped in and drove the car out to the curb. He honked the horn loudly, three times.

Reggie and Mike came running out the front door and jumped into the front seat and the back seat.

"Are you driving us to the museum Uncle Adrian?" Reggie asked.
"Yep," said Adrian, "Hold on, now!"

Pulling on the gearstick, Adrian pressed on the gas and the car chunnered out into the road. Adrian turned, and then headed off to school.

"Just wait til our friends see this!" said Reggie, excitedly. They didn't have long to wait. A couple of minutes later, and the car pulled up outside the school gates. Mounting the curb, Adrian drove through the gates and executed a sharp, 180-degree turn in the courtyard. He honked the horn again, and waited. Students stuck their heads out windows, and ran down staircases, along corridors, until they had reached the courtyard. They stared at the car in amazement, the shining brass headlamps and the red paint, glistening in the sunlight.

"Hey!" one of Reggie's friends shouted, "Can we come!?"

Reggie nodded. Two of Reginald's friends climbed into the back seat. Then two of Michael's friends scrambled into the back rumble-seat.

"Right," said Adrian, "Who wants to try and start us off?"

One of the teachers stepped out, it was Skander's history teacher, "I'll do it!" he shouted. Bending down over the front, he grabbed the crank and turned it. Everyone watched. Eventually, the engine caught on and the car started. Adrian honked the horn and they were off! The cool breezes whisked past the car, and the boys couldn't believe they were riding in an antique car, driven by a ghost! Where-ever it was that Adrian learnt to drive before he died, he did it very well. The car slid in and out of lanes of traffic, it turned smoothly around corners and eventually reached the front doors of the museum. Parking the car in a secluded spot of the multistory carpark next door, they all headed into the museum to meet Skander and Jason...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Friday - History excursion day!

choices: A jewel-robbery inside the museum!
An art-theft inside the museum!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Alright, classes," said one of the teachers, "Now this is meant to be a fun day off. Browse around the museum, check stuff out, look at the models. If you have any money, you're welcome to buy stuff at the souvenier-shop".

"Come on, Adrian!" said Skander, "Let's go look around!"
"I bet this place holds a lot of memories, huh?" said Jason, grinning.
"Show us stuff, Uncle Adrian! Please!?" said Reggie and Michael.

"I see I don't have a choice," said Adrian, laughing. He tugged out his pocket watch and checked the time, "Alright, let's go!"

The group of students wandered through all the different exhibits, staring at the photos, at the stuff behind the glass cabinets, at the mock-ups of houses, living-rooms, street-scenes, offices, police-stations, antique motor-cars, steam-trains and aeroplanes hanging from the ceiling.

"Look at this, Uncle Adrian!" said Mike, walking over to an old Ford Model T, "Our car's better than this one!" he said. He opened the door of the car and climbed in. Reggie climbed into the cab of a steam locomotive and tugged on all the levers, wheels and cords. He grabbed a long cable running along the ceiling of the cab and pulled it. A large, brass bell rang loudly. They kept searching and walking around.

"The Age of Steam", Skander said, reading a placard, "Were you alive then?" he asked, turning to Adrian.
"Sure was," said Adrian, "Everything used to be run by steam. Boats, trains, elevators, electrical power was steam-generated...even the first cars were run by steam".
"How do you run a car with STEAM?" one of Reggie's friends asked.
"How do you run anything with steam? You fill up the tank with water, you boil the water, that makes steam..."
"But that would take ages!"
"Not if you made the amount of water really small," said Adrian. "You heated up small amounts of water each time and that made steam to drive the car...Hey, I haven't seen one of these in ages!"

The ghost walked over to a recreation of an old office with a placard which read:

"An Early 20th Century Office".

Adrian stared around at the desks, the bookcases, the typewriters and the telephones. He sat down in a chair and read the card next to a typewriter which said: "Feel free to try me".

"Okay," the ghost said. He floated a piece of paper into the machine and cranked it in with the rollers. Pressing his fingers on the round, glass and metal keys, the ghost began typing. The clattering of the keys and the rattling of the carriage was loud and clanky. When the carriage reached the end of the line, a bell rang. Adrian pushed the page up a bit, and then shoved the carriage back to the 'start' position. All the kids crowded around them, wanting to try stuff out.

"This is fun!" said Jason.

They passed all kinds of exhibits - cars, musical instruments, furniture, art, clocks, jewellery. Adrian was comparing his own pocket watch to the ones behind a display case, when an alarm went off!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: At the Museum.

choices: Monday at school, the next week...
Skander lands to meet the media...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Bells jangled and sirens wailed. Lights flashed and all around, people could hear the slamming of electronic security doors.

"What the hell was that?" Skander shouted to Jason. Armed security guards jogged past the boys and Skander and Jason went with them. They skidded into a room with broken glass everywhere. A sign hanging from the ceiling read: "JEWELLERY EXHIBIT".

Jason rushed from display case to display case. Every single one was empty. Each one had had its glass fronts smashed and the jewellery snatched out of it. Rings, necklaces, diamonds, rubies, sapphires, emeralds, pearls - all gone.

"Hey!" a security guard shouted, "You boys aren't allowed in here!"

Skander, Jason and Adrian vanished. When they reappeared, they were flying over the museum. Skander and Jason wore black and red while Adrian hovered nearby in his usual black suit.

"Now where did they go?" Skander shouted. Adrian stared around, he pointed to a white van speeding out of a parking-lot.

"There!" he shouted.
"Adrian, you go tell the police, we'll handle this!" Jason shouted. Adrian vanished. Skander and Jason dived, faster and faster, soon, they were hovering just behind the van.

"What do you wanna do?" Skander asked. Jason paused and thought, "Gimme your cape," he said. Skander unbuckled his long cape and handed it over. Jason vanished and resolidified inside the van. He staretd picking up briefcases, bags and boxes, all crammed full of stolen loot. He put them inside the cape and bundled it up like a sack of dirty laundry, then, he teleported out of the van with the bulging cape in his hands.

"Piece of cake!" he said.
"If you drop that or if you rip my cape, I am SO gonna kill you!" Skander shouted. "Now what?"
"I'm off, buddy! Have fun!"

And with that, Jason soared off. Skander wondered what to do. Up ahead, he could see a police roadblock. The van skidded around the spike-strips, lifted onto two wheels and then slammed back down again.

"Oh no you don't!" said Skander, he dived under the van, he was an inch from scraping himself against the bitumen road-surface. Slowly, he began to rise.

The van's wheels lifted off the road, the van lifted off the road! Soon, it was hovering in mid-air. Holding onto the front axle, Skander started flying, carrying the van on top of him like a parachute backpack. He wondered what to do. Suddenly, he felt movement. The sliding door in the side of the van opened! A man leaned out holding a gun. He stuck his head underneath the van and started firing at Skander. Skander ignored him. The bullets bounced off him and he kept on flying. The man fired desperately. One bullet hit Skander's shoulder.

In a pretence of pain, Skander let out a yelp and his right hand let go of the axle.

Unsupported, the van lurched over to the right. The man screamed as he fell out. Skander let go of the van entirely now. He let it drop. Diving after the man, he snatched him easily out of the sky and then went flying back towards the van. He threw him into the open side door and slammed it shut after him, then dived back underneath.

"Ladies and gentlemen, please remember to keep all exterior doors closed at all times, thank you", he said, his voice echoing inside the van's cabin.

Finally, Skander saw what he wanted. The local police-station. The road was clear ahead, and behind and below, Skander could see helicopters from the police and news companies, police-cars and reporters and cameramen, racing after him, all trying to get the best story, the best pictures...

"Ladies and gentlemen, please prepare for landing," said Skander. Bending his arms back, he threw the van forward. It soared through the air, coming closer and closer to the ground. The men inside screamed.

WHAM!

The van hit the road! The front two tyres exploded on impact and the van skidded and slid and slithered along, on its bare rims and the tyres of the back wheels. Sparks flew and rubber screeched...until it finally came to a halt, the front bumper of the van just nudging the gates leading into the police station's impound yard.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: A jewel-robbery inside the museum!

choices: What about Adrian and the science-block?
The library collapses while Skander and Jason are inside.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Tell us a story, Uncle Adrian," said Reggie. Reggie, Michael, Skander, Adrian and Jason were sitting in the schoolyard, eating their lunch. Adrian smiled, "Aren't you two getting a bit old for stories?"
"Aren't you getting a bit old to be hanging around kids?" Jason asked. Reggie giggled. Adrian made a face. "Fine," he said. "What do you want to know about?"

"What was life like when you were alive?" Mike asked.
"Why do you want to know?"
"It'd be interesting," said Reggie. "You lived so long ago".

Adrian smiled. He sat down between his two nephews and ruffled their hair. "Hehehe...Alright...well...hmmm...What would you..."

But whatever Adrian was about to ask, it was lost when a sudden jangling and wailing came up around them! The boys all whipped around to see everyone frozen in shock.

"What the hell is that?" Adrian asked.
"It's the fire-alarm!" Skander said. He heard the deep "Whoooop! Whoooop!" of the siren and the high, jangling of the electronic bells. "Reggie, Mike, you stay here!"

"Where are you guys going!?" Mike shouted. But Skander, Jason and Adrian had already run off. They bumped into a group of teachers.

"What's happened?" Jason asked.

"It's two fires!" one of the teachers shouted, "One in the science-block, one in the library-complex!"

Jason turned from Skander to Adrian, wondering what to do.

"You two go to the library, I'll handle the science-complex," Adrian said.
"What? No way!" Skander shouted.
"There's gonna be gas and acid and chemicals and all kinds of poisonous stuff in the science-block! I'm already dead! I don't care about that stuff! I can't die again! You boys go to the library!"
"But!..."
"MOVE IT!"
"Yes sir!"

Skander and Jason leapt into the air and flew off to the library while Adrian ran to the science-block. Thick, black smoke was blasting out the windows and pouring into the skies above. The library across the road was also belching out smoke, thick, white, fluffy plumes of it. Skander and Jason headed inside. Jason sniffed and coughed.

"Can you smell plastic?" he shouted over the wailing of the siren, "I can!"
"What do we DO?" Skander shouted.
"Downstairs!" Jason said, "We can start there and move up!"

The boys rushed downstairs. Offices and warehouses were everywhere down here, they stored paper, books, records and computers. As the boys went down lower, the lights flickered.

"HELLO!?" Skander shouted. The smoke was almost unbearable down here. They coughed and tried to keep low to the ground. Jason pushed open a door into one of the offices. Everything was on fire! Skander sniffed the air. He smelt something...strange...tangy...

"It's GAS!" he shouted, "Let's get the hell outta..."

BOOOOOOOOOM!!!

The building shook! Plaster and light-fixtures came crashing down! Skander just remembered the staff-complex and its kitchen were part of the library building. The fire must've set off the gas-mains in the kitchen! Flames roared and crackled! They were so loud, the boys couldn't even hear the sirens and bells down here.

"He...eehheh...HELLO!" Jason coughed. He saw something on the ground, "Hey! Skander who is that!?"

The boys rushed forward to see a man lying in a corridor. He was wearing a blue suit. It was Mr. Webster, one of the legal-studies teachers.

"You grab him!" Jason shouted. Skander lifted the man onto his back. He wasn't very heavy, but because Skander had to bend so low to keep out of the smoke, it wasn't easy keeping his balance. He sneezed and coughed as the smell of melted plastic became overpowering!

"Just fly!" Jason shouted. Skander grabbed Mr. Webster and levitated, then, flew! The two boys floated and shot along the corridors and up the stairs. They reached the foyer. They smashed out the glass doors into the courtyard and Skander flew Mr. Webster out onto the school oval. Boys and girls shouted and pointed.

"It's Stryker and Blade!"
"Whoooooo!"
"YOU GO BOYS!"
"Look out!"

Skander and Jason flew back in and kept searching the building, they rushed upstairs to see the library doors closed.

"What the hell!?" Jason shouted, "These things won't open!"
"I bet the electrics shorted out!" Skander yelled back, "These doors are probably jammed!"

The doors into the library were made of stainless steel and glass. The glass was breakable, but the elaborate latticework of steel bars was not. Skander and Jason ripped, kicked, bent and pummelled until they had created a hole big enough for them to get through. They climbed through it into the hot and smoke-filled library. They could see broken windows and people on the floor.

"Come on!" Jason shouted, "Grab as many as you can and let's get the hell outta here!"

Skander grabbed people by their shirts, gathering them up like shopping-bags and then flying through one of the broken windows, over the top of the building and over to the oval. A firetruck pulled up nearby and firemen started unreeling hoses and plugging them into hydrants. Red and white lights flahed as ambulances, sirens wailing, skidded into the schoolyard. Skander and Jason dropped off their loads and then flew back into the library to find more people...this was a real nightmare!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: C'mon Baby, Light My Fire.

choices: The students chat about the party all week.
Friday evening...time for the party.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Skander come back!" Stacy screamed. But Skander flew back into the library with Jason to try and find more people. The two boys moved from room to room, but everyone seemed to be out.

"Come on!" Skander shouted to Jason, "We...ahheh!...We better move!"

The two boys hovered into the air when suddenly they heard a groaning noise. What was that?

Outside on the school oval, students screamed as the library and some of the surrounding buildings, collapsed!

"SKANDER!" Stacy screamed.
"JASON!" Tina yelped.

Lying dazed on the floor with the burning wreckage of the collapsed library all around them, the two superteens tried quickly to assess their situation.

"We gotta get outta here!" Skander shouted.
"The rubble's too hot to touch!" Jason yelled back over the crackling of the flames.

Skander reached up for a steel beam and touched it. He could see steam rushing up from where he grabbed the beam. But it didn't hurt. He pulled his hand away. It wasn't even burnt! Perhaps if he tried his plasma beams, he could blast their way out? Yeah...

Skander clenched his hands and threw them open again. Something blasted out from his palms and hit the beams!

Only it wasn't energy beams. It was...water!
