"Hey Jason! Look!" Skander said. He tried it again. Concentrating hard, Skander could turn his hands into firehoses! Jason watched, and then tried himself. Together, the boys managed to put out enough of the fire to lift the rubble off them. They flew out into the air and then soared down onto the oval again. Students and teachers cheered and waved.

"Wow! That was incredible!" said Stacy, hugging Skander as he landed next to her. "And you're still the cutest..." she said. Skander smiled.

"Oooh look," she said, grabbing one of his huge arms, "You cut yourself!"

Skander checked his right arm. There was a nasty cut running along his arm. He shrugged, "It's nothing".
"Makes you look tough..." she said, grinning. Skander nodded. He started beyond her for a minute, to a figure in black, standing several yards away. Adrian gave them a thumbs up, and vanished.

--- --- --- ---

"...Well due to the fire, we won't be able to hold the halloween dance at school this year," said the year-level co-ordinator to everyone, "Electricians and gas-men had to be called in to check all the wiring and pipes and it's just too much hassel to set up the party around them. Now...it would seem that the party would have to be cancelled..."

Everyone groaned.

"Do we have to!?"
"What about next week?"
"Can't we have it outside?"
"Are you kidding? Not in this weather!"
"What about the gym?"

"Sorry, but the gym has to be rewired along with all the other major buildings, those two fires did a lot of damage," said their coordinator. "But, I have had a suggestion".

Everyone looked up.

"Skander, could you come up here, please?"

Skander got up and walked to the front of the room, "I spoke to Mr. Cracknell and we've decided that we can hold this year's halloween party," Skander said. "It'll be at my house, for all you guys who've seen it, I think you'll agree it'll be perfect. It'll be this Friday, at six o'clock, you can come in a costume if you wish. But if you can't find one, then formal clothes are expected. If you have any questions, you can leave a note in my locker and I'll catch up with you during school to talk about it".

Everyone started chatting.

"Oh man this is cool..."
"Awesome!"
"Thanks Skander!"
"What's your address!?"
"Stacy, are you going?"
"Of course I'm going!"
"Yeah, she's got the hots for Skander...rrrawwwr..."
"Melissa!...Yeah, isn't he cute?"
"Skander, dude, nice work, man".

Skander smiled. He'd cleared it with his mother and with Jason's parents and Mr. and Mrs. Stone. They all agreed to help prepare for the party on Friday. All he had to do was spread the word!
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Relocation, Relocation.

choices: The party starts!
Something else happens....
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Two buses pulled up on a lonely residential street. They pulled up side by side, and then the doors were opened. Four teachers and nearly a hundred students poured off the buses onto the pavements. They checked around until they found the right house-number.

Stone Manor, the house which Melinda Jones had bought cheap because of rumors it was haunted, towered four storeys high. Lights were off. And apart from the streetlamps, old-fashioned and dim, the whole place was in darkness. They walked up to the front gates, which swung open on their approach.

"Cool," said one of the boys. They started up the driveway towards the house. Everyone stared around at the enormous building. Skander and his mother lived here alone? Woah.

They reached the front doors and one of the boys rang the doorbell. Slowly, the two double doors creaked open. It was pitch black inside.

"Do we go in?" one of the girls asked.
"I guess so," said one of the boys. Slowly, the group of about a hundred students and about half a dozen teachers, crowded into the room. The foyer was huge and echoy. The perfect place for a dance. The house was old and creepy. The perfect place for halloween!

"HELLO!?" one of the teachers shouted out, "ANYONE HOME?"

No answer. Some of the kids tried the lights. They weren't working.

Fitzz!!!!

Someone struck a match. Everyone watched the single glowing matchstick. Then, it lit an oil-lamp, which was turned up bright. Adrian stood at the top of the stairs, holding the lamp in his right hand. The ghostly figure dressed in black. He floated slowly down the stairs towards them, the lamp the only source of light in the entire room. He stopped at the bottom of the stairs. Everyone watched.

"Hi!" one of the boys said, "We are at the right place, right?"

Adrian vanished. Some of the boys yelped and the girls screamed. Adrian reappeared in the very middle of the room, still holding the lamp.

"Good evening, mortals. And welcome to Stone Manor. My name is Master Adrian. Master Adrian Jeremiah Stone, and I will be your resident ghost this evening. Skander, Jason, the Stone Twins and their parents will be down shortly. In the meantime, make yourselves at home".

Adrian vanished again and appeared next to a fuse-box. He plugged in a few leads, and suddenly, all the lights came on!

"Wooooaaaah..." everyone gasped as they stared around the grand foyer. "This is amazing!"

"Hey guys!" said Skander. He was walking down the stairs, dressed in a black, three-piece suit. The Stone twins and Jason followed.

"Let's begin, huh?" said Skander.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Halloween

choices: Everyone begs Skander, Adrian and Jason to show off their powers.
The party continues without any other interruptions.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Skander and Jason shook hands and chatted, while the two Stone twins went to meet their friends.

"Hey guys!!"

Skander turned around to see Ldyia and her friends, Francie, Jess and Roz. He groaned. Excellent, the school cheerleading troupe. Nothing but four of the brattiest, sluttiest girls ever. He couldn't stand then. Jason walked up to Skander and shuddered. "Who invited Bitchzilla and the three Witches?" he groaned.
"I dunno," said Skander. "Let's move over to the stairs before they..."
"SKAAAANDER!"
"Oh god, kill me now!..."
"Skaaander! Oh aren't you adoooorable! Muah!!"

Skander struggled not to throw up as a face, loaded with lipstick, powder and WAAAAY too much perfume, was shoved offensively close to him. Lips kissed him and then withdrew. Skander gagged from the overpowering scent of lavender.

"And what was that about?" Stacy asked, smiling.
"Never mind!" Skander coughed, "I...I think I'm gonna be sick! Who the hell invited her here!?"
"I dunno, but gossip about a party at YOUR place spreads like fire on gas, she could've found out any old way!" Stacy said.
"Well thank god nobody likes her much. Perhaps she'll leave," Jason said. "At least she has the decency to stick to her own group of friends".
"Don't look now, but she's starting to spread out," said Stacy.
"Who invited HER?" Tina asked, walking up to Skander with a tall, solid-looking footballer with thick, blonde hair.
"Who's this?" Skander asked.
"Oh this is Darcy! He's Melissa's boyfriend...isn't he CUTE?"
"Hey," said Darcy, shaking Skander's hand. The guy had a palm so huge it must've taken a fortune teller two weeks to read it.
"Hey," said Skander.
"So you're the flyboy, huh?"
"Yeah".
"Wanna show me some of your 'moves'?"
"I...Not right now..." said Skander.

"Good evening, Darcy," said Adrian, walking into the group, "Is there something wrong, Skander?"
"Huh?" Skander asked, he whipped his head back. "Oh...just some...girls. Oh god why did they have to come! And...OH NO!!"

Four of the biggest, strongest, most arrogant jocks that the school could possibly produce, just entered the foyer.
"Oh no...this is gonna ruin everything!" Skander groaned.
"Yo dude!" said Skander's friend Richard, "Why are THEY here?"
"I DUNNO! WHO THE HELL TOLD THEM!?" Skander shouted over the sound of the music and chatter.
"Not me!" said Richard.

"Hey pipsqueak! Get over here!"

The boys looked up to see Lance, one of the taller jocks, beckon Reginald over. The boy was half his size, and he was holding a cup of...something.
"What took you so long!?" the giant snapped. He yanked the cup out of the boy's hand and then peered into it, "I asked for COKE! Not fanta! I hate Fanta!"
"Yeah but the Coke's not..."
"I said I wanted COKE!"

The bully tipped the orange, fizzy drink over the boy's head, "Now go and do it!"
"Laance!" said Francie, "Don't be so mean!...What're you looking at you little piece of tripe? Go off and get his drink! GO!"

The girl shoved Reggie and he fell over onto the floor. Adrian vanished. He reappeared behind his nephew and lifted him up. "Get to your room next door and change before your parents see you," said Adrian, and shoved his nephew out the front door and across the street.

"Who ARE those guys?" Adrian asked Skander, a few minutes later.
"You don't wanna know, Adrian..."
"Oh YES I DO," Adrian said fiercely, "That big fellow over there just shoved my nephew onto the floor and tipped Fanta all over his clothes! I wanna teach him a lesson..."
"Adrian!!!" Skander said.
"What's the matter?" Jason asked, popping up next to Skander. The two boys told him.
"Ooooooh..."
"Let me scare them. Let me do it. I'll scare them good!" Adrian said.

"...Skander and his mom live here and it's supposed to be some sort of 'haunted house'...Yeah right! Perhaps they got it because it was a total dump! But haunted? Gimme a break!" Lydia said.
"A DUMP?" Adrian snarled, "In the Belle Epoque, this was one of the finest houses in town! Oh let me scare them, just this once!"
"Adrian!" Skander said, then he lowered his voice, "You're a ghost...You better do a damn good job. Make them run out of the house screaming if you can".
"Oh come to me, dark powers..." said Adrian, holding up his arms dramatically.
"You're not serious, are you?" Jason asked, nervously.

Adrian turned around and grinned, evilly. His eyes flashed red. Then, he vanished.

"...I mean, a ghost-house?" Lydia continued, "Yeah right...I bet this place is real spooky!"
"You have no idea, sweetheart..." Adrian whispered in her ear. He wafted invisibly around them, grinning. What should he do? Should he start off small? Build to something big? Hmmm...

He swarmed over to the beverage-table and scooped up some cold water in his hands. He floated back and dribbled it over the eight, unwanted guests.

"Hey Lance! Watch it with your drink!" Roz hissed.
"I didn't do anything!"
"Yeah you did! You keep getting water on me!"
"I'm drinking COKE!"

Adrian decided to do some classic ghosty stuff. He floated into a portrait hanging on the wall. The painting started rattling and swaying back and forth on its hook. The jocks and cheerleaders stared at it nervously. The lights flickered. The music died and came back on again.

"Looks like this house is kinda creepy," said Bradley, one of the jocks.
"Oh pleeease!" said Lydia, "I wouldn't believe this house was haunted unless a ghost popped up right in front of me!"

"Ooooh?" Adrian said to himself, "Be careful what you wish for..." he whispered in Lydia's ear. "Because it might...come...TRUE!"

The eight of them screamed as Adrian shot out of the floor, right through the middle of the circle they'd created for themselves! His eys glowed a horrific, vampirish red, his teeth were sugar-white and to the screaming teenagers, he looked just like a vampire!

"You dare to defame the house of my family! For this you will PAY!" he roared. He shot into the air and swooped down on the girls. With surprising strength, he hoisted Lydia up into the air by her hair and flew her out the door. Her friends screamed and raced out of the house!

"Duuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuude!" Darcy said, "That was AWESOME!"
"Oh thank you," said Adrian, "I haven't done a good scare in decades..."
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Party Poopers

choices: A week later at school...
During the night, there are more ghostly visitors.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
The rest of the party continued without incident, there was dancing, singing, joking, chattering, eating and drinking.

"I can't believe we have a halloween party with a REAL ghost!" said Stacy, grinning.
"Thank you," said Adrian.
"And so charming and cute!" said Tina. Adrian laughed.
"Adrian, is death scary?" Darcy asked.
"It depends," said Adrian. "It depends on how you die. And how and when and where you die determines what your afterlife might be like..."
"How did you die?"
"It's not important".
"No really, I think it'd be cool to..."

Skander grabbed Darcy and covered his mouth with both his hands, "If you value your life, you won't say another word," he whispered in his friend's ear.

Darcy forced Skander's hands away from his mouth and turned back to Adrian, just in time to see his eyes turn back to their ordinary grey, from a piercing blood red.

"Woah...sorry man," said Darcy.
"Huh..." Adrian said. He whirled his cloak around his body and vanished.
"Gee I hope I didn't offend him," Darcy said.
"He'll be alright," said Skander.

Once everyone had left, Skander and Jason loaded everything into the dishwasher and helped Melinda tidy everything up.

"Goodnight, Jason!" she said. Jason waved and vanished. Skander walked through the house, checking everything. As he approached the hall, he saw Adrian standing in the middle of the foyer, underneath the chandelier, playing a violin. Sweet, relaxing music wafted through the house.

"I didn't know you could play the violin," said Skander, grinning.

Adrian finished playing. He turned around to face Skander.

"Mister Skander, there is a LOT about me that you don't know," he said. "And this is just one of those things. That was Mozart, did you like it?"
"Yeah it was great!"
"Thank you...Well, you must be getting tired".

Skander yawned, "Yeah I am..."
"Well, off to bed with you, Young Skander...Go on!" the ghost said, waving his violin-bow in the boy's face. Skander grinned and started upstairs. He reached his bedroom, stripped to his boxers and stretched.

Someone wolf-whistled.

"ADRIAN!"

The ghost popped out of the mirror, grinning. "Get to bed," he said.
"Not if you're gonna perv on me! I never knew ghosts could be gay..."
"Oh where's your sense of humor? Go on, bed! I'll turn out the lights".

Skander sighed. He got into bed and Adrian floated around the room and turned out the lights.

If anyone outside had bothered to look onto the roof of the Stone Manor, they might've seen a young man sitting on the chimney. A young man dressed in black suit with a double albert chain in his waistcoat...and playing Brahms' Lullaby in the violin...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: After the Party

choices: On to Whitmarsh Manor.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
School was pretty different with so many changes around, but Skander and Jason managed to cope. Adrian followed them everywhere.

"Why are YOU coming to school?" Jason asked, "You're dead!"
"One is never too old to learn," Adrian said. "And Pythagoras's theory only works on RIGHT-angle triangles, Jason, not equalateral triangles..."
"Wha..oh crap!"

Jason ripped the page out of his notebook, scrunched it up and threw it across the room into the bin. The bell rang and the boys teleported back home. Skander kicked off his shoes and relaxed in his room, while Adrian surfed on the internet. The ghost who had previously shunned society was now getting pretty good at using 21st century technology. His ghostly fingers hammered away at the keys as he typed.

"Easy Adrian!" Skander said, "It's a computer! Not a typewriter!"
"Sorry, but I've got a typewriter's fingers!" said Adrian, laughing, "I'm used to applying more pressure than I usually do..."

*Krrrrch!*
"Calling Stryker, calling Stryker, this is Commissioner Weston calling Stryker, over!"

Skander jumped off his bed and grabbed up the mouthpiece for the radio on his desk. He jiggled one of the knobs.

"Stryker here, reading you loud and clear, over!"
"Weston here. Assemble team at police HQ, in my office. Important meeting, over".
"What time, over?"
"ASAP. On verge of important drugs bust, require assistance, over".
"We're on our way. Over and out!"

Skander stripped down and tugged on his red and black uniform while Adrian vanished to find Jason. The two super-teens and their spiritual guide flew off until they reached the police headquarters. They teleported into the commissioner's office and sat down...Or in Adrian's case, hovered over a chair.

"You boys are prompt!" said the commissioner, "But that's just as well. We have a very VERY delicate situation".
"What's the matter?" Skander asked.
"We've finally located a gang of drug-dealers," said Weston, "They do everything. Cocaine, marajuianna, heroin, meths, opium, ice, you name it!..."
"So it's a drugs bust, why do you need us?" Skander asked.
"BeCAUSE they're in a place where we can't touch them," the commissioner said. "If we could get them out, we could pounce them at once...But if we can't".
"Well where are they located?" Skander asked.
"Whitmarsh Manor..."
"Whitwhatwhere?"
"Whitmarsh Manor. It's an old Victorian mansion about ten miles from here, out on the coastline, near the town of Whitmarsh. Problem is, the building's isolated and it's very easy for them to escape. Whitmarsh backs onto the sea. If we drove up in our cars, they'd simply slip down to the water on the other side and get away in boats".
"Why don't you go by land AND sea?" Jason asked.
"We'd like to, but its pretty dangerous. Also, there's a helipad there..."
"A what?" Adrian asked.
"A helicopter landing-pad...Well, not really. It's an old tennis-court or something, or so our survelliance photos tell us...but they could also get away by air. And if they do that...Well, I don't think we'd ever catch them".
"So what do you want US to do?" Skander asked.
"Find them, capture them, turn them over to us," said Weston, "PREFERABLY alive, but from what I hear, these guys won't be taken in that state".
"Well, we're on our way," said Skander. "Where do we go?"
"Whitmarsh is about ten miles south of here," the commissioner said, "You should see it, it's a fairly big town, but not huge. The manor's right on the edge of town".
"Thanks," said Skander, "Well, come on guys!...We'll see you later, Commissioner. How do we contact you if we want to?"
"A phone-call will do. But some of my men will follow a few miles behind you, just in case".
"Right," said Jason, "let's go!"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: A week later at school...

choices: Skander likes the idea. Whitmarsh Manor is their new superhero HQ.
He likes living where he is. They decide not to do it.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Come on, come on!" Adrian shouted at Stryker and Blade as they flew through the skies.
"What's the big RUSH Adrian!?" Skander shouted.
"I WANT TO GET TO BLOODY WHITMARSH!"
"Well then let's just bloody teleport!"
"Oh".

The three figures vanished from the sky and appeared, hovering over Whitmarsh Manor. Adrian took a deep breath and sighed.
"Something wrong?" Skander asked.
"Those no good, conniving little bastards..." Adrian said.
"What?"
"USING OUR HOUSE!" Adrian roared.
"What!? Adrian what are you talking about!?" Skander shouted.
"Whitmarsh Manor is OUR manor!" Adrian said, "It's belonged to the Stone Family since it was built! Or it did...By rights this should belong to Geoffrey and his family! And damn it, I'm going to claim it back!"

Before the two other teens could stop the ghost, Adrian had soared through the roof of the house. Skander looked at Jason, who shrugged. The two teens vanished into the house with Adrian.

Flying through the house so as to make as little noise as possible, the three figures scoped the place out. They finally discovered the various drugs labs in the basements. There were twelve men there, with chemistry sets and fires and bunsen-burners and all kinds of things. They had obviously got the lights working, because one man was watching television.

"Let me do this..." Adrian whispered.
"What are you going to do?" Skander asked.
"Shhhhh..."

Adrian floated into the room, invisibly. Just his outline could be seen. And in the dim room, it wasn't easy to see it unless you knew what you were looking for.

WHAM!

The doors slammed shut.

"Yo what the hell, man!?" one of the gangsters shouted, "What's goin' on!?"
"It's just the wind," one of the other men said.
"Luther, all the doors just slammed shut!"
"Well then OPEN them!"

The man who spoke first went to try and open the door to the ground floor, but it was locked!
"Hey Luther! The door's locked!"
"What? Let me try..."

The man named Luther rattled the handle, but sure enough, the door was locked.
"Oh real smart, Timmy, you didn't put the chocks under the doors to stop them MOVING, and now we're trapped in here!"
"I DID put the chocks under the doors!"
"Hey guys!" said another man, "Is someone checkin' all these chemical sets?"

The two arguing black men turned around to see a fat white man with a red beard who looked like a biker, who was pointing to the chemistry sets. The drugs and chemicals inside the beakers were bubbling furiously! Whatever might have happened next was suddenly interrupted by several loud blasts!

The beakers exploded and glass flew everywhere! The bunsen burners flared up and soon all the workbenches were on fire! Skander and Jason were peering through the keyhole in the door.

"Wooooah...Adrian's got it goin' on!" Jason said.
"Where? Let me see!" Skander said, and he bent down to the keyhole. His jaw dropped. Men were throwing water onto the workbenches, but it wasn't helping!

"Let's get the hell outta here!" one of the men shouted.
"HOW!? That idiot Tim locked us in!"
"I DID NOT!"
"No he didn't..." said a voice.

Everyone froze.

"I did".

Adrian appeared, hovering over the fires.

"Holy shiiit!..."
"HOW DARE YOU DEFILE THE HOUSE OF MY FAMILY! YOU WILL BE VERY SORRY!"

There was a blast like a nuclear bomb going off, and the twelve men were thrown back. Skander and Jason flinched at the sounds of bodies hitting the floor and walls. They waited for a few minutes, then teleported into the room.

"All done," said Adrian.

"You didn't KILL THEM did you?" Skander asked.
"Nooo!...Just knocked them out. Help me bind and gag them. Then we can get them outta here!..."

Using electrical cords and tape, they bound the crooks up like turkeys, and flew them out to the waiting police-vans.

"Niiice...Niiiiiice!" said Weston, as other officers clapped and cheered. "Good work, boys!"
"Thanks commissioner!" said Skander.
"You boys'll be getting a BIG cheque in the mail, I can promise you that," said the commissioner, "Good work!...By the way, we heard an explosion inside. I hope nothing was damaged?"
"Eehm...I hope you weren't counting on taking photos and evidence," said Skander, "Their drugs lab is a bit of a mess..."
"We'll send in a clean-up team anyway," said Weston, "Take some snapshots, some bits and pieces, then...Well I don't know what'll happen next, this house has been abandoned for years..."
"We'll figure something out," said Adrian.

When the evidence-gathering team entered the house and the other cops left with their arrested suspects, the three friends sat on the cliff overlooking the sea below.

"Hey Adrian..." Jason said.
"Hmmm..."
"You said this house belonged to your family..."
"Hmmm..."
"I had an idea..."
"Hmmm?"
"You think...ehm...we could have it?"
"WHAT?"
"N-n-not...like...I mean..." Jason spluttered, "As a hideout?"
"A hideout?'
"A headquarters! We could repair it, clean it up, renovate it, bring back all the old charm! And then downstairs, we could make like a whole 'Bat-cave' dealie, with all our high-tech stuff...What do you say?"
"I dunno..."
"PLEEEEAAASE?"
"Well...nobody really owns the house...I WAS going to give it to Geoffrey," Adrian said, "BUT...I think you might have a good idea there. We certainly have the money to renovate it..."
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: On to Whitmarsh Manor.

choices: The housewarming party...
The boys get straight to work in their new, mansion headquarters.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"...This is the study, then next door is the library, across the landing is the records room, conference-room, dying-room..."
"You mean living-room".
"No, I mean dying-room".

Stacy and Tina stared at Adrian, "Dying room?"
"Certainly," said Adrian, "All houses of this period had dying-rooms".
"Wh...what's it for?" Tina asked.

Adrian raised an eyebrow, "Dying?"

"You're joking," said Stacy.
"No I certainly am not," said Adrian. "If a member of the family or the household staff had a fatal illness which was incurable, or too-far progressed for treatment to be effective, he or she, was placed in the dying-room, a peaceful sanctuary to live out their last few days on this earth".
"Creepy," said Tina.
"Thank you," said Adrian. "Now, through that corridor are the bedrooms, the master's bedroom, the plus...eight...no...nine others, if I recall, and the four guest bedrooms. There's five bathrooms upstairs, two downstairs..."

Adrian walked slowly down the stairs leading into the foyer of Whitmarsh Manor.

"You really seem to know this house," said Tina, "I can't believe you got the whole place renovated and restored and...re...-everything! In just three months!"
"Skander and Jason are very fast and efficient workers," Adrian said, "And we had a lot of help. Here is the drawing-room, the ballroom, the music-room, the main dining-room, the kitchens, store-rooms, billiard-room and at the back here, the swimming-pool, home gymnasium and general conservatory".
"Woooow..." said Tina.
"All the weights are specially cast from lead," Adrian said, "So as they would be heavy enough to pose a challenge...however small...to Skander and Jason".

Stacy grinned, "I think they should've used cars".

The ghost smiled, "Perhaps. The garage is accessed through that passage there. There's also the tennis-court out the back. Now, through these doors..."

Adrian opened a pair of doors underneath the grand staircase which led into the foyer, "...lead into our...secret lair...of sorts. Come".

While the top few floors of Whitmarsh Manor had been lovingly and carefully renovated, refurbished and restored to original, Belle Epoque style of the turn of the century, as was Adrian's desire, the basements of the mansion were like a timewarp into the twenty-first century.

"Through this door is the computer-room, with twenty-four hour highspeed internet access, printers, scanners, four PCs..."
"Four?" Stacy asked.
"One for me, one for Skander, one for Jason, and one spare," Adrian said. "Next door is the radio and communications room. It has telephones and a radio transmitter and reciever. On the other side of the corridor, is the home theater, bathroom and storage-rooms for equipment and...other necessities".

Skander and Jason strolled down the stairs into the basements, "Hey girls," Skander said, "How're you liking Adrian's tour?"
"It's great!" said Stacy, "What a beautiful house!"

Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrring!...rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrring!!...

"Oh damn!" Adrian grumbled. And he quickly teleported upstairs. He appeared next to the desk in the study and he picked up the handset of an old-style telephone.

"Hello?"
"Hey Uncle Adrian, just wanted to know how things were going?"
"Wonderful Geoffrey, wonderful. Why?"
"Oh we were all...well...wondering...When you guys might be throwing a housewarming party?"
"I don't think that's been discussed, but I'll see what I can do".

Adrian hung up and headed back downstairs...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Welcome to Whitmarsh Manor; AKA: Trident Force HQ.

choices: Jason's parents and Skander's mother arrive.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Rain pattered down as an old, 1918 Pierce-Arrow drove through town and towards a large manor house built above the sea.

"I don't know why you insisted on driving us here in this thing," said Susan.
"Oh it's something for the kids," said Geoffrey.
"Yeah mah," said Mike, "We like this car".

The car stopped outside a pair of imposing metal gates. Geoffrey squeezed the hooter three times. The gates rattled, and swung slowly open.

"Cool!" said Reggie. "So this house really belonged to our family?"
"Yes," said Geoffrey, "It's beautiful, isn't it? I really gotta say, the fixed it up great".

The car drove in, and parked under the verandah. They got out and headed to the door.

"I don't see a bell anywhere," said Susan.
"There it is!" said Reggie, pointing to a heavy chain and knob. Susan grabbed it and pulled. Inside, they could hear a loud clanging sound.

"Oh wow," she said, "An actual bell! This kinda neat..."
"See? I told you you'd love it," said Geoffrey.

There was a sudden gust of wind and a young man dressed in black appeared behind the family, holding an old oil lamp.

"Good evening".

Susan screamed and the boys jumped. Geoffrey whirled around.

"Christ! Don't DO that!" he said.

Adrian headed towards the door and opened it.

"Come in," he said. "You are expected. Welcome...to Whitmarsh Manor".
"Are we the first here, Adrian?" Geoffrey asked.
"Yes sir. We're also expecting the girls, Jason's parents, their friends, Skander's mother and colleagues, and the residents of Whitmarsh, the town down the road".
"Oh swell," said Geoffrey. "Hey, why haven't you turned the lights on?"
"With so many people, and with the wiring not yet fully tested, we did not want to overload the circuitry," Adrian explained. "We will be using lamps and candles for this evening, except in the kitchen. I hope you don't mind?"
"Not at all," said Susan, "It looks kinda cool".
"Hmmm. This may be cool, but the weather outside is not," said Adrian, "There is a fire in the drawing room, if you wish to wait in there".
"Thanks," said Susan, "I love the furniture!"
"I insisted on it," said Adrian.

"Hey Uncle Adrian, can we stick with you?" Reggie and Mike asked. Adrian smiled, "Certainly, if you like".
"Can I carry the lamp?" Mike asked.
"No," said Adrian. He put the lamp on the coffee-table in front of the drawing-room fireplace. "You may carry the candles, howeer".

Mike and Reggie took up the candlesticks and followed their ghostly relative into the hall. The doorbell rang again and Adrian went to answer it. It was Tina, Stacy, their parents and their brothers.

"Hey Adrian!" said Tina, "Where's my Jason?"
"He's in the kitchen," said Adrian.
"What's with the candles?" Stacy's father asked.
"We did not want to overload the power-grid just yet," said Adrian, "We're not too sure of the wiring at the moment".
"Oh okay...the candles are a nice touch".

In the kitchen, Stacy and Tina watched Skander and Jason working at the speed of light. Sandwiches, sausages, pizzas and sausage-rolls were being cooked, made, sliced, baked and boiled at the speed of light. Trays, platters and bowls filled with food were being turned out at amazing speed.

"Adrian, stop being a doorman and start being a waiter!" Skander said, "We need to get this food into the drawing room!"

Adrian grabbed an entire tray of sandwiches and disappeared. He popped back a minute later, grabbed more food, and vanished again. Stacy's parents smiled at his efficiency.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: The housewarming party...

choices: A ship in trouble out on the water...
A fire in the distance, further down the coastline.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Clang-clang, clang-clang, clang!

"I'll get it!" said Stacy, and she ran across the hall to pull the door open. Skander's mother and Jason's parents were standing on the porch.

"Hey!" said Stacy, "Come in!"
"We're not too late, are we?" Skander's mother asked, "Where's my big beautiful boy?"
"You mean MY big beautiful boy," said Stacy.
"Not while I'm around, girl," said Mrs. Jones, "Where is he?"
"Mom?" Skander called out, "I'm in the kitchen!"

Mrs. Jones headed down the corridor towards the kitchen, examining everything as she went. "Wow..." she said, "This is impressive! Hey honey!"

Skander gave his mother a hug and she kissed him.
"Mooom! Not in front of Jason!"
"Awww sweetums..." said Skander's mother.
"MOM!"

She laughed. "Can I help with anything? You need drinks?"

"Champagne?" Adrian asked, popping out of the floor, with a dusty bottle in his hands.

"What the heck is that?" she asked.
"Champagne!" said Adrian. "It's a bit old, but once it's chilled, it'll taste great!"
"Where'd you get that from? The family mosuleum?"
"The wine-cellar," said Adrian, and he cleaned the bottle and put it in the fridge.

Shortly after, the doorbell rang again, and dozens more people flooded into the grand old house. Everyone chatted away excitedly, and shook hands and hugged and kissed.

"Nice work!" said Commissioner Weston, staring around, "Very nice...You boys have earned this alright!"
"Thanks Commissioner," said Skander. "Curry-puff?"
"Thanks," said the policeman, reaching for the curry-puff on a platter. "Hey what's that noise?"

Skander headed into the ballroom to find Adrian sitting at the organ, playing a very creepy piece of music.

"What the hell is that?" Skander asked, "Sounds like a funeral march!"
"Song D'Automne," said Adrian, matter-of-factly. "Don't like it?"
"Sure, if we were holding a halloween party, but...can't you do something more upbeat?"
"How about some disney songs?" Tina asked, "You know any?"

Adrian rubbed his hands together, "I know a few," he said.

Stacy gave Skander a kiss, "This is the ballroom, huh?" she asked.
"Yep".
"So it's like a party-room?"
"Yeah".
"Cool! Let's dance!"

Soon, everyone found themselves dancing to the ghostly organ music, being provided courtesy of the late Master Adrian Jeremiah Stone. His hands lept from keyboard to keyboard while his feet worked the pedals underneath.

"How the hell does he DO that?" Darcy asked as he whisked past Skander with his girlfriend, "That guy can play anything!"
"90 years of practice, I guess," said Jason, "Tina!" he yelped when she stepped on one of his feet.
"If you MOVED better you wouldn't get in the way," she scolded, "Loosen up!"

Suddenly, Adrian stopped playing and everyone stopped dancing.

"What's going on?" Skander asked.

"Is that what I think it is?" Adrian asked, pointing out one of the large windows. Everyone rushed over to the windows. The rain had slackened off now, but it was still tremendously windy. Out of the windows, they could see...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Let's Get This Party Started.

choices: The survivors join in the party.
Skander and Jason find a friend of theirs onboard the ship.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Whitmarsh Manor was built right on the water's edge, and through the windows of the ballroom, everyone could see a ship rocking and rolling in the heaving waves. It looked like it was in serious trouble. Red distress flares went up and exploded into the night sky. Near to the manor, a towering white lighthouse had a light that flashed and shone through the night, two white beams shining out onto the choppy water.

Before anyone could say anything, Skander had run out of the ballroom and through the hall. He threw open the front doors and ran through the grounds, with Jason following behind him. The two boys scrambled down the sides of the cliff and started walking across the water towards the ship.

Walking on water was one of Skander's favourite powers. It wasn't easy in rough seas, but it was manageable. He lost his balance many times, but he finally reached the ship, to see passengers gathered on deck. Skander and Jason were both wearing their black and red lycra costumes, which they wore under all their other clothes at all times. People shouted and pointed and the two boys scrambled up the side of the ship, pulling themselves up hand over hand, up the anchor-chains.

Lifeboats were loaded with passengers, but the storm was too rough to allow the boats to be launched safely.

"Looks like we'll have to fly them off!" Skander shouted at Jason. Jason nodded. Over the sound of the storm, he waved his hands and Skander understood that Jason wanted to take two lifeboats at the same time. Skander nodded back and mouthed the word "OK".

Lashing two lifeboats together, the crew loaded women and children in. Jason swooped down and grabbed a handful of ropes and flew off, the pair of boats swinging away underneath him like some sort of white, wooden basket with rope handles. Skander did the same. They looked like a pair of storks delivering babies from the ship to the safety of the manor grounds.

Party guests ran outside to help bring everyone into the house while Adrian vanished downstairs to the communications room. he was soon on the radio to the nearest emergency centers, which sent ambulances and the coastguard to come and help.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: A ship in trouble out on the water...

choices: Blake tells Skander his folks bought a house in Whitmarsh, now Blake can visit!
The day after the storm...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Skander and Jason landed on the deck of the rolling ship where they saw more people climbing into lifeboats or jumping into the ocean. Coastguard boats had showed up by this time, and were busy hauling people from the water into their boats.

"Come on, we need to get more people off!" Jason shouted over the sound of the storm.
"Yeah!" Skander said, "You go that way, I'll..."
"Skander! Jason! Hey!! OVER HERE!"

The two boys turned around to see a boy with dirty blond hair struggling through the wind towards them. It took Skander a minute, but then he remembered! Blake, the boy they'd met on the beach, who had invited them to his house for the fanclub meeting. Blake screamed and waved. The ship rocked again and he fell over against he railing of the ship. Skander grabbed him with a powerful right hand.

"Hey Blakie! What're you doing here!?" Skander shouted.
"This was supposed to be a holiday!" Blake screamed back, "SOME HOLIDAY! GET ME THE HELL OUTTA HERE!"
"Hold on, buddy!" Jason shouted. He grabbed Blake's other hand. "Ready!?" Jason shouted again. The two boys nodded, and they flew off.

When they landed back at Whitmarsh Manor, they hurried Blake inside. Blake changed into some of Skander's clothes upstairs and then went downstairs to find his parents. The housewarming party was still going, and survivors were being welcomed into Whitmarsh Manor with open arms and being served food and drinks. Blake stared around everywhere.

"This place is amazing!" he said.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Hey Blake!

choices: A month later, the boys end up on the Ellen Degeneres Show.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
Trident Force got straight to work in its new headquarters. They sent emails, listened in on radio, watched the news and kept track of everything that was going on. They helped out the cops in high-speed persuits, in apprehending criminals and in dealing out their own vigilante justice. A powerful searchlight on the roof of Whitmarsh kept the coastline safe, and all around for dozens of miles, people could see the light swinging around, shining out a beacon of hope and safety.

A man dressed in a suit strolled up the driveway of Whitmarsh Manor. He carried a briefcase in one hand. He reached the gates and pulled a bell-cord. The bell swung and jangled and the man waited for someone to respond.

"May help you?"
"Yaaaah!!"

Adrian walked up to the man from behind him.

"Uh yeah," said the man, "I'm here to speak to Stryker and Blade about a uh...proposition".
"Business?" the ghost asked.
"Yeah. Who are you?"
"Just the caretaker," said Adrian. He unlocked the gate. "Come in".

The man bent down and picked up his briefcase.

"Well thanks for unlocking the..." he said, but Adrian had vanished.

Nervously, the man headed up the driveway. Behind him, the gates slammed shut again and locked. He reached the front porch and knocked on the door.

"Come in!" said Adrian, opening the door.
"Jesus!" the man yelped, "How'd you get here so fast!?"
"I am the caretaker, sir. I know my way around this entire house. Stryker and Blade are in the library, upstairs, to the left, sir".
"Thanks," said the man. Adrian closed the door and turned around.

"May I take your hat, sir?" Adrian asked.
"Oh thanks," said the man, handing Adrian a grey fedora hat.
"And your coat?"
"No, I'd rather keep this on me, thanks".
"Yes sir. Right upstairs, sir".
"Thanks", and the man started up the stairs.

"So caretaker, how old is this..." the man began, but Adrian had vanished again.
"What the hell!?...Okay...No more double martinis before lunch..." he mumbled to himself. He reached the top of the stairs and walked around the landing.

"Hello!?" he called out. A door opened and a handsome, blond-haired teenager stuck his head out.
"Yeah?"
"Aaaah, you must be Stryker," said the man.
"Yeah".
"My name's James Matherson..."
"Come in," said Stryker. James entered the library and Skander closed the door.
"Tell me," said Stryker, "What I can do for you...Blade! Wake up!"

Jason grunted and sat up in his chair.

"Huh?...oh! Hi!" he said. Jason shook the man's hand and pointed to a chair, "Sit down".

"Boys, I come as a representative of Miss Degeneres..."
"Degeneres...Ellen Degeneres?" Skander asked.
"Yeah! She's been watching you fellows on TV and she'd love it if you could make a spot on her daytime talkshow".
"Oooooh," sad Skander, "So that's it, huh?"
"Yes".
"Sounds intriuging".

The man smiled, "She's willing to pay you $2000 each for your appearances".

Jason whistled, "How much!?"

"Two thousand each".
"Saaay, that's not bad," Jason said. "How can we contact her?"

James smiled, "Here's a card," he said, handing Skander a card with some names and numbers on it. "If you give her a phone-call, you guys can talk over everything with her and arrange a date and time. She would like you on her NEXT show, if you can manage it".
"Sure," said Skander.
"And here's my card," said James, "Just in case you need to contact me about anything. Now, if I can find my hat, I'll be off..."
"Sure," said Skander.
"Where's your caretaker?" James asked.
"Caretaker?" Jason asked, "What caretaker?"
"What...I...this...guy. Young guy, twenties, wore black. He let me in here!" James said, "Where is he?"
"I dunno who you're talking about," said Skander, "We don't have a caretaker at Whitmarsh, or a butler or anything!"
"But..."

The man turned around dizzily, then, he noticed his hat on the table. His jaw dropped. He snatched up the hat, which certainly wasn't there a second ago, and jammed it on his head.

"Yes well...thanks for your time, boys! If you need any help, you ring the numbers on those cards!"

The man turned around headed out of the library and down the stairs. He reached the bottom when the figure in black appeared in front of him.

"Your briefcase, sir," Adrian said, holding it.

James's jaw dropped. Snatching it out of Adrian's hand, he ran out of the house and down the road, through the mysteriously opened gates, and into his car. A minute later, the screeching of tires could be heard as the expensive Mercedes sped off!

"Adrian!" Jason said.
"I haven't had a good scare in yeeeaaars," Adrian said, "That was SO much fun".
"Hopefully as fun as this," said Skander, picking up the phone...
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Showtime!

choices: "Giving us a demonstration of your powers?"
"Answering some audience questions & fan-mail?"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"We have a great show for you this week! Yes sir, yes ma'am! Today we're chatting with celebrity toyboy Zac Efron in his latest movie role, we're talking to Mr. Robin Williams!..."

The crowd cheered and clapped.

"...and of course, everyone's favourite superheroes, Stryker and Blade!"

More cheers and whistles. The crowd was going wild.

In the back, Skander and Jason waited in the blue room, along with the other guests. They all exchanged autographs and shook hands. Skander couldn't believe he was holding Robin Williams' autograph! They all chatted and joked until one by one, they were called out. Skander and Jason were the 'Grand Finale' of that week's show, so they waited the longest. Not that they complained. They got the bulk of the show to themselves, so they weren't too fussed.

A man knocked on the door, "Boys! You're up next! Come on!"

Excitedly, the boys rushed out onto the stage. People clapped and cheered.

"Ladies and gentlemen! Put your hands together for Stryker and Blade!" Ellen screamed, and the studio audience was going berserk! The boys bowed and then sat down.

"Well!" said Ellen, "Boys! Who's who?"
"I'm Stryker," said Skander.
"And I'm Blade," said Jason.
"Nice to meet you boys," said Ellen, "So tell me, how on earth did you boys develop superpowers? Roll around in toxic goo as babies?"

The crowd laughed, Skander grinned, "It's a secret, Ellen, we can't tell you. And we can't really divulge our identities here either, so you'll excuse our masks..."
"That okay. They make you boys look cute!"

"W00t! CUTE!" someone shouted, and everyone laughed.

"So boys...wow I don't even know where to start! You're young, you're cute, you have superpowers...I suppose becoming superheroes was naturally the next step, huh?"
"Well yeah," said Jason, "Being a superhero is every kid's dream, right? Well we weren't gonna let it slip away!"
"Of course," said Ellen, "Has becoming superheroes caused any major changes in your lives?" she asked.
"Well...lots!" said Skander, "We don't live at home anymore, we don't go to school anymore, we fly around and help people!"
"Very nice," said Ellen, "And your parents must be proud!?"
"Oh yeah!" said Jason, "Very proud. Well...Stryker's parents more than mine. Mine were actually kinda shocked".

"What's with the name 'Trident Force'?" Ellen asked, "Where did that come from?"
"Well 'Tri' is three, and there's three of us," said Skander.
"But there's only two of you here!" said Ellen.
"Our third member is a BIT shy," said Jason, "He usually stays out of the limelight. But he's usually around somewhere, in the crowd, on the sidelines..."

Suddenly, all the lights went out. People screamed.
"Hey what's going on!?" Ellen called out.

"Muauahahahahahahahaha!! Who knows what evil...lurks...in the hearts of men? Muahahahahahhahahaha!!...The Shadow knows! Hahahahhaaha!!"

The lights flickered and came back on again and people gasped and sighed.

"What was that!?" Ellen called out.
"We are no longer alone," said Skander. "It appears the third member of our group has decided to join us, after all".

"You must be The Shadow," said Ellen, looking at Adrian as he walked across the stage.

"Yes ma'am," said Adrian, "Nice to meet you".

"Well!" said Ellen, "Now that you're all here...how about..."
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: On Ellen

choices: Yes.
No.
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.content:
"Well!" said Ellen, "I'm sure a LOT of people here have questions for these three, wonderful young men, so, I'll turn you boys over to the audience, and let them ask away! But first, we have a few questions which were submitted during the ad-break...uuuh...Eric!...Where's Eric?"

A tall, overweight man with stubble and brown hair stood up.

"Yeah hi," he said, "This is a question for all of them, but what's with your names? Why did you pick what you did?"
"A good question," said Ellen, "Boys?"
"Well I picked 'Stryker' or 'Striker' because I reckoned it sounded cool," said Skander, "I wanted something that sounded distinctive and memorable".
"Very nice, and you?" Ellen asked. She handed the microphone to Jason.
"The Blaaaaayde..." said Jason, grinning. "My name is what it is, because it's a play on words with my actual name...which I won't be revealing here".
"And...Where's the last guy...Oh! And you?" Ellen asked.
"My name comes from The Shadow," said Adrian, "I borrowed it from the legendary crimefighter of yesteryear, who is heard and rarely seen by mortal eyes..."

The crowd laughed nervously.

"Okay...next question!" said Ellen, "This is...from Jeannette!...Jeanette...?"

A young lady in her twenties with red hair stood up, "Yeah, I wanted to know, are you boys taken?"
"Yes we are," said Skander.

Some of the girls in the audience "ooooohed!" with envy.

"You boys must get a LOT of dates, huh?" said Ellen.
"Well..." said Skander, blushing and wringing his hands. The crowd laughed.

"One more question from...Dustin!"

A guy who looked like a college freshman stood up.

"Yeah uh..." he said, "This is for the guy in the black. The Shadow...I been readin' stuff online that says you're a ghost..."

The audience started chattering.

"...Is that real?"

Adrian looked at Dustin.

"I don't know. Do you believe in ghosts?"
"Well...I...dunno...I guess not...not really..."

Adrian vanished and the crowd screamed. He reappeared at the back of the auditorium, standing right behind Dustin.

"What about now?"
"HOLY!..."

*Bleep!*

"How the *Bleep!* did you DO THAT!?" he shouted. The crowd laughed nervously.
"Does that answer your question?" Adrian asked.
"So you're really a ghost?"
"Not convinced? I could possess you if you like and make you do cartwheels across the stage..."
"No way dude, it's cool! It's cool!" said Dustin. "Woah!!"

"This is a first, ladies and gentlemen," said Ellen, "An actual ghost on the Ellen Degeneres show! On live, national television! I suppose that this does prove after all that ghosts do exist! Now, are there any other questions?"
1432122222111211221111111111112112111122.title: Q&A.

choices: "...we have a big drugs bust tomorrow night..."
"...we're trailing a gang of housebreakers and need to catch them..."
1432122222111212.content:
Skander sat at the radio in his room while Jason lay on the bed. Adrian hovered absent-mindedly near the bookcase, checking out Skander's collection of literature. Skander was busy tuning the dials and trying to find something juicy on the airwaves...

"...Domestic disturbance at..." Krrrrch "Hit and run at the corner of Elm and...." Krrrch "Code Three, Code Three, shooting and robbery at 43 Banker Street. Repeat, shooting and robbery at 43 Banker Street. All units, all available units respond...krrrch...suspects armed and dangerous...Code Three...Ambulance dispatched..."

"Did you hear that?" Skander said, getting up.
"Where is it?" Jason asked.
"43 Banker Street."
"Banker Street? That's pretty far, isn't it?" Adrian asked. "We better teleport."

Changing into their costumes at super-speed, the two boys disappeared into thin air, with Adrian following behind. They reached the apartment-block and looked around. It was all in semi-darkness.

"How the hell are we supposed to see anything!?" Skander said to Jason. Adrian materialised in front of them. He was glowing a ghostly white glow which lit up the immediate area around him. "Come on," he said, "I saw someone moving nearby..."

Skander and Jason jogged around, searching here and there. They heard a deafening blast and Jason jumped as a shotgun slug hit him in the stomach. It flattened against his abs and fell to the ground. Jason reached out and grabbed blindly. Skandler raced over and suddenly found the shotgun-barrel shoved into his mouth! The gun fired and Skander felt hot lead fill his mouth. More angrily than anything else, Skander bit the muzzle of the shotgun off. Then, he slowly started munching on the barrel, his diamond-hard teeth smashing through the metal, right down to the trigger-guard. The robber goggled at the sight before him of a teenager eating up his shotgun. Skander spat and the twisted, mashed-up remains of the gun clattered to the ground, followed by the 'clunk!' of the slug fired into his mouth.

"Enough joking," said Skander, "Come on Blade, get him up!"

Jason heaved the man up. Skander picked up a steel fencepost lying nearby and wrapped it around the man's wrists like one of those flexible wire bag-ties. He bent the steel bar as easily as if it was wire.

"That should keep him from waving his arms around," said Skander, "Now only if we could see!"

The robber let out a howl and jerked his head back! Two very bright, white beams of light struck him square in the face! "WHO ARE YOU GUYS!?" he screamed. He struggled with the bar wrapped around his hands, trying to cover his face.

"Stryker, your eyes!" Jason said. "Look!"

Skander stared around. Two, super-bright 'eyelights' blazed out of his eyes, bright as lighthouse lamps. Jason quickly said, "I wanna be able to see!"

His eyes blazed white, and two bright beams shot out. Using their new-found power, the two boys dragged the man back to the apartment-complex. The ambulance was there and paramedics were carting a man away on a stretcher. A man in official-looking uniform strode towards the boys.

"Evening boys!" he shouted.

It was Commissioner Weston.

"Evening, Commissioner," said Skander, "Here's the suspect, all gift-wrapped for you."
"I see you're making good use of that eh...little present I sent you."
"Yeah it's great," said Jason. "Real useful."
"Excellent, excellent...Listen, you and your msyterious third friend might be able to help me..."
1432122222111212.title: Moonlighting.

choices: Newspaper reporters, photographers and journalists who want interviews!
Police, paramedics and security-guards.
143212222211122.content:
"Where now?" Skander shouted at Adrian as they flew threw the sky. The wind was making it hard to communicate.

"I DUNNO!" Adrian bellowed back, "LET'S JUST FLY AROUND A BIT!"

The two boys and one ghost soared around the city. Flying was fun. Flying was easy! Flying was risky!

"Skander look out!" Jason screamed. Skander's head whipped around. He let out a shriek of terror and swerved out of the way! A passenger-jet, a 747 jumbo, came soaring down through the air.

"Hey!" Jason shouted, "Don't you hear something!?"
"Huh?" Skander shouted.
"I hear it!" Adrian shouted, "Or...Don't hear it!"
"WHAT IS IT!?" Skander yelled.
"Look at the plane! The engines aren't turning!" Jason shouted.

Sure enough, the blades of the plane's jet engines were completely stationary.

"Adrian! Hop inside and see what's going on! But for the love of God, don't show yourself!" Skander shouted. The ghost dived through the roof of the cockpit...

"Mayday, mayday, mayday!" the captain of the plane shouted, "We are in an emergency, mayday! Tower, do you copy?"
"Reading you loud and clear..."
"We have run out of fuel, over. We are gliding. I repeat, gliding! Our descent is rapid...Jack, can we make it to the airport?"

The co-pilot checked the charts in front of him.

"Where's the nearest airport?" he asked.
"At least a hundred miles..."
"Damn it! Then no!"
"We may have to make an emergency landing!" the captain shouted into his microphone.

"Copy that. U/A Flight 87 preparing for crash-landing..."

Adrian had heard enough. He soared up out of the plane.

"They're out of gas!" he shouted at Skander, "They're trying to make it to the airport!"

"Where is it!?" Skander asked.

"A hundred miles that-a-way!" Adrian shouted, pointing ahead. "The plane's dropping too fast!"

"You go ahead!" Skander shouted, "Jase! Come on!"

Flying either side of the plane, the two boys dived and then flew up under the wings, holding them up.

"You know, this isn't as heavy as I thought it was!" Jason shouted, "It's like a kite! A heavy kite, but I could carry this thing all day!"
"Well try carrying it a hundred miles without dropping it!" Skander shouted. They kept flying. Then they changed positions, flying over the wings, with their hands holding onto the edges, keeping the plane up, their black and red capes flapping behind them in the slipstream. Passengers stared out the window.

"Ladies and gentlemen, please remain calm!" Skander shouted. He had no idea how loud he was actually shouting. Inside the cabin, the passengers could hear his every word!

"Sit back, enjoy Trident Force Airlines and try to get some sleep! We'll be on the ground soon!"

Skander turned his Hollywood-handsome face to one of the windows and smiled. Everyone waved back. Jason did the same.

The further they flew, the easier it became to hold the plane. Finally, they saw the runway. The pilots pulled on levers and pressed buttons. The landing-gear came down and the plane hit the runway! The force was considerable and for a second, Skander let go of the plane. Jason struggled to hang on. Flaps in the wings opened up as the plane struggled to slow down. Skander jumped down to the runway and grabbed the axles of the landing-gear. Planting his boots firmly into the ground, he pressed them down, hard! He skidded and scraped along the tarmac, until finally...

Ambulances, fire-trucks and airport security rushed over. Skander gasped. He'd sooner try stop a nuclear missile than try and wrestle a loaded jumbo-jet to the ground...Jason was sweating. Suddenly, they saw people rushing towards them...
143212222211122.title: Go Fly a Kite!

choices: Back at home, the two boys discover new powers.
Adrian wants to show his new friends something special...
1432122222111221.content:
"Helloooo..." said Skander, stepping out from under the safely-landed jet. "Hey Bladey, look!"

Jason stared across the tarmac to see about a dozen men and women running towards them. They could see motion-picture cameras, stills cameras, notepads, pens and audiotape recorders in their collective hands.

"Who are they?" Jason asked.
"The Press, I'll bet," said Skander, he grinned. "Come on, buddy-boy, let's get famous..."

"Hey! Hey you kids!" one of the reporters shouted.
"Jerry don't call them that!"
"Yes, Michael Hayes, Daily Star, Who are you?"

"Woah, woah, woooooaaaah!" Jason said, holding up his hands as the two teenagers were surrounded by reporters on all sides. "Easy, ladies, guys...one at a time, please! Mr. Hayes, I am the Blade and this is my friend the Stryker. Together, we are two parts of a three-person team, and we call ourselves Trident Force. A three-pronged attack force to protect people from crime and danger."
"Impressive!" said Hayes, writing quickly, "And how old are you?"
"We're sixteen," said Stryker.
"And very handsome, too!" said one of the lady reporters. The two boys grinned.
"Hey, here are the pilots!" one of the reporters said, "Captain Mitchell, is there anything you'd like to say?"

The captain was a man in his fifties. He tugged off his cap and wiped his forehead with a handkerchief. "When I grew up, I did it with Superman, Batman and all the rest of them. Now that I'm growin' a little older, it's nice to know the city I love...is being well-protected! By these fine fellows," he said, he patted Jason and Skander on the shoulders.

"How about a photo!?" someone shouted.

At once, a dozen cameras came out of nowhere.

Skander looked at Jason, "What do you think?"
"Oh alright...Me in the front."
"Why you?"
"Because I look cuter."
"Shove off!"

Standing either side of the captain with the plane behind them, the two boys posed while cameras flashed and plinked.

Mr. Hayes stepped forward, "Hey Stryker, how about an autograph?"

Skander shrugged, "Sure, got a pen?"
"Now how would I look? A reporter without a pen!? Here!" he said, handing Skander a biro.
"Anything in particular?"
"Whatever you like..."

To Mike Hayes, and a long and friendly association with the local media - Stryker

"Thanks!" the reporter said.

Another reporter stepped forward, "Excuse me, did I hear you right? You said you have THREE members?"
"That's right," said Jason.
"Well there's you, and there's Stryker...where's the third guy?"
"Oh he's around..." said Skander, staring over his shoudler. "He's always...around...but he prefers to keep out of the limelight. If you look hard...you might find him somewhere..."

The reporters did, but couldn't find anything. They thanked the boys and dispersed.

"Look hard!" Adrian said, "Blind as bats!"

As the crowd left, he appeared in front of his friends, right at the back of the mob of reporters.

Skander grinned, "Sneaky bastard."
"That's me," said Adrian, floating over, "Well...that was satisfying. Now what?"
1432122222111221.title: Impromptu Press Confrence.

choices: Heading home with Adrian, the boys discover they have more powers.
They hang around to be thanked by the hostages.
1432122222112.content:
The Sundowner Hotel was a respectable joint. Or it was meant to be. A hotel built to replicate the swanky, fancy hotels of the Wild West. The furniture was antique and the carpets were rich red and gold mixed together in fancy patterns. The walls were of carved wood, and with old-style electric lights and lamps everywhere. The staff wore old-fashioned clothes from the 19th century.

"Flying is great," said Skander, looking at Jason, "But I wish we could just teleport to places, like you do," he said, turning to Adrian.

"It's not hard," said Adrian. "You just think of where you wanna go and visualise yourself there..."

As he said it, the ghost, flying through the sky alongside Jason and Skander, disappeared!

"Woah!" said Jason. He floated over to Skander and grabbed his arm. "The Sundowner..." he whispered.

There was a rushing sound and a flash of light! Both boys vanished and reappeared on the roof of a building.

"See?" said Adrian, watching them appear, "I told you it wasn't hard...Come on, let's go in."

Jason and Skander climbed down an emergency staircase while Adrian slipped through the ceiling. The boys stared around the hotel. Using super-speed, they checked the rooms, going down, floor by floor. They found the hostages and the crooks, desperate drug-dealers, in the middle of a lounge on the fourth floor.

"Let the Shadow handle this..." said Adrian, grinning evilly at his two friends. Skander and Jason held back, watching their ghostly ally do his stuff.

A loud echoing laugh vibrated around the lounge, as if through surround-sound speakers...

"...Muauahahahahahahaa!!...Who knows what evil...Lurks in the hearts of men? Hehehahahahahaah!! The Shadow knows! Hauahahahahahahaha!!..."

"You gotta admit..." Jason whispered in Skander's ear, "Adrian has style!"

"What is this!?" one of the druggies shouted, "Some stupid radio-broadcast!?"

Another, echoing, evil laugh filled the hall.

"Oh no..." said Adrian. Invisibly, he floated through the air. He surrounded the man who'd spoken. Adrian grabbed a revolver and bullets hidden inside the man's coat. Materialising on the other end of the room, Adrian cocked the pistol.

"Missing something?" he asked. He pointed the gun. The people screamed.

"Now you see me..."

Adrian vanished into thin air, the gun going with him.

"...now you don't!" he said, his voice echoing creepily around.

"Put down your guns," the disembodied voice said. "And head out where all those nice friendly coppers have their own hotel for you."

"Screw you!" one of the men said, "Who are you!? I swear I'm gonna shoot!"

"Can't hit whatcha can't see, now can you?" the ghost asked, and chuckled.
"Smart-ass...well perhaps not! But I sure as hell can hit what I CAN see!" he said.

Suddenly, the man and the others screamed as Adrian appeared barely two feet in front of him, the gun pointed right between the eyes.

"Okay, shoot," said Adrian. The man was trembling, his hands were shaking so much he could barely hold the gun. He fired! The bullet went right through Adrian and hit the trunk of a potted palm tree.

"Path-et-ic..." said Adrian, smirking. "Naughty boy..." he reached out and grabbed the other gun, stuffing it into his whispy coat.

"Let's get in there..." Jason whispered. Skander nodded. They threw open the doors to the lounge and charged in. The men opened fire!

It was quite hopeless.

The bullets hit Skander and Jason in the chest...but that was it. Rebounding like peas or flattening themselves like miniature globs of mashed-potato, the bullets bounced harmelssly off them. The two boys floated through the air and grabbed the crooks, disarming them quickly and forcing them to the ground. A hostage stood up, "Who are you guys!?" he shouted.

"Trident Force," said Jason. He hovered down to the ground. "Now if you don't mind, I need your tie."

The man undid his necktie. Jason used it to tie up the crooks arms behind their backs and to tie them all together until they looked like some ridiculous entry into a crazy race, the four crooks had their hands tied behind their backs, and their hands tied to each other behind their backs, until neither could move at all. The cops raced upstairs and stopped, grinning and laughing.

"Nice work, boys," they said. "Come on, you four...It's gonna be 25 years in the slammer for you..."

Adrian tugged out the guns from his coat and gave them to Stryker. He whispered something in Skander's ear.

"You might want these, officer," said Skander, "Their weapons and ammo."

"Thanks kid," said the policeman. He opened a bag and dropped them in. "Okay boys...easy on the stairs..."
1432122222112.title: Showdown at the Sundowner.

choices: Shine the ghost out of the house and out of my life.
Help the ghost, and vice versa.
Leave the decision hanging in the air.
1433.content:
Truth be told, I thought I was dreaming, but since when do dreams feel so...real! I hope that I am dreaming, but some part of me, wants this to be real. Well, I have seen stranger things.
There was a huge gap of awkward silence as he smokes his cigarette. I decided to break the silence.

'So...Why are you here?' I asked nervously.
'I told you, this is my house and this is my room!' he said, tired of repeating himself.
'Yeah, but since I live here now, can we call it MY room?'
'Uhhh... NO!' he said bitterly.

I think this ghost is trying to get me out of this house. I have to get rid of it somehow, but what can I do? I pinched myself to make sure that I was dreaming. I wasn't. Now that I have established that, I have to find the ghost's weakness. I decide to stall.

'What WERE you're hobbies?' I asked trying to act like I care.
'I used to play Chinese checkers with the butcher's son,' Adrian said, 'he was my best friend.'
'Interesting...'

There has to be some way to get rid of him. Using brute force won't work, he's a ghost...that smokes. What are ghosts most afraid of?

'Oh Tim Robbinson,' Adrian was babbling to himself, 'if only I can see you again.'

Maybe I can vacuum him into an anti-ghost bag... Wait. Ghosts are afraid of the light. I thought that the light in the room was a bit dark. Where is a strong source of light? I have quite a strong flashlight in my desk drawer. I quietly opened the drawer. That Adrian ghost is still rambling on. I took my flashlight and pointed it at him, switched on, as fast as I can.

'Die ghost, DIEEEE!' I shouted.

I looked to see if he is still there, and he was, not impressed at all.

'Oh, so that's how it was going to be!' Adrian sneered

He looked angry as he approuched me. I am about to be killed by a ghost. What am I going to do? If I was going to do something, I'd better do it fast. I stood up and ran for the door, but the ghost slammed it shut. He took out something that looked like a butcher's knife. It can't end like this.

Suddenly, out of the blue, my teeth started to glow. It became brighter and brighter and then...I smiled. The ghost grunted at the sight of the bright light my teeth were giving off. The light became brighter and brighter. The ghost screamed like a baby.

'Aaaahhhhh!' he screamed, 'Turn it off, turn it off!'
'Why should I?' I asked angrily.
'I can help you!' he said out of desperation.

I closed my mouth and therefore dimmed the light.

'I can help you,' he repeated, 'only if you help me first.'

I didn't know if I can trust him, but help from a ghost can be usefull.
So what was I to do?
1433.title: Skander wonders what's going on. Now he can...

choices: Tell your parents
Try to hide the giant stone statue.
14331.content:
Skander, a little confused as to what exactly was going on, opened his mouth, and waited for the light to start streaming out like a hurricane. To be trite, the light never came.

The ghost smiled. "Sooooo," he said, viciously, once again reaching for his knife, "still trying to me out?" He advanced upon Skander, raising the blade higher in the air.

Skander backed up until he felt the wall against him. He was cornered by this evil character before him, ready to kill him for ownership of the room. Skander kept flashing his pearly-whites at the ghost; constantly smiling, then closing, smiling, then closing.

"What's the matter kid," came that voice, "got a twitch?" He laughed bitterly, and stabbed at him. Skander raised his arm to defend himself, and, after a few seconds of silence, and hidden eyes, found that there was no pain, as was expected. Instead, as Skander found as he raised his head to view the circumstance, the ghost had turned to stone; pure, physical, touchable stone.

"No way," Skander whispered in awe, "no way..."

He stood, and looked upon the stone statue that was taking up room in, what is now officially, his room.
14331.title: Shine the ghost out of the house and out of my ...

Someone tries to break into his house right there.
Reader's Choice.  Make it count.
144.content:
As Skander started reading, he started to drift off into sleep. Even though he slept through his alarm, he felt tired. As Skander fell asleep, he started to feel a strange feeling in his eyes. He figured that it was just his tired eyes. "SKANDER JONES!" His English teacher yelled. "No falling asleep in my classroom!"

"Sorry Mrs. Pinckett," Skander yawned. "I really don't feel well. Can I go to the Nurse?"

"Fine, I'll write you a pass," Mrs. Pinckett answered reluctantly. As she was writing his pass, Skander began to notice the weird feeling in his eyes again. This time though, his eyes were open. As he looked at Mrs. Pinckett's desk, he noticed he was able to see right through it like it wasn't there. He screamed bloody murder. "Skander, are you okay?" The teacher asked.

"No, I need to get home! I'm in pain!" Skander lied. He needed to ask his mother about this.

"Just go to the Nurse already! I have a class to teach," Mrs. Pinckett insisted. Skander ran through the halls to the Nurse, somehow faked a fever, and got a one way ride home from his mother.

"Mom, I have a question for you," Skander informed his mother about his X-ray vision. "Why can I do that?"

"Well, the answer is quite simple, yet simultaneously unbelievable. Skander, you and I are actually aliens. The last of our kind in fact," Mrs. Jones explained. "Our race has a very rare trait where some can develop super powers. It is extremely rare. The last of our race to develop powers died 500 years ago. However, before I left the planet with you on a regular trade mission, our planet blew up. When I returned to the site of our planet, it was gone. I fled to the first planet I could find, which was Earth. You and I are the only ones left!" She started to cry.

"Oh, I did not know that." Skander said with a look of absolute shock.

"That's not all though," Mrs. Jones added. "I read up on this rare trait, because the doctors knew that you had it since you were born. Apparently, on different planets with different atmospheres, different things can happen with the trait. It depends on the elements in the atmosphere. Our home planet had a atmosphere made mostly of oxygen and water vapor. However, I read that nitrogen makes the super power trait much stronger and more developed. Since this atmosphere is made of almost 80% nitrogen, expect a lot of powers and changes soon. The powers usually develop when the person turns 17. You turned 17 one week ago. This seems right."

"Well, I'm going to be developing powers. I might as well become a superhero!" Skander cheered up. "I think just having X-ray vision is pretty lame though. You can't do much with that."

"In due time," Mrs. Jones assured Skander. "Soon, you will have more. Until then, you should get some rest. You didn't sleep well, did you."

Mrs. Jones and Skander arrived at the Jones household, and Skander immediately ran to his bed. He fell asleep almost immediately.

When he woke up, he felt different. He walked over to the bathroom, and noticed that his once skinny, tall body became a muscular one. He looked like a junior bodybuilder, built with big, ripped muscles. He also felt stronger. He decided to test his strength by going to his basement gym. He has been trying to bulk up, but nothing worked. Now, he needed to see if he got stronger. He entered the gym, which only had a couple of weights, a barbell, and a bar to do pull ups. Skander's pull up record before was only 3, but now he felt unstoppable. He walked up to the bar, jumped onto it, and started pulling up. It was incredibly easy. He started doing it with one hand, while holding the heaviest dumbbell he could find in the other. It was still incredibly easy. "I've definitely acquired super strength. What about speed?" He asked himself. He cleared the middle of the room, and started to run around in a circle. He got faster and faster and faster, all without tiring. "Speed, check. Flight?" He jumped into the air, and started hovering in the air. He moved around, and landed softly. "Check. Durability? If not, this is going to hurt." He took the 20 pound dumbbell, held it over his 8 pack abs, and dropped it. It bounced off harmlessly, leaving no mark, and with Skander feeling no pain. "Check, thankfully. What else can I do?" He went back upstairs to his computer, and looked up a list of super powers. "What about laser vision?" He took a piece of scrap paper, and focused on trying to vaporize it. Eventually, a beam of light came out of his eyes, setting the paper ablaze. "Huh, I wonder if I can make it different colors. It would be cool to have blue laser eyes." He took another piece of paper, and focused on it, this time thinking about blue. Somehow, it worked, and the paper burned blue. "Cool, what else is here? Telekinesis." He concentrated on lifting his trash can. Soon, the can lifted into the air. Then, he made his bed with his mind, making sure he could do specific things. Then, for the hell of it, he lifted his bed, both with his arms and mind. They were both very easy for him. "Next is, walking on water." Skander, still only in his shorts, went outside to his pool, and stepped onto the water, only to notice that he was not going under. He thought about going underwater, and he fell in, only to notice that he could breathe and see clearly underwater. What can't I do? He thought. He swam back up to the surface, where he tried to make an energy ball in his hand, similar to the Dragon Ball series. It also worked. As he fired it straight up, he noticed his mother coming home. She must have gone out food shopping. Before he was to go into the house to help her and tell her about his powers, he watched as the energy ball exploded high in the sky. He hoped that he did not hit a plane.

"Hi Skander, you look different," his mother commented on Skander's new physique.

"Yeah, just found my powers. There are a lot, and I'm still finding more," Skander retorted. He listed off all the powers he's found. "I think if I become a superhero though, I'm going to need a costume."

"Yeah, I can make you one," Mrs. Jones said.

"Thanks mom!" Skander said happily. "Well, I'm going to see if I have more powers. See you when I'm done." Skander went back up to his room. "Okay, strength, speed, durability, flight, telekinesis, laser eyes, walking on water, breathing underwater, energy balls, x-ray vision, what else? Teleportation?" He focused on himself being on his bed rather than in his chair. Nothing happened. "Oh well, guess I'm flying everywhere. How terrible," he said sarcastically. "I don't think shape shifting is something that I'd have." He continued skimming through the lengthy page. He then came across psychokinesis. "Includes pyrokinesis, metalkinesis and hydrokinesis. Some telekinetics also have these powers. Let's see if I'm that someone!" He took a glass of water, and tried to make the water float. It worked. Next, he tried to create a ball of fire in his hand. It worked. He made sure that the smoke did not set of the smoke alarm. Then, he tried to bend his metal trash can without his super strength. It became a mess of metal. Finally, at the bottom of the page, he noticed force fields. Skander tried to conjure up a force field. He saw a small translucent sphere hovering in the air. He bent the shape around, making it flat, then a square, then a cube. The then through a pencil at it. The pencil bounced off. He then tried to make a one way force field. He telekinetically retrieved the pencil, then threw it again. It bounced off one side of the field. He retrieved the pencil again, turned the force field around, and threw the pencil, which passed right through. "Awesome. All these powers. Once mom's done with my suit, I can be a superhero! I think I'll be The Blaze." Skander made that decision, and went downstairs. "Mom, when you make my costume, can you make it with this in mind? I decided my name was The Blaze. Thanks mom!" He requested.

"Sure." His mother responded. I hope he uses his powers for good. She thought. Unbeknownst to her, Skander heard that, because he can read minds. He went to the kitchen to make himself some lunch. He decided to make a sandwich. As he was cutting it in half, he cut his finger. The cut closed immediately though. "Regenerative healing. I can get used to this," he laughed as he ate his sandwich.

Rules for continuing this story:

Don't kill Skander, and keep his powers consistent. If you add some, make sure he goes through the "discovering a new power" process. Keep Skander a hero, but if you want to make an evil super villain, be my guest. With that, feel free to add on! Don't be shy!
