Jasper Hillard Davian was your typical, idealised teenage boy. Tallness ran in his family. His cousin Mike was almost seven feet. At six and a half, Jasper felt as small as five two.

"Are you coming OUT yet!?"

"Just a minute!"

"Jasper! Come on!"

Jasper groaned. Mothers!

The tall, muscular teenager dumped about two gallons of gel into his hair to fix it up right. He hated it when it stuck up unevenly. He wanted it to look good. Not "caveman" good, but "rough-and-tough" good. He spent more time tweaking, modelling and sculping his head of brown hair than a sculptor spent modelling a block of clay. Finally satisfied with his hair after the sixth time, he came out of the bathroom. He tugged on his jacket and grabbed his backpack.

"Honey, if you're going to spend that much time in the bathroom, at least try and hurry up in the mornings, hmm?" said Alison.
"Sorry, maah," said Jasper. They headed out the door and into the driveway. Jasper threw his bag into the back seat and got in the front. His mother started the car.

"Oh damn!" she groaned.
"Now what?" he asked.
"Flat battery".
"Well how the hell did that happen?"
"Your FATHER, I'll bet! Jump-starting his car or something...Oh trust him to forget to...Ooooh! David I am going to fry you ALIVE when you get home! Honey, you better take your bike!"
"But mom!"
"No buts! I can't drive you today, sorry!"

Jasper groaned. He got out of the car and went to get his bike. He strapped his backpack onto the back of the bike and climbed on. He wasn't going to bother with a helmet. It would mess up his hairdo. He checked his reflection in the dial of his watch, which he kept more for making sure he was godlike gorgeous more than for checking the time. He pressed down on the pedals and the racing bike shot off. His long legs pumped up and down tirelessly as he whizzed along. This was easy! He remembered how much loved riding a bike when he was a kid. Perhaps he should do this from now on? Yeah...When it wasn't raining, at least. He took a corner, the tires squealed. He hit the pavement, jumped up and then pedalled through the school gates. He squeezed lightly on the brakes and the bike slid into the bike-rack. He forgot his lock! Crap! Forget it, he'd chance it this one time. He'd have to get a lock sooner or later, though.

Jasper unbuckled his backpack and headed inside. He checked his watch, this time to actually see if he was late. Nope. Fifteen minutes early. Sweet!

"Oh so you made it todae, didja Jaspy?"

Jasper looked up from his watch to see Brandt and Ivan striding towards him. Brandt was tall, like Jasper. His hair was a lighter brown, and shorter, neater. He had a strong Irish accent, which made him an absolute chick-magnet.

"Ve vondered vhen you vuld get here!" said Ivan. Ivan Pytor Loskov was a Russian. He looked like some Cold-War-era spy. Five feet, nine inches tall, with very, very, VERY short, buzz-cut blond hair. His body was so pale he might have been bathed in bleach as a baby. He was very thin and sharp.

"Well you guys had each other for company, didn't you?" said Jasper, "What's up?"

"Zis crazy booze-sviller, he still hasn't returned my iPod yet!" Ivan said, "And I vant it back, Brandt, or the next song you vill listen to is zhe funeral march by Chopin, yes?"
"Alright alright...bloody Red!" said Brandt, "here, take your iPod!...We wondered where you were, Jasper.."
"Car broke down, I had to cycle to school instead," said Jasper. "Come on, we got history coming up in..."
"Vive minutes," said Ivan, checking his watch, "ve better move, come!"

"Five minutes,” Jasper repeats out loud.

I could use more than five minutes Jasper thought to himself. He closed his eyes and cursed himself for forgetting the lock to his bike. He knew that his bike was probably safe, and that most of the kids in his school could be trusted … most, but not all.

His thoughts ran to Michael Gibson the weirdest kid in school! Everyone knew Gib-stick, as they all called him because he was so skinny and weak from the time they were eight years old until today. He had always been different and most of the kids picked on him all the time, but in the past few months Gib-stick had become weirder still. He had started to put on weight, some muscle, and he had started fighting back against all those who had picked on him, and he always won. His fights were so strange. He seemed to never throw a punch or make a move, but he would win and hurt the other kid badly. Everyone now knew that you did not cross Gib-stick. Even to call him Gib-stick was enough to get yourself very, very hurt. Jasper did not even want to think the name Gib-stick because it seemed like Gib-stick, Michael, knew when people were talking about him. It was like he could read your thoughts.

Jasper had never referred to Michael as Gib-stick or joined in when other kids picked on him. Jasper always said hello to Michael, but they were never friends. However, a few days earlier Jasper was running down the hall because he was late for class. He turned a corner quickly and collided with Michael. Michael fell to the ground hard and all of his books and papers flew in every direction. Jasper had not seen him until it was too late, and did not feel the impact of their collision as Michael had. As Jasper stood still above Michael, who was struggling to get up, they made eye contact.

“I’m sorry, Michael, I am late for Anatomy. I didn’t mean to knock you over,” Jasper explained quickly as he offered a hand out to Michael to help him up.

Michael did not say a word. He only stared coolly into Jasper’s eyes. Jasper felt a strange sensation deep in his body. Like a warming sensation that was growing hotter and hotter. Jasper looked down to his midsection where the heat was coming from and then quickly back to Michael. Michael broke his stare and the sensation left Jasper’s body. Jasper did not know if in that moment he was feeling a new strange power beginning or if it was something else.

Michael did accept Jasper’s assistance. He slowly got to his feet and began retrieving his books and papers from the hallway floor. Jasper picked up a book and was reaching for another set of papers when Michael said, “Just leave them. Get on to class. I don’t want your help.”

Jasper knew it was best to leave Michael so to not anger him further. “I am really sorry, Michael,” Jasper said over his shoulder as he turned to leave. Just then Jasper realized that three of the prettiest girls in their grade were watching the whole thing. These girls had always picked on Michael. They are the three who had come up with the name Gib-stick. It was no secret that Michael had a crush on all three of the girls, and especially their leader Haley Stedt. Haley was a devious girl who liked to tease Michael. She would flirt with him all the time, but always called him Gib-stick while the other girls giggled.

Jasper knew this situation was about to get worse for Michael, and it did.

“Hey, Gib-stick, are you gonna let Jasper run all over you like that?” Haley was the first to call out. The other two were quick to join in with their jeering and continuous giggling. Jasper turned back to Michael and their eyes met again. Jasper knew that Michael would not be angry at the girls. He knew that Michael would blame their teasing on him this time, and he was right.

“You think this is funny?” Michael said in a low angry voice to Jasper.

“No, I didn’t mean to run into you, Michael,” Jasper replied emphasizing the name Michael in his reply. It was then that Jasper realized that all of the books and papers that had just been scattered throughout the hallway were neatly stacked in Michael’s arms.

Michael interrupted Jasper’s thoughts, “Don’t worry about it. Soon enough they will be laughing at you!” With that Michael walked past Jasper with a terse grin on his lips.

Jasper had forgotten about this encounter until now. For some reason Jasper knew that he should have locked his bike, but he also thought that it would not matter. If Michael Gibson wanted Jasper’s bike, no lock was going to protect it. It was then that Jasper realized that he had been standing in the hallway with his eyes closed reliving this encounter for several moments. Jasper opened his eyes.

Everything and everyone in school was frozen in place. Jasper turned around. A younger student had been carrying her books loosely and one had come loose and was falling to the ground. Jasper looked astonishingly at the book suspended in mid-fall. The book was opening. A neatly folded note had started to escape the book’s pages and was frozen on the edge of freedom. Jasper recognized this as the kind of notes his female classmates pass to one anther during boring lectures. The whole world seemed frozen in place. Jasper walked around the hallways and peeked inside of classrooms. Nothing moved. No fans were turning. No one breathed. Jasper thought nearly half an hour had passed, and still nothing had changed. He looked at his watch. No time had passed! It was still five minutes until the hour.

Jasper realized that he had done this. I just wanted more that five minutes to talk with Brandt and Ivan before going to history class. I wonder if the whole world is stopped, or just what is close to me. I wonder how I get it to start again. I wonder if they can all see me walking around them. These thoughts and more all ran through Jasper’s head.

153.content:
History class went by fairly fast. They were studying the Second World War. Hearing about blood and guts and battles made it interesting and the double-period seemed to fly by.

"Man you dudes got CREAMED in Stalingrad," said Jasper.
"Shut up," said Ivan. "Come on, it's time for our recess break".

Grabbing their books, the three friends left the classroom and went to their lockers. Jasper dumped his books on top of his locker while he tried to open his locker. He shoved the key into the padlock and turned.

Nothing happened.

"What the hell?" he thought. He pulled the key out and checked it. Yeah, this was the right one. He shoved it back in and turned it. Still nothing.

"DAMN IT!" he screamed. He rammed the key in a third time and twisted it.

SNAP!

Brandt and Ivan jumped.

"What the hell...?" Jasper goggled. He held out his hand to find half his key there. The other half was stuck inside the now busted padlock.

"Duuude, what did you DO?" said Brandt. He was examining the broken key, snapped clean in half.

"I...It's this stupid locker!" Jasper groaned. He grabbed the lock and squeezed, trying to rip it off. Perhaps it was so screwed that the shackle would just break. He wrenched it.

It didn't move.

"GAAAAH!" Jasper screamed. He slammed his fist against the lock. He felt something give! Then a sharp pain as something hit his foot. He bent down and picked up half his padlock from the floor. The shackle of his lock was still attached to his door.

"Woah..." he said. He slid the shackle away from the door and held the two halves of the lock in his hands, "Damn!" he said.

"You didn't..." said Brandt.
"What?"
"You snapped that thing in half!"

Jasper looked at the lock. No he didn't!...Wait...yes he did! This lock was only a week old. It was brand new! It shouldn't break like this, should it?

Jasper squeezed the shackle of the lock in his hand. He felt it bend beneath his fingers. He raised an eyebrow. He put the other bit of the lock in his pocket and started twiddling around with the broken shackle. He twisted it, bent it, straightened it, twirled it up into a spiral around one of his fingers...This was SOLID STEEL! How could he bend it like this?

"Oi Ivan, you seeing this?" Brandt asked in disbelief. Ivan nodded. Jasper had now opened his locker, put his books into it, closed it and put the shackle through the loops in the door to hold the thing closed. He tied the bar of steel up into a neat bow, and left it there.

"I never knew I could do this!" said Jasper. "Perhaps the metal was faulty".

Jasper and Ivan walked off. Brandt stared at the bow of steel. He tried to squeeze it like Jasper had done.

"Ouch!" he winced as he nearly broke his fingers. "How did he DO that?"

Jasper turned around to see Derek, Zach, Arnold and Billy. They were your typical, stuck-up, rebellious teens. Jasper had had enough of their bullying and teasing. They usually picked on Brandt and Ivan because they weren't born in America. As expected, they largely ignored Jasper, and turned to the other boys.

The boys sailed through the air like baseballs, hitting the sandpit of the elementary school next door. They staggered to their feet, spitting sand out of their mouths and brushing it out of their hair.

1533.title: Bad Boys.

15331.content:
Sunday evening and Jasper finished the last of his maths homework. He closed the book, capped his pen and swivelled around in his chair to surf the 'net. He brought up the site for the local newspaper and checked the forecast. Every single day for the next week was going to be boiling hot. He checked through the weather warnings. No fires, no barbeques, keep out of the sun...

"All schools closed by local Board of Education"

Jasper read the message again. Due to the extreme heat, all schools in the metropolitan area were to be closed for a week. Jasper grinned. A weeklong free holiday! Awesome. He packed his bag and then left his room. His parents were in the living-room, watching television.

"...and that concludes the news for this evening..." said the announcer on the nightly news. David Davian changed the channel to watch sports while Jasper's mother started doing the ironing.

"Lucky kid," said Jasper's father, "No school for you this week!"
"I know," said Jasper. He sat down. "I think it's already getting to me, I'm feeling kinda woozy".
"Have dinner, then you can go sleep," said his mother.

Jasper headed into the kitchen. His mother was a phenomenal cook. A huge pizza and an entire pan of lasagna was cooling on the island counter.

"Aren't you guys eating?" Jasper asked.
"We've already had two pizzas between us," said Jasper's dad, "You can have the rest".
"Okay".

And Jasper sat down to eat.

"Our little boy's growing up so fast," said Jasper's mother, smiling at her husband. David grinned, "He's fine, sweetheart. He's healthy, he's gotta good appetite and he's doing well in school. What else could we ask for?"

Jasper's mother looked up when she heard the dishwasher door close.

"Done!" Jasper shouted, "I'm off to bed!"

Jasper's mother headed into the kitchen and gasped. The entire pizza and the whole pan of lasagna were gone. That kid sure knew how to eat!...Aaah but he was a growing boy. Nothing wrong with that...
15331.title: Heatwave.

153311.content:
The heatwave that was forecast certainly lived up to its name. On Monday morning it was already 115 degrees Fahrenheit, with the mercury only expecting to rise, and not drop. Jasper groaned and rolled over fitfully in bed. He hated hot weather. He always found it impossible to sleep in hot weather. He rolled over and got out of bed. Maaan he felt dizzy. He got up and stumbled over to the bathroom to brush his teeth. He parked himself in front of the sink and reached down for his toothbrush and toothpaste. He lathered up his mouth and started scrubbing.

Was the top of the mirror always this close to his forehead? He didn't remember it being that close. Perhaps the heat was warping his mind or something. Yeah, that was it. Just the heat. He finished brushing his teeth and went back into his room to change. His clothes felt a little tight. Perhaps he was working out a bit too much. Hehehe. He tugged them on anyway, and then went into the kitchen, where his mother was making cereal for breakfast.

"Hey sweetie!" she said, and she hopped up on her tip-toes to give him a kiss, "Hungry?"
"Mmmm..." Jasper mumbled, and sat down.
"Hey champ!" said Jasper's dad, "Honey".
"Sweetie," said Mrs. Davian.
"I'll see you folks this evening," said David. He gave his son a ruffle of his brown hair and his wife a kiss, "You be good now, Jasp".
"Yeah pa," said Jasper. He started eating his cereal. He was really hungry. He ate one. Two. Three. Four. Five bowls. By the time he was done, the box of Frosty Flakes was completely empty. He got up and wondered what to do today. Nothing too exertive. It was waaay to hot for that. He'd watch a movie or something. He went back to his room, turned on his computer and put a DVD into the disc-drive. He'd sit back and watch a few movies, yeah, that sounded like a good idea. He turned off the lights and turned on the air-conditioning, and went to find something to eat.

"Back again?" his mother asked, "You ARE hungry!"
"So?" Jasper asked.
"Nothing," she said, "Just nice to see you eating".
"Thanks," said Jasper. He took an entire tub of ice-cream and a spoon back to his room. He had serious munchies. He had no idea why he was so hungry, but he was. So he took a bottle of lemonade and a glass back to his room, too.
153311.title: Morning Person.

choices: Jasper wonders what else he can set on fire.
Jasper remembers his super-strength. He wonders if he can break something.
1533111.content:
Jasper laughed and laughed and laughed. He was watching a comedy film which he hadn't seen in ages and he was really enjoying it. He slurped and licked away at the ice-cream and gulped down the lemonade. The cold, tingliness felt good inside his sweltering body. When the movie was over, he took the DVD out of the disc-drive of his computer and put in another one. And watched that. After perhaps eight hours of solid film-watching, Jasper got up to stretch. He had a serious crick in his back. He stood up and stretched. He threw his arms up and yawned and groaned and...touched the ceiling with his hands.

No way.

Jasper knew he was tall, but he wasn't that tall!...was he? He reached up again. He could press his fingers firmly into the ceiling above his head. He was sure he wasn't able to do this yesterday! He looked around. He didn't feel any taller. And yet he could touch the ceiling. But then how often DID he touch the ceiling with his hands? Not that often. Perhaps he could always do it, and he just never noticed it. Yeah, that was it. He sat down in his chair again and kicked it around, spinning around lazily, his body stretched out and relaxed. He pushed his chair over to the mirror hanging next to his wardrobe and looked at it. He let out a yelp like a wounded dog.

Staring back at him was a Jasper Davian with brown hair, muscular physique, tall stature and...glowing red eyes. Jasper's jaw dropped. He got up and stumbled through his room in the dark. He grabbed the light-switch and flipped it. He ran back to the mirror and stared. His eyes were bloodshot red. They even seemed to be glowing. He narrowed his eyes and the glowing seemed to become even stronger. Suddenly, a red beam shot out of his eyes, striking a scrunched up tissue-paper on the table underneath the mirror. The piece of tissue burst into flames, and just as quickly, smouldered into ashes.

"What the hell!?" he yelped. He reached down and picked up the tissue. It crumbled into black and grey fluffy ashes between his fingers. He just set something on fire with his eyes! This was not human. He stood up and wondered what was going on. He stared at the mirror again and blinked. His eyes returned to their normal colour. He blinked again. Still normal. He narrowed them. They flooded with redness, when he opened his eyes properly again, they were blood red, again. Jasper picked up a spool of thread on his dressing-table. Jasper was always vain and this included his clothing. He hated having loose buttons or rips or tears, and he was too impatient to wait for his mother to repair his clothes, so he usually did all his own sewing. He concentrated his eyes on the roll of thread and another red beam shot out of his eyes, hitting it solidly in the middle. It took a bit longer, but soon, the thread started to smoulder. Then it blackened. But nothing else. Wait...fire always burned upwards. Jasper tilted the spool of thread in his fingers and concentrated on the lowest part of the spool, which was now at a roughly 45-degree angle. The threads caught fire and suddenly, the flames raced up and around the cardboard spool and the thread and suddenly, Jasper found himself holding a fireball in his hands!

Only...It didn't hurt. He rolled it from hand to hand. He closed his hands around it, he clenched the flaming lump of cotton in one hand, and then the other. It didn't hurt him at all! He could feel the flames on his fingers and hands, but they felt like nothing more than a slight tingling.
1533111.title: Red Eyes.

choices: Monday again. Time for school...
Something happens during the night.
15331112.content:
This was...scary, but also kinda cool. Jasper wondered what else he could do now. He could set things on fire and he could...Oh yeah, the super-strength dealie. He stood up and wondered what he could test his strength on. There was an empty plastic bottle on his desk. He grabbed it and squeezed it. The cap flew off under the immense pressure. it hit the curtains and clattered to the floor. A few, easy squeezes and he'd turned the bottle from a 600ml lemonade container into a pellet of plastic no bigger than a quarter. It was like folding tissue-paper. That was EASY. He wondered what else he could do. He headed onto the back patio where he found a whole heap of firewood which his dad had been chopping up for the winter. Jasper set up a couple of logs and picked up the biggest axe he could find. It was a beasty chunk of steel on a shaft of wood - the log-splitter.

He kept his legs wide apart and tried to remember what his dad had taught him about splitting logs. High, fast, aim for the edge of the log. Right.

Jasper tapped the log gently with the blade, to mark his target. He heaved the axe above his head and let it drop.

WHAM!

The log, a piece of oak, nine inches across, was blasted apart by the axe. The two halves of the log flew off into the distance. Jasper collected them again, aimed and let the axe drop. Wham! Wham! He'd split the log into quarters. He tossed it aside. As he did more logs, he found it became easier and easier to do, until it was as easy as chopping up vegetables. Soon, he was holding one axe in each arm, swinging back and forth, shattering logs and then tossing them aside. He finished the last few logs and then decided that it was getting far too hot to continue. He put the axes aside and headed indoors. He was sweating like a pig. Stripping naked, he stepped into the shower in the bathroom and turned on the tap. The water was cool and wonderfully refreshing...and it was splashing over his chest.

What?

Jasper stepped out of the stream of water to discover that the shower-head only reached his shoulders! He would have to sit down if he wanted to have a proper shower. He squatted down in the shower-cubicle and started cleaning himself. Once he was done, he stepped out...and hit his head on the top of the shower's door-frame. He swore and rubbed his forehead tenderly. He dried himself and then headed off to find more clothes. He tugged them uncomfortably on and stared at himself in the mirror. The T-shirt and shorts were uncomfortably tight. He decided that just shorts would do. He grabbed the T-shirt and tried to take it off. But it wouldn't budge. It was clinging to his body like paint! He tugged and stretched and crinkled and grabbed...but it would not move!

"Damn it!" he screamed. He threw his arms up and the shirt ripped open! At the same time, the door to his bedroom swung open and an elderly woman in her seventies peeped around the door.

"Did I hear a young man in here using improper language?" she asked.
"Sorry nana," Jasper said, "It's my..."
"...Weeeeeell," said nana, walking in, "Aren't YOU getting strong!"

Jasper blushed. His grandmother had a very flirty and dirty sense of humor for an old lady, and she certainly never held back. She came in and grabbed him around the chest and abs. "Mmm!" she said. "Growing up fast, aren't you Jaspy?"
"Gran!"

The old woman laughed, "Here, I'll help you with the shirt, sweetums," she said. And carefully, she tugged it off him, to reveal her grandson in all his topless glory.

"Awww, aren't you adorable," she said. Jasper bent down and the old woman gave him a kiss. "What are you going to wear?" she asked.
"I dunno, none of my shirts fit me," Jasper said. "I guess I can just wear the shorts".

Nana looked at the shorts, which left nothing to the imagination. "Those shorts?" she asked. "Aren't they a bit...tight?"
"They're all I have!" Jasper said, exasperatedly.

"Oooh, poor sweetums. Well anyway, it's time for dinner!"

Jasper followed his grandmother into the dining-room where the family sat down for sushi. Something cold and filling was what they needed on such a hot day. Jasper ate roll after roll after slice after slice.

"Aren't you eating a bit much, son?" David asked.
"Nonsense!" said nana, "He's a growing boy! Aren't you, sweetums?"
"Graaaan!" Jasper groaned. Jasper's mother laughed, "Mom, stop teasing!" she said.

Jasper finished his meal, had a few drinks, cleaned up and then went to bed. The heat was making him drowsy. He turned his air-conditioning on full-blast, turned off all the lights and climbed into bed...

WHUNK!

What had happened? He had thought about getting down to earth...and he did. Perhaps if he thought about flying or floating or...hovering or...whatever it was!...he would do that too?

"Fly!" he said.

"Forward"? he whispered.

WHUNK!

"Forward!"

Finally, he stopped, his feet hitting the floorboards. This was weird. He needed a drink to clear his head. He opened the bedroom door and went to get a glass of water. "You better get home and get some new clothes, Jasper!" Ivan said.

He bent down and picked them up easily. He jumped into the air and flew off back home. School could wait....

153311121211211111111.content:
"Alright alright I'm coming!" said a voice, and granny bustled across the hall and opened the door.

"Ye...well!"
"Hey gran," said Jasper, "Can I come in?"
"Oh sure, come in, come in...And who are these two?"
"Oh, this is Ivan and this is Brandt".
"Hi," the two boys said.

Nanna stepped aside as the two boys and a giant teen entered the hall, she closed the door behind him, her eyes following her enormous grandson as he stretched up to his full height in the hall, one of the few places in the house with a significantly high ceiling.

"Darling, I'm sure you're very proud of your...musculature...but social customs dictate that you wear CLOTHES when you go out!"
"Gran, I RIPPED OUT OF MY CLOTHES!" Jasper shouted.
"Ooooh?" said the old woman, examining the tattered remains of her son's jeans and shirt, "My my...we ARE growing fast, aren't we?"
"Six inches fast!" Jasper said.

Nanna Davian's eyes bulged, "Six...INCHES? Oh my...Well...you ARE getting big, aren't you?"
"Gran, I need some CLOTHES!" Jasper said, exasperatedly.
"Alright, alright, keep your undies on...they're the only thing you have on, and you're not taking them off when you're around me!"
"Do you HAVE any clothes!?" Jasper asked.
"Yes," said nanna, "I suspected you hadn't stopped growing yet, so I made some clothes for you myself, they might be a BIT tight...six inches in a day? I hadn't expected that...but, well, we'll see!"

The old woman left the three friends standing in the hall, and headed off to her room. She came back a few minutes later with a simple cotton shirt and some shorts. The shirt was a T-shirt with white with black stripes on it, and the shorts were dark blue.

"There, put those on!" she said.
"Where'd you get so much fabric?" Brandt asked.
"I used to be a seamstress," said nanna, "I have my sources".

Slowly, Jasper tugged on the clothes. They actually fit pretty good. He smiled and looked at himself in the mirror. "These are alright!" he said, turning around as if he'd just put on an expensive, pure-wool, three-piece suit with a shirt made of Eygptian cotton and a tie made of French silk.

"Well, it'll do...for now," said granny. "But I'll probably have to make more clothes for you sometime in the future, I expect...Well...I have to prepare dinner. Are you two staying?" she asked, looking at Brandt and Ivan. The two boys looked at each other, and then looked at Jasper, who was looking at them.

"Why not?" Brandt said. "Our parents won't mind".
"Excellent!" said granny. "Jasper, darling, I want you to do something for me while I prepare dinner..."
"Sure nanna, what is it?" Jasper asked.
153311121211211111111.title: Granny Knows Best.

1533111212112111111111.content:
"Be a good little boy, pick up your brother from school, hmm?" she asked.

"I have to cook dinner! It's spaghetti and lasagna tonight. You know how long that takes me. And I KNOW it's your favourite!...Hmm chubkins?"
"Grrraaaaaaaan!"

She smiled and slapped her grandson on the ass with a wooden spoon, "Go on! Or he'll be late home!"

"Hehehehe...chubkins," said Brandt.
"Shut up, Brandt," Jasper said.

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---

"Hunter, what ARE you doing?" two of his friends asked. Hunter was standing near the school gates, holding onto his backpack, and staring up into the sky. He appeared to be looking for something.
"I...huh? Oh...I'm...just waiting for my brother..." he said, distractedly.
"What, you expect your brother to come flying in or something?" said one of his friends.
"Well...yeah," said Hunter.
"Oh pfffft! He's only human, man! He's not like...the concorde or something!"
"He WILL come!" Hunter said, "And he WILL fly! And he..."
"WOAH DUDE!"

Hunter turned around. Something tall. Bulky. HUGE, was blocking the sun and walking towards him. When the glare and shadows balanced out, Hunter groaned.

"Hey kid, time to go home," said Jasper.
"Awww Jasper! I wanted you to fly here!"
"Sorry kid, I done enough flying today, get your bag".

Hunter picked up his bag and Jasper bent down to help him put the straps on properly.

"Dude!" said one of Hunter's friends, "You are HUGE!"

"Well saw-rrey!"

Jasper ruffled his brother's hair and smiled, "Come on".

"Awwww...he's wuffling his brother's hair!" said another one of the boys, and he snickered.

"Jasper, you're embarrassing me...Please, can we fly home?" Hunter asked.
"Oh okay..." said Jasper, "Get on my back".

Hunter climbed onto his brother's leg, and then scrambled up his broad arms and back, locking his arms and legs over his brother's shoulders and leaning forward.

"Gonna piggyback him home too?" one of Hunter's friends asked, "Hunter, your brother can't fly!"
"Just watch!" said Hunter. "Come on, Jasper! Show them!"

Jasper cleared his throat, "This is DavianAir101 preparing for takeoff. Hold on tight and shield your eyes, kid. You two better stand back," he added, looking at Hunter's friends.

"Yeah right, what's the matter?" one of Hunter's friends asked, still grinning.
"It's to protect you from the downdraft," Jasper said.
"Pffft!"
"Suit yourself..."

WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!!!!!

Hunter's two friends were thrown back into a nearby bush by the force of Jasper taking off! They hit the bush and smashed through the branches, coughing and gasping.

"HOLY CRAP!" one of them screamed as they both watched Jasper soar off into the air.

"So," said Jasper, reaching back and patting his brother on the head, "How was school?"

choices: Mom and dad are home...DINNER TIME!!!
15331112121121111111111.content:
The kitchen windows flew open and Jasper came soaring in.

"Hi gran! Bye gran!" Hunter shouted as he whizzed past, holding onto Jasper's back. Jasper skidded to the ground in the entrance-hall and Hunter scrambled down off his brother's back.

"That was awesome!" he said, giving Jasper a hug. Jasper smiled and ruffled his brother's hair, "Yeah, now go do some of your homework. Dinner will be ready soon".
"I have to do a spelling-test..."
"Get mom and dad to help you with it later, okay man?"
"Can't you?"
"I got stuff to do!"

Before Hunter could reply, Jasper nudged him firmly in the direction of his bedroom, and then jogged back into the kitchen, where Brandt and Ivan were busy mixing the sauce.

"I see you're back," said Brandt, "That was a hell of an entrance!"
"Thanks," said Jasper. He bent over the saucepan and picked up a spoon.

CRACK!

"OW!!"
"No tasting! Naughty!"
"GRANDMA!!"
"OUT!"
"But!..."
"OUT! Go set the table!"

Still rubbing the tender spot on his ass where his grandmother had smacked him none too lightly with a wooden spoon, Jasper opened the cupboard and carried out plates, spoons, glasses, forks and knives.

"I'll get the drinks," said Ivan. He opened the fridge and brought out a large jug of milk.

"Your grandmother is quite a cook, Jasper, I should introduce her to mine, they'd get on like a flaming house!"
"Sure, Ivan, sure," said Jasper.
"She makes these beautiful little dumplings, stuffed with meat and potatoes and..."

"YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEOOOOOOOOOOOOWWWWWWW!!!!!"

Ivan screamed and could've jumped two feet in the air! Taffy shot out from underneath Ivan's foot and scarpered off down the corridor. Balancing the plates, glasses and cutlery in one hand, Jasper lunged backwards to try and grab the jug of milk. It flew out of Ivan's hand and plummetted downwards!

And stopped.

Jasper's hand was about a foot from the jug. And the jug was about three inches from the floor. It was hovering in midair!
"What the hell!?" Ivan gasped.
"Here juggy..." Jasper said, as if he was coaxing a frightened kitten out from under a bed, "Come here...good juggy...come on...come to Jasper...come on...COME ON!!"

The jug, jumped into the air and the milk inside it sloshed around. Then, to Ivan's amazement, it hovered over to Jasper, who grabbed it by the handle.

"How did you DO THAT?" he gasped.
"I...I dunno..." said Jasper. "I just thought...I...I..."

Everything had happened so fast, Jasper hadn't realised WHAT had happened! He just stopped a jug from falling five feet and smashing into a million pieces. The jug had hovered in mid-air and had come to him when called! What? Jasper had told Ivan and Brandt about his alien-beingness in class...written on a sheet of paper...but he didn't think his powers included the ability to levitate stuff!

Jasper headed to the table and put everything down.

"Try it again!" Ivan said. Jasper looked at everything, "Are you sure?"
"Go on!"

Jasper shrugged. "Um...okay...uhh...Hmmmm...."

Jasper paused. How the hell would he do this? How DID he do it? He stood there, thinking. Then, he raised a hand. The plates rose into the air. The knives and forks spilt off the plates, clattering onto the table.

"Whoops," Jasper said.
"How're you DOING THAT?" Ivan asked.
"I'm just...thinking about it. It's...mind-power, I think," Jasper said. Jaspr then waved his arms around the room, the plates flew, this way and that, skidding, clunking and clattering into place.

"Hey this is pretty fun!" he said. He continued to practice, with the glasses and cutlery.

"Try the jug again," said Ivan. "Fill the glasses!"

Jasper grinned. Holding out his hands and concentrating hard, and looking at the jug, Jasper watched it hovering mid-air. It floated from the middle of the table, over one of the glasses. Ivan picked up the glass. Jasper was thinking in his mind: Tip...tip...tip...come on...tip...tip over...tip...pour...tip...tip...

The jug slowly began to rise. The bottom rose up, and the top came down. Shakily, it started splooshing milk into the glass. It wasn't perfect, and Jasper felt he got more milk onto the table than he did get into the glass...but it was a start, anyway!

"I think I need practice," he said, when he watched Ivan wiping the milk off his right hand.

1533111212112111111111111.content:
Jasper groaned. He lay in his hammock in his room. The dinner had gone well. Ivan and Brandt had chatted, joked, shouted and argued, and eventually went home about nine thirty. Jasper had helped his grandmother clean up, while mom and dad helped Hunter with his homework. After convincing him that "Happiness" didn't have a 'y' in it, they sat down to watch some late-night television together while nanna went to do some writing. Jasper had already finished his homework. He whizzed through it at super-speed, turning the pages of his books so fast he nearly set them on fire. Right now, he lay in his temporary bed, wondering what to do. Why not practice that telekinesis thing? Yeah...

Jasper walked over to his rubbish-bin. It was empty. He put it in the middle of his bedroom. He opened a drawer in his desk and pulled out two baseballs and two tennis-balls. He put them on his desk. Sitting on the side of his hammock, Jasper practiced levitating the balls from his desk, to the bin. He did this over and over again, back and forth. Then, he tried levitating heavier things like books, chairs and lamps around the room. They floated and hovered and wavered, but never once did they ever drop.

"This is easy!" he said to himself. He wanted something harder. He put a blank pad of paper on his desk and focused on the fountain pen his dad bought him for school. The cap unscrewed. The pen rose into the air and the nib swung downwards to point to the page.

Slowly, then faster and faster, the nib scribbled over the page, leaving shining, glistening lines of black ink. Jasper recapped the pen and then went to see what he'd done.

The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog

It was a bit messy, but otherwise, Jasper was now convinced he could control his telekinesis enough to make a pen write for him. This was kinda cool. He wondered what else to do. Using on his telekinetic powers, he opened the box of matches on his bedside table that he kept there just for blackouts. A match hovered in mid-air, then, it struck itself against the side of the box. It flared to life and then floated upwards towards the candle next to Jasper's bedside lamp. The match lit the candle, and then fell to the tabletop, extinguishing itself on the way down. Jasper levitated the candle towards him and then blew it out. This was EASY!

Jasper tiptoed out of his room and tiptoed into his brother's room. Hunter was asleep. Scrapples the tiger was snuggled up under his owner's arm, and Taffy the kitten was snoozling away in the folds of the blanket. The cat snuffled, but didn't wake up. Slowly, Jasper made Scrapples rise into the air. Higher, higher, higher...soon, the plush-toy was just a couple of inches from the celing.

"Scrapples?" Hunter mumbled. "Scrapp...YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!!"

Hunter screamed loud enough to wake the dead! The terrified, ten-year-old boy found himself floating, about six feet up in the air, completely unsupported! There wasn't a single thing that he could see, that was holding him up, and yet he couldn't get down, either! The bedroom door opened and Darlene came in.

"Honey what...Jasper!"

Jasper stepped out of the shadows behind the closet and grinned.

"Put your brother back into bed right now!"
"Yeah mom".

Jasper levitated Hunter back to bed, and dumped Scrapples on top of him.

"I don't want to hear you bullying your brother again, okay?" Darlene asked.
"Yeah mom," said Jasper.
"Good! And you let him sleep!"
"Okay, okay!"

Darlene left the room, closing the door behind her.

"Hey little tiger," said Jasper. He walked over to Hunter's bed and sat down. Hunter scrabbled up onto his pillows, hugging Scrapples as if he was a lifeline.

"Don't touch me!" he said.
"Heeeey, I was just messin' with yah," said Jasper, "Come on...C'mere!"
"No!"
"Huuuunter!"
"You SCARED ME!!!"
"Hey I had to practice! And you weren't doing anything".
"You took Scrapples!"
"Heeeey," said Jasper. He came closer, but Hunter didn't move. Jasper reached out and grabbed his brother, "It's okay little dude," he said. He hugged him, "I was just messin' with yah...Hey, no hard feelings, okay?"
"Awwww..."

Jasper gave his brother a hug and ruffled his hair. "Come on, tiger, time for bed...hmmm?"

"Okay...no hard feelings...but next time wake me UP if you're going to leveltate me!"
"Whenever you like, tiger," said Jasper. "Goodnight".
"Night Jaspy".
"Goodnight, Scrapples!"
"Scrapples is still angry with you!"

15331112121121111111111111.content:
Jasper groaned as he got up the next morning. He'd had a terrible night's sleep. He'd tossed, turned, fidgeted, stretched, compacted, had cramps, growing-pains and stiffness all over his body. If not for the fact that the hammock wrapped tightly around his body, he would've rolled right out onto the floor. Jasper got up.

CRACK! RIP!! Schirrrrrip!!!

"GODDAMN IT!" he screamed.

"Looks like your brother's awaaake!" said Nanna, as she gave Hunter a kiss, "Come on, Hunter, hurry, or he'll be eating all your breakfast again!"

Nanna left Hunter to change, and went to see what her other grandson was up to. She knocked on the door.

"Jasper, darling, can I come in?"

Jasper groaned. He'd completely ripped out of his clothes! Not even his underwear managed to stay in one piece!

"I..." he began, "Gran my clothes ripped again!"
"That's alright, I have some bigger ones," she said, "Can I come in?"
"No you don't get it, like, they TOTALLY ripped! I don't have a damn thing to WEAR!"

Nanna laughed. She headed to her bedroom and came back a few minutes later with some stuff in her arms. She opened the door.

"Weeeeeell!"
"NANNA!!!"

The petite woman closed the door behind her while her giant grandson sat, dejected on his hammock.

"You ARE growing!" she said, and she chuckled. Jasper sure was. "Just look at yoooouuu!" said nanna, staring him up and down, "How tall are you now?"
"I don't KNOW!" Jasper groaned, "I can't even stand up straight anymore!"
"Well stand up anyway, and we'll see! These ceilings are eight feet high".

Jasper groaned. He stood up. His long legs straightened out, his back and torso sought verticality...his monster schlong fell down heavily and hung there under its own weight...his shoulders and chest came upright...

'Clunk!'

"See?" he said, "I'm gonna get a crick in my neck if I get any taller!"
"Yes I can see..." said Nanna.
"WILL YOU STOP!..." Jasper sat down again to try in vain to conceal his flesh-cannon, which was now a hefty two feet long. And his nuts really were the size of nuts now. Coconuts.

The old woman dropped the clothes and laughed. "Oh Jasper!...You're my little dumpling and I LOVE you!" she said. "But still...one has to stare at your...development..." she said, and her eyes lingered downwards again.

"Gran, just LEAVE! Thanks for the clothes, I'll get changed now!" he said, desperate to get his grandmother out of the room. Christ! Was it really natural for all grandmothers to be this interested in their grandson's sexual equipment!?

Jasper finally tugged on his clothes, brushed his teeth and headed to the kitchen. He ate four boxes of cereal and drank six bottles of milk, two loaves of bread and a pound of butter for breakfast.

"What's the matter, lost your appetite this morning?" David asked. He laughed and waved goodbye to his kids and wife and then headed out the front door to work.

Flying had to be the coolest thing in the world for Jasper. And it was also the most convenient thing in the world. He was so tall now, that even the corridors at school could barely take him. Well, they could take him rather comfortably, but still, he was having trouble ducking around hanging light-fixtures and doorframes and dangly art-displays. He soared overhead, between the ceiling, and the tops of students, finally landing outside his locker. He untied the steel rod around his door and took out his books and papers and headed off to class. As he flew around the corridors, he could hear voices following him everywhere...

"Wow! Did he get even taller?"

"Alright, class!" said their geography teacher, "Today we're studying the Earth's magnetism and continental drift! So, if we could all fight Jasper's magnetism and drift away from our resident continent, back to our seats, we can...Marcia, Susan, what are you doing?"
"Just checking out the twin peaks of Mount Jaspmore," said Marcia and Susan giggled. The two chicks sat back down again, keeping their eyes squarely focused on Jasper's ass.
"Oh very funny Marcia", said Jasper. Their teacher smiled, "Okay, now in the beginning there was just one, big landmass...who can tell me the name of that landmass...?"

Jasper sighed as he doodled in class. He wrote down all the powers he had so far...

Heat-vision.
Super-speed.
Super-strength.
Telekinesis.

He wondered what else he could do? He sat there in class...he was so bored...He hated geography...He spun his pencil around...doodling and fiddling...

"...and that's why landmasses move how they do," said Mr. James, "Now..." he turned around to face his class again, "..Where's Jasper?"

Jasper was gone. There was a desk, books, pens, paper...but Jasper himself was nowhere to be seen.

"Maybe he went to the toilet?" one of the boys suggested.
"I think we would all have seen him if he left the room," another boy said.
"Maybe he snuck out the window?" one of the girls suggested.
"We're on the third floor!"
"You think that matters to him?"
"Yeah perhaps not..."

Jasper grunted and yawned. He was barely awake...what were they talking about? He opened his eyes and looked around.

"...Perhaps he flew out?"
"I think we'd see that, too".
"What if he shrunk?"
"A dude that big would take a LONG time to shrink to someone we couldn't see!"
"Yeah I suppose so..."

Jasper didn't take long to figure out that they were talking about him.

"Guys, what're you talking about?" he asked.

Everyone turned to stare at him.

"What? No!"
"Yeah you did!" said one of the girls, "We all turned around and you weren't there!"

"Mr. Davian, if you don't explain where you were, I'm going to have to give you a detention for trying to skip class," said Mr. James.
"I didn't do ANYTHING!" said Jasper, "What's going on!?"
"One moment you were here, then you were gone, now you're back again!" said one of the boys in front of him, "How'd you do that?'
"DO WHAT!?" Jasper groaned.
"Alright enough!" said Mr. James, "Your homework is on the board, copy it down, please!"

Jasper copied down the homework and ducked out of the room. Brandt and Ivan followed him. They had two spare periods now, so they headed off to an empty classroom to...'study'.

15331112121121111111111111111.content:
"HOW did you do that!?" Brandt asked, angrily.

"Ve saw you," he said, "You verr there, at your desk at the back of the classroom, venn we turned around, you were gone!"

"I wasn't there?"

Jasper turned to Brandt, who nodded, "No-one could see you. We thought you'd left the room or something!"

"I..." Jasper said. "Ummm...Hmm".

Jasper sat down on a desk. How did he do it? He thought back. He thought back to geography. It was a boring class...It was boring, he was bored...His mind was blank, swimming, empty...Wait, was that it? Hmmm...

If his MIND was blank...Maybe HE would also become 'blank'? Like, invisible? But then why did he reappear when he spoke? His mind wasn't blank!...but that was no good. How could this be a power, then? Jasper did some more thinking. Yeah...prehaps once his mind was blank and he went invisible, if he kept thinking about invisibility, he would REMAIN invisible, no matter what? Yeah...that seemed to make sense.

"Okay," he said. He stood up. "I'm gonna try this out".

He stood at the front of the classroom...then paused, "Who's got a mirror?"

Brandt handed Jasper his iPod. The shiny stainless-steel case would do as a mirror. Jasper emptied his mind, trying to think about as little as possible. Right on cue, his face, reflected in the shiny steel case of the iPod, vanished!

"Woah!" he said. He stared at his arms, his legs, his body, hands, feet, clothing...He was totally invisible!

"This is cool!" he said, "Can you see me?"

"No," said Brandt.
"Me neither!" said Ivan.
"Oh this is awesome! I can go invisible now!" Jasper said, "Oh wow! This is...cool!"

And, just by willing himself, Jasper became visible again. Then invisible, then visible. He switched back and forth faster than a bored man channel-surfed on a TV. Ivan and Brandt were getting dizzy!

"I can go invisible!" he said, "Yeah!!!"

"HE SHOUTED AT MEEEEEEE!!..."

"You put a civil tongue in your moth, Jasper Davian! You weren't much different from Hunter when you were his age, you know!"
"Yeah nanna..."
"There there snuggums...you want to help nanna cook dinner?"
"Dinner?"
"Yeah?"
"Okay!"

Nanna led Hunter down the hall, the little boy turned around and stuck his tongue out at Jasper. Jasper lunged forward to try and grab Hunter.

"NO!" said Nanna, whirling around faster than a ballerina to stand between the two boys, "I don't want to hear you two fighting with each other again! Understand!?"
"Yeah nanna..." said Jasper.
"HUNTER?"
"Yes nanna".

Jasper sighed. He sat down. Now he felt bad. He hated fighting with Hunter. He was a damn cute little kid when he wanted to be, and just as lovable...but not when he was trying to be a smartass. Jasper yawned. He was so tired...How he wished he was in his room...relaxing...sleeping...

He lay down on the rug in the hall, groaning...the rug was soft and comfortable....He wished he could get to bed..but he was too...tired...tooooooooo layyyyyyyyyyyy-zeeeeeeee...

He shut his eyes...

Almost at once, he opened them again and let out a yelp of surprise!

He wasn't lying on the rug at all! He was lying in his hammock, in his room! With the door closed! What?

Jasper sat up...he was wearing the same clothes!...Maybe it was a dream? He looked at the clock on his bedside table. No...only two minutes had passed. What was going on?

Jasper was fully awake now. He stood up...hit his head on the ceiling again...and wondered what was going on. He was in the entrance-hall lying on the floor just now...then he thought about...going to his room...then he closed his eyes...and went to sleep...now he was IN his room!

Jasper did some very fast thinking. He could teleport! Oh man this was cool!...He wondered what to do. He would need practice. Yeah...He would teleport from his room to the kitchen. He visualised the ktichen in his mind, and then whispered the word under his breath. "Kitchen!"

He blinked his eyes. He remembered it only happpened because he closed his eyes. He blinked. His room. An instant of darkness. Light.

He stared around him again...he was standing at the kitchen doorway! Woah this was COOL!

"Now how did YOU get there?" Nanna asked.
"Nanna you'll never believe this..." said Jasper.

15331112121121111111111111111211.content:
Jasper lay in his hammock in his room, contemplating what he could do. He could be invisible, and he could teleport. He grinned. This was cool! But what use was teleporting? He could fly. He supposed it would be useful in emergencies. And if he was going to use it in emergencies, he better make sure he knew how to do it properly. He had to practice. But...where was he supposed to practice? School?

Yeah, school sounded like a good place. It was always empty at night...Just a few security guards...nothing else. Big, empty rooms...yeah, school would be perfect!

"School!" he said aloud. He vanished! And then reappeared.

It was very dark, where-ever he was. He stood up. He could feel a cool breeze on his face. Breeze? Where was he?

Jasper took a step forward and felt hard concrete beneath his feet. He let out a yelp of shock! He ran! Then stopped. And looked down.

Sure enough, he was standing on the roof of the school's main building!

"Damn...maybe I should've been more specific..." he said. He thought of...the gym! Yeah, that would work. The gym was huge...He blinked.

When he opened his eyes again, the breeze was gone. Jasper was aware of the musty smell of sweat, salty water and moisture. Where was he? He took a step. He could feel linoleum under his feet. Or something that felt like lino, anyway. He blinked.

Jasper let out a roar like a lion! He staggered back and hit the floor, hard! Everything in front of him was brightly lit! As bright as if it was daytime! What the hell was going on!? He got to his feet and looked around. He blinked. Suddenly, he was in darkness again. He blinked again, and suddenly he could see everything! He could see that he was in the basketball court of the school's gym. He rushed to the door, squeezed through it and headed downstairs to the change-rooms. He stepped into the bathroom and stared at himself in the mirror. His eyes were shining a powerful, bright light! And not just flashlight powerful, this was like...lighthouse powerful! Jasper was sure if he stood out on a rock in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, people a hundred miles away could point him out! Jasper blinked. His 'eyelights' went off and he found himself in darkness again. He blinked once more, and found that they turned on again. He kept blinking. Off, on, off, on, off, on, off...on. Soon, he discovered that by thinking, he could control the power and range of his eyelights. This was awesome! But he had to get back to practicing his teleportation. He thought of a place he wanted to be. In front of the serving-counter in the cafeteria. He blinked. Then, he blinked again, to turn on his eyelights.

He made it! He blinked and thought of a stairwell near the science-department...he was there! He thought of the foyer of the administration complex...there he was! This was easy! Soon, Jasper didn't even have to THINK anymore. He just had to WANT to go there and he was there! This was incredible!! He stood in the foyer of the administration building. The library was behind him, in front of him, offices and the staffroom and the kitchens and storage-rooms. The foyer was a huge, airy place in the daytime, but at night, it was quiet, dark, cold, empty...and kinda spooky.

Suddenly, Jasper was brought back from his wanderings, his musings, by a sharp pain in his back! His legs, his calves, his arms, his shoulders! His NECK! He collapsed to the ground and groaned! His entire body was cramping up and it hurt like hell! He couldn't even MOVE! He just lay helpless on the ground as his muscles cramped up! His teeth were gritted and his body was shaking, he was sweating! Slowly...VERY slowly...the pain went away...What WAS that? Jasper got to his feet and stretched a bit, trying to get the kinks and tingles out of his body. Wait...something wasn't right. He felt different...Something was tight....

No.

Oh no.

No. Not now!

RIP!

Jasper's shirt ripped open as he started growing taller! NOW when would it stop? Last time this happened, he reached 8'3"! How much would he grow this time? And what was that he could hear in the distance? Footsteps? Jasper was glad the room was so dark. He could hear the footsteps getting closer! Closer! CLOSER!!!!
15331112121121111111111111111211.title: Things that go Bump in the Night.

choices: The next morning, Jasper wakes up even taller still!

153311121211211111111111111112112.content:
The footsteps stopped...the person, possibly a security guard, went in another direction. Jasper started growing, fast! He could feel his back and whole body expanding upwards and outwards as he grew taller, wider, heavier, more muscular. His clothes once again ripped to shreds. He stared at himself in the reflective glass windows of the offices on the second floor of the building...Damn he looked hot. But nanna was going to KILL HIM...or die from shock...when she realised he'd ripped through yet another set of clothes!

Jasper didn't have anything around with which to measure himself with. He would go home and try and sleep it off...Wait...how could he go HOME? He'd barely fit in the HOUSE! Damn it! It wasn't a bad night. It was warm, with a slight breeze, but the breeze was warm, too. Oh to hell with it. He'd sleep on the roof.

Jasper squeezed out of the foyer of the school admin building and took off. He hoped nobody saw him, the only thing that had managed to stay on his body were his boxer-shorts, and even they felt uncomfortably tight. Navigating by streetlamps, Jasper finally reached home. Instead of landing on the front lawn like he usually did, he landed on the roof. He found a flat-patch above the garage, and fell asleep on the cool, rough roof. He hoped nobody would wake up to find him sleeping, almost totally naked, on the roof of the house, and ask him what the hell he thought he was up to...
153311121211211111111111111112112.title: Grow in Peace, My Son.

1533111212112111111111111111121121.content:
"Dong-dong-deng-dong...dong-deng-dong-dong...dong-dong-deng-dong...CLANG!!!! ..."

"Whuuuu..." Jasper groaned.

The first strike of the hour made Jasper get up. What was that noise...? Oh right...the church in the next block was striking the hour. Jasper groaned and got to his feet. He listened to the striking bells. Three...four...five...six...seven.

Seven o'clock in the morning. Jasper groaned. He sat down on the roof of the garage...then he lay down...then he rolled over...

"YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!"

WHUMP!!!

Jasper struggled to his feet! He just dropped eight feet off the roof of the garage, landing in his grandmother's flowerbeds! Oh Nanna was gonna really kill him now. He got up and shook the dirt and soil and leaves and flowers out of his hair and stretched. Oh God...what a way to start the day. He leaned against the garage, running his hands through his hair, one elbow resting on the roof...

Wait what?

Since when was he tall enough that he could stand next to a building eight feet tall and rest his elbow...albeit at right-angles to his torso...on the roof?

Jasper stared at the garage, and then stared at himself. He did a quick calculation in his head. Oh no...this could NOT be happening...But it had. Somehow, he'd grown even TALLER during the night! He wasn't quite sure HOW tall, but he guessed it was less than the huge spurt he had when he was fooling around in school.

The front door opened.

"...look up, the skies are sunny...YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!"

"Nanna!"

Nanna, who had come out to get the newspaper stared up at the giant teenager, dressed only in red boxer-shorts.

"JASPER?" she gasped, "WHAT HAPPENED?"

Somehow, in some, superhuman feat of contortionistic skill, Jasper managed to get himself into the house. His grandmother closed the door and Jasper sat down.

"What HAPPENED to you!?" she asked, "And where are the clothes I made you?"

Bit by bit, Jasper explained what happened.

"You can see in the dark?" she said.
"Well...Sorta. Lights came out of my eyes and it was like I had headlights or...eyelights, really".
"And you grew more?"
"Yeah! Only this spurt was huge! All my muscles cramped up! I was having...I dunno...growing pains, I guess...I don't even know how tall I am now. Nanna, I'm sorry about the clothes..."
"Ooooh it's alright," she said, "I can make more!...I wonder how tall you really are, then..."

"WOAH!"

Hunter appeared at the top of the stairs wearing blue pyjamas and holding Scrapples in his hands. "Nanna what did you FEED him?"
"Hey Tiger," said Jasper, "Yeah I know...I dunno what Nanna's been feeding me, either".

Nanna scratched her forehead. "How are we going to do this...I know!"

The woman ran to her bedroom and came back a few minutes later with some knitting-needles, a ball of yarn, and a foot-long ruler.

"Outside!" she said. Jasper squeezed through the door again and went into the back yard, with Hunter following. Nanna instructed her grandson to lay on the grass.

"Hunter, take one end of the ball of wool and this knitting-needle," said Nanna, tying the end of the wool-strand to the needle, "and push the needle into the ground at Jasper's feet, understand?"
"Yeah nanna," said Hunter. Jasper reached out for Scrapples.
"I'll look after him for yah," said Jasper. Hunter gave his plush-toy to his brother and then went to peg out the string. Nanna tugged the ball of wool along the full length of Jasper's body.

"Chin up, darling, I want to get a proper measurement!" she said. Jasper jerked his chin upwards.

"Good..." Nanna broke the yarn, tied the broken end to another knitting needle, and sank that into the ground, just after the end of Jasper's head.

"There!" she said, "Get up and measure it!"

Jasper got up and reached for the foot-long ruler and started measuring the string.

"One...two...three...four..."

"If he goes on like that, we'll be here until dinner!" said Hunter.
"Patience, honey," said Nanna, putting her arms around Hunter's chest, "Let's just wait".

"...seven...eight..."

Jasper paused.

"What's wrong, honey?" Nanna piped up.

"Nine foot, even", Jasper said. Hunter's jaw dropped and nanna screamed, clapping her hands to her mouth.

"You grrew..." she said.
"NINE INCHES!..." Hunter blurted out.
"IN ONE NIGHT!?" the old lady screamed.
"I...I guess..." said Jasper.
"Oooooh..." Nanna groaned. Hunter yelped and reached out to catch the old lady as she lost her footing and nearly fainted.

"Nanna!?" David shouted, running out the back door, "What's...Woah!"

Bit by bit, Jasper explained everything to his parents. Darlene shook her head. "You better stay home today, Jasper," she said. "You'll need your rest after a growth-spurt like that! Not even nanna thought you'd grow that much!"
"Got that straight!" said Nanna, sitting in her armchair, still holding the nine feet of woollen yarn which had nearly made her drop in a dead faint. "Nine feet!" she said again. "Oh my my my..."

Jasper smiled, he gave his grandmother a kiss, "Love you, nanna," he said. Heading downstairs into the basement, now the only room which was really large enough to hold Jasper, he lay down on a bunch of mattresses that his father had set up for him as a temporary bed. He needed a break. Hunter, David and Darlene went off to school and work. Nanna started doing the housework...

15331112121121111111111111111211211.content:
After a growth-spurt like that, Nanna decided that Jasper would be REALLY hungry. She better cook him something. Where to start? A dozen eggs, six, foot-long sausages, bacon, a bottle of pancake-mix shaken and poured into a platter of pancakes, with syrup and ice-cream, two boxes of cereal, a gallon of milk and...toast. One loaf, buttered, with a pound of butter. She started cooking. Nanna was a machine. She danced a ballet around the kitchen, switching, swirling, hopping and twirling between the bench, sink, stove, fridge, cupboards, toaster, garbage-bins and a huge, 18-inch wide platter on the table. Once everything was done, the kitchen was spotless, nanna was exhausted, and Jasper would be starving.

"Jaaaaasper honey!" she called downstairs, "Breakfast!"

Jasper came up carefully, not wanting to bump his head on anything, and sat down at the table...on the floor. He ate, and ate, and ate, and ate. It was almost an hour of solid eating. He finished the sausages, bacon and eggs, then the tomatoes and toast, then the pancakes, ice-cream and syrup, and finally, the huge bowl of cereal and milk.

"Mmmm...that was great, nanna," he said. "Thanks".
"My pleasure," she said. "You go have a nap, I'm going to make you some new clothes".

Jasper nodded and went to lie down. He was feeling very tired after his growth-spurt. He set an alarm-clock on the floor next to his 'bed' in the basement, to go off two hours later, and went to sleep...

Shrugging his schoolbag over his shoulder, which he had caught after his brother had thrown it into the air, Hunter followed Paul into the school. He put his stuff into his locker and pulled out his books for maths and English.

"Mr. Davian!"

Hunter turned around to see Mr. Ivans, the school headmaster. "Can you come with me, please?"

Hunter was nervous. Mr. Ivans was a scary guy. Or at least, he looked scary. He was actually quite nice once you got to know him, and he knew all his students by name. Hunter followed him uneasily along the corridor and up some stairs, into the administration-wing of the school and into an office. Ivans beckoned Hunter in, and then closed the door.

"Your grandmother gave me a phone-call this morning, just before school started," said Mr. Ivans, he pointed to a seat and gestured for Hunter to sit down. "And I want you to know that..."
"I can't fly in school?" Hunter asked.
"I didn't say that..." said Mr. Ivans, he sat down as well.
"We all know about your brother. And your grandmother telephoned to advise me that you too, will soon be developing...certain powers. Is that right?"
"Um...I guess so," said Hunter.
"Very well then," said Ivans. "I want us to have an understanding, then, that you won't use your powers to hurt anyone..."
"So I can't!?"
"You CAN use your powers! It wouldn't be fair if you couldn't. But I want you to understand that...as they say...with great powers come great responsibility. I want you to use them carefully and responsibly, understand?"
"Yes sir".
"Good".
"What if someone's being picked on? What if it's an emergency?" Hunter asked.
"You should get a teacher," said Mr. Ivans.
"What if there isn't time?"

Mr. Ivans laughed, "Your grandmother warned me you might try this. She said the same thing about your brother. If you really think you have to, you can go ahead and do whatever you like, provided it's for a good cause and there aren't any lasting consequences, understand?"
"Yes sir".

"Good," said Mr. Ivans, "Well I think that's everything. I hope that you have a nice day. And Hunter..."
"Yes sir?"
"Perhaps when you're free, you can fly over the school and get down all the balls and frisbees stuck on the roof. I've been getting calls from all the teachers who are asking me when I'm gonna get maintenance up there to get their students' balls down again!"

Hunter grinned, "Sure Mr. Ivans".

And Hunter left the room. Where did he go now...?

info.brief_description: You're a boy who discovers one day that you're an alien being with super powers.
info.description:
You're an average boy who, up till now, has lived the life of an average Joe until one day you wake up and your super powers begin to develop one-by-one!

You first discover that you possess super-hearing. The following day, you realize that you can see through walls. A few hours later, you discover you can fly! A few days later, you realize you have super strength. The following week, you discover you have heat vision and super speed! One-by-one, your powers begin to develop. It almost becomes hard NOT to use them! You're just too "super"! How do you adjust to normal life at home and at school, as a super-kid?

First, you cautiously tell your parents you've been experiencing strange feelings. Then, you find out you were an alien! How do you take that? Then, you must cope with "being normal" at school. How do you adjust to being a "super-kid" among "normal" students? Do you tell anyone? Do you show off to your best friend? What happens when you get bullied in school? what do you do, when you start seeing and hearing everything that happens around you?

Finally, do you decide to become a super hero? How do you pick a costume? Or, do you remain undercover? This is your chance to create a new super hero character!

Please: NO sex, no vore, no killing off anyone, no curse words, no one-line chapters, or the like. I will delete and/or edit chapters as I see needed.

You may add as many powers to your hero as you like. Make it fun and interesting. What I'm looking for, is that the hero doesn't know what powers he has until they surface, and he has to learn how to use them once he discovers what his powers are. Give him as many powers as you wish; you can practically make him omnipotent as long as he becomes a super hero and not a villain. The whole idea is that you create an "origin" story for a superhero here. I would love to see the "hero" as a character who is shy, timid, humble, and maybe even a little scared of all the powers he suddenly comes to possess. You can give him the ability to become invisible, to grow into a giant, to fire lasers from his fists, to teleport, to have telekinesis, or even to control other people's minds. How would he deal with all those powers, at home, at school, or when he's with his friends or his relatives?

***I will award 500 Gift Points to complete, acceptable, and well-written chapters of 300 words or longer.***

Have fun!!!!

Rex
